original: tha dad pa ni phan tshun mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'o //üîΩde dag las ni rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug pa yin nam zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni phan tshun mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'o // de dag las ni rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug pa yin nam zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid mi mthun pa'o //
translated: Different means having different characteristics.üîΩDo conceptual thoughts not engage those?

original: de dag las ni rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug pa yin nam zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid rnams la ste /
analyzed: de dag las ni rnam par rtog pa mi 'jug pa yin nam zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid rnams la ste /
translated: Do conceptual thoughts not engage those?

original: ji ltar de dag la rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo skye zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de dag la rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo skye zhe na /
translated: How do conceptual thoughts arise in regard to those?

original: 'chad par byed pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs te /
analyzed: 'chad par byed pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs te /
translated: The answer is given by the words, ‚Äúthose who explain, etc.‚Äù

original: dngos po ji ltar gnas pa bzhin rnam par 'jog pa de rnams ni rnam par rtog pa'i blo las snang ba yang gzhan yin la rang gi mtshan nyid kyang gzhan yin no zhes de ltar rnam par 'byed par byed do //
analyzed: dngos po ji ltar gnas pa bzhin rnam par 'jog pa de rnams ni rnam par rtog pa'i blo las snang ba yang gzhan yin la rang gi mtshan nyid kyang gzhan yin no zhes de ltar rnam par 'byed par byed do //
translated: Those who posit things as they are, distinguish that the appearance to conceptual thought is one thing and the intrinsic identity is another.

original: tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa rnams ni de ltar rnam par 'byed par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa rnams ni de ltar rnam par 'byed par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Those who employ conventions do not distinguish in that way.

original: tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa de dag ni rang gi dmigs pa kho na zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo la snang ba kho na'o //
analyzed: tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa de dag ni rang gi dmigs pa kho na zhes bya ba rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo la snang ba kho na'o //
translated: Those who make conventional expressions, only their own objects, that is, only what appears to a conceptual consciousness.

original: snang ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: snang ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: An appearance is a specific characteristic.

original: rnam par brtags par bya ba'i don ni spyi snang ba ste /
analyzed: rnam par brtags par bya ba'i don ni spyi snang ba ste /
translated: An object to be imagined is a universal, an appearance.üîΩHaving made them one, they make a specific characteristic the object of a conceptual consciousness and express it with a word.

original: de dag gcig tu byas nas rang gi mtshan nyid kho na rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo yul du byed cing sgras kyang brjod do zhes de ltar mos par byas nas don bya ba byed pa'i don la 'jug go //
analyzed: de dag gcig tu byas nas rang gi mtshan nyid kho na rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo yul du byed cing sgras kyang brjod do zhes de ltar mos par byas nas don bya ba byed pa'i don la 'jug go //
translated: Having understood it in that way, they engage in the object that performs a function.

original: tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa de dag gi bsam pa'i dbang gis tha dad pa'i dngos po rnams la rnam par rtog pa'i blo skya ba na zhes de @88b skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa de dag gi bsam pa'i dbang gis tha dad pa'i dngos po rnams la rnam par rtog pa'i blo skya ba na zhes de @88b skad ces brjod do //
translated: The conceptual consciousness that arises in regard to different things due to the power of their thought is called that.üîΩIn the same way, etc.

original: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa la de bzhin du zhes bya ba ni bsdu ba ste /
translated: In the same way means that it is a summary.

original: de dag gi bsam pa'i dbang gis rang gi mtshan nyid rnams la rnam par rtog pa can gyi skye ba na zhes brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi de bzhin du smra ba po sgras de byed pa rgyur gyur pa nyid kyis byed pa ma yin pa
analyzed: de dag gi bsam pa'i dbang gis rang gi mtshan nyid rnams la rnam par rtog pa can gyi skye ba na zhes brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi de bzhin du smra ba po sgras de byed pa rgyur gyur pa nyid kyis byed pa ma yin pa
translated: Not only do they say ‚Äúwhen the conceptual consciousness arises in regard to intrinsic identity,‚Äù but they also say that the speaker, by the fact of being the cause of that action, is not the agent.

original: dag las ldog pa'i don rnams ston par byed do zhes kyang brjod do //
analyzed: dag las ldog pa'i don rnams ston par byed do zhes kyang brjod do //
translated: They also say that the words indicate the objects that are the reverse of those.

original: gal te 'byed par byed pa rnams kyis kyang snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don dag gcig pa nyid do zhes bya bar ci ste rtog par mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'byed par byed pa rnams kyis kyang snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don dag gcig pa nyid do zhes bya bar ci ste rtog par mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If the differentiators also think that the object that appears and the object that is to be analyzed are the same, why don‚Äôt they think that the object that appears and the object that is to be expressed are the same?

original: de kho na nyid sems par byed pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de kho na nyid sems par byed pa rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThose who think about reality‚Äù and so on.

original: de kho na nyid sems pa ni rigs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i 'chad par byed pa rnams so //
analyzed: de kho na nyid sems pa ni rigs pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i 'chad par byed pa rnams so //
translated: Those who think about reality are the commentators who follow reasoning.

original: snang ba tha dad pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni snang ba ni gsal bar snang gi rnam par brtag par bya ba ni ma yin te rnam par rtog pa dang 'brel pa la bsal ba nyid mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: snang ba tha dad pa la sogs pa'i sgo nas zhes bya ba ni snang ba ni gsal bar snang gi rnam par brtag par bya ba ni ma yin te rnam par rtog pa dang 'brel pa la bsal ba nyid mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn terms of different appearances, etc.‚Äù means that an appearance is a clear appearance, but it is not something to be imagined, because it is not suitable to be clear in relation to imagination.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni snang ba 'gags kyang rnam par brtag par bya ba mi 'gag pa dang / don bya ba byed pa dang mi byed pa bsdu ste snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba dag tha dad pa med par mi sems so zhes bya bar rnal ma dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni snang ba 'gags kyang rnam par brtag par bya ba mi 'gag pa dang / don bya ba byed pa dang mi byed pa bsdu ste snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba dag tha dad pa med par mi sems so zhes bya bar rnal ma dang sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the case where the appearance ceases but the object to be imagined does not cease, and the case where it performs or does not perform a function. One should not think that appearances and the object to be imagined are not different.

original: klan ka pas gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: klan ka pas gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúIf, etc.‚Äù

original: phyi rol gyi rnams la spyi rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir rtogs pa po'i bsam pa'i rjes su byed na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rnams la spyi rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir rtogs pa po'i bsam pa'i rjes su byed na /
translated: If the exclusion of other is posited as a universal because it conforms to the thought of the cognizer,

original: de'i tshe gzhan sel ba yang spyi yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe gzhan sel ba yang spyi yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then at that time the exclusion of other would not be a universal.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Thus, etc.

original: tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa rnams la sgras gzhan sel ba brjod do zhes bya ba de ltar rtogs pa ni med do zhe na /
analyzed: tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa rnams la sgras gzhan sel ba brjod do zhes bya ba de ltar rtogs pa ni med do zhe na /
translated: Those who posit conventions express the exclusion of other by means of words - there is no such understanding.

original: slob dpon gyis kyang nyes pa mtshungs pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis kyang nyes pa mtshungs pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The master [DignƒÅga] states thus, etc. in order to show that the fault is the same.

original: de ltar mi rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan sel ba'i ngo bor ro //
analyzed: de ltar mi rtogs pa zhes bya ba ni gzhan sel ba'i ngo bor ro //
translated: Not understanding thus means not understanding in terms of the nature of the exclusion of other.

original: khyod kyis kyang spyi ji ltar gsal ba las tha dad pa la sogs pa'i rnam par 'dod pa de ltar yang mi rtogs pa nyid do //
analyzed: khyod kyis kyang spyi ji ltar gsal ba las tha dad pa la sogs pa'i rnam par 'dod pa de ltar yang mi rtogs pa nyid do //
translated: Just as you assert that the universal is different from the particulars, etc., it is also not understood in that way.

original: bye brag pa rnams kyi ltar na ni spyi rten las tha dad pa yin no //
analyzed: bye brag pa rnams kyi ltar na ni spyi rten las tha dad pa yin no //
translated: According to the Vai≈õe·π£ikas, the universal is different from the substratum.

original: grangs can pa rnams kyi ltar na ni tha mi dad pa yin no //
analyzed: grangs can pa rnams kyi ltar na ni tha mi dad pa yin no //
translated: According to the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas, it is not different.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni @89a * //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni @89a * //
translated: The word etc.

original: re re la yongs su rdzogs pa nyid la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: re re la yongs su rdzogs pa nyid la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: includes being complete in each individual, etc.

original: gal te spyi dngos por gyur pa dang gzhan sel ba gnyi ga rtogs pa med par mtshungs na ci'i phyir tha snyad la gzhan sel ba kho nar brjod ce na /
analyzed: gal te spyi dngos por gyur pa dang gzhan sel ba gnyi ga rtogs pa med par mtshungs na ci'i phyir tha snyad la gzhan sel ba kho nar brjod ce na /
translated: If it is the same that both a universal and the exclusion of other are not realized without a conceptual cognition, why is only the exclusion of other said to be a convention?

original: blo rnam pa tha mi dad pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: blo rnam pa tha mi dad pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe mind that has no different aspects . . .‚Äù

original: rang gi mtshan nyid rnams kyi rigs mi mthun pa dang bral ba nyid gzhan sel ba yin pas de blo rnam pa tha mi dad pa can gyi rgyu mtshan nyid du brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid rnams kyi rigs mi mthun pa dang bral ba nyid gzhan sel ba yin pas de blo rnam pa tha mi dad pa can gyi rgyu mtshan nyid du brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: Since the exclusion of other is the dissimilarity of individual characteristics from what is dissimilar, it is said to be the cause of the mind that has no different aspects.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rigs mi mthun pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhan sel ba de ni dngos po tha dad pa thams cad la yang yod pa'i phyir dang / gzhan sel ba de lta bu spyi'i blo'i rgyud nyid du 'gal ba med pa'i yang phyir te 'di ltar ji ltar shing gcig shing ma yin pa las log par mthong ba ltar gzhan yang de dang 'dra bas de'i phyir de la blo rnam pa gcig pa can skye
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa dang bral ba'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhan sel ba de ni dngos po tha dad pa thams cad la yang yod pa'i phyir dang / gzhan sel ba de lta bu spyi'i blo'i rgyud nyid du 'gal ba med pa'i yang phyir te 'di ltar ji ltar shing gcig shing ma yin pa las log par mthong ba ltar gzhan yang de dang 'dra bas de'i phyir de la blo rnam pa gcig pa can skye
translated: In the same way that one tree is seen as the opposite of non-tree, so are others, and therefore a cognition with a single aspect arises in regard to them.

original: la 'di la ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yang med do //
analyzed: la 'di la ni gnod pa can gyi tshad ma yang med do //
translated: And there is no valid cognition that contradicts this.

original: gtan tshigs gsum pa sgra'i rten can gyi tha snyad kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs gsum pa sgra'i rten can gyi tha snyad kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The third reason is stated in the phrase ‚Äúthe convention that is the basis of sound.‚Äù

original: de ltar snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan sel ba'i rgyu can nyid du snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ltar snang ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gzhan sel ba'i rgyu can nyid du snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it appears as such‚Äù means because it appears to have exclusion of other as its cause.

original: 'di ni de las gzhan pa yongs su spangs nas /
analyzed: 'di ni de las gzhan pa yongs su spangs nas /
translated: This is because it is the opposite of that which is other than it.

original: 'jug 'gyur zhes kyang sgra brjod de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jug 'gyur zhes kyang sgra brjod de zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: The words it is said and so on are used to introduce the verse.

original: 'di zhes bya ni rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo'i //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ni rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo'i //
translated: The word this refers to the conceptual mind.

original: ji ltar zhe na bya ba ni rnam pa gcig pa can du snang ba ltar te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na bya ba ni rnam pa gcig pa can du snang ba ltar te /
translated: How? Action appears to have a single aspect.

original: de ltar phyi rol gyi spyi de med do zhes bya bar tshig khong nas drang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar phyi rol gyi spyi de med do zhes bya bar tshig khong nas drang ngo //
translated: Thus, the external universal does not exist. The words it is said are inserted into the verse.

original: de bas na rnam par rtog pa can gyi mthong ba'i rten spyi dngos por gyur pa ni med do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par rtog pa can gyi mthong ba'i rten spyi dngos por gyur pa ni med do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the intended meaning is that the real universal, which is the basis of the conceptual perception, does not exist.

original: spyi med pa'i gtan tshigs su 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: spyi med pa'i gtan tshigs su 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To prove that there is no universal, he says because of the non-existence of the universal, etc.

original: gsal ba rang gi mtshan nyid rnams ni rjes su mi 'gro zhing 'dre bar mi 'gyur te 'dis ni spyi tha mi dad par khas len pa gsal to//
analyzed: gsal ba rang gi mtshan nyid rnams ni rjes su mi 'gro zhing 'dre bar mi 'gyur te 'dis ni spyi tha mi dad par khas len pa gsal to//
translated: The individual characteristics of the particulars do not follow and do not mix. This shows that the acceptance of the non-difference of the universal is clear.

original: tha dad pa gsal ba'i phyir rjes 'gro gzhan ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: tha dad pa gsal ba'i phyir rjes 'gro gzhan ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To show the difference, he says because of the difference of the particulars, etc.üîΩ

original: spyi'i ngo bo rjes su 'gro bar 'dod pa gang yin pa khyad par dag las gzhan pa de na mngon sum gyi blo la snang ba med do //
analyzed: spyi'i ngo bo rjes su 'gro bar 'dod pa gang yin pa khyad par dag las gzhan pa de na mngon sum gyi blo la snang ba med do //
translated: That which is asserted to be the universal, which is the same in all particulars, is not perceived by the cognition of perception.

original: rjes su 'gro ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'dre ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba ma yin zhes bya ba ni 'dre ba ma yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúNot the same‚Äù means not mixed.

original: gal te phan tshun @89b rjes su 'gro ba zhig tu gyur na ni de'i tshe ngo bo gcig tu gyur pas tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: gal te phan tshun @89b rjes su 'gro ba zhig tu gyur na ni de'i tshe ngo bo gcig tu gyur pas tha dad pa med do //
translated: If they were the same, then they would be one entity and there would be no difference.

original: rgyu des na spyi nyid med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: rgyu des na spyi nyid med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: For that reason, it follows that there would be no universal.

original: khyad par mtshungs pa rnams kyi shes pa rnam pa gcig pa can gyi rgyu nyid kyi chos ni spyi yin na de khyad par med na med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khyad par mtshungs pa rnams kyi shes pa rnam pa gcig pa can gyi rgyu nyid kyi chos ni spyi yin na de khyad par med na med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The property that is the cause of the cognition of a single aspect in things that are similar is the universal. If that were not different from the particulars, it would not exist.

original: de rnams las zhes bya ba ni gsal ba rnams las so //
analyzed: de rnams las zhes bya ba ni gsal ba rnams las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom them‚Äù means from the particulars.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba 'di'i 'grel pa ni tha dad pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba 'di'i 'grel pa ni tha dad pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúDifferent‚Äù is the commentary on ‚Äúother.‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i blo la zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi blo la'o //
analyzed: de lta bu'i blo la zhes bya ba ni mngon sum gyi blo la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch a cognition‚Äù means the cognition of perception.

original: 'di skad du nyams su myong ba'i 'og rol gyi dus su 'byung ba rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo la 'khrul pa'i dbang gis rnam pa gcig tu snang ba rjes su 'gro mod kyi 'on kyang de tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir de'i dbang gis dngos po
analyzed: 'di skad du nyams su myong ba'i 'og rol gyi dus su 'byung ba rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo la 'khrul pa'i dbang gis rnam pa gcig tu snang ba rjes su 'gro mod kyi 'on kyang de tshad ma ma yin pa'i phyir de'i dbang gis dngos po
translated: However, since that is not a valid cognition, it does not establish the object

original: rnam par mi gzhag ste /
analyzed: rnam par mi gzhag ste /
translated: in accordance with that.

original: rnam par rtog pa tshad mar gyur pa ma yin pas dngos po rnam par gzhag na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin no ;
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa tshad mar gyur pa ma yin pas dngos po rnam par gzhag na ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin no ;
translated: If conceptual thought were a valid cognition, it would follow, absurdly, that it would establish the object.

original: /'di ni spyi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba la rang bzhin mi dmigs pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: /'di ni spyi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa med pa'i tha snyad bsgrub par bya ba la rang bzhin mi dmigs pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is an explanation of the nature of the nonobservation of a nature in the proof of a negative proposition, which is characterized by the observation of a universal.

original: spyi mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa ma yin pa ni khas blang du yang mi rung ste 'di ltar spyi mi snang na ji ltar bdag nyid du //
analyzed: spyi mi dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa ma yin pa ni khas blang du yang mi rung ste 'di ltar spyi mi snang na ji ltar bdag nyid du //
translated: The nonobservation of a universal, which is characterized by the nonobservation of a universal, is not suitable to be accepted, because if the universal does not appear, how could it be the nature of the object?

original: spyi'i rang gi ngo bor gzhan zhes bya ba spyi dang ldan pa 'dzin pa'am ji ltar rang gi ngo bor gzhan tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: spyi'i rang gi ngo bor gzhan zhes bya ba spyi dang ldan pa 'dzin pa'am ji ltar rang gi ngo bor gzhan tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: In general, the meaning of ‚Äúendowed with otherness‚Äù is to apprehend that which is called ‚Äúotherness‚Äù as a universal. Or, in context, it is to impute the term ‚Äúotherness‚Äù to that which is itself.

original: bsdus pa'i don ni spyi'i stobs kyis gsal ba rnams la shes pa dang / brjod pa 'jug par 'dod de /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don ni spyi'i stobs kyis gsal ba rnams la shes pa dang / brjod pa 'jug par 'dod de /
translated: The general meaning is that one wishes to engage in the cognition and expression of the particulars by the power of the universal.

original: de lta bas na spyi ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa kho nar 'dod do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na spyi ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa kho nar 'dod do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Therefore, the universal is asserted to be just the characteristic of the object of apprehension.

original: de ltar na re zhig gzung ba'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir du ma dang 'brel pa can gcig ni med do //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig gzung ba'i mtshan nyid du gyur pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir du ma dang 'brel pa can gcig ni med do //
translated: Thus, first, since the characteristic of the object of apprehension does not exist, a single universal related to many does not exist.

original: du ma dang 'brel pa can gcig cig yod du chug na 'on kyang spyi'i ngo bo nyid du rigs pa ma yin pas de dag dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: du ma dang 'brel pa can gcig cig yod du chug na 'on kyang spyi'i ngo bo nyid du rigs pa ma yin pas de dag dang 'brel pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Even if a single universal related to many were possible, still, since it is not reasonable as the nature of a universal, he says, ‚ÄúThat which is related to those . . .‚Äù

original: de dag dang zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i khyad par dang ngo //
analyzed: de dag dang zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i khyad par dang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the particulars.

original: bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni gnyis nyid la sogs pa dang 'bras bu'i rdzas dag kyang spyi'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bshad zin to zhes bya ba ni gnyis nyid la sogs pa dang 'bras bu'i rdzas dag kyang spyi'i ngo bo nyid du 'gyur ro zhes bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúAlready explained‚Äù means that duality, etc., and the substance of the effect would also be the universal nature.

original: gal te gcig cig du ma @90a * //
analyzed: gal te gcig cig du ma @90a * //
translated: If one thing is related to many,

original: dang 'brel ces te de'i phyir spyi yin pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dang 'brel ces te de'i phyir spyi yin pa ni ma yin no //
translated: it is not the universal.

original: 'on kyang tha mi dad pa'i brjod pa dang blo'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa gcig spyi yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on kyang tha mi dad pa'i brjod pa dang blo'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa gcig spyi yin gyi /
translated: However, the one that is the reason for the expression and cognition of non-difference is the universal,

original: gnyis nyid la sogs pa thams cad ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyis nyid la sogs pa thams cad ni ma yin no //
translated: but not all dualities, etc.

original: de ni sgra dang shes pa ji skad bshad pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na ;
analyzed: de ni sgra dang shes pa ji skad bshad pa'i rgyu mtshan ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na ;
translated: Because that is not the reason for the word and cognition as explained.üîΩHow does cognition engage and a single cognition engage in the universal nature of a particular manifest thing through another, through a universal?

original: ji ltar gzhan gyi sgo nas spyi'i sgo nas gzhan la gsal ba'i khyad par spyi'i ngo bo nyid gcig par ma byas pa la shes pa 'jug cing shes pa rnam pa gcig pa can 'jug / gzhan gyis de dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogsüîΩpa smras te /
analyzed: ji ltar gzhan gyi sgo nas spyi'i sgo nas gzhan la gsal ba'i khyad par spyi'i ngo bo nyid gcig par ma byas pa la shes pa 'jug cing shes pa rnam pa gcig pa can 'jug / gzhan gyis de dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba la sogsüîΩpa smras te /
translated: He says: Because another is related to it, etc.

original: gsal ba de dag dang 'brel pa'i phyir gzhan spyi'i sgo nas kyang gzhan la shes pa 'jug go zhe na /
analyzed: gsal ba de dag dang 'brel pa'i phyir gzhan spyi'i sgo nas kyang gzhan la shes pa 'jug go zhe na /
translated: And because of the connection with those manifestations, consciousness is applied to another through a universal.

original: slob dpon gyis grangs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis grangs dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The master [DignƒÅga] says, ‚ÄúNumber, etc.,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ni yod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bdun pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni yod pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bdun pa yin no //
translated: This is the seventh characteristic of existence.

original: bsdus pa'i don ni grangs yod pa dang / 'bras bu'i rdzas yan lag can la sogs pa yod pa dang sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ldan pa la sogs pa zhig yod na yang /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don ni grangs yod pa dang / 'bras bu'i rdzas yan lag can la sogs pa yod pa dang sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ldan pa la sogs pa zhig yod na yang /
translated: The condensed meaning is this: If number, etc., exist, and if the substance of the effect, the whole, etc., exist, and if the things that are referred to by the word ‚Äúetc.,‚Äù such as inherence, etc., exist,

original: spyir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: spyir 'gyur ro zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: then there is a universal.

original: gal te grangs la sogs pa ni spyi'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir de'i stobs kyi rdzas la shes pa rnam pa gcig pa can mi 'jug go zhe na /
analyzed: gal te grangs la sogs pa ni spyi'i bdag nyid ma yin pa'i phyir de'i stobs kyi rdzas la shes pa rnam pa gcig pa can mi 'jug go zhe na /
translated: If you say that because number, etc., are not of the nature of universals, a consciousness with a single aspect does not occur with regard to substance through their power,

original: spyi'i bdag nyid 'di gang yin zhes de nyid spyod pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: spyi'i bdag nyid 'di gang yin zhes de nyid spyod pa ma yin nam zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then is it not the case that you are not engaging with that very thing, asking ‚ÄúWhat is the nature of the universal?‚Äù

original: grangs la sogs pa la ma gtogs pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid nyid mi shes pa'i phyir 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no /
analyzed: grangs la sogs pa la ma gtogs pa'i spyi'i mtshan nyid nyid mi shes pa'i phyir 'di ni rigs pa ma yin no /
translated: Because the universal itself is not known apart from number and so on, this is not a valid reason.

original: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This is the meaning.üîΩHe demonstrates just that in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúIf the universal is related to that . . .‚Äù

original: de nyid de la 'brel pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te spyi'i bdag nyid 'di gang yin zhes dris pa de la khyod kyis gcig cig du ma dang 'brel pa yod na gsal ba rnams la tha mi dad pa'i shes pa 'jug ste des na zhes
analyzed: de nyid de la 'brel pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te spyi'i bdag nyid 'di gang yin zhes dris pa de la khyod kyis gcig cig du ma dang 'brel pa yod na gsal ba rnams la tha mi dad pa'i shes pa 'jug ste des na zhes
translated: When asked, ‚ÄúWhat is the nature of the universal?‚Äù you say, ‚ÄúIf one is related to many, then cognition of the particulars is not different. Therefore . . .‚Äù

original: bya ba shes pa 'jug pa'i rgyus na du ma dang 'brel pa gcig ni spyi yin no zhes /
analyzed: bya ba shes pa 'jug pa'i rgyus na du ma dang 'brel pa gcig ni spyi yin no zhes /
translated: The reason for the engagement of cognition is that one related to many is the universal.

original: spyi'i mtshan nyid smras pa spyi'i mtshan nyid de la kho bos bshad pa 'bras bu'i rdzas la sogs ba gang dag la du ma dang 'brel pa yod pa ste /
analyzed: spyi'i mtshan nyid smras pa spyi'i mtshan nyid de la kho bos bshad pa 'bras bu'i rdzas la sogs ba gang dag la du ma dang 'brel pa yod pa ste /
translated: You have stated the definition of the universal. We say that the definition of the universal is those things that are effects, substances, and so on that are related to many.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gnyis nyid la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gnyis nyid la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes being related to two and so on.

original: de dag las kyang de dag gi rten gyi rdzas rnams la shes pa rnam pa gcig pa can 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag las kyang de dag gi rten gyi rdzas rnams la shes pa rnam pa gcig pa can 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: And from those, cognition with a single aspect would engage the substances that are their supports.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na rgyu mtshan srid pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na rgyu mtshan srid pa'i phyir te /
translated: Why? Because the reason is possible.

original: @90b 'di ltar spyi du ma dang 'brel pa kho na las gcig tu shes pa skye bar 'dod na /
analyzed: @90b 'di ltar spyi du ma dang 'brel pa kho na las gcig tu shes pa skye bar 'dod na /
translated: Thus, if you assert that cognition of a single thing arises only from the connection with many universals,

original: gcig tu shes pa'i rgyu mtshan du ma dang 'brel pa nyid ni 'bras bu 'bras bu la sogs pa la yang yod do //
analyzed: gcig tu shes pa'i rgyu mtshan du ma dang 'brel pa nyid ni 'bras bu 'bras bu la sogs pa la yang yod do //
translated: the connection with many reasons for a single cognition also exists in effects, effects of effects, and so on.

original: gcig tu shes pa 'jug pa de'i phyir grangs la sogs pa yang spyi'i bdag nyid yin no //
analyzed: gcig tu shes pa 'jug pa de'i phyir grangs la sogs pa yang spyi'i bdag nyid yin no //
translated: Because a single cognition engages them, number and so on also have the nature of universals.üîΩIf that were not so,

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te spyi'i mtshan nyid ji skad bshad pa dang ldan yang grangs la sogs pa la spyi'i bdag nyid du mi 'dod na gzhan spyir 'dod pa la yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te spyi'i mtshan nyid ji skad bshad pa dang ldan yang grangs la sogs pa la spyi'i bdag nyid du mi 'dod na gzhan spyir 'dod pa la yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: if you did not assert that number and so on have the nature of universals even though they possess the characteristics of universals as explained, then you would not assert that anything else is a universal.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no difference.

original: de ltar rdzas la sogs pa yang spyi'i nyid du gyur na ni rdzas dang yon tan la sogs pa'i ngo bo 'chol ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar rdzas la sogs pa yang spyi'i nyid du gyur na ni rdzas dang yon tan la sogs pa'i ngo bo 'chol ba yin no //
translated: If substance and so on were universals, the nature of substance, quality, and so on would be confused.

original: blo'i snang ba kho na zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo la rnam pa gcig tu snang ba ste /üîΩda ni shes pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: blo'i snang ba kho na zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo la rnam pa gcig tu snang ba ste / da ni shes pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúThe appearance of cognition‚Äù means the appearance of a single aspect in a conceptual cognition.üîΩNow, if you say that because it is the nature of cognition,

original: shes pa bzhin du yod pa nyid pas spyi yin no zhe na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: shes pa bzhin du yod pa nyid pas spyi yin no zhe na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: it exists like cognition and is a universal,üîΩthis is not so.

original: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'gog par byed de //üîΩspyi shes pa'i ngo bor 'dod pa gang yin pa shes pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid bzhin du /
analyzed: de ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'gog par byed de // spyi shes pa'i ngo bor 'dod pa gang yin pa shes pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid bzhin du /
translated: He refutes this with ‚ÄúThis is not so‚Äù and so on.

original: shes pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: shes pa dang tha dad pa ma yin pa ste /
translated: That which is asserted to be the nature of the cognition of a universal is not different from the intrinsic identity of cognition.

original: ji ltar don gzhan phyi rol gyi la 'brang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar don gzhan phyi rol gyi la 'brang bar 'gyur te /
translated: How could it be related to another object, an external object?

original: de dag gi spyi ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag gi spyi ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not their universal, that is the meaning.

original: de nyid shes pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: de nyid shes pa'i ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: He demonstrates this with ‚ÄúThat is the nature of cognition‚Äù and so on.

original: shes pa'i ngo bo de ni don de rnams la med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa'i ngo bo de ni don de rnams la med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the entity of consciousness does not exist in those objects.

original: gal te shes pa'i ngo bo gsal ba rnams kyi rjes su mi 'gro ba ni bden na 'on kyang blo'i snang ba de la de'i ngo bor zhen pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gal te shes pa'i ngo bo gsal ba rnams kyi rjes su mi 'gro ba ni bden na 'on kyang blo'i snang ba de la de'i ngo bor zhen pa'i phyir /
translated: If it is true that the entity of consciousness does not follow the clarity of objects, then the appearance of consciousness is conceived to be its entity.

original: phyi rol gyi dngos por sgro btags pa'i phyir de ltar 'khrul pas zhes bya ba 'di ni dngos po rnams kyi mtshungs pa'i ngo bo yin no zhes 'khrul pas spyir tha snyad 'dogs so zhe na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi dngos por sgro btags pa'i phyir de ltar 'khrul pas zhes bya ba 'di ni dngos po rnams kyi mtshungs pa'i ngo bo yin no zhes 'khrul pas spyir tha snyad 'dogs so zhe na /
translated: Since it is mistaken in that way, it superimposes external things, and thus it is mistaken in that it superimposes the same entity of things in general.

original: 'di ni grub pa'i mtha' smra bas yang 'don pa kho na yin na /
analyzed: 'di ni grub pa'i mtha' smra bas yang 'don pa kho na yin na /
translated: This is merely the assertion of the proponents of tenets.

original: bstan bcos mdzad pa ni gsal ba rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu gcig pa can de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa las log pa rnams blo de lta bu'i rgyu mtshan nyid yin pas blo de gzhan sel ba'i rten can du bzhed la /
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pa ni gsal ba rang bzhin gyi 'bras bu gcig pa can de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa las log pa rnams blo de lta bu'i rgyu mtshan nyid yin pas blo de gzhan sel ba'i rten can du bzhed la /
translated: The author of the treatise asserts that the basis of the exclusion of other is the reason for that type of consciousness, which is not the result of a single nature that is clarity, but is the opposite of that which is not its result.

original: gzhan ni rgyu mtshan de lta bu mi 'dod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: gzhan ni rgyu mtshan de lta bu mi 'dod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: Others merely do not assert that reason.

original: de nyid kyi phyir grub pa'i mtha' smras bas rgyu mtshan kho na dri bar de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgsal @91a * //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir grub pa'i mtha' smras bas rgyu mtshan kho na dri bar de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gsal @91a * //
translated: the treatise states, ‚ÄúBecause of the assertion of tenets.‚Äù

original: ba'i khyad par spyi dngos por gyur pa'i chos dang bral ba de la'o //üîΩgsal ba'i rang bzhin gyi rigs mi mthun pa la sogs pa rnams 'bras bu gcig pa can nyid du mi 'dod na de ltar shes pa skye ba'i mtshungs so zhes bya ba de ltar shes pa skye ba'i rgyu gang zhig yin /
analyzed: ba'i khyad par spyi dngos por gyur pa'i chos dang bral ba de la'o // gsal ba'i rang bzhin gyi rigs mi mthun pa la sogs pa rnams 'bras bu gcig pa can nyid du mi 'dod na de ltar shes pa skye ba'i mtshungs so zhes bya ba de ltar shes pa skye ba'i rgyu gang zhig yin /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the specific instance that is devoid of the universal that is a real entity.üîΩIf you do not assert that different types of specific instances have the same effect, then what is the cause of the arising of the cognition that perceives them in that way?

original: cung zad kyang med pa nyid de 'di ltar gzhan khyad par rigs mi mthun pa las log pa rnams ni shes pa gcig gi rgyu nyid du mi 'dod la spyi dngos por gyur pa yang med do //
analyzed: cung zad kyang med pa nyid de 'di ltar gzhan khyad par rigs mi mthun pa las log pa rnams ni shes pa gcig gi rgyu nyid du mi 'dod la spyi dngos por gyur pa yang med do //
translated: There is no cause at all, because you do not assert that different types of specific instances are the cause of a single cognition, and there is no universal that is a real entity.

original: rten med par zhes bya ba ni spyir shes pa rgyu mtshan med par skye na ni thams cad la 'gyur ro zhes bya ba shing dag la yang ba lang ngo snyam pa'i shes pa rnam pa gcig pa can 'byung bar 'gyur ro //üîΩshes dang tha dad ma yin pa //
analyzed: rten med par zhes bya ba ni spyir shes pa rgyu mtshan med par skye na ni thams cad la 'gyur ro zhes bya ba shing dag la yang ba lang ngo snyam pa'i shes pa rnam pa gcig pa can 'byung bar 'gyur ro // shes dang tha dad ma yin pa //
translated: If consciousness were to arise without a cause, then it would arise in regard to everything.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don gzhan rnam pa gcig tu na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i don gzhan rnam pa gcig tu na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The meaning of the statement ‚Äúconsciousness is not different‚Äù and so on is as follows.

original: sngar ni don gzhan zhes bya ba'i sgras phyi rol gyi yin par bshad do //
analyzed: sngar ni don gzhan zhes bya ba'i sgras phyi rol gyi yin par bshad do //
translated: The word ‚Äúdifferent‚Äù in the previous statement refers to external objects.

original: da ni shes pa gzhin  yin par bstan te /
analyzed: da ni shes pa gzhin  yin par bstan te /
translated: Now, it is taught that consciousness is different.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ji ltar shes pa gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ji ltar shes pa gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúHow can consciousness be different from itself?‚Äù

original: shes pa khyad par ji lta bu can zhig ce na /
analyzed: shes pa khyad par ji lta bu can zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of consciousness is different?

original: gsal ba gzhan la 'byung ba'i ste ba lang gi gsal ba gcig la rnam par rtog pa can gyi shes pa skyes pa gang yin pa de las gzhan pa pa lang gi gsal ba gzhan la rnam par rtog pa can gyi shes pa skyes pa'i zhes bya ba'i
analyzed: gsal ba gzhan la 'byung ba'i ste ba lang gi gsal ba gcig la rnam par rtog pa can gyi shes pa skyes pa gang yin pa de las gzhan pa pa lang gi gsal ba gzhan la rnam par rtog pa can gyi shes pa skyes pa'i zhes bya ba'i
translated: The meaning of the passage is this: A conceptual cognition of a cow arises in regard to one particular cow, and a conceptual cognition of a cow arises in regard to another particular cow.

original: don to // 'di ltar shes pa'i khyad par du ma la khyab pa'i phyir ram phyi rol gyi gsal ba la khyab pa'i phyir spyi yin pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na shes pa'i snang ba la ni gnyi ga yang med do //
analyzed: don to // 'di ltar shes pa'i khyad par du ma la khyab pa'i phyir ram phyi rol gyi gsal ba la khyab pa'i phyir spyi yin pa zhig tu 'gyur grang na shes pa'i snang ba la ni gnyi ga yang med do //
translated: In this way, it would be a universal because it pervades many particular cognitions or because it pervades external particulars. But neither of these two is the case with regard to the appearance in cognition.

original: de nyid de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te gsal ba gzhan zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi'o //
analyzed: de nyid de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te gsal ba gzhan zhes bya ba ni phyi rol gyi'o //
translated: He demonstrates just this with ‚ÄúFor that reason, etc.‚Äù ‚ÄúAnother particular‚Äù means an external one.

original: de ltas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug sdud do //
analyzed: de ltas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug sdud do //
translated: With ‚ÄúFor that reason, etc.‚Äù he concludes.

original: de nyid don rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad de /
analyzed: de nyid don rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas 'chad de /
translated: He explains this with ‚ÄúThe objects, etc.‚Äù

original: bdag nyid gang gis kyang zhes bya ba ni spyi'i ngo bos so //
analyzed: bdag nyid gang gis kyang zhes bya ba ni spyi'i ngo bos so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy any nature of its own‚Äù means by the nature of a universal.

original: de rnams la de ltar 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni don rnams la mtshungs pa'o zhes bya bar 'dzin pa'o //üîΩgrub pa'i mtha' smra bas kyang rnam par rtog pa 'di'i rgyu brjod dgos te /
analyzed: de rnams la de ltar 'dzin pa zhes bya ba ni don rnams la mtshungs pa'o zhes bya bar 'dzin pa'o // grub pa'i mtha' smra bas kyang rnam par rtog pa 'di'i rgyu brjod dgos te /
translated: The apprehension of those as such is the apprehension of sameness with respect to objects.

original: rten med par skye na ni thams cad la thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rten med par skye na ni thams cad la thal bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: The proponent of tenets must state the cause of this conception, If it arises without a basis, it would follow that it arises everywhere.

original: ming don gang ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ming don gang ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: He says, What is the name that possesses the object, etc.?

original: ming ni @91b brdar byed pa'o //üîΩde don gang dang ldan pa ste gang la rtogs par bya ba nyid kyi don 'bras bu phan tshun tha dad pa gang yin pa yod pa ni zhes bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: ming ni @91b brdar byed pa'o // de don gang dang ldan pa ste gang la rtogs par bya ba nyid kyi don 'bras bu phan tshun tha dad pa gang yin pa yod pa ni zhes bya ba yin pa'i phyir /
translated: A name is a conventional symbol.

original: ming brdar byed pa'o //
analyzed: ming brdar byed pa'o //
translated: The name that possesses the object, that is, the name that has the object that is to be understood, is the name that is the conventional symbol for the object that is the result of the mutual difference of the name and the object.

original: don gang dang ldan pa ni 'bras bu phan tshun tha dad pa gang zhig rtog pa dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: don gang dang ldan pa ni 'bras bu phan tshun tha dad pa gang zhig rtog pa dang ldan pa ste /
translated: The object that possesses the name is the object that is the result of the mutual difference of the name and the object, and it is the object that possesses the conception.

original: phan tshun du tha dad pa dngos po rnams kyi rigs mi mthun pa la ldog pa'i mtshan nyid de lta bu de ni nor ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'di'i yang sa bon yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun du tha dad pa dngos po rnams kyi rigs mi mthun pa la ldog pa'i mtshan nyid de lta bu de ni nor ba'i rnam par rtog pa 'di'i yang sa bon yin no //
translated: The seed of this erroneous conception is the characteristic of the exclusion of heterogeneous entities that are mutually different.

original: bsgrub par bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad de /
analyzed: bsgrub par bya ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad de /
translated: He explains that with ‚Äúthat which is to be established,‚Äù etc.

original: de'i bsgrub bar bya ba can ma yin pa dag las zhes bya ba de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dag las bsgrub par bya ba tha dad pa can bsgrub par bya ba so so ba can gyi dngos po rnams tha dad par shes par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i bsgrub bar bya ba can ma yin pa dag las zhes bya ba de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dag las bsgrub par bya ba tha dad pa can bsgrub par bya ba so so ba can gyi dngos po rnams tha dad par shes par bya ste /
translated: The entities that have a different to-be-established property, i.e., that are not the effect of that, should be understood to be different.

original: de dag yongs su spangs nas /
analyzed: de dag yongs su spangs nas /
translated: Having excluded those,

original: de'i 'bras bu can dag la 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir brdar byed de /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu can dag la 'jug par 'gyur ba'i phyir brdar byed de /
translated: one engages in those that are its effect, and thus one makes a convention.

original: phan tshun tha dad pa gang zhig shes par bya ba'i phyir brdar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: phan tshun tha dad pa gang zhig shes par bya ba'i phyir brdar byed pa yin no //
translated: One makes a convention in order to understand those that are mutually different.

original: phan tshun tha dad pa'i ji skad du bshad pa /
analyzed: phan tshun tha dad pa'i ji skad du bshad pa /
translated: Those that are mutually different are as they have been explained.

original: de ni log pa'i rnam par rtog pa gcig gi bdag nyid du snang ba can rnam pa gcig pa can de'i sa bon yin te /
analyzed: de ni log pa'i rnam par rtog pa gcig gi bdag nyid du snang ba can rnam pa gcig pa can de'i sa bon yin te /
translated: It is the seed of that, which has the nature of a single false conception, and which appears as a single aspect.

original: rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rgyu yin no //
translated: It is the cause.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i 'di ni zhes bya ba ni spyi'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa'o de kho na 'dzin pa na zhes bya ba ni khyad par te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i 'di ni zhes bya ba ni spyi'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa'o de kho na 'dzin pa na zhes bya ba ni khyad par te /
translated: This conception is a conception that has a general aspect. When it apprehends that, it has a particular aspect.

original: 'di yang lhag par zhen pa'i dbang gis brjod kyi rnam par rtog pa la dngos po 'dzin pa ni med do //
analyzed: 'di yang lhag par zhen pa'i dbang gis brjod kyi rnam par rtog pa la dngos po 'dzin pa ni med do //
translated: This is also expressed by the power of excessive attachment, but there is no apprehension of an entity in a conception.

original: rang gi bag chags kyi rang bzhin las zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyi ngo bo nyid las te /
analyzed: rang gi bag chags kyi rang bzhin las zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i bag chags kyi ngo bo nyid las te /
translated: From the nature of its own habitual tendencies means from the nature of the habitual tendencies of conception.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba rnam pa gcig pa can nyid du snang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba rnam pa gcig pa can nyid du snang ngo //
translated: Thus, it appears as a single aspect.

original: yang ji ltar na 'bras bu gcig byed pa nyid gang gis na de ma yin pa dag las de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa ngag las log pa'i rgyus gsal ba rnams tha mi dad pa zhes brjod pa tha dad pa rang gi mtshan nyid rnams kyi 'bras
analyzed: yang ji ltar na 'bras bu gcig byed pa nyid gang gis na de ma yin pa dag las de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa ngag las log pa'i rgyus gsal ba rnams tha mi dad pa zhes brjod pa tha dad pa rang gi mtshan nyid rnams kyi 'bras
translated: The cause of their exclusion from that which is not their effect is that they are called ‚Äúnon-different‚Äù because they are the same effect of individual characteristics that are different.

original: bu tha mi dad pa rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid rnam pa gcig pa can yin te /
analyzed: bu tha mi dad pa rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid rnam pa gcig pa can yin te /
translated: The effect of individual characteristics that are different is the single aspect that is the nature of a single cognition.

original: cig shos dang ma 'brel pa ni de las ldog pa can rnams kyi 'dra ba nyid yin no zhes smos pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: cig shos dang ma 'brel pa ni de las ldog pa can rnams kyi 'dra ba nyid yin no zhes smos pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: The other is not related to that, but it is the similarity of those that are the opposite of that.

original: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'de bas te rang bzhin ni ngo bo nyid do //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi rang bzhin zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'de bas te rang bzhin ni ngo bo nyid do //
translated: The response to that is stated in ‚ÄúThe nature of things, etc.‚Äù Nature is essence.

analyzed: gcig rtogs pa ni rnam pa gcig tu mngon par shes pa'o // don shes pa ni nyams @92a * //
translated: The understanding of one is the clear knowledge of a single aspect.

original: su myong ba'i shes pa ste /
analyzed: su myong ba'i shes pa ste /
translated: The knowledge of the object is the experience of the object.

original: gcig rtogs pa dang don shes pa zhes zlas dbye ba yin no //
analyzed: gcig rtogs pa dang don shes pa zhes zlas dbye ba yin no //
translated: The understanding of one and the knowledge of the object are a compound.

analyzed: sngar smos pa'i mtshan nyid ma nges pa'i phyir don shes pa'i zhes bya ba'i sgras ches nyung ba nyid yin yang sngar smos pa ma byas so //

analyzed: de la gcig rtogs pa'i don gcig bsgrub pa la nges pa zhes bya ba 'di ni dngos nyid du nye bar bkod pa yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes such things as fire and house.üîΩThe word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes such things as fire and house.üîΩThe word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes such things as

original: don shes pa la sogs pa don gcig bsgrub pa la nges pa zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe nyid du nye bar bkod pa yin te /
analyzed: don shes pa la sogs pa don gcig bsgrub pa la nges pa zhes bya ba 'di ni dpe nyid du nye bar bkod pa yin te /
translated: The example is stated in the phrase ‚Äúthe ascertainment of a single object, such as a pot,‚Äù etc.

original: gnyi ga la grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga la grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because both parties accept this example.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dpe nyid dang por rnam par dbye ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dpe nyid dang por rnam par dbye ste /
translated: Therefore, the example is stated first.

original: ji ltar dbang po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ji ltar dbang po dang yul dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa rnams kyis gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa gcig skyed par byed do zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: ji ltar dbang po dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la ji ltar dbang po dang yul dang snang ba dang yid la byed pa rnams kyis gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa gcig skyed par byed do zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äújust as the sense faculty, the object, light, and mental activity‚Äù is to be supplied in the phrase ‚Äúproduce a single visual consciousness.‚Äù

original: 'di ni dngos po'i stobs kyis grub pa'i dper brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni dngos po'i stobs kyis grub pa'i dper brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is an example that is established by the power of fact.

original: bdag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' la brten nas te /
analyzed: bdag dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi grub pa'i mtha' la brten nas te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe self, the sense faculty, the object, etc.‚Äù is based on the tenets of other schools.

original: yid ni brtag pa yul phra mo la gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: yid ni brtag pa yul phra mo la gnas pa yin no //
translated: The self is the mental faculty that is subtle and abides in the body.

original: de rnams phrad pa zhes bya ba ni bdag dang dbang po dang don rnams phrad pa ste bdag ni yid dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: de rnams phrad pa zhes bya ba ni bdag dang dbang po dang don rnams phrad pa ste bdag ni yid dang sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthe contact of these‚Äù refers to the contact of the self, the sense faculty, and the object. The self is associated with the mental faculty.

original: yid ni dbang po dang ngo //
analyzed: yid ni dbang po dang ngo //
translated: The mind is the sense faculty.

original: dbang po ni don dang ngo zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po ni don dang ngo zhes 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The sense faculty is the object.

original: bdag dang dbang po dang yid dang don rnams dang phrad pa zhes zlas dbye ba yin te /
analyzed: bdag dang dbang po dang yid dang don rnams dang phrad pa zhes zlas dbye ba yin te /
translated: The contact is a conjunction of the self, the sense faculty, the mind, and the object.

original: bdag dang dbang po dang yid dang don bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du phrad pa grogs byed pa can rnams ni rnam par shes pa bskyed do zhes khas len to //
analyzed: bdag dang dbang po dang yid dang don bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin du phrad pa grogs byed pa can rnams ni rnam par shes pa bskyed do zhes khas len to //
translated: The self, the sense faculty, the mind, and the object, which are in a state of conjunction, which are in a state of being a contributory cause, generate consciousness.

original: de'i ngo bor nges pa'i spyi med kyang zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu gcig pa can nyid du nges pa ste /
analyzed: de'i ngo bor nges pa'i spyi med kyang zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu gcig pa can nyid du nges pa ste /
translated: Even though there is no universal that is ascertained as the nature of that,

original: gzhan mig la sogs pa mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skyed par byed pa nyid ces bya ba spyi ni mi 'dod do //
analyzed: gzhan mig la sogs pa mig gi rnam par shes pa la sogs pa skyed par byed pa nyid ces bya ba spyi ni mi 'dod do //
translated: we do not accept that there is a universal called the nature of generating visual consciousness, etc., in other sense faculties such as the eye.

original: da ni dngos nyid du nye bar bkod pa de ston to //
analyzed: da ni dngos nyid du nye bar bkod pa de ston to //
translated: Now he shows the example of the nature of things.

original: @92b shing sha pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni shing sha pa dang / seng ldeng dang n+ya gro dha la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: @92b shing sha pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni shing sha pa dang / seng ldeng dang n+ya gro dha la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù in ‚Äúcamphor, etc.‚Äù includes khadira and nyagrodha trees.

original: phan tshun rjes su mi 'gro yang //
analyzed: phan tshun rjes su mi 'gro yang //
translated: Even though they do not follow each other,

original: zhes bya ba ni shing du gcig pa nyid kyis spyi med par yang ngo //üîΩshing sha pa la sogs pa ni shing zhes rnam pa gcig tu mngon par shes pa skyed par byed pa'am /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni shing du gcig pa nyid kyis spyi med par yang ngo // shing sha pa la sogs pa ni shing zhes rnam pa gcig tu mngon par shes pa skyed par byed pa'am /
translated: This means that the universal does not exist because of the non-difference of the tree.

original: mngon par shes pa la gzhan me dang khyim la sogs pa shing gis bsgrub par bya ba'i don bya ba bskyed do zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa la gzhan me dang khyim la sogs pa shing gis bsgrub par bya ba'i don bya ba bskyed do zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar ro //
translated: The cognition of the tree, etc. is produced as one kind, or it produces the effect to be accomplished by the tree, such as fire, house, etc.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni shing rta la sogs pa'i bya ba yongs su bsdu'o //üîΩrkyen ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni re zhig gang gi tshe /üîΩme'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dang phrad pa de'i tshe ni me skyed par byed la /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni shing rta la sogs pa'i bya ba yongs su bsdu'o // rkyen ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni re zhig gang gi tshe / me'i lhan cig byed pa'i rkyen dang phrad pa de'i tshe ni me skyed par byed la /
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the activity of the chariot, etc.üîΩ‚ÄúIn accordance with the conditions‚Äù means that when the fire encounters the cooperative conditions, then it produces fire.

original: khyim dang mthun pa'i rkyen dang phrad pa'i tshe ni khyim skyed par byed do //
analyzed: khyim dang mthun pa'i rkyen dang phrad pa'i tshe ni khyim skyed par byed do //
translated: When it encounters the conditions that are favorable to the house, then it produces the house.

original: tha dad par khyad par med kyang chu la sogs pa ni shing gis bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tha dad par khyad par med kyang chu la sogs pa ni shing gis bsgrub par bya ba'i don byed par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Although they are not different in kind, water, etc. are not able to perform the function of accomplishing wood,

original: de dag ni rang bzhin gyis 'bras bu de dag dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni rang bzhin gyis 'bras bu de dag dang ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they do not naturally possess that effect.

original: 'dir yang dper na gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa la rna ba la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: 'dir yang dper na gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa la rna ba la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Here, it is like the ear, etc. in relation to the consciousness of form, etc.

original: dper na rna ba dang sgra la sogs pas gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa bskyed par mi nus pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na rna ba dang sgra la sogs pas gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa bskyed par mi nus pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the ear, sound, etc. are not able to generate the consciousness of form.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ro la sogs pa la rnam par shes pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ro la sogs pa la rnam par shes pa bsdu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the consciousness of taste, etc.

original: dper na rims la sogs pa zhi bar bya ba la sogs pa'i don gcig la sman dag mthong ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: dper na rims la sogs pa zhi bar bya ba la sogs pa'i don gcig la sman dag mthong ba lta bu ste /
translated: For example, in the case of a single purpose, such as the alleviation of fever, etc., various medicines are seen.

original: lhan cig pa zhes bya ba ni gsal ba gzhan dang lhan cig pa'o //
analyzed: lhan cig pa zhes bya ba ni gsal ba gzhan dang lhan cig pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúTogether‚Äù means together with another manifestation.

original: so so yis zhes bya ba ni re re'i ngo bos so //
analyzed: so so yis zhes bya ba ni re re'i ngo bos so //
translated: ‚ÄúIndividually‚Äù means by the nature of each.

original: 'am zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dpe snga ma la ltos nas bsdu ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: 'am zhes bya ba'i sgra ni dpe snga ma la ltos nas bsdu ba'i don yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúor‚Äù means that the example is included in the previous example.

original: gzhan gyis ma yin pa ni zho dang ga gon la sogs pa'i gsal ba rnams kyis so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis ma yin pa ni zho dang ga gon la sogs pa'i gsal ba rnams kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúNot by another‚Äù means not by the individual entities of curd, sesame, etc.

original: yang na dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed de rims la sogs pa zhi bar bya ba la sogs pa de la sman nyid ces bya ba'i spyi la ltos pa ni med do //
analyzed: yang na dper na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed de rims la sogs pa zhi bar bya ba la sogs pa de la sman nyid ces bya ba'i spyi la ltos pa ni med do //
translated: Or, he explains it with ‚ÄúFor example, etc.‚Äù There is no reliance on a universal called ‚Äúmedicine‚Äù for the pacification of fever, etc.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: tha dad kyang de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: tha dad kyang de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because, although different, it has that nature.

original: rims la sogs pa'i 'bras bu zhi bar byed pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rims la sogs pa'i 'bras bu zhi bar byed pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has the nature of pacifying the effect of fever, etc.

original: gal te tha dad pa rnams la spyi zhig yod na ni spyi la ltos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa rnams la spyi zhig yod na ni spyi la ltos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were a universal in different things, there would be reliance on a universal.

original: der khyad par med kyang zhes bya ba ni tha dad par khyad par med kyang ngo //
analyzed: der khyad par med kyang zhes bya ba ni tha dad par khyad par med kyang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúEven though there is no difference there‚Äù means even though there is no difference in the different things.

original: zho @93a * //
analyzed: zho @93a * //
translated: curd

original: dang ga gon la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni zhor ma ded pa ni zho nyid ma langs pa'o //
analyzed: dang ga gon la sogs pa zhes bya ba ni zhor ma ded pa ni zho nyid ma langs pa'o //
translated: The phrase curds and so on means that the curds are not produced from the milk itself.

original: gzhan dag na re zho dang ga gon zhes zlas dbye ba yin no zhes zer ro //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re zho dang ga gon zhes zlas dbye ba yin no zhes zer ro //
translated: Others say that curds and so on is a dvandva compound.

original: de lta bu zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu gcig byed pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bu zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu gcig byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase such as these means that they produce a single effect.

original: de dag las zhes bya ba sle tres la sogs pa gsal ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: de dag las zhes bya ba sle tres la sogs pa gsal ba rnams la'o //
translated: The phrase from them refers to the manifest entities such as the myrobalan.

original: spyi de kho na las rims zhi ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu gcig pa der 'gyur te /
analyzed: spyi de kho na las rims zhi ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi 'bras bu gcig pa der 'gyur te /
translated: The single effect that is characterized by the cessation of fever and so on is produced from that universal alone.

original: des na dpe ma grub po snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: des na dpe ma grub po snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the example is not established. This is the idea.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te spyi khyad par med phyir zhes bya ba spyi ni gcig pa'i phyir dang rtag pa'i phyir khyad par med do //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de ni rigs pa ma yin te zhes bya ba smos te spyi khyad par med phyir zhes bya ba spyi ni gcig pa'i phyir dang rtag pa'i phyir khyad par med do //
translated: The Proponents of the Doctrines of the Enumerators say, That is not logical, because the universal is not differentiated. Because the universal is one and permanent, it is not differentiated.

original: 'bras bu de byed par zhes bya ba ni rims zhi ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu byed pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu de byed par zhes bya ba ni rims zhi ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu byed pa'o //
translated: The phrase in producing that effect means in producing the effect that is the cessation of fever and so on.

original: gzhan du ni spyi la khyad par med pa'i sle tres la sogs pa gsal ba de dag gi zhing la sogs pa tha dad kyang rims zhi ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu de yang /
analyzed: gzhan du ni spyi la khyad par med pa'i sle tres la sogs pa gsal ba de dag gi zhing la sogs pa tha dad kyang rims zhi ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu de yang /
translated: Otherwise, in the absence of a difference in general characteristics, such as the general characteristics of lettuce, the results of pacifying illness and so on would be the same even though the fields and so on are different.üîΩ

original: khyad par med par thal 'gyur phyir te /
analyzed: khyad par med par thal 'gyur phyir te /
translated: Otherwise, the result of pacifying disease, etc. would be the same, because the general characteristics of the vegetables, etc. would be undifferentiated, even though their fields, etc. are differentiated.

original: gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig pa nyid du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they would be the same.

original: zhi ba myur ba dang bul ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zhing khyad par can las 'khrungs pa rnams kyis ni zhi ba myur ro //
analyzed: zhi ba myur ba dang bul ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni zhing khyad par can las 'khrungs pa rnams kyis ni zhi ba myur ro //
translated: The terms ‚Äúquick‚Äù and ‚Äúslow‚Äù in ‚Äúquick pacification‚Äù and ‚Äúslow pacification‚Äù refer to those born from special fields, etc.

original: bzlog pa rnams kyis ni zhi ba bul lo //
analyzed: bzlog pa rnams kyis ni zhi ba bul lo //
translated: Those born from the opposite fields, etc. are slow.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ches myur ba dang ches bul ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ches myur ba dang ches bul ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes very quick and very slow.

original: zhing dang legs par bya ba la sogs pas tha dad pa'i sle tres la sogs pa nye bar sbyar ba las lus nad med pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yon tan mchog dang ches mchog tu yang mi 'gyur te /

analyzed: de'i phyir gzhi mthun pa nyid ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, there is no common locus.

original: chos gzhan spangs pa kho nas blo de las gzhan pa'i khyad par 'dod pa med pa'i phyir khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos po yang ma yin no //
analyzed: chos gzhan spangs pa kho nas blo de las gzhan pa'i khyad par 'dod pa med pa'i phyir khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos po yang ma yin no //
translated: And because it is not asserted that the cognition is a different attribute than the mere exclusion of other phenomena, it is not the case that there is a relation of attribute and possessor of the attribute.

original: gnyis pa chos can brjod pa'i sgra'i phyogs la ni gzhi mthun pa nyid dang / khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos po yod de ba lang dkar po'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa chos can brjod pa'i sgra'i phyogs la ni gzhi mthun pa nyid dang / khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos po yod de ba lang dkar po'o zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: In the second case, where the term expresses a subject, there is a common locus and there is a relation of attribute and possessor of the attribute, as in the case of ‚Äúwhite ox.‚Äù

original: gzhi mthun pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs su de lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhi mthun pa nyid kyi gtan tshigs su de lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this, BhƒÅviveka says, ‚ÄúIn the case of a common locus, the reason is ‚Äòbecause of being such and such.‚Äô‚Äù

original: de lta bu'i brda'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par gcad par khyad par gzhan ma spangs pa la chos kyi sgrar brdar gdags pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i rgyus so //
analyzed: de lta bu'i brda'i rjes su 'brang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni rnam par gcad par khyad par gzhan ma spangs pa la chos kyi sgrar brdar gdags pa'i rjes su 'brang ba'i rgyus so //
translated: Because of following such a convention, i.e., because of following the convention of designating the word dharma for a particular that is not excluded.

original: rnam par gcad pa'i chos ni rnam par gcad pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos so //
analyzed: rnam par gcad pa'i chos ni rnam par gcad pa'i bdag nyid kyi chos so //
translated: The dharma of exclusion is the dharma of the nature of exclusion.

original: bsdus pa ni chos can gcig la sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: bsdus pa ni chos can gcig la sbyor ba ste /
translated: Inclusion is the application to one substratum.

original: de dag ni rnam par gcad pa'i chos mtha' dag kyang yin la bsdus pa yang yin pas zhes las 'dzin pa can du bya ste /üîΩchos rgyur gyur @95a * //
analyzed: de dag ni rnam par gcad pa'i chos mtha' dag kyang yin la bsdus pa yang yin pas zhes las 'dzin pa can du bya ste / chos rgyur gyur @95a * //
translated: Since they are both the totality of dharmas of exclusion and also included, they are to be taken as having the suffix -tva.

original: ba byed pa nyid du lhag par zhen nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ba byed pa nyid du lhag par zhen nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of engaging in the belief that the dharma is the cause of the activity of the object.

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni gal te rnam par rtog pa'i cha la phyi rol du lhag par zhen pa zhig tu ma gyur na de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa de lta bu skyes kyang don bya ba byed pa la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni gal te rnam par rtog pa'i cha la phyi rol du lhag par zhen pa zhig tu ma gyur na de'i tshe rnam par rtog pa de lta bu skyes kyang don bya ba byed pa la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, i.e., if there were no belief in the external with regard to the part of imagination, then even though such imagination arises, it would not engage in the activity of the object.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the conceptual image.

original: tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa'i skyes bu'i lhag pa'i dbang gis don bya ba byed pa nyid du snang bas de'i phyir de mi byed pa dag las tha dad pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa'i skyes bu'i lhag pa'i dbang gis don bya ba byed pa nyid du snang bas de'i phyir de mi byed pa dag las tha dad pa lta bu yin no //
translated: Because it appears to be a functioning thing due to the power of the person who imputes the convention, therefore, it is as if it were different from those which do not perform a function.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan kho na ci'i phyir de kho na nyid ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan kho na ci'i phyir de kho na nyid ma yin zhe na /
translated: If the conceptual image is just that, why is it not reality?

original: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThat is not reality,‚Äù etc.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan de ni de kho na yin zhing dngos po ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i gzugs brnyan de ni de kho na yin zhing dngos po ma yin no //
translated: That conceptual image is not reality, it is not a thing.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: don bya ba mi byed pa nyid kyis brtag cing dpyad pa'i yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don bya ba mi byed pa nyid kyis brtag cing dpyad pa'i yan lag ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not a part of the investigation and analysis of the nonperformance of a function.

original: don bya ba mi byed pa ni de kho na nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: don bya ba mi byed pa ni de kho na nyid ma yin te /
translated: The nonperformance of a function is not reality.

original: 'di ni 'og nyid nas bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni 'og nyid nas bshad par bya'o //
translated: This will be explained later.

original: de la rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas 'ongs pa don gyi rnam pa rnam par rtog pa'i blo la snang ba gang dag yin pa rnam par rtog pa'i blo la gnas pa'i don de dag ni /
analyzed: de la rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas 'ongs pa don gyi rnam pa rnam par rtog pa'i blo la snang ba gang dag yin pa rnam par rtog pa'i blo la gnas pa'i don de dag ni /
translated: The aspects of objects that appear to the conceptual mind through their own characteristics are the objects that exist for the conceptual mind.

original: mtshan nyid tha dad pa can gyi spyi de dang mtshungs so zhes bya bar 'dzin to //
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad pa can gyi spyi de dang mtshungs so zhes bya bar 'dzin to //
translated: Those aspects of objects that appear to the conceptual mind through their own characteristics are apprehended by the conceptual mind as being the same as a universal that has a different characteristic.

original: 'ga' zhig las log par zhes bya ba ni rigs mi mthun pa las log par te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig las log par zhes bya ba ni rigs mi mthun pa las log par te /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom some‚Äù means from a dissimilar type.

original: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i shing gi khyad par rnams kyang /üîΩphyi rol la lhag par zhen pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i shing gi khyad par rnams kyang / phyi rol la lhag par zhen pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Thus, the particular trees that appear to the conceptual mind

original: shing ma yin pa rnams la log pa lta bur snang ste /
analyzed: shing ma yin pa rnams la log pa lta bur snang ste /
translated: appear as if they were the opposite of non-trees because they are the essence of the attachment to external objects.

original: gzhan dag kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: The same is true of the others.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni de dang mtshungs so zhes bya bar 'dzin pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni de dang mtshungs so zhes bya bar 'dzin pa ma yin te /
translated: They are not apprehended as being the same as their own characteristics.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: spyi snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa de la rang gi mtshan nyid mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi snang ba'i rnam par rtog pa de la rang gi mtshan nyid mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the specific characteristics do not appear in the conceptual thought that perceives the universal.

original: de ltar na re zhig blo la snang ba'i don la spyi'i tha snyad 'dogs par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig blo la snang ba'i don la spyi'i tha snyad 'dogs par bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is explained that the universal is designated in relation to the object that appears to cognition.

original: da ni gzhi mthun pa nyid kyi tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir de dag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: da ni gzhi mthun pa nyid kyi tha snyad gdags pa'i phyir de dag nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, in order to designate the universal in relation to the basis, he says, ‚ÄúThose very things,‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i don de dag nyid 'ga' zhig las log pa lta bur 'dug pa na ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i don de dag nyid 'ga' zhig las log pa lta bur 'dug pa na ste /
translated: Those very things that appear as objects in conceptual thought, when they appear as if they exclude some,

original: dper na autpala ma yin pa las log pa autpala'i khyad par de dag nyid gzhan sngon po ma yin pa las kyang log pa ldan pa lta bur ldog pa gnyis dang ldan par yang snang la /
analyzed: dper na autpala ma yin pa las log pa autpala'i khyad par de dag nyid gzhan sngon po ma yin pa las kyang log pa ldan pa lta bur ldog pa gnyis dang ldan par yang snang la /
translated: for example, the specific characteristics of the utpala, which exclude what is not the utpala, appear as if they possess two negations, excluding what is not blue.

original: chos can gcig gi ngo bor tha mi dad par @95b yang snang ngo //
analyzed: chos can gcig gi ngo bor tha mi dad par @95b yang snang ngo //
translated: And they appear as if they are not different in the nature of a single basis.

original: de bas na log pa gnyis dang ldan pa'i chos can gcig kho nar snang ba'i phyir gzhi mthun pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de bas na log pa gnyis dang ldan pa'i chos can gcig kho nar snang ba'i phyir gzhi mthun pa nyid yin no //
translated: Therefore, because they appear as a single basis possessing two negations, they are a universal.

original: blo la snang ba'i don rnams la spyi dang gzhi mthun pa'i tha snyad 'dogs pa bshad ma thag pa 'di yang nor ba'i don kho na la 'dogs pa yin no //
analyzed: blo la snang ba'i don rnams la spyi dang gzhi mthun pa'i tha snyad 'dogs pa bshad ma thag pa 'di yang nor ba'i don kho na la 'dogs pa yin no //
translated: The immediately preceding explanation that the terms ‚Äúuniversal‚Äù and ‚Äúcommon locus‚Äù are applied to objects that appear to the mind are also applied to only mistaken objects.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa rnams bdag nyid kyis med kyang rnam par rtog pa can gyi blos de ltar rnam pa gcig dang ldan pa dang / ldog pa gnyis dang ldan pa'i chos can gcig gi ngo bor ston pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam pa rnams bdag nyid kyis med kyang rnam par rtog pa can gyi blos de ltar rnam pa gcig dang ldan pa dang / ldog pa gnyis dang ldan pa'i chos can gcig gi ngo bor ston pa'i phyir te /
translated: Although the aspects of conceptual cognition do not exist by way of their own entity, the conceptual mind shows them as having one aspect, two modes of negation, and the nature of a single entity.

original: rnam pa gcig tu snang ba'i phyir spyi'i tha snyad 'dogs la //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig tu snang ba'i phyir spyi'i tha snyad 'dogs la //
translated: Because they appear as one aspect, the term ‚Äúuniversal‚Äù is applied.

original: ldog pa gnyis dang ldan pa'i chos can gcig gi ngo bor snang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: ldog pa gnyis dang ldan pa'i chos can gcig gi ngo bor snang ba'i phyir /
translated: Because they appear as the nature of a single entity that has two modes of negation,

original: gzhi mthun pa'i tha snyad 'dogs so //
analyzed: gzhi mthun pa'i tha snyad 'dogs so //
translated: the term ‚Äúcommon locus‚Äù is applied.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa 'di thams cad nor ba'i don kho na la yin na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa 'di thams cad nor ba'i don kho na la yin na /
translated: If all of these conceptual cognitions are only mistaken with respect to their objects,

original: ci'i phyir byas pa nyid la sogs pa 'ongs pa mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni tshad ma yin la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir byas pa nyid la sogs pa 'ongs pa mi rtag pa dang / bdag med pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni tshad ma yin la /
translated: Why is the conceptual thought of impermanence, non-self, etc. with regard to what is produced, etc. a valid cognition,

original: rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: but the conceptual thought of permanence, etc. not?

original: 'di thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says: ‚ÄúAll of this,‚Äù etc.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThis‚Äù refers to the conceptual thought of permanence, etc.

original: thams cad bslad pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
