analyzed: thams cad bslad pa yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: ‚ÄúAll of this‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: bslad pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
analyzed: bslad pa'i rnam par rtog pa'o //
translated: It is a conceptual thought that is adulterated.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dag kho na mthong ba gang yin pa des gzhag pa'i bag chags des byas pa yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dag kho na mthong ba gang yin pa des gzhag pa'i bag chags des byas pa yin te /
translated: It is produced by the latent impressions that are deposited by that very seeing of the own-characteristics.

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni dngos po mthong ba'i sgo nas brgyud de 'ongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad ni dngos po mthong ba'i sgo nas brgyud de 'ongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For all conceptual thoughts come about through the medium of seeing things.

original: 'di ltar rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang dngos po mthong ba kho na las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang dngos po mthong ba kho na las byung ba yin te /
translated: Thus, the conceptual thought of permanence, etc. also arises only from seeing things.

original: 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba la sogs pas 'khrul ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //üîΩde la rnam par rtog pa thams cad dngos po mthong ba'i sgo nas 'ongs pa nyid du 'dra ba las de dang 'brel pa las skye ba mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams ni de snang ba nyid ma yin yang /
analyzed: 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba la sogs pas 'khrul ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do // de la rnam par rtog pa thams cad dngos po mthong ba'i sgo nas 'ongs pa nyid du 'dra ba las de dang 'brel pa las skye ba mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams ni de snang ba nyid ma yin yang /
translated: Therefore, it is only a mistake to think that the impermanent and so on are the essence of things.üîΩIn this regard, all conceptual thoughts arise from seeing an entity.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba nyid ma yin yang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo de dngos po la yod pa'i phyir dngos po la mi slu ste /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba nyid ma yin yang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo de dngos po la yod pa'i phyir dngos po la mi slu ste /
translated: From the connection with that, conceptual thoughts such as impermanence arise. They do not appear as that, but they are not mistaken with regard to the entity because the nature of impermanence and so on exists in the entity, even though its specific characteristics do not appear.

original: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid ngo bor mi snang bas 'khrul pa zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do //üîΩrang gi ngo bor ma bzung yang nor bu'i 'od la nor bur 'khrul pa slu ba lta bu ste nor bu'i 'od ni nor bu dang @96a * //
analyzed: mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid ngo bor mi snang bas 'khrul pa zhes bya ba 'ba' zhig tu zad do // rang gi ngo bor ma bzung yang nor bu'i 'od la nor bur 'khrul pa slu ba lta bu ste nor bu'i 'od ni nor bu dang @96a * //
translated: Conceptual thoughts such as impermanence are only said to be mistaken because they do not appear as the essence of the specific characteristics.

original: 'brel pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: 'brel pa'i phyir la /
translated: Even though they are not apprehended as their essence, like the mistake of mistaking the light of a jewel for the jewel, they are not mistaken because the light of the jewel is connected with the jewel.

original: 'khrul ba ni 'od la brten nas skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khrul ba ni 'od la brten nas skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because error arises in dependence on light.

original: rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: But the conceptual thoughts of permanence, etc. are not like that.

original: de dag ni dngos po mthong ba'i sgo nas 'ongs pa nyid yin yang dngos po la med pa kho na'i rnam par sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni dngos po mthong ba'i sgo nas 'ongs pa nyid yin yang dngos po la med pa kho na'i rnam par sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though they arise from seeing things, they superimpose what is nonexistent on things.

original: de nyid gzhan dag ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: de nyid gzhan dag ni ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: He shows that with ‚ÄúThey are not like that, etc.‚Äù

original: gzhan rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni dngos po la mi slu ba ma yin zhes bya ba de ltar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa ni dngos po la mi slu ba ma yin zhes bya ba de ltar sbyar ro //
translated: The conceptual thoughts of permanence, etc. are not nondeceptive with regard to things.

original: de khyad par las rab tu skye ba yin yang zhes bya ba'i don gyi khyad par las skye ba yin yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de khyad par las rab tu skye ba yin yang zhes bya ba'i don gyi khyad par las skye ba yin yang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: Even though they arise from a particular thing, etc. means even though they arise from a particular object.

original: ji ltar mthong ba'i khyad par mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de'i rjes su 'brang ba nges pa yongs su bor nas 'dra ba cung brad tsam gzung bas 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'dra ba yongs su gzung bas khyad
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba'i khyad par mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid gang yin pa de'i rjes su 'brang ba nges pa yongs su bor nas 'dra ba cung brad tsam gzung bas 'dra ba gzhan 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid kyi 'dra ba yongs su gzung bas khyad
translated: Having abandoned the ascertainment that follows the characteristics of impermanence and so on, just as they are seen, by apprehending a mere slight similarity, one superimposes a difference in the characteristics of the arising of another similarity.

original: par gzhan sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir te brtan pa nyid la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir mar me'i 'od la gsal bar 'dra ba'i sgo nas nor bu'i blo zhugs pa nor bu'i dngos po la bslu ba lta bu ste brgyud pas kyang mar me dang 'brel pa'i phyir
analyzed: par gzhan sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir te brtan pa nyid la sogs par sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir mar me'i 'od la gsal bar 'dra ba'i sgo nas nor bu'i blo zhugs pa nor bu'i dngos po la bslu ba lta bu ste brgyud pas kyang mar me dang 'brel pa'i phyir
translated: Because of superimposing another difference, like superimposing stability and so on, the mind engages the gem through the similarity of the light of the lamp being clear, but it is deceived with respect to the entity of the gem, because it is related to the lamp through a continuum.

original: ro // gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa rnams log pa'i don kho na yin pa de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i don gyi yul rnams la don bya ba byed pa nyid med do //
analyzed: ro // gang gi phyir rnam par rtog pa rnams log pa'i don kho na yin pa de'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i don gyi yul rnams la don bya ba byed pa nyid med do //
translated: Because conceptual thoughts are only mistaken objects, therefore objects of conceptual thoughts do not perform a function.

original: des na yang na ni gzhan gyis ji ltar don byed ces smras pa gang yin pa de yongs su spangs so //
analyzed: des na yang na ni gzhan gyis ji ltar don byed ces smras pa gang yin pa de yongs su spangs so //
translated: Therefore, the statement ‚ÄúHow can it perform a function for another?‚Äù is completely rejected.

original: gal te 'o na ji ltar rnam par rtog pa'i don gyi yul la spyi'i de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa rnam par gcod pa'i mtshan nyid can du rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: gal te 'o na ji ltar rnam par rtog pa'i don gyi yul la spyi'i de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa rnam par gcod pa'i mtshan nyid can du rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: If one says, ‚ÄúHow is a universal that is not the effect of an object established as the object of a conception that excludes what is not that?‚Äù

original: don bya ba byed pa lta bur snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: don bya ba byed pa lta bur snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it appears as if it performs a function.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ni don bya ba byed pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir de mi byed pa dag las tha dad pa lta bu ste zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ni don bya ba byed pa nyid du snang ba'i phyir de mi byed pa dag las tha dad pa lta bu ste zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: For that very reason, it is said, ‚ÄúBecause it appears to perform a function, it is as if it were different from those that do not perform that function.‚Äù

original: gang yang rang gi mtshan nyid la yang mi rtag pa la sogs pa mi rtogs pa'i phyir de'i ngo bo ma yin la zhes smras pa de yongs su spangs pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gang yang rang gi mtshan nyid la yang mi rtag pa la sogs pa mi rtogs pa'i phyir de'i ngo bo ma yin la zhes smras pa de yongs su spangs pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Also, the statement ‚ÄúIt is not the essence of that because impermanence and so on are not realized in its particular nature‚Äù is completely rejected.

original: 'di ltar gang zhig dang 'brel pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid mi rtag pa nyid dang mi ldan par 'gyur ba dngos po g-yo ba la ma gtogs pa mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba ni cung zad kyang med kyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang zhig dang 'brel pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid mi rtag pa nyid dang mi ldan par 'gyur ba dngos po g-yo ba la ma gtogs pa mi rtag pa nyid ces bya ba ni cung zad kyang med kyi /
translated: Thus, apart from the impermanence of a thing that is in motion, there is nothing at all called ‚Äúimpermanence‚Äù that is not endowed with its own characteristic of impermanence.

original: 'on kyang rang gi mtshan nyid kho na mi rtag pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dngos po g-yo ba nyid mi rtag @96b pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi mtshan nyid kho na mi rtag pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dngos po g-yo ba nyid mi rtag @96b pa yin te /
translated: However, because its own characteristic is the nature of impermanence, the impermanence of a thing that is in motion is impermanence.

original: bdag med pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bdag med pa la sogs pa yang de bzhin du blta bar bya'o //
translated: Selflessness and so on should be viewed in the same way.

original: gal te rang gi mtshan nyid kho na mi rtag pa nyid yin na /üîΩde rnam par rtog pa rnams la mi snang ba'i phyir ji ltar don 'di ni mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: gal te rang gi mtshan nyid kho na mi rtag pa nyid yin na / de rnam par rtog pa rnams la mi snang ba'i phyir ji ltar don 'di ni mi rtag pa'o //
translated: If its own characteristic is impermanence,

original: don 'di'i mi rtag pa nyid do snyam du rnam par rtog pa rang gi mtshan nyid la rag par 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: don 'di'i mi rtag pa nyid do snyam du rnam par rtog pa rang gi mtshan nyid la rag par 'jug par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: how can the thought ‚ÄúThis object is impermanent‚Äù or ‚ÄúThis object‚Äôs impermanence‚Äù engage its object by means of its own characteristic, since its own characteristic does not appear to conceptual consciousness?

original: de'i phyir de de lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de de lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore he says, ‚ÄúIt is like this . . .‚Äù

original: de zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to its own characteristic.

original: de lta bu la zhes bya ba g-yo ba'i ngo bo la skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos nyid du skad cig ma gcig tu gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid du gzung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta bu la zhes bya ba g-yo ba'i ngo bo la skad cig mar gnas pa'i chos nyid du skad cig ma gcig tu gnas pa'i ngo bo nyid du gzung ba'i phyir /
translated: ‚ÄúIn that way‚Äù refers to the fact that the nature of movement is apprehended as the reality of momentary duration, as the nature of remaining for one moment.

original: dus phyis skad cig ma tha ma mthong ba rnams la 'di snyam du 'di ni mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs par sems pa 'byung ste /üîΩkhyad par gzhan gnyi ga mi spong bar brjod par 'dod na ni 'di ni mi rtag pa'o zhes bya bar gzhi mthun par sems la /
analyzed: dus phyis skad cig ma tha ma mthong ba rnams la 'di snyam du 'di ni mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs par sems pa 'byung ste / khyad par gzhan gnyi ga mi spong bar brjod par 'dod na ni 'di ni mi rtag pa'o zhes bya bar gzhi mthun par sems la /
translated: Later, when the final moment is seen, the thought occurs, ‚ÄúThis is impermanent,‚Äù and so on.üîΩIf one wishes to express the difference without denying both, one thinks of the common locus, ‚ÄúThis is impermanent.‚Äù

original: khyad par gzhan spong ba brjod par 'dod na ni 'di'i mi rtag pa nyid do snyam du sems so //
analyzed: khyad par gzhan spong ba brjod par 'dod na ni 'di'i mi rtag pa nyid do snyam du sems so //
translated: If one wishes to express the difference by denying the other, one thinks, ‚ÄúThis is its impermanence.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa rnams ni de'i chos nyid de rang gi mtshan nyid dang chos kho na la ldog pa'i bye brag gis brdar btags pa'i sgra'i rjes su 'brang bas 'jug pa na'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnams ni de'i chos nyid de rang gi mtshan nyid dang chos kho na la ldog pa'i bye brag gis brdar btags pa'i sgra'i rjes su 'brang bas 'jug pa na'o //
translated: Conceptual thoughts engage by following the words that are conventionally designated to the specific characteristics and the phenomena that are their reality.

original: ngo bo du ma dang ngo bo gcig pa dag ni chos du ma dang gcig pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo du ma dang ngo bo gcig pa dag ni chos du ma dang gcig pa'o //
translated: The many natures and the one nature are the many and one properties.

original: de dag dang tha dad pa zhes zlas dbye ba ste mi rtag pa dang byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos du ma dang bum pa la sogs pa mang po rnams kyi mi rtag pa nyid kyi chos gcig pa dang bum pa'i mi rtag pa zhes tha dad
analyzed: de dag dang tha dad pa zhes zlas dbye ba ste mi rtag pa dang byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos du ma dang bum pa la sogs pa mang po rnams kyi mi rtag pa nyid kyi chos gcig pa dang bum pa'i mi rtag pa zhes tha dad
translated: They are different from those, as the compound indicates. Impermanence, being produced, etc., are the many properties of many things such as pots, etc., and the one property of impermanence is the impermanence of the pot, etc.

original: par yang ston te dngos po rnams zhes bya ba khong nas drang ngo //
analyzed: par yang ston te dngos po rnams zhes bya ba khong nas drang ngo //
translated: They are shown to be different, and the word ‚Äúthings‚Äù is supplied from the commentary.

original: rnam par rtog pa dngos po 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pas rnam par gzhag pa'i chos du ma la sogs pa de kho na nyid yin te de nyid kyi phyir ston par byed do zhes bshad do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dngos po 'dzin pa ma yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pas rnam par gzhag pa'i chos du ma la sogs pa de kho na nyid yin te de nyid kyi phyir ston par byed do zhes bshad do //
translated: Since conceptualization does not apprehend things, the many and one properties established by conceptualization are reality. Therefore, it is said that the Teacher teaches that.

original: gal te 'o na ni dngos po mi 'dzin pa'i phyir rten med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'o na ni dngos po mi 'dzin pa'i phyir rten med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if that is so, since it does not apprehend things, it would have no basis.

original: de rnams rten med pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de rnams rten med pa yang ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: It is not that they have no basis, etc.

original: de rnams zhes bya ba ni chos du ma la sogs pa ston par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams zhes bya ba ni chos du ma la sogs pa ston par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the conceptual thoughts that reveal many phenomena.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi rten ni dngos po'i khyad par mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid mthong ba nyams su myong ba de yin pa'i phyir te /üîΩ'di ltar don dam par mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo rang gi mtshan nyid mthong nas mthong ba'i mthus 'byung ba'i @97a * //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi rten ni dngos po'i khyad par mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid mthong ba nyams su myong ba de yin pa'i phyir te / 'di ltar don dam par mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo rang gi mtshan nyid mthong nas mthong ba'i mthus 'byung ba'i @97a * //
translated: The basis of conceptual thoughts is the experience of seeing the characteristics of impermanence, etc., of specific things.

original: rnam par rtog pa dag mthong ba'i rnam par lhag par zhen pas 'jug go //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dag mthong ba'i rnam par lhag par zhen pas 'jug go //
translated: Thus, having seen the nature of impermanence, etc., in the ultimate, one engages in conceptual thoughts that arise through the power of seeing, by way of the superimposition of seeing.üîΩConceptual thoughts that have the aspects of impermanence, etc., express and engage in their objects in accordance with the aspects of what is seen.

original: gang gi phyir mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa rnams ji ltar mthong ba'i rnam pa kho nas mngon par brjod cing 'jug gi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhin du don gzhan gyi rjes su 'brang ba ni
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa rnams ji ltar mthong ba'i rnam pa kho nas mngon par brjod cing 'jug gi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa bzhin du don gzhan gyi rjes su 'brang ba ni
translated: They do not follow other objects, as do conceptual thoughts that have the aspects of permanence, etc.

original: ma yin pa de'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma yin pa de'i phyir te /
translated: This is so because

original: de dag kyang dngos po'i chos nyid ma yin no zhes smras pa gang yin pa de yang yongs su spangs pa yin pas dngos po med pa'i chos nyid kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dag kyang dngos po'i chos nyid ma yin no zhes smras pa gang yin pa de yang yongs su spangs pa yin pas dngos po med pa'i chos nyid kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: And since you have completely abandoned the claim that those are not the reality of things, he says, ‚ÄúThe reality of non-things, etc.‚Äù

original: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa de dag dngos po'i chos nyid ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa de dag dngos po'i chos nyid ma yin pa yang ma yin no //
translated: Impermanence, etc. are not the reality of things.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: de'i rang gi ngo bo kho na dngos po'i rang gi kho na de ltar mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos nyid du snang zhing so sor snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i rang gi ngo bo kho na dngos po'i rang gi kho na de ltar mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos nyid du snang zhing so sor snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because their own nature appears as the reality of things, and appears individually.

original: dngos po mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo yod pa'i phyir de skad du bshad kyi /
analyzed: dngos po mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo yod pa'i phyir de skad du bshad kyi /
translated: Because the nature of impermanence, etc. of things exists, it is explained in that way.

original: rnam par rtog pa la dngos po'i chos snang ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la dngos po'i chos snang ba ni ma yin no //
translated: But the reality of things does not appear to conceptual thought.

original: gal te mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa dngos po'i chos kho na snang na /
analyzed: gal te mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa dngos po'i chos kho na snang na /
translated: If impermanence, etc. are the reality of things,

original: 'o na ci ste rnam par rtog pas byas pa 'khrul pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na ci ste rnam par rtog pas byas pa 'khrul pa yin zhe na /
translated: why is it that conceptual thought is mistaken in its fabrication?

original: dngos po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúThings that are one, etc.‚Äù

original: dngos po gcig la du ma'i ngo bor 'dzin pa dang / mang po rnams la gcig pa nyid dang chos dang chos can dag tha dad par 'dzin pa ni 'khrul pa ste nor pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dngos po gcig la du ma'i ngo bor 'dzin pa dang / mang po rnams la gcig pa nyid dang chos dang chos can dag tha dad par 'dzin pa ni 'khrul pa ste nor pa'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The apprehension of many entities as having a single nature and the apprehension of phenomena and the entity possessing the phenomena as different are mistaken, i.e., erroneous.

original: yang ci'i phyir gcig pa nyid la sogs pa 'khrul pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir gcig pa nyid la sogs pa 'khrul pa yin zhe na /
translated: Again, why are singularity, etc., mistaken?

original: don gcig dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don gcig dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúThings that perform the same function, etc.‚Äù

original: don gcig byed pa bum pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis chu bcu ba la sogs pa'i don gcig byed pa la /
analyzed: don gcig byed pa bum pa la sogs pa'i khyad par gyis chu bcu ba la sogs pa'i don gcig byed pa la /
translated: Things that perform the same function, such as a pot, etc., perform the same function, such as holding water, etc.

original: de ltar shes par 'dod na /
analyzed: de ltar shes par 'dod na /
translated: If one wishes to know that,

original: don gcig byed pa nyid du shes par 'dod na de lta bu'i ngo bo bstan pa'i ched du /
analyzed: don gcig byed pa nyid du shes par 'dod na de lta bu'i ngo bo bstan pa'i ched du /
translated: if one wishes to know that they perform the same function, then in order to demonstrate that nature,

original: don gcig byed pa nyid bstan pa'i ched du de ltar gzhag par bya ba'i phyir de tha snyad gdags pa bla chos su bya ba'i phyir bum pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ngo bor gcig tu rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don gcig byed pa nyid bstan pa'i ched du de ltar gzhag par bya ba'i phyir de tha snyad gdags pa bla chos su bya ba'i phyir bum pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa ngo bor gcig tu rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to demonstrate that they perform the same function, they are posited as one entity, and in order to designate them as a mere convention, they are posited as one entity, such as the entity of a vase.

original: de bzhin du gcig gis kyang don du ma byed pa dper na bum pas mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / chu bcu ba dang shes pa la sogs pa'i don bya ba byed par nges par res 'ga' bar byed pa lta bu la de ltar shes par 'dod na /
analyzed: de bzhin du gcig gis kyang don du ma byed pa dper na bum pas mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / chu bcu ba dang shes pa la sogs pa'i don bya ba byed par nges par res 'ga' bar byed pa lta bu la de ltar shes par 'dod na /
translated: Similarly, one does not perform a function, such as a vase producing an eye consciousness, or a water-holding function, or a consciousness, and so on. If one wishes to know that it is sometimes certain to perform a function,

original: don du ma byed pa @97b nyid du shes par 'dod na /
analyzed: don du ma byed pa @97b nyid du shes par 'dod na /
translated: if one wishes to know that it does not perform a function,

original: de lta bu'i ngo bo bstan pa'i ched du don du ma byed pa nyid du bstan pa'i ched du de ltar gzhag par byas pa'i phyir te mig gis gzung bar bya ba nyid dang / sa las gyur pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bor rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta bu'i ngo bo bstan pa'i ched du don du ma byed pa nyid du bstan pa'i ched du de ltar gzhag par byas pa'i phyir te mig gis gzung bar bya ba nyid dang / sa las gyur pa dang / mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bor rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to demonstrate that such an entity is not a real entity, it is said that it is posited as such, because it is posited as the entity of what is to be apprehended by the eye, as that which is derived from the earth element, as impermanence, and so on.

original: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan dag la yang ci rigs par brjod par bya'o //
translated: So too, the other should be explained as appropriate.

original: dngos po'i khyad par gyi sgo nas /
analyzed: dngos po'i khyad par gyi sgo nas /
translated: In terms of the particular of the entity,

original: dngos po gcig la chos du ma rnam par gzhag pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: dngos po gcig la chos du ma rnam par gzhag pa ni ma yin te /
translated: many phenomena are not posited in one entity.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po gcig pu de la du ma mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po gcig pu de la du ma mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because many are not suitable in that one entity.

original: de bas na gcig la du ma nyid du 'dzin na 'khrul pa'o zhes bshad do //
analyzed: de bas na gcig la du ma nyid du 'dzin na 'khrul pa'o zhes bshad do //
translated: Therefore it is explained that to apprehend many in one is mistaken.

original: de bzhin du du ma la gcig nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yang de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa las ldog pa'i sgo kho na nas yin gyi dngos po'i khyad par las ni ma yin pas du ma la yang gcig nyid mi rung ba'i phyir zhes bya
analyzed: de bzhin du du ma la gcig nyid du rnam par gzhag pa yang de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa las ldog pa'i sgo kho na nas yin gyi dngos po'i khyad par las ni ma yin pas du ma la yang gcig nyid mi rung ba'i phyir zhes bya
translated: Likewise, the establishment of the many as one is only by way of the exclusion of the non-effect, but not by way of a particular entity. Therefore, since the many is not suitable as one,

original: ba smos te /
analyzed: ba smos te /
translated: he says,

original: de ltar na du ma gcig 'dzin pa 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na du ma gcig 'dzin pa 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the apprehension of the many as one is an error.

original: de bzhin du chos dang chos can tha dad par 'dzin pa yang 'khrul pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du chos dang chos can tha dad par 'dzin pa yang 'khrul pa kho na yin no //
translated: Likewise, the apprehension of the property and the possessor of the property as different is an error.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gsal ba rnams ni rjes su mi 'gro zhes bya ba la sogs pa spyi tha dad pa yang gong nyid du bkag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba rnams ni rjes su mi 'gro zhes bya ba la sogs pa spyi tha dad pa yang gong nyid du bkag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the difference of the universal has already been refuted above, such as in the statement, ‚ÄúThe manifestations do not follow.

original: chos rnams ni chos can las tha dad pa kho na ste /
analyzed: chos rnams ni chos can las tha dad pa kho na ste /
translated: The properties are only different from the possessor of the property.

original: des na sgra'i don dngos po ji lta ba bzhin yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: des na sgra'i don dngos po ji lta ba bzhin yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the meaning of the word would be just as it is in reality.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir de rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de rnams kyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúThose,‚Äù and so on.

original: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos de rnams kyi rang bzhin ngo bo nyid tha dad pa'i phyir sgra'i don dngos po ji lta ba bzhin yin par khas len na /
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos de rnams kyi rang bzhin ngo bo nyid tha dad pa'i phyir sgra'i don dngos po ji lta ba bzhin yin par khas len na /
translated: If you accept that the meaning of a word is an entity just as it is, then the nature or essence of those phenomena such as impermanence would be different,

original: autpala sngon po'o //
analyzed: autpala sngon po'o //
translated: and it would be impossible for the words ‚Äúblue lotus‚Äù

original: sgra mi rtag go zhes bya ba'i gzhi mthun pa nyid mi rung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sgra mi rtag go zhes bya ba'i gzhi mthun pa nyid mi rung ba'i phyir /
translated: to be used together because the words ‚Äúimpermanent‚Äù and ‚Äúsound‚Äù would be different.

original: sngon po la sogs pa yon tan rnams dang autpala la sogs pa rigs rnams phan tshun tha dad pa'i phyir de dag rjod par byed pa'i sgra rnams gzhi gcig la 'jug pa med pas gzhi mthun pa nyid mi rung ste /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa yon tan rnams dang autpala la sogs pa rigs rnams phan tshun tha dad pa'i phyir de dag rjod par byed pa'i sgra rnams gzhi gcig la 'jug pa med pas gzhi mthun pa nyid mi rung ste /
translated: Since the qualities such as blueness and the types such as lotus are mutually different, the words that express them cannot be used together, so it is impossible for them to be used together.

original: de lta bas na sgra'i don dngos po ji lta ba bzhin rnam par gnas pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na sgra'i don dngos po ji lta ba bzhin rnam par gnas pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of a word does not exist as an entity just as it is.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dogs pa bsu bar byed de /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dogs pa bsu bar byed de /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif you say‚Äù and so on introduces the opponent‚Äôs view.

original: rdzas gang la sngon po la sogs pa'i chos kyi khyad par de dag yod pa de gcig yon tan dang rigs kyi sgra gnyis kyis brjod pa'i phyir nyes pa med de gzhi mthun pa nyid med pa'i nyes pa med @98a * //
analyzed: rdzas gang la sngon po la sogs pa'i chos kyi khyad par de dag yod pa de gcig yon tan dang rigs kyi sgra gnyis kyis brjod pa'i phyir nyes pa med de gzhi mthun pa nyid med pa'i nyes pa med @98a * //
translated: There is no error because that substance in which those attributes of blue and so on exist is expressed by both the terms quality and type.

original: de zhe na lan du phan mi 'dogs pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de zhe na lan du phan mi 'dogs pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you say that, then in response, Vasubandhu says, ‚ÄúIt is not tenable that that which does not benefit is dependent on another.‚Äù

original: rdzas ni khyad par du 'dod pa sngon po la sogs pa la phan par byed pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rdzas ni khyad par du 'dod pa sngon po la sogs pa la phan par byed pa ma yin te /
translated: Substance is not asserted to be a qualifier of blue and so on because it does not benefit them.

original: rdzas kyi yon tan sngon po'am rigs autpala nyid la phan pa ni 'ga' yang mi byed do //
analyzed: rdzas kyi yon tan sngon po'am rigs autpala nyid la phan pa ni 'ga' yang mi byed do //
translated: It does not benefit blue, a quality of substance, or the type of utpala at all.

original: de bas na rdzas phan mi 'dogs pa la rag ma las par 'jug pa sngon po la sogs pa gzhan gyi dbang nyid mi rung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na rdzas phan mi 'dogs pa la rag ma las par 'jug pa sngon po la sogs pa gzhan gyi dbang nyid mi rung ba'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because it is not tenable that substance, which does not benefit, engages without relying on another, blue and so on are not dependent on another.

original: sngon po la sogs pa'i chos rnams khyad par ma yin te /
analyzed: sngon po la sogs pa'i chos rnams khyad par ma yin te /
translated: Therefore attributes such as blue are not qualifiers.

original: khyad par nyid ni gzhan gyi dbang nyid kyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par nyid ni gzhan gyi dbang nyid kyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a qualifier is distinguished by being dependent on another.

original: de lta ma yin na 'di ni 'di'i khyad par ro zhes bya ba nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'di ni 'di'i khyad par ro zhes bya ba nyid du yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were not so, then it would not be possible to say, ‚ÄúThis is the particular of that.‚Äù

original: 'on te chos rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang nyid rdzas kyi yul can du 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on te chos rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang nyid rdzas kyi yul can du 'dod na /
translated: But if the dependent nature of phenomena is asserted to be the domain of substance,

original: de'i tshe gzhan gyi dbang nyid yin na ni bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po yin par khas blang dgos te /
analyzed: de'i tshe gzhan gyi dbang nyid yin na ni bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa'i dngos po yin par khas blang dgos te /
translated: then at that time, if it is the dependent nature, one must accept that it is the entity that is produced and the producer.

original: khyad par rnams ni bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par rnams ni bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Particulars are what is produced.

original: rdzas ni skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rdzas ni skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: Substance is the producer.

original: gzhan du na gzhan gyi dbang nyid mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na gzhan gyi dbang nyid mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, the dependent nature would be untenable.

original: skyed par byed pa yang skad cig mar 'dod par bya dgos te skad cig ma ma yin pa la ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyed par byed pa yang skad cig mar 'dod par bya dgos te skad cig ma ma yin pa la ni rim dang cig car dag gis don byed pa 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: And the producer must be asserted to be momentary, because it is contradictory for something that is not momentary to perform a function either gradually or instantaneously.

original: de bas na 'bras bu 'dod pa khyad par rnams dang / rgyur 'dod pa rdzas lhan cig mi gnas pa'i phyir dus gcig tu khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi dngos por gyur pa gnyis su brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de bas na 'bras bu 'dod pa khyad par rnams dang / rgyur 'dod pa rdzas lhan cig mi gnas pa'i phyir dus gcig tu khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi dngos por gyur pa gnyis su brjod par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, since the special thing that is the effect and the substance that is asserted to be the cause do not coexist, it is not possible to say that the special thing and the basis of the special thing are simultaneous and real.

original: de'i tshe rgyur 'dod pa khyad par gyi gzhi 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe rgyur 'dod pa khyad par gyi gzhi 'gags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, the basis of the special thing that is asserted to be the cause has ceased.

original: gcig ces bya ba ni khyad par dang ldan pa 'gags pa'o //
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba ni khyad par dang ldan pa 'gags pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú One‚Äù refers to the basis of the special thing that has ceased.

original: sgro gdags pa ni nye bar ston pa'o //üîΩde'i tshe sgra dngos po'i yul can du mi 'gyur te sgra blos sgro btags pa'i khyad par gyi gzhi kho na brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgro gdags pa ni nye bar ston pa'o // de'i tshe sgra dngos po'i yul can du mi 'gyur te sgra blos sgro btags pa'i khyad par gyi gzhi kho na brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚Äú Superimposition‚Äù means to teach.üîΩAt that time, the word would not have a real thing as its object, because the word expresses only the basis of the special thing that is superimposed by the mind.

original: gal te khyad par gyi gzhi 'gags pa gang yin pa de'i yul can gyi sgra ni blo la snang ba'i yul can yin du zin kyang khyad par nye ba gang yin pa de kho na rjod par byed pa'i sgra ni dngos po'i yul can nyid yin par 'gyur
analyzed: gal te khyad par gyi gzhi 'gags pa gang yin pa de'i yul can gyi sgra ni blo la snang ba'i yul can yin du zin kyang khyad par nye ba gang yin pa de kho na rjod par byed pa'i sgra ni dngos po'i yul can nyid yin par 'gyur
translated: If the word that has as its object the basis of the special thing that has ceased is indeed one that has as its object the appearance in the mind, then the word that expresses only the special thing that is present would have a real thing as its object.

original: zhe na / blo la snang ba'i yul can nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
analyzed: zhe na / blo la snang ba'i yul can nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te //
translated: If you say that, then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna says:üîΩThe subject that appears to awarenessüîΩis the object of expression.

original: brjod par gang la yul blo la snang ba yod pa de la skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: brjod par gang la yul blo la snang ba yod pa de la skad ces bya'o //
translated: Whatever is the object of expression that appears to awareness is called ‚Äúthe object of expression.‚Äù

original: de'i ngo bo ni nyid de de yin na ni khyad par gyi yul can du 'dod pa'i brjod par thams cad kyang de kho na dang 'dra bar rnam par rtog pa'i blo la @98b snang ba'i yul can kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo ni nyid de de yin na ni khyad par gyi yul can du 'dod pa'i brjod par thams cad kyang de kho na dang 'dra bar rnam par rtog pa'i blo la @98b snang ba'i yul can kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If that is its nature, then all objects of expression that are asserted to be the subject of a distinction will be just like that, only the subject that appears to a conceptual awareness.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dzin pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dzin pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúBecause of the apprehension,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'dzin pa'i blo la de lta bu'i khyad par tha dad pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba dngos po'i ngo bo sna tshogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i khyad par gyi gzhi gcig pu mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dzin pa'i blo la de lta bu'i khyad par tha dad pa dang ldan pa zhes bya ba dngos po'i ngo bo sna tshogs pa'i khyad par dang ldan pa'i khyad par gyi gzhi gcig pu mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In the apprehending awareness, a single basis of distinction that possesses a variety of distinctions, the nature of things, does not appear.

original: 'di ltar khyad par ldan pa 'gags pa sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i blo ni rnam par rtog pa can yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyad par ldan pa 'gags pa sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i blo ni rnam par rtog pa can yin la /
translated: Thus the awareness that superimposes a distinction that possesses a distinction is conceptual.

original: dngos por gyur pa'i khyad par la dmigs pa'i blo ni gzhan de nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa can kho na yin par khas blang dgos te /
analyzed: dngos por gyur pa'i khyad par la dmigs pa'i blo ni gzhan de nyams su myong ba'i rnam pa can kho na yin par khas blang dgos te /
translated: It must be accepted that the cognition that observes the particular that is an entity is only the aspect of the experience of that other.

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa la dmigs pa'i blo ni gcig yin par mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa la dmigs pa'i blo ni gcig yin par mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not suitable for the cognition that observes an entity and a nonentity to be one.

original: khyad par tha dad pa dang ldan pa gcig pu mi snang na yang gzhi mthun pa nyid ga la zhig yin /
analyzed: khyad par tha dad pa dang ldan pa gcig pu mi snang na yang gzhi mthun pa nyid ga la zhig yin /
translated: Even if a single thing does not appear to have different attributes, how could there be a common locus?

original: gang gi tshe khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi gnyi ga yang rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo la snang ba nyid yin par 'dod pa de'i tshe ni ldog pa gnyis kyis nye bar zin pa'i chos can gcig snang ba'i blo gcig kho na skye bas gzhiüîΩmthun pa nyid mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: gang gi tshe khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi gnyi ga yang rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo la snang ba nyid yin par 'dod pa de'i tshe ni ldog pa gnyis kyis nye bar zin pa'i chos can gcig snang ba'i blo gcig kho na skye bas gzhiüîΩmthun pa nyid mi 'gal lo //
translated: When both the attribute and the basis of the attribute are asserted to appear to a conceptual cognition, then only one cognition that observes a single phenomenon that is qualified by two different negations arises. Therefore there is no contradiction in asserting a common locus.

original: gal te khyad par dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dogs pa bsu ste blo gcig sgro btags na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa'i nyes pa 'di med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te khyad par dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan gyi bsam pa'i dogs pa bsu ste blo gcig sgro btags na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa'i nyes pa 'di med do zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúThe distinction . . . ,‚Äù etc., this anticipates the opponent‚Äôs doubt. If you say, ‚ÄúThere is no fault in the explanation, ‚ÄòIf one mind is imputed . . . ,‚Äô‚Äù

original: khyad par dang ldan pa dang dus mnyam du grub pa'i khyad par las gzhan gyi dbang med pa'i phyir khyad par nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: khyad par dang ldan pa dang dus mnyam du grub pa'i khyad par las gzhan gyi dbang med pa'i phyir khyad par nyid ma yin no //
translated: then the distinction that is established simultaneously with the one possessing the distinction is not different from the dependent.

original: gal te grub pa'i snga rol na gzhan gyi dbang nyid yin pas de kho na'i tshe khyad par nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te grub pa'i snga rol na gzhan gyi dbang nyid yin pas de kho na'i tshe khyad par nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúPrior to being established, it is the dependent itself, and at that time it is the distinction itself,‚Äù

original: ma grub pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ma grub pa yang ma yin zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna explains: That which is not established . . .

original: ma grub pa ri bong gi rva 'dra ba yang gzhan gyi dbang ngam khyad par nyid ma yin no /üîΩ// / bam po bcu pa /
analyzed: ma grub pa ri bong gi rva 'dra ba yang gzhan gyi dbang ngam khyad par nyid ma yin no /üîΩ// / bam po bcu pa /
translated: That which is not established, like the horn of a rabbit, is not the dependent or the distinction.

original: rnam pa thams cad du yod pa dang med pa la gzhan gyi dbang med pa'i phyir khyad par rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang nyid rtogs pas sgro gdags pa byas nas /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du yod pa dang med pa la gzhan gyi dbang med pa'i phyir khyad par rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang nyid rtogs pas sgro gdags pa byas nas /
translated: Since the dependent is not at all existent or nonexistent, the dependent nature of the distinctions is imagined by the mind that superimposes.

original: gzhan gyi dbang nyid du tha snyad 'dogs na ni /üîΩthams cad du zhes bya ba rnam pa thams cad du ji ltar gzhan gyi dbang nyid du tha snyad gdags pa la blo'i rjes su byed pa bzhin du khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhir tha snyad gdags pa la yang sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i blo de kho
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang nyid du tha snyad 'dogs na ni / thams cad du zhes bya ba rnam pa thams cad du ji ltar gzhan gyi dbang nyid du tha snyad gdags pa la blo'i rjes su byed pa bzhin du khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhir tha snyad gdags pa la yang sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i blo de kho
translated: If the dependent nature is conventionally designated,

original: na ji ste mi sbyor /üîΩde sbyar bar ni rigs te blos bstan pa'i don du snang ba rnams la ma brten @99a * //
analyzed: na ji ste mi sbyor / de sbyar bar ni rigs te blos bstan pa'i don du snang ba rnams la ma brten @99a * //
translated: then why does the mind that superimposes the conventional designation of the dependent nature not apply the designation of the distinction and the basis of the distinction to all aspects, in all ways, just as it does to the dependent nature?

original: par tha snyad gdags par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par tha snyad gdags par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is reasonable to apply it, because without depending on the objects that appear to the mind, it is impossible to designate anything conventionally.

original: dngos po sgra gcig dang tshad ma gcig gis yul du byas na dngos po stobs kyis dngos po'i rang gi ngo bor gyur pa'i khyad par ma lus pa 'phangs pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i sgra la sogs pa don med pa gang yin pa sngar don gyi rangüîΩgi ngo bo gcig /
analyzed: dngos po sgra gcig dang tshad ma gcig gis yul du byas na dngos po stobs kyis dngos po'i rang gi ngo bor gyur pa'i khyad par ma lus pa 'phangs pa'i phyir de las gzhan pa'i sgra la sogs pa don med pa gang yin pa sngar don gyi rang gi ngo bo gcig /
translated: If one object is made the object of a single word and a single valid cognition, then all the particularities that are the nature of the object are implied by the power of the object. Therefore, it is meaningless for there to be words and so on that are different from that.üîΩThe meaning of the above passage is as follows.

original: bdag nyid mngon sum yin pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pas dngos por smra ba'i phyogs la bshad pa der yang blo la snang ba'i rjes su byed pa la mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag nyid mngon sum yin pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pas dngos por smra ba'i phyogs la bshad pa der yang blo la snang ba'i rjes su byed pa la mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The meaning of the passage that begins ‚ÄúThe nature of the object is singular‚Äù and ends ‚ÄúThe nature of the object is directly perceived‚Äù is not that the object is made to conform to the appearance in the mind.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: blo la snang ba ni dngos po med pa'i phyir dngos po'i mthu las 'byung ba'i nyes pa rnams su thal ba med do //
analyzed: blo la snang ba ni dngos po med pa'i phyir dngos po'i mthu las 'byung ba'i nyes pa rnams su thal ba med do //
translated: Because the appearance in the mind is not an object, the fallacies that arise from the power of the object do not apply.

original: mang po'i tshig gis ni 'di skad du de las gzhan pa don med pa'i nyes par thal bar mi 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
analyzed: mang po'i tshig gis ni 'di skad du de las gzhan pa don med pa'i nyes par thal bar mi 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu ma zad kyi /
translated: The plural particle in ‚Äúmany words‚Äù is not used to indicate that there are many words.

original: de bzhin du spyi tha dad pa med pa dang / khyad par rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang nyid mi rung ba'i phyir khyad par dang / khyad par gyi gzhi nyid med pa dang / blo la khyad par tha dad pa dang lhan cig mi snang ba'i phyir gzhi mthun pa nyid med par bshad pa gang yin pa de dag kyang 'di la mi srid do zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du spyi tha dad pa med pa dang / khyad par rnams kyi gzhan gyi dbang nyid mi rung ba'i phyir khyad par dang / khyad par gyi gzhi nyid med pa dang / blo la khyad par tha dad pa dang lhan cig mi snang ba'i phyir gzhi mthun pa nyid med par bshad pa gang yin pa de dag kyang 'di la mi srid do zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: Likewise, since there is no difference in the general, and since it is not tenable that the particulars are dependent on something else, there is no particular and no basis of a particular. Since the difference does not appear simultaneously with the mind, there is no common locus. Since all of these are impossible, they are explained as nonexistent.

original: de nyid tha mi dad pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: de nyid tha mi dad pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: The line ‚Äúsince they are not different from that‚Äù and so on teaches this.

original: 'di ltar blo la snang ba'i ngo bo de tha mi dad par snang bas de'i phyir ci ji ltar shes pa bzhin mi 'gal lo zhes 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar blo la snang ba'i ngo bo de tha mi dad par snang bas de'i phyir ci ji ltar shes pa bzhin mi 'gal lo zhes 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyar ro //
translated: Since the nature that appears to the mind appears without difference, therefore, as will be explained below, there is no contradiction with the cognition.

original: sngon po zhes brjod pa na rnam par rtog pa'i blos sngon po ma yin pa las log par rnam pa gcig yul du byas kyang sngon po'i rnam pa de nyid la rnam pa gzhan la the tshom log pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon po zhes brjod pa na rnam par rtog pa'i blos sngon po ma yin pa las log par rnam pa gcig yul du byas kyang sngon po'i rnam pa de nyid la rnam pa gzhan la the tshom log pa ni ma yin no //
translated: When one says ‚Äúblue,‚Äù the conceptual cognition takes as its object a single aspect that is the opposite of what is not blue. But within that very aspect of blue, there is no certainty about other aspects.

original: de bas na blo la snang ba'i ngo bo de rnam pa gzhan ma nges pa ste autpala ma yin pa las log pa autpala'i rnam pa ma nges pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrnam pa gang la nges pa ma skyes pa de ni rnam pa gzhan te de la re ba dang bcas pa blo autpala'i sgra sbyor ba las skyes pa gzung bar bya ba snang bas zhes bya bar sbyar te 'dis ni khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos
analyzed: de bas na blo la snang ba'i ngo bo de rnam pa gzhan ma nges pa ste autpala ma yin pa las log pa autpala'i rnam pa ma nges pa'i phyir ro // rnam pa gang la nges pa ma skyes pa de ni rnam pa gzhan te de la re ba dang bcas pa blo autpala'i sgra sbyor ba las skyes pa gzung bar bya ba snang bas zhes bya bar sbyar te 'dis ni khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos
translated: Therefore, that nature which appears to the cognition is not ascertained as other aspects, because the aspect of a blue lotus is not ascertained as the opposite of what is not a blue lotus.

original: po'i rgyu mtshan bshad do //
analyzed: po'i rgyu mtshan bshad do //
translated: That aspect in which certainty has not arisen is another aspect, and that cognition, which is accompanied by expectation, is produced from the application of the term ‚Äúblue lotus.‚Äù It should be understood as appearing as the object. This explains the reason for the distinction between the characterized and the characteristic.

original: gzhi mthun pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan sgra'i don tha dad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhi mthun pa nyid kyi rgyu mtshan sgra'i don tha dad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The reason for the common locus is stated in ‚Äúthe meaning of the term is different,‚Äù and so on.

original: sgra'i don tha dad pa sngon po ma yin pa dang / autpala ma yin pa las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid sgrub cing ston pa yang blo la snang ba'i ngo bo ldog pa gnyis kyis nye bar zin pa de ni @99b chos can gcig pa nyid du tha mi dad par rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo la snang bas
analyzed: sgra'i don tha dad pa sngon po ma yin pa dang / autpala ma yin pa las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid sgrub cing ston pa yang blo la snang ba'i ngo bo ldog pa gnyis kyis nye bar zin pa de ni @99b chos can gcig pa nyid du tha mi dad par rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo la snang bas
translated: The meaning of the words is as follows: The definition of the exclusion of what is not blue and what is not a lotus is established and taught. The entity that appears to the mind is grasped by two exclusions. It appears to the mind that conceives of difference as a single entity.

original: so // spyi la sogs pas ji ltar shes pa bzhin te ji ltar grags pa bzhin mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: so // spyi la sogs pas ji ltar shes pa bzhin te ji ltar grags pa bzhin mi 'gal lo //
translated: It is not contradictory for the subject and the predicate to be as they are known, as they are renowned, in terms of universals and so on.

original: blo la snang ba 'dis chos dang chos can gyi khyad par dag kyang ji ltar shes pa bzhin mi 'gal lo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: blo la snang ba 'dis chos dang chos can gyi khyad par dag kyang ji ltar shes pa bzhin mi 'gal lo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This appearance to the mind is also not contradictory for the subject and the predicate to be as they are known.

original: de nyid don du ma las zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /üîΩblo la snang ba don du ma las tha dad pa srid pa las so //
analyzed: de nyid don du ma las zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te / blo la snang ba don du ma las tha dad pa srid pa las so //
translated: This is taught by ‚Äúbecause it is possible that it is different from many objects‚Äù and so on.üîΩIt is possible that the appearance to the mind is different from many objects.

original: blo la snang ba brdzun pa'i phyir don du ma las tha dad pa lta ga la yod de /
analyzed: blo la snang ba brdzun pa'i phyir don du ma las tha dad pa lta ga la yod de /
translated: How could it be different from many objects because the appearance to the mind is false?

original: skyes bu'i mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis 'di skad du brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: skyes bu'i mngon par zhen pa'i dbang gis 'di skad du brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: It is only due to the power of a person's manifest clinging that this is expressed.

original: blo la snang ba de'i don gcig cig las tha dad pa gang yin pa de ci sgra mi rtag pa nyid dang / mig gis gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid yin nam zhes bsgrub pa dang dgag pa shes par 'dod pa la blo la snang bar gyur pa'i dngos po kho na rab tu ston to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: blo la snang ba de'i don gcig cig las tha dad pa gang yin pa de ci sgra mi rtag pa nyid dang / mig gis gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid yin nam zhes bsgrub pa dang dgag pa shes par 'dod pa la blo la snang bar gyur pa'i dngos po kho na rab tu ston to zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The meaning of what appears to the mind is one thing, but what is different from that is either the impermanence of sound or the fact that it is not apprehended by the eye. In order to understand affirmation and negation, only the entity that appears to the mind is indicated.

original: rnam pa gang gis she na /üîΩchos zhes bya ba'i sgra khyad par gzhan spangs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te tha dad par brjod nas so //
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis she na / chos zhes bya ba'i sgra khyad par gzhan spangs pas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te tha dad par brjod nas so //
translated: By what aspect?

original: chos tha dad pa lta bur rnam par gzhag nas zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: chos tha dad pa lta bur rnam par gzhag nas zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The word 'dharma' is used to exclude other distinctions. The word 'dharma' is used to indicate a particular thing, and it is connected with the words 'having excluded other distinctions.'üîΩHaving established it as if it were a different dharma. It is connected with the words 'having established it as if it were a different dharma.'

original: 'di ltar mi rtag pa nyid dang mig gis gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid ces chos kyi sgras brjod pa byas na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mi rtag pa nyid dang mig gis gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid ces chos kyi sgras brjod pa byas na /
translated: In this way, having used the word 'dharma' to express 'impermanence' and 'not apprehended by the eye,'

original: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos tha dad lta bur rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos tha dad lta bur rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: The various dharmas, such as impermanence, are established as if they were different.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: blo la de ltar snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: blo la de ltar snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because they appear that way to the mind.

original: chos zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod na chos 'dzin pa'i blo la tha dad pa lta bur snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod na chos 'dzin pa'i blo la tha dad pa lta bur snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: When they are expressed by the word ‚Äúdharma,‚Äù they appear to the mind that grasps dharmas as if they were different.

original: bye brag tu ma phye bar zhes bya ba ni khyad par thams cad ma spangs par te /
analyzed: bye brag tu ma phye bar zhes bya ba ni khyad par thams cad ma spangs par te /
translated: Without distinction means without abandoning all distinctions.

original: blo la snang ba 'di'i ngo bo nyid gzhan khyad par gzhan ma spangs pa /
analyzed: blo la snang ba 'di'i ngo bo nyid gzhan khyad par gzhan ma spangs pa /
translated: The nature of this appearance to the mind, without abandoning other distinctions,

original: chos can nyid du rnam par gzhag nas /
analyzed: chos can nyid du rnam par gzhag nas /
translated: is established as the substratum.

original: sgra'i dngos po de kho na rab tu ston to //
analyzed: sgra'i dngos po de kho na rab tu ston to //
translated: The thing that is the word reveals just that.

original: 'di skad du mi rtag pa nyid dang / mig gis gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid do zhes chos kyi sgras brjod do //
analyzed: 'di skad du mi rtag pa nyid dang / mig gis gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa nyid do zhes chos kyi sgras brjod do //
translated: In this way, impermanence and not being perceptible to the eye are expressed by the word ‚Äúdharma.‚Äù

original: chos tha dad pa lta bur bstan nas yang sgra mi rtag go zhes chos can gyi sgras brjod de ngo bo nyid gzhan chos can du rnam par gzhag nas dngos po de nyid rab tu ston to zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: chos tha dad pa lta bur bstan nas yang sgra mi rtag go zhes chos can gyi sgras brjod de ngo bo nyid gzhan chos can du rnam par gzhag nas dngos po de nyid rab tu ston to zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Having taught the property and the property-possessor as if they were different things, he then says ‚Äúsound is impermanent,‚Äù expressing the property-possessor with the word ‚Äúsound.‚Äù Having thus presented the property-possessor as something different from the property, he then teaches that very thing.

original: de tsam gyi chos zhes bya ba ni khyad par gzhan spangs pa dang / ma spangs pas chos dang chos can dag tha dad pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i blo tha dad pa dang ldan pa lta bur rnam pa tha dad pa can lta bur @100a * //
analyzed: de tsam gyi chos zhes bya ba ni khyad par gzhan spangs pa dang / ma spangs pas chos dang chos can dag tha dad pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i blo tha dad pa dang ldan pa lta bur rnam pa tha dad pa can lta bur @100a * //
translated: The so-called property is the thing from which other features have been eliminated or not eliminated. Because the property and the property-possessor are different, they appear to have different aspects, as if they were associated with different conceptual cognitions.

original: snang gis dngos su tha dad pa dang ldan pa nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: snang gis dngos su tha dad pa dang ldan pa nyid ma yin te /
translated: But they are not actually associated with difference.

original: de'i rnam pa ni brdzun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rnam pa ni brdzun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the aspect of that [conceptual cognition] is false.

original: dngos po tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad pa dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa'i phyir tha dad pa dang ldan pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They are not associated with difference because the things are different.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dngos po tha dad pa yin na /
analyzed: dngos po tha dad pa yin na /
translated: If the things were different,

original: ji skad bshad pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir te spyi dang gzhi mthun pa nyid la sogs pa med pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te dngos po la tha dad pa med na ji ltar gcig la tshig tha dad pa dang de bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir te spyi dang gzhi mthun pa nyid la sogs pa med pa'i nyes par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // gal te dngos po la tha dad pa med na ji ltar gcig la tshig tha dad pa dang de bzhin du mi rtag pa nyid ni bsgrub par bya ba'o //
translated: because the previously explained errors would ensue, because the errors of the absence of generality, common locus, and so on would ensue.

original: byas pa nyid ni bsgrub pa'o zhes bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa tha dad par yang ji ltar 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir tha dad pa de lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: byas pa nyid ni bsgrub pa'o zhes bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa tha dad par yang ji ltar 'gyur zhe na de'i phyir tha dad pa de lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If there is no difference in entity, how could there be different words for one thing? And likewise, how could there be a difference between the probandum and the proof, such as impermanence is the probandum and being produced is the proof?üîΩTherefore he says, ‚ÄúSuch a difference,‚Äù and so on.

original: chos tha dad pa khyad par gzhan spangs pa de lta bu mang po brjod pas tshig tha dad pa dang bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa tha dad par byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: chos tha dad pa khyad par gzhan spangs pa de lta bu mang po brjod pas tshig tha dad pa dang bsgrub par bya ba dang sgrub pa tha dad par byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Many different phenomena are expressed by different words, and thus there is a difference between the probandum and the proof.

original: gang dag la bstan de dang de la log pa'i dngos po de'i rang gi ngo bo yod pa chos snang ba'i khyad par de dag gis te /
analyzed: gang dag la bstan de dang de la log pa'i dngos po de'i rang gi ngo bo yod pa chos snang ba'i khyad par de dag gis te /
translated: Those who are taught are those who have the special appearance of the reality of the thing that is the object of negation.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i blo la gnas pa'i chos kyi ngo bor snang ba'i khyad par dag gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i blo la gnas pa'i chos kyi ngo bor snang ba'i khyad par dag gis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that they have the special appearance of the reality of the thing that is the object of the conceptual mind.

original: ci'i phyir byed ce na de'i rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir byed ce na de'i rang gi ngo bo zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Why is it done? He says, ‚ÄúIn order to understand the reality of that thing that is the object of negation.‚Äù

original: log pa'i dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo de kho na rtogs par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: log pa'i dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo de kho na rtogs par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is in order to understand the reality of that thing that is the object of negation.

original: de dag ni brgyud pas dngos po dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: de dag ni brgyud pas dngos po dang 'brel pa'i phyir ro ;
translated: Because those are indirectly related to the thing.

original: / skabs su bab pa'i don nyid gzung bde bar bya ba'i phyir bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /
analyzed: / skabs su bab pa'i don nyid gzung bde bar bya ba'i phyir bsdu ba'i tshigs su bcad pa /
translated: In order to make it easy to grasp the point at hand, he states a summarizing verse:

original: rang bzhin de 'dzin rnam rtog blo //
analyzed: rang bzhin de 'dzin rnam rtog blo //
translated: The conceptual mind that apprehends that reality

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The above is stated.üîΩ

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin de nyams su myong ba'i 'og tu skye ba rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin de nyams su myong ba'i 'og tu skye ba rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo gang yin pa'o //
translated: The conceptual mind that arises after the experience of the reality of the thing.

original: de'i don can 'dra ba ni lhag par zhen pa'i dbang gis dngos po'i yul can lta bu'o //
analyzed: de'i don can 'dra ba ni lhag par zhen pa'i dbang gis dngos po'i yul can lta bu'o //
translated: The meaning of that is as follows: It is like the object of a thing, due to the power of special attachment.

original: de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dag las tha dad pa gang yin pa de'i mthar thug pa ste /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dag las tha dad pa gang yin pa de'i mthar thug pa ste /
translated: The ultimate of that is what is different from those that do not have that as their result.

original: de nyams su myong ba'i stobs kyis skye ba'i phyir dang / log pa'i dngos po thob par byed pa'i phyir de'i mthar thug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de nyams su myong ba'i stobs kyis skye ba'i phyir dang / log pa'i dngos po thob par byed pa'i phyir de'i mthar thug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called the ultimate because it arises by the power of experiencing that, and because it causes the attainment of a false thing.

original: blo de lta bu de la ngo bo gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni don gyi rnam pa gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: blo de lta bu de la ngo bo gang yin pa zhes bya ba ni don gyi rnam pa gang yin pa ste /
translated: That kind of cognition is called the nature of that, which is the aspect of the object.

original: snang ba dang rtag par bya ba dag gcig tu byed pa'i phyir phyi rol lta bu'o //
analyzed: snang ba dang rtag par bya ba dag gcig tu byed pa'i phyir phyi rol lta bu'o //
translated: It is like the external because it makes the appearance and the object of apprehension into one.

original: gsal ba rigs mthun pa dag la mtshungs par snang ba'i phyir gcig lta bu'o //
analyzed: gsal ba rigs mthun pa dag la mtshungs par snang ba'i phyir gcig lta bu'o //
translated: It is like one because it appears equally in the cognitions of the same type.

original: rigs mi mthun pa gzhan las log pa lta bur snang ba yin gyi log pa nyid ni ma @100b yin no //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa gzhan las log pa lta bur snang ba yin gyi log pa nyid ni ma @100b yin no //
translated: It appears as if it were different from other dissimilar types, but it is not actually different.

original: blo la snang ba'i ngo bo de ni de kho na nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: blo la snang ba'i ngo bo de ni de kho na nyid ma yin no //
translated: That nature that appears to cognition is not reality.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: brtag pa'i yan lag med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: brtag pa'i yan lag med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it lacks the parts of examination.

original: don byed nus pa kho na brtag pa'i yan lag yin no //
analyzed: don byed nus pa kho na brtag pa'i yan lag yin no //
translated: Only that which is able to perform a function has the parts of examination.

original: de bas na brtag pa'i yan lag med pa nyid kyis don byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na brtag pa'i yan lag med pa nyid kyis don byed mi nus pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is explained that because it lacks the parts of examination, it is not able to perform a function.

original: gang gi phyir blo la snang ba'i ngo bo de kho na nyid ma yin pa de'i phyir de'i yul can gyi tha snyad ni nor ba'i don kho na la 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir blo la snang ba'i ngo bo de kho na nyid ma yin pa de'i phyir de'i yul can gyi tha snyad ni nor ba'i don kho na la 'jug pa yin te /
translated: Because the nature that appears to cognition is not reality, the conventional that has it as its object engages only the meaning that is erroneous.

original: de bas na shes pa la yod pa'i don de rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de bas na shes pa la yod pa'i don de rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúThose that exist for cognition, etc.‚Äù

original: shes la yod ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i blo la snang ba ste shes pa la yod pa de rnams /
analyzed: shes la yod ces bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i blo la snang ba ste shes pa la yod pa de rnams /
translated: ‚ÄúExist for cognition‚Äù means that they appear to the conceptual mind. Those that exist for cognition,

original: 'di ltar ldog pa'i ngo bo can ldog pa'i ngo bo dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar ldog pa'i ngo bo can ldog pa'i ngo bo dang ldan pa ste /
translated: have the nature of exclusions, i.e., they have the nature of exclusions.

original: dper na autpala ma yin pa las log pa'i ngo bo can autpala'i don dag pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na autpala ma yin pa las log pa'i ngo bo can autpala'i don dag pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, the meaning of a pure blue lotus has the nature of an exclusion from that which is not a blue lotus.

original: des na zhes bya ba gzhan las ldog pa can gyi ngo bo'i autpala nyid kyis tha dad pa ma yin pa lta bur snang gi don dam par ni ma yin te /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba gzhan las ldog pa can gyi ngo bo'i autpala nyid kyis tha dad pa ma yin pa lta bur snang gi don dam par ni ma yin te /
translated: Therefore, it is as if the nature of the lotus is not different from the other, because of the word ‚Äútherefore,‚Äù but not ultimately,

original: blo la snang ba'i ngo bo brdzun pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: blo la snang ba'i ngo bo brdzun pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the nature that appears to the mind is false.

original: 'dis ni spyi'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan bshad do //üîΩde nyid gzhan las log par yang snang ste zhes bya ba ni blo la snang ba'i don gzhan las log pa'i ngo bo can de dag nyid gzhan rigs mi mthun pa las log par yang snang ste de dper na autpala'i khyad par de dag nyid sngon po ma
analyzed: 'dis ni spyi'i tha snyad kyi rgyu mtshan bshad do // de nyid gzhan las log par yang snang ste zhes bya ba ni blo la snang ba'i don gzhan las log pa'i ngo bo can de dag nyid gzhan rigs mi mthun pa las log par yang snang ste de dper na autpala'i khyad par de dag nyid sngon po ma
translated: This explains the reason for the convention of generality.

original: yin pa las log pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: yin pa las log pa lta bu'o //
translated: It also appears as the opposite of the other, that is, those that have a nature opposite to the other object that appears to the mind appear as the opposite of the other, that is, as the opposite of a dissimilar type. For example, those features of the lotus appear as the opposite of the non-blue.

original: de'i phyir ldog pa gnyis kyis nye bar zin pa'i don gcig snang ba'i phyir gzhi mthun pa nyid kyi sa bon bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir ldog pa gnyis kyis nye bar zin pa'i don gcig snang ba'i phyir gzhi mthun pa nyid kyi sa bon bshad do //
translated: Therefore, because one object appears as grasped by two different conceptual consciousnesses, the seed of common locus is explained.

original: de nyid de las zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: de nyid de las zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: That itself is taught by the words ‚Äúthat itself from that,‚Äù and so on.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni blo la snang ba'i don de rnams la tha snyad rgyas par byed ces bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni blo la snang ba'i don de rnams la tha snyad rgyas par byed ces bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn regard to those‚Äù should be supplied with ‚Äúthe extensive use of expressions.‚Äù

original: khyad par ji lta bu can zhig ce na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu can zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of distinction?

original: nor ba'i don can no //
analyzed: nor ba'i don can no //
translated: ‚ÄúThe meaning of error.‚Äù

original: gang dag rgyur gyur pas zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag rgyur gyur pas zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of that?

original: spyi dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: spyi dang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says ‚Äúthe universal,‚Äù etc.

original: spyi'i yul can dang gzhi mthun pa'i yul gyi shes pa dang ni brjod pa yis spyi'i spyod yul can gyis ni spyi'i tha snyad rgyas par byed la /
analyzed: spyi'i yul can dang gzhi mthun pa'i yul gyi shes pa dang ni brjod pa yis spyi'i spyod yul can gyis ni spyi'i tha snyad rgyas par byed la /
translated: The cognition of a common locus and that which has a universal for its object, and the expression that has a universal for its domain, make the universal the basis of the extensive use of expressions.

original: cig shos kyis ni gzhi mthun pa nyid kyi tha snyad rgyas par byed do //
analyzed: cig shos kyis ni gzhi mthun pa nyid kyi tha snyad rgyas par byed do //
translated: The other, i.e., the cognition of a common locus, makes the common locus the basis of the extensive use of expressions.

original: tha snyad ni 'dir sgra dang shes pa'i bdag nyid kho na yin mod kyi 'on kyang byed pa dang bcas pa la brten nas shes pa dang sgra dag gis byed pa'i ngo bo nyid brjod par 'dod pas de gnyis kho nas don rab tu ston pa'i mtshan nyid
analyzed: tha snyad ni 'dir sgra dang shes pa'i bdag nyid kho na yin mod kyi 'on kyang byed pa dang bcas pa la brten nas shes pa dang sgra dag gis byed pa'i ngo bo nyid brjod par 'dod pas de gnyis kho nas don rab tu ston pa'i mtshan nyid
translated: Although expressions are only sound and cognition, still, because the desire to express is based on the activity, sound and cognition are said to have the nature of activity. Therefore, only those two have the characteristic of revealing the object.

original: kyi byed pa la tha snyad nyid du brjod par 'dod @101a * //
analyzed: kyi byed pa la tha snyad nyid du brjod par 'dod @101a * //
translated: The function of the mind is called ‚Äúconventionality.‚Äù

original: pa'i phyir nyes pa med de /
analyzed: pa'i phyir nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault, because we wish to use the term ‚Äúexclusion‚Äù to refer to the activity of the exclusion.

original: dper na shes pa tshad ma nyid dang 'bras bu nyid yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na shes pa tshad ma nyid dang 'bras bu nyid yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, consciousness is valid knowledge and is an effect.

original: dngos po rnams kyi de kun yang //
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi de kun yang //
translated: ‚Äú All of these are in things‚Äù

original: zhes bya ba ni dngos po rang gi mtshan nyid rnams kyi tha snyad shes pa dang brjod pa'i mtshan nyid ni phan tshun med cing phan tshun rnam par gcod pa gang yin pa de la brten pa ste /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni dngos po rang gi mtshan nyid rnams kyi tha snyad shes pa dang brjod pa'i mtshan nyid ni phan tshun med cing phan tshun rnam par gcod pa gang yin pa de la brten pa ste /
translated: means that the conventional cognition and expression of the characteristics of things are mutually exclusive and mutually a dichotomy, and that is the basis.

original: ldog pa'i dngos po nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog pa'i dngos po nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they arise from the experience of the thing that is the negation.

original: des na zhes bya ba ni phan tshun med pa la brten pa de nyid kyi tha snyad de gzhan sel ba'i yul can zhes bya'i /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba ni phan tshun med pa la brten pa de nyid kyi tha snyad de gzhan sel ba'i yul can zhes bya'i /
translated: ‚Äú Therefore‚Äù means that the conventional is based on mutual exclusion, and for that reason it is called ‚Äúhaving an object that is the exclusion of other,‚Äù

original: ldog pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: but not because it apprehends the characteristic of the negation.

original: tha snyad de ni dngos po rnyed cing dngos po 'thob pa'i rten yang yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad de ni dngos po rnyed cing dngos po 'thob pa'i rten yang yin no //
translated: That conventional is the basis for obtaining a thing and for attaining a thing.

original: thams cad ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang tha snyad gang la brgyud pas dngos po de lta bu dang 'brel pa yod pa'o //
analyzed: thams cad ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang tha snyad gang la brgyud pas dngos po de lta bu dang 'brel pa yod pa'o //
translated: not all, but only those that are related to the thing in question by way of convention.

original: dper brjod pa /
analyzed: dper brjod pa /
translated: An example is given:

original: rjes dpag ji skad bshad ji bzhin //üîΩzhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: rjes dpag ji skad bshad ji bzhin // zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: As in the case of inference, as previously explained.

original: ji bzhin zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa ji skad bshad pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: ji bzhin zhes bya ba ni rjes su dpag pa ji skad bshad pa lta bu ste /
translated: As in the case of inference, as previously explained.

original: sngar rjes su dpag pa rnam par rtog pa can bshad pa lta bu yin no //
analyzed: sngar rjes su dpag pa rnam par rtog pa can bshad pa lta bu yin no //
translated: As in the case of the previously explained conceptual inference.

original: rjes su dpag pa rnam par rtog pa can dang cig shos ni rang la snang ba'i don du lhag par zhen pa'i phyir 'khrul par smra yang gzhan brten pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rjes su dpag pa rnam par rtog pa can dang cig shos ni rang la snang ba'i don du lhag par zhen pa'i phyir 'khrul par smra yang gzhan brten pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: The conceptual and non-conceptual inferences are said to be mistaken because they are fixated on the object that appears to them. But the other conceptual thoughts, such as the one that apprehends a rope as a snake, are not.

original: de la ni rgyud las kyang dngos po dang 'brel pa med pa de dngos po ni mi brten pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la ni rgyud las kyang dngos po dang 'brel pa med pa de dngos po ni mi brten pa la sogs pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: In the latter case, there is no relation to a thing, because the thing is not the nature of the rope, etc.

original: mar me'i 'od la nor bu bzhin //
analyzed: mar me'i 'od la nor bu bzhin //
translated: Like a jewel in the light of a lamp.

original: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i blo 'khrul pa ltar mar me'i 'od la yang de dang 'dra de 'khrul pa nyid du mtshungs mod kyi nor bu'i 'od nor bu nyid du gzung ba ni nor bu rnyed par bya ba rtog par byed
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni ji ltar nor bu'i 'od la nor bu'i blo 'khrul pa ltar mar me'i 'od la yang de dang 'dra de 'khrul pa nyid du mtshungs mod kyi nor bu'i 'od nor bu nyid du gzung ba ni nor bu rnyed par bya ba rtog par byed
translated: Just as there is the mistaken idea of a jewel in the light of a jewel, so too there is the mistaken idea of a lamp in the light of a lamp. Although they are similar in being mistaken, the light of a jewel is apprehended as a jewel itself, and one seeks to obtain the jewel.

original: pa yin gyi mar me'i 'od ni ma yin no //
analyzed: pa yin gyi mar me'i 'od ni ma yin no //
translated: But the light of a lamp is not that.

original: de dang 'dra bar brten pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i yang thob par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dang 'dra bar brten pa la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i yang thob par bya ba ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: In the same way, the conceptual thoughts of support and so on are not to be obtained. This is the meaning.

original: spyi'i tha snyad kyi sa bon bstan pa de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: spyi'i tha snyad kyi sa bon bstan pa de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
