translated: The teaching of the seed of the convention of generality is stated in ‚ÄúIn that regard, etc.‚Äù

original: de la zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tshig gi phrad dam /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba'i sgra ni tshig gi phrad dam /
translated: The word ‚Äúin that regard‚Äù is a verbal prefix.

original: gsal ba de dag las 'bras bu gcig pa can gyi gsal ba rnams mi gsal ba'am /
analyzed: gsal ba de dag las 'bras bu gcig pa can gyi gsal ba rnams mi gsal ba'am /
translated: From those individual things, the individual things that have the same effect are not clear,

original: spyi dang gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa de dag las re zhig spyi'i tha snyad kyi sa bon brjod do zhes nges par gzung ba yin no //
analyzed: spyi dang gzhi mthun pa la sogs pa de dag las re zhig spyi'i tha snyad kyi sa bon brjod do zhes nges par gzung ba yin no //
translated: or the generality, common locus, and so on. From those, the seed of the convention of generality is stated first. This is the meaning of the definite description.

original: du ma'ang 'bras bu gcig pa can ni dper na bum pa'i khyad par rnams chu bcu ba la sogs pa 'bras bu gcig pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: du ma'ang 'bras bu gcig pa can ni dper na bum pa'i khyad par rnams chu bcu ba la sogs pa 'bras bu gcig pa lta bu'o //
translated: And many things can have the same effect, as for example, the various particularities of a pot have the same effect in holding water, etc.

original: shes pa dang brjod pa gang dag la @101b rten de'i 'bras can min zhes bya ba 'bras bu de lta bu mi byed pa gang dag yin pa de dag las gzhan pa ldog pa de yod pa de dag gi dngos po du ma yin yang gcig nyid /
analyzed: shes pa dang brjod pa gang dag la @101b rten de'i 'bras can min zhes bya ba 'bras bu de lta bu mi byed pa gang dag yin pa de dag las gzhan pa ldog pa de yod pa de dag gi dngos po du ma yin yang gcig nyid /
translated: Those cognitions and expressions which do not have that effect, i.e., which do not produce that effect, are excluded from those which do. And although they are many, they are one in the existence of that exclusion.

original: tha snyad rab tu 'jug par byed spyi'i tha snyad thob par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tha snyad rab tu 'jug par byed spyi'i tha snyad thob par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù means that the universal is established by the application of a convention, i.e., by the attainment of a conventional expression.

original: blo la snang ba'i don kho na la de ltar rgyas par byed de /
analyzed: blo la snang ba'i don kho na la de ltar rgyas par byed de /
translated: The universal is only a mental object, and it is extended in that way.

original: snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba dag gcig tu byas nas du ma yin yang gcig byed pa zhes brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba dag gcig tu byas nas du ma yin yang gcig byed pa zhes brjod pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: The appearance and the object of investigation are taken as one, and although they are many, it is said that they have one effect.

original: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni spyi 'das ma thag pa la ltos nas so //
analyzed: de bzhin zhes bya ba ni spyi 'das ma thag pa la ltos nas so //
translated: The word ‚Äúthus‚Äù refers to the universal that was just mentioned.

original: gcig kyang du ma byed pa ni dper na bum pas mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / chu chu ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu byed pa lta bu'o //üîΩde'i dngos yongs su bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu du ma byed pa nyid rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig kyang du ma byed pa ni dper na bum pas mig gi rnam par shes pa dang / chu chu ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu byed pa lta bu'o // de'i dngos yongs su bstan pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu du ma byed pa nyid rab tu bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The production of a single effect by many is like the production of the visual consciousness by the eye, visible form, light, space, and attention; and the production of the pot, etc. by clay, wheel, rope, water, stick, potter, etc.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúIn order to demonstrate its effect‚Äù means in order to demonstrate the production of a single effect.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúThe cause of a single effect is understood to be a collection‚Äù means that the cause of a single effect is understood to be a collection.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúThe cause of a single effect is understood to be a collection‚Äù means that the cause of a single effect is understood to be a collection.

original: de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa'i don dag las tha dad pa'i rgyus /üîΩbum pa ni mig gis gzung bar bya ba dang sa las gyur pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa chos sna tshogs su shes par byed do //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa'i don dag las tha dad pa'i rgyus / bum pa ni mig gis gzung bar bya ba dang sa las gyur pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa chos sna tshogs su shes par byed do //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThe cause of a single effect is understood to be a collection‚Äù means that the cause of a single effect is understood to be a collection.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúThe cause of a single effect is understood to be a collection‚Äù means that the cause of a single effect is understood to be a collection.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúThe cause of a single effect is understood to be a collection‚Äù means that the cause of a single effect is understood to be a collection.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúThe cause of a single effect is understood to be a collection‚Äù means that the cause of a single effect is understood to be a collection.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúThe cause of a single effect is understood to be a collection‚Äù means that the cause of a single effect is understood to be a collection.

original: 'dis ni gzhi mthun pa nyid dang khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos po'i sa bon bshad do //üîΩsgra don 'di zhes bya ba ni blo la snang ba'i don /üîΩbrjod dang zhes pas gcig nyid du //
analyzed: 'dis ni gzhi mthun pa nyid dang khyad par dang khyad par gyi gzhi'i dngos po'i sa bon bshad do // sgra don 'di zhes bya ba ni blo la snang ba'i don / brjod dang zhes pas gcig nyid du //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThe cause of a single effect is understood to be a collection‚Äù means that the cause of a single effect is understood to be a collection.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúThe cause of a single effect is understood to be a collection‚Äù means that the cause of a single effect is understood to be a collection.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúThe cause of a single effect is understood to be a collection‚Äù means that the cause of a single effect is understood to be a collection.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúThe cause of a single effect is understood to be a collection‚Äù means that the cause of a single effect is understood to be a collection.üîΩThe statement, ‚ÄúThe cause of a single effect is understood to be a collection‚Äù means that the cause of a single effect is understood to be a collection.

original: tha snyad rab tu 'jug par byed //
analyzed: tha snyad rab tu 'jug par byed //
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúThe cause of a single effect is understood to be a collection‚Äù means that the cause of a single effect is understood to be a collection.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pas bshad pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The statement, ‚Äú

original: gzhi mthun pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzhi mthun pa nyid ces bya ba ni /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúa common locus‚Äù means

original: grags pa bzhin du brjod pa ste zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: grags pa bzhin du brjod pa ste zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: ‚ÄúCommon locus‚Äù is to be supplied with ‚Äúis spoken of in accordance with what is commonly accepted.‚Äù

original: don dam par yod pa min yang ji lta bur grags pa bzhin du brjod pa ste /
analyzed: don dam par yod pa min yang ji lta bur grags pa bzhin du brjod pa ste /
translated: That is, although they do not ultimately exist, they are spoken of in accordance with what is commonly accepted.

original: zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa can gyis blo'i ngo bor brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa can gyis blo'i ngo bor brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is said to be the nature of the conceptual mind.

original: 'di ltar dngos po la sgra'i don dang gzhi mthun pa 'di ni mi srid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po la sgra'i don dang gzhi mthun pa 'di ni mi srid do //
translated: Thus, it is impossible for a thing to be a common locus of the meaning of a word.

original: grags pa bzhin du brjod pa ste zhes bshad pas de'i phyir /
analyzed: grags pa bzhin du brjod pa ste zhes bshad pas de'i phyir /
translated: Since it is explained that ‚Äúis spoken of in accordance with what is commonly accepted,‚Äù therefore,

original: de nyid bstan par chos dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par chos dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: in order to demonstrate that, he says, ‚ÄúThe property and the basis of the property,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ni chos so //
analyzed: 'di ni chos so //
translated: This is the property.üîΩThis is the basis of the property.

original: 'di ni chos can no zhes rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni chos can no zhes rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: This is the presentation.

original: tha dad tha dad min ci 'dra //
analyzed: tha dad tha dad min ci 'dra //
translated: How are they different and not different?

original: zhes bya ba ni gcig kyang 'bras bu du ma byed pa nyid kyis de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dag las ldog pa'i sgo nas tha dad do //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni gcig kyang 'bras bu du ma byed pa nyid kyis de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dag las ldog pa'i sgo nas tha dad do //
translated: Since a single thing produces many effects, it is different from those that do not have those effects.

original: du ma yang 'bras bu gcig byed pa ni de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa las log pa nyid kyis tha dad min pa'o //
analyzed: du ma yang 'bras bu gcig byed pa ni de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa las log pa nyid kyis tha dad min pa'o //
translated: The many also are not different from that which does not have the same effect, because they are the opposite of that which does not have the same effect.

original: 'di ni rnam par rtog pa'i blos sgro btags pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ni rnam par rtog pa'i blos sgro btags pa'i phyir /
translated: This is because the mind that conceives of them as different is a conceptualizing mind that superimposes.

original: de nyid don ni ma brtags pa ste gang gis de kho na nyid kyi dngos po'i don la ma ltos pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /üîΩ'jig rten na ji ltar blo la snang @102a * //
analyzed: de nyid don ni ma brtags pa ste gang gis de kho na nyid kyi dngos po'i don la ma ltos pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te / 'jig rten na ji ltar blo la snang @102a * //
translated: The meaning of reality is not examined, because it is not dependent on the meaning of reality, as the words are to be connected.

original: pa la yang de'i ngo bor lhag par zhen pa nyid kyis grags pa ste /
analyzed: pa la yang de'i ngo bor lhag par zhen pa nyid kyis grags pa ste /
translated: In the world, whatever appears to the mind is also renowned as that nature, because of the adherence to that nature.

original: chos la sogs pa rnam par dbye ba de la'o //
analyzed: chos la sogs pa rnam par dbye ba de la'o //
translated: The analysis of phenomena and so forth is in relation to that.

original: de bzhin kho nar zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten la grags pa bzhin du'o //üîΩbsgrub bya sgrub pa kun gzhag pa //
analyzed: de bzhin kho nar zhes bya ba ni 'jig rten la grags pa bzhin du'o // bsgrub bya sgrub pa kun gzhag pa //
translated: Just as it is is just as it is renowned in the world.üîΩThe wise have established all proofs

original: mkhas pa rnams kyis byas pa yin //
analyzed: mkhas pa rnams kyis byas pa yin //
translated: in relation to what is to be proven.

original: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This is how it is to be connected.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na dam pa'i don la 'jug bya'i phyir mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid rtog par bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na dam pa'i don la 'jug bya'i phyir mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid rtog par bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Why? Because it is for the sake of engaging in the ultimate, in order to understand the characteristics of impermanence, etc.

original: yang ci'i phyir gcig pa nyid la sogs pa'i tha snyad dngos po la mi srid ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir gcig pa nyid la sogs pa'i tha snyad dngos po la mi srid ce na /
translated: Moreover, why is the conventional expression of sameness, etc. not possible in regard to things?

original: de'i phyir dam pa'i don gyi don rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dam pa'i don gyi don rnams ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Hence, he says, ‚ÄúThe things of the ultimate . . . ‚Äù

original: don dam pa pa'i dngos po rnams ni rang gi 'dre ba med pas de'i phyir dngos po la spyi'i tha snyad med do //
analyzed: don dam pa pa'i dngos po rnams ni rang gi 'dre ba med pas de'i phyir dngos po la spyi'i tha snyad med do //
translated: Since things of the ultimate are not mixed with one another, therefore, the conventional expression of the universal does not exist in regard to things.

original: dngos po de la du ma nyid mi rung ba'i phyir byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos dag gis so sor tha dad pa med de /
analyzed: dngos po de la du ma nyid mi rung ba'i phyir byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos dag gis so sor tha dad pa med de /
translated: Since multiplicity is not possible in regard to that thing, there is no difference in the individual characteristics of the things such as impermanence, etc.

original: de'i phyir dngos po de dag la ngo bo gcig pa dang / don gcig la du ma'i ngo bor lhag par zhen pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo'i bslad pa yin te 'khrul pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po de dag la ngo bo gcig pa dang / don gcig la du ma'i ngo bor lhag par zhen pa gang yin pa de ni rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo'i bslad pa yin te 'khrul pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the adherence to the single nature of those things and to the multiplicity of natures in a single object is the corruption of the conceptualizing mind, i.e., it is an error.

original: gang gi phyir don dam pa pa'i dngos po rnams 'dre ba yang med tha dad pa yang med pa rgyu des na 'di ni chos mang po rnams kyi spyi'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du chos mang po rnams kyi khyad par ro zhes bya ba'i bye brag tha dad pa nyid kyi tha snyad gang yin pa de ni blo'i don la yin gyi phyi rol gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir don dam pa pa'i dngos po rnams 'dre ba yang med tha dad pa yang med pa rgyu des na 'di ni chos mang po rnams kyi spyi'o zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du chos mang po rnams kyi khyad par ro zhes bya ba'i bye brag tha dad pa nyid kyi tha snyad gang yin pa de ni blo'i don la yin gyi phyi rol gyi rang gi mtshan nyid la ma yin no //
translated: Because ultimate things are neither mixed nor different, therefore, this is the general characteristic of many phenomena, and similarly, this is the specific characteristic of many phenomena.

original: gal te blo la snang ba brdzun pa'i phyir ji ltar de la byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos tha dad pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: gal te blo la snang ba brdzun pa'i phyir ji ltar de la byas pa nyid la sogs pa'i chos tha dad pa yin zhe na /
translated: If the appearance to the mind is false, how can there be different properties such as being produced in that?

original: de nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIn that very thing,‚Äù and so on.

original: blo'i snang ba nyid la'o //
analyzed: blo'i snang ba nyid la'o //
translated: In the appearance to the mind itself.

original: 'di skad du phyi rol dang gcig pa nyid du lhag par zhen pas ji ltar rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan las log pa ltar /
analyzed: 'di skad du phyi rol dang gcig pa nyid du lhag par zhen pas ji ltar rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan las log pa ltar /
translated: In this way, because of the superimposition of external things as being the same, the specific characteristic is posited as different from the general characteristic.

original: de mthong ba las 'ongs pa rnams par rtog pa la snang ba la yang de bzhin du lhag par zhen to zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de mthong ba las 'ongs pa rnams par rtog pa la snang ba la yang de bzhin du lhag par zhen to zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: It is explained that those who come to see it in that way also conceive of the appearance in conceptual cognition in the same way.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rab tu brtag ces bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rab tu brtag ces bya ba smos so //
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚Äúone should thoroughly investigate.‚Äù

original: ji ltar mngon sum rang gi mtshan nyid kho na 'dzin pa de bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba'i chos mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa bsgrub pas rjes su dpag pas khyad par du byas pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kho na ci'i phyir mi 'dzin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar mngon sum rang gi mtshan nyid kho na 'dzin pa de bzhin du bsgrub par bya ba'i chos mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa bsgrub pas rjes su dpag pas khyad par du byas pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid kho na ci'i phyir mi 'dzin zhe na /
translated: Just as perception apprehends only its own characteristics, why does inference not apprehend only the specific characteristic that is qualified by the probandum, such as impermanence?

original: de'i phyir bsgrub bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir bsgrub bya zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it says, ‚ÄúThe probandum . . .‚Äù

original: 'di ni bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: The thought is that this is the probandum, and this is the proof.

original: 'di ni sgrub pa'o snyam pa'i rtog pa la dngos por mthong ba nyams pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid @102b snang ba nyid nyams pa'i phyir spyis khyad par du byas pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa ltag la yod /
analyzed: 'di ni sgrub pa'o snyam pa'i rtog pa la dngos por mthong ba nyams pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid @102b snang ba nyid nyams pa'i phyir spyis khyad par du byas pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa ltag la yod /
translated: Because the perception of things in that conceptualization is impaired, the appearance of the specific characteristic is impaired, and therefore there is no apprehension of the specific characteristic that is qualified by the universal.

original: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po la sogs pas gzhan sel bas khyad par du byas pa'i khyad par 'dzin te zhes bshad pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid spyi dang 'brel pa 'dzin par dam bcas so snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir khyad par zhes bya ba la
analyzed: slob dpon phyogs kyi glang po la sogs pas gzhan sel bas khyad par du byas pa'i khyad par 'dzin te zhes bshad pa'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid spyi dang 'brel pa 'dzin par dam bcas so snyam du dogs pa bsal ba'i phyir khyad par zhes bya ba la
translated: To dispel the doubt that they are committed to the apprehension of a universal related to a particular, he says QUALIFIED,

original: sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: sogs pa smos te /
translated: and so on.

original: khyad par spyi dang 'dres pa shes so zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di la yang /
analyzed: khyad par spyi dang 'dres pa shes so zhes bya ba'i tshig 'di la yang /
translated: The statement, ‚ÄúOne knows a particular mixed with a universal,‚Äù

original: rang gi mtshan nyid gzung bya min rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yin par bstan to zhes bya ba de ltar khong du chud par ni mi bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid gzung bya min rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yin par bstan to zhes bya ba de ltar khong du chud par ni mi bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: does not mean that one should understand that a particular is apprehended, but that a particular is taught to be a universal.

original: 'on kyang der ni blo la snang ba'i khyad par dag kho na gzhan sel ba'i mtshan nyid kyis spyi de dang 'dres par 'dzin to zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang der ni blo la snang ba'i khyad par dag kho na gzhan sel ba'i mtshan nyid kyis spyi de dang 'dres par 'dzin to zhes bya bar rtogs par bya'o //
translated: However, one should understand that the particular that appears to the mind is apprehended as mixed with that universal by the definition of an other-exclusion.

original: gal te yang ci'i phyir de la de ltar rtog par bya zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yang ci'i phyir de la de ltar rtog par bya zhe na /
translated: But why should one think of it in that way?

original: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The verse begins, ‚ÄúThat which is manifold in one aspect . . .‚Äù

original: du ma la gcig pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni spyi'i rnam pa'o //
analyzed: du ma la gcig pa nyid kyi rnam pa ni spyi'i rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect of oneness in the manifold is the universal aspect.

original: gcig la khyad par mang po nyid ni khyad par gyi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: gcig la khyad par mang po nyid ni khyad par gyi rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect of manifoldness in the one is the particular aspect.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni chos dang chos can gyi rnam pa la sogs pa yongs su bsdu ste /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni chos dang chos can gyi rnam pa la sogs pa yongs su bsdu ste /
translated: The term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the aspect of the property and the property possessor, and so on.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid de ni de dag spyir yang gzung bya min no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid de ni de dag spyir yang gzung bya min no //
translated: The particular is not apprehended as a universal.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: byas pa nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i chos kyi bye brag khyad par ji lta bu can zhig ce na /
analyzed: byas pa nyid dang mi rtag pa nyid la sogs pa'i ngo bo'i chos kyi bye brag khyad par ji lta bu can zhig ce na /
translated: What is the particular, the specific nature of a property such as being produced or impermanent?

original: khyad par te dngos po'i ngo bo mang po rnams rang gi mtshan nyid de gcig la ste /
analyzed: khyad par te dngos po'i ngo bo mang po rnams rang gi mtshan nyid de gcig la ste /
translated: The particular, the manifold nature of an entity, is not suitable in the one,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid de gcig bu la mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid de gcig bu la mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that particular is not suitable in the one.

original: dngos po gcig cig la dngos po'i ngo bo mang po ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: dngos po gcig cig la dngos po'i ngo bo mang po ni mi rung ste /
translated: It is not suitable for a single entity to have a manifold nature,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la cha shas med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because a particular is partless.

original: de'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: de'i ngo bo zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The ‚Äúnature‚Äù of that is its own characteristic.

original: kun las log pa ni thun mong ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: kun las log pa ni thun mong ma yin pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúTurning away from all‚Äù means not being shared in common.

original: de de bzhin du rtogs par byed pa'i sgra yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid de thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bor 'dzin par byed pa'i sgra med pa'o //
analyzed: de de bzhin du rtogs par byed pa'i sgra yod pa ma yin zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid de thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bor 'dzin par byed pa'i sgra med pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is no word‚Äù means that there is no word that causes one to understand that own characteristic as the nature that is not shared in common.

original: rtog pa yang yod pa ma yin zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te /
analyzed: rtog pa yang yod pa ma yin zhes bya bar skabs dang sbyar te /
translated: ‚ÄúThere is also no conception‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bor 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bor 'dzin par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúThere is also no conception that causes one to apprehend that own characteristic as the nature that is not shared in common.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: sgra dang rtog pa ni spyi nyid du ni 'jug phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra dang rtog pa ni spyi nyid du ni 'jug phyir ro //
translated: Because words and conceptions engage only universals.

original: de rtogs par byed pa'i sgra med do zhes smra bas rang gi mtshan nyid la sgra rnams mi sbyor ro zhes bshad pa yin pas de'i phyir yang ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gleng ba byed do //üîΩspyi nyid @103a * //
analyzed: de rtogs par byed pa'i sgra med do zhes smra bas rang gi mtshan nyid la sgra rnams mi sbyor ro zhes bshad pa yin pas de'i phyir yang ci'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa gleng ba byed do // spyi nyid @103a * //
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThere is no word that causes one to understand that‚Äù explains that words are not applied to intrinsic identity. Therefore, the discussion of ‚Äúwhy‚Äù and so on is relevant.

original: du ni 'jug phyir ro //
analyzed: du ni 'jug phyir ro //
translated: Because it is applied to the universal.

original: zhes bshad ma thag pa'i phyir gleng ba mi rigs pa ma yin na ma zhe na /
analyzed: zhes bshad ma thag pa'i phyir gleng ba mi rigs pa ma yin na ma zhe na /
translated: Since this has just been explained, the discussion is not irrelevant.

original: de ni bden na lan lhag par brjod pa'i phyir nya bar bkod do //
analyzed: de ni bden na lan lhag par brjod pa'i phyir nya bar bkod do //
translated: That is true, but the response is stated in excess, so it is repeated.

original: brdas yul du byas pa ni brdar btags pa ste /
analyzed: brdas yul du byas pa ni brdar btags pa ste /
translated: That which is made an object by convention is a conventional designation.

original: sgra rnams kyis ni de ston to //
analyzed: sgra rnams kyis ni de ston to //
translated: Words reveal it.

original: de ni tha snyad ched du byas //
analyzed: de ni tha snyad ched du byas //
translated: That is for the sake of convention.

original: zhes bya ba ni brda'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni brda'o //
translated: That is the convention.

original: tha snyad kyi dus de'i tshe rang gi mtshan nyid gang la brdar 'dogs so zhes bya bar 'dod pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid med do //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi dus de'i tshe rang gi mtshan nyid gang la brdar 'dogs so zhes bya bar 'dod pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid med do //
translated: At the time of convention, there is no intrinsic identity that is the basis of the conventional designation, as you assert, because there is no intrinsic identity.

original: brdar 'dogs pa'i dus na rang gi mtshan nyid mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid tha snyad kyi dus su rjes su 'gro ba ni med de /
analyzed: brdar 'dogs pa'i dus na rang gi mtshan nyid mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid tha snyad kyi dus su rjes su 'gro ba ni med de /
translated: When the sign is designated, the intrinsic identity that is seen does not continue at the time of the expression.

original: gsal ba gzhan gyi ngo bo ni gsal ba gzhan la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba gzhan gyi ngo bo ni gsal ba gzhan la mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the nature of one manifestation is not possible for another manifestation.

original: gang yang gsal ba gcig cig brda'i yul nyid du 'dod pa gang yin pa de yang skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir dus gzhan na /
analyzed: gang yang gsal ba gcig cig brda'i yul nyid du 'dod pa gang yin pa de yang skad cig ma nyid yin pa'i phyir dus gzhan na /
translated: Also, that which is asserted to be the object of the sign, a single manifestation, is momentary, so at another time

original: de nyid kyis ngo bo rjes su 'gro ba med na /
analyzed: de nyid kyis ngo bo rjes su 'gro ba med na /
translated: it does not continue with that intrinsic identity.

original: yul dang dus kyis tha dad pa'i gsal ba la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
analyzed: yul dang dus kyis tha dad pa'i gsal ba la lta smos kyang ci dgos /
translated: What need is there to mention that it is different in terms of place and time?

original: rgyu des na rang gi mtshan nyid de la brdar ma yin te 'dogs pa zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu des na rang gi mtshan nyid de la brdar ma yin te 'dogs pa zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung ngo //
translated: Therefore, the expression ‚Äúthat intrinsic identity is not designated as the sign‚Äù is to be extracted from within.

original: sgra rnams kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: sgra rnams kyis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed de /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe words . . . ‚Äù and so on explains this.

original: sngar zhes bya ba ni brda'i dus na'o //
analyzed: sngar zhes bya ba ni brda'i dus na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPreviously‚Äù is at the time of the sign.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid gcig la brdar bya ba'i sgra zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid gcig la brdar bya ba'i sgra zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe word that is designated to the single intrinsic identity‚Äù is to be applied.

original: phyis zhes bya ba ni tha snyad kyi dus na'o //
analyzed: phyis zhes bya ba ni tha snyad kyi dus na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúLater‚Äù means at the time of the convention.

original: ci'i phyir rigs pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rigs pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not reasonable?

original: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says ‚Äúthat‚Äù and so on.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni brda'i dus na mthong ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni tha snyad kyi gnas skabs na yod pa'i gsal ba yul dang dus kyi tha dad pa la mi 'bral ba'i phyir zhing rjes su mi 'gro ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni brda'i dus na mthong ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni tha snyad kyi gnas skabs na yod pa'i gsal ba yul dang dus kyi tha dad pa la mi 'bral ba'i phyir zhing rjes su mi 'gro ba'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù means that the intrinsic identity seen at the time of the convention is not present in the manifestation that exists at the time of the convention, because it is not connected to the different places and times, and because it does not follow.

original: gcig la mthong ba'i khyad par ni gzhan la mi srid do //
analyzed: gcig la mthong ba'i khyad par ni gzhan la mi srid do //
translated: The difference seen in one is not possible in another.

original: 'dis ni de'i tshe rang gi mtshan nyid med ces bya ba 'dis rnam par bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni de'i tshe rang gi mtshan nyid med ces bya ba 'dis rnam par bshad do //
translated: This explains the phrase ‚Äúat that time, there is no intrinsic identity.‚Äù

original: spyi tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa'i lta ba yin no //
analyzed: spyi tha dad pa zhes bya ba ni bye brag pa'i lta ba yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúA different universal‚Äù is the view of the Vai≈õe·π£ikas.

original: grangs can pa'i lta ba ni tha mi dad pa yin to /
analyzed: grangs can pa'i lta ba ni tha mi dad pa yin to /
translated: The view of the SƒÅ·πÉkhyas is that it is not different.

original: gsal ba rigs mthun ba la khyab pa'i phyir khyab pa'o //
analyzed: gsal ba rigs mthun ba la khyab pa'i phyir khyab pa'o //
translated: It is pervasive because it pervades the similar class of manifestations.

original: gang gi phyir spyi brjod pa des na de'i phyir tha snyad kyi dus na med pa'i nyes pa med cing tha snyad kyi dus na sgra'i don med pa'i nyes med de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir spyi brjod pa des na de'i phyir tha snyad kyi dus na med pa'i nyes pa med cing tha snyad kyi dus na sgra'i don med pa'i nyes med de /
translated: Since the general is expressed by that, therefore there is no fault of nonexistence at the time of conventional expression, and there is no fault of the meaning of the word not existing at the time of conventional expression.

original: sgra'i don ni spyi yin pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: sgra'i don ni spyi yin pa'i phyir la /
translated: Because the meaning of the word is the universal,

original: de yang gcig pa nyid kyis brda dang tha snyad kyi dus gnyi ga na yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang gcig pa nyid kyis brda dang tha snyad kyi dus gnyi ga na yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and that exists at both the time of the convention and the time of expression because of being one.

original: ci nas zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don ni ci nas kyang zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin te /
analyzed: ci nas zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don ni ci nas kyang zhes bya ba'i don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning of the word ‚Äúhow‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúin what way.‚Äù

original: ci nas kyang skyes bu tha snyad kyi dus su sgra brjod pa las don byed par nus pa'i don @103b shes nas de bsgrub pa'i phyir don byed pa bsgrub pa'i phyir 'jug par 'gyur snyam pa'i bsam pa 'dis /
analyzed: ci nas kyang skyes bu tha snyad kyi dus su sgra brjod pa las don byed par nus pa'i don @103b shes nas de bsgrub pa'i phyir don byed pa bsgrub pa'i phyir 'jug par 'gyur snyam pa'i bsam pa 'dis /
translated: In what way, when a person at the time of conventional expression understands the meaning that is able to perform a function from the expression of the word, in order to accomplish that, in order to accomplish the performance of a function, he engages with the thought,

original: don rnams la rjod par byed pa'i sgra rnams sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: don rnams la rjod par byed pa'i sgra rnams sbyor bar byed do //
translated: and he applies words that express those meanings to those objects.

original: 'di nyid kyi rnam par bshad pa ni 'jig rten la zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi rnam par bshad pa ni 'jig rten la zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The explanation of this is ‚Äúin the world‚Äù and so on.

original: mi 'di brda mi byed cing brdar mi 'dogs pa'am /
analyzed: mi 'di brda mi byed cing brdar mi 'dogs pa'am /
translated: This person does not make a convention, or does not designate, or does not apply a sound to the object designated.

original: brdar btags pa'i don la sgra mi sbyor bas te nyam nga ba ni 'bras bu la mi lta bar 'ga' zhig la gtsigs cher 'dzin pa'o //
analyzed: brdar btags pa'i don la sgra mi sbyor bas te nyam nga ba ni 'bras bu la mi lta bar 'ga' zhig la gtsigs cher 'dzin pa'o //
translated: The distress is the holding of something as important, without regard to the result.

original: rtsom pa ni tha snyad do //
analyzed: rtsom pa ni tha snyad do //
translated: The undertaking is the convention.

original: 'bras bu'i don can ni 'bras bu med pa ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i don can ni 'bras bu med pa ma yin pa'o //
translated: The result is not the absence of result.

original: ril zhes bya ba'i sgra'am /
analyzed: ril zhes bya ba'i sgra'am /
translated: The word whole

original: gzhan yang rung ba'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang rung ba'o //
translated: or other is used.

original: mkho ba kho nar brtsi ba ni gzung bar 'os par ro//
analyzed: mkho ba kho nar brtsi ba ni gzung bar 'os par ro//
translated: The consideration is the suitability of grasping.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩrtsom pa 'bras bu med pa rtsom pa 'bras bu dang bral ba ni rtog pa sngon du gtong ba rnams kyis yal bar dor bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / rtsom pa 'bras bu med pa rtsom pa 'bras bu dang bral ba ni rtog pa sngon du gtong ba rnams kyis yal bar dor bar bya ba yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Why?

original: gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the undertaking without result, the undertaking devoid of result, is to be abandoned by those who have previously conceived a notion, because it is not to be grasped.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de lta bas na'o //
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba ni de lta bas na'o //
translated: Therefore means in that case.

original: 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don la ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don la ste /
translated: The something is the object of manifest desire.

original: sbyor ba ni brdar byed pa'o //
analyzed: sbyor ba ni brdar byed pa'o //
translated: The application is the convention.

original: 'dis kyang zhes bya ba ni rtogs par byed pa pos so //
analyzed: 'dis kyang zhes bya ba ni rtogs par byed pa pos so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy this‚Äù means by the one who understands.

original: 'bras bu 'ga' kho na la lta ba'i rigs so zhes bya ba ni dgos pa kho na la ltos pa'i rigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'bras bu 'ga' kho na la lta ba'i rigs so zhes bya ba ni dgos pa kho na la ltos pa'i rigs so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is reasonable to see some result, that is, it is reasonable to see only the purpose.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu ste /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the result.

original: 'dod pa thob pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: 'dod pa thob pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: It has the characteristic of obtaining what is desired.

original: mi 'dod pa 'dor ba'i mtshan nyid ces ci rigs par sbyar ro //
analyzed: mi 'dod pa 'dor ba'i mtshan nyid ces ci rigs par sbyar ro //
translated: It has the characteristic of avoiding what is not desired.üîΩSince the purpose of a person is just the nature of obtaining what is desired and avoiding what is not desired, therefore, this person who is the agent of the activity, having understood the desired and undesired results,

original: gang gi phyir skyes bu'i don 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa 'thob pa dang spong ba'i ngo bo kho na yin pa de'i phyir sbyor ba po'i skyes bu 'dis 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu de dag gis bsgrub pa dang sgrub pa ma yin pa'i donüîΩshes par byas na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir skyes bu'i don 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa 'thob pa dang spong ba'i ngo bo kho na yin pa de'i phyir sbyor ba po'i skyes bu 'dis 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu de dag gis bsgrub pa dang sgrub pa ma yin pa'i don shes par byas na /
translated: the meaning of what is to be accomplished and what is not to be accomplished,

original: 'dod pa bsgrub pa de la 'jug pa dang ; mi 'dod pa bsgrub pa la ldog pa dag bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'dod pa bsgrub pa de la 'jug pa dang ; mi 'dod pa bsgrub pa la ldog pa dag bya ba'am /
translated: should engage in the activity of accomplishing what is desired and should turn away from accomplishing what is not desired.

original: gzhan dag byed du gzhug pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan dag byed du gzhug pa'am /
translated: Or he should cause others to do it.

original: nyan pa po rnams kyang sbyor ba la gus par 'gyur snyam pa'i bsam pa 'dis sgra rnams sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyan pa po rnams kyang sbyor ba la gus par 'gyur snyam pa'i bsam pa 'dis sgra rnams sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: One should employ words with the thought that the listeners will be respectful toward the practice.

original: re zhig sgra sbyor ba ni gzhan gyi yan lag yin pa'i phyir gzhan la tha snyad du bya'o zhes sgra sbyor bar ni rigs nas /
analyzed: re zhig sgra sbyor ba ni gzhan gyi yan lag yin pa'i phyir gzhan la tha snyad du bya'o zhes sgra sbyor bar ni rigs nas /
translated: Since the employment of words is a limb of another, it is proper to employ words for the sake of another.

original: rang nyid 'jug pa dang ldog par bya ba la go sgra ci zhig dgos she na /
analyzed: rang nyid 'jug pa dang ldog par bya ba la go sgra ci zhig dgos she na /
translated: But what need is there for words in order to engage in and turn away from something oneself?

original: bden te sgra sbyor ba goms pa las bdag nyid kyang rtogs par byed pa na re 'ga' de ltar rtogs par 'gyur ba nye bar bkod par byas pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: bden te sgra sbyor ba goms pa las bdag nyid kyang rtogs par byed pa na re 'ga' de ltar rtogs par 'gyur ba nye bar bkod par byas pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: It is true that one can understand by oneself through the practice of employing words, but it is only in order to make others understand in that way that words are employed.

original: de lta ma yin na yal bar 'dor bar bya ba yin @104a * //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na yal bar 'dor bar bya ba yin @104a * //
translated: Otherwise, it would be useless,

original: pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sgra sbyor ba 'bras bu med na btang snyoms su gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni sgra sbyor ba 'bras bu med na btang snyoms su gzhag pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one would be indifferent if the employment of words were fruitless.

original: gal te rigs kyang don bya ba byed pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te rigs kyang don bya ba byed pa yin te /
translated: If a word is suitable, it is meaningful,

original: de bas na rigs la sgra sbyor bar yang 'gyur la /
analyzed: de bas na rigs la sgra sbyor bar yang 'gyur la /
translated: and therefore one employs words for the sake of the class.

original: 'bras bu med pa yang ma yin no snyam du sems na de'i phyir de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa yang ma yin no snyam du sems na de'i phyir de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you think that it is not nonexistent, then to respond to that, it says, ‚ÄúIn that case, etc.‚Äù

original: de la zhes bya ba rigs sgra'i don yin par 'dod pa la rigs de ni don byed par rung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba rigs sgra'i don yin par 'dod pa la rigs de ni don byed par rung ba ma yin no //
translated: In that case, the meaning of the term ‚Äúgenus‚Äù is asserted to be the object, but that genus is not suitable to perform a function.

original: de nyid rigs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston te /
analyzed: de nyid rigs ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston te /
translated: That itself is taught by ‚Äúgenus is not, etc.‚Äù

original: rigs ni bzhon pa dang bzho ba la sogs pa byed par nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs ni bzhon pa dang bzho ba la sogs pa byed par nus pa ma yin te /
translated: A genus is not able to perform the function of riding, carrying, etc.

original: de bas na bzhon pa dang bzho ba don du gnyer ba la rigs brjod pa don med pas de'i don du sgra sbyor ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na bzhon pa dang bzho ba don du gnyer ba la rigs brjod pa don med pas de'i don du sgra sbyor ba ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, since the expression of a genus is meaningless for one who seeks riding and carrying, the term is not applied for that purpose.

original: gal te 'o na gang gi tshe bzhon pa dang bzho ba la sogs pa'i skabs ma yin pa de'i tshe rigs la sgra sbyor ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'o na gang gi tshe bzhon pa dang bzho ba la sogs pa'i skabs ma yin pa de'i tshe rigs la sgra sbyor ro zhe na /
translated: If you think that when it is not the context of riding and carrying, etc., then the term is applied to the genus,

original: de lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de lta bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it says, ‚ÄúIn that case, etc.‚Äù

original: de lta bu zhes bya ba ni bzhon ba dang bzho ba la sogs pa'i skabs te /
analyzed: de lta bu zhes bya ba ni bzhon ba dang bzho ba la sogs pa'i skabs te /
translated: In that case means in the context of riding, carrying, etc.

original: 'bras bu med pa'i sbyor ba ni yal bar dor bar bya ba yin no zhes bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i sbyor ba ni yal bar dor bar bya ba yin no zhes bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has already been explained that a performance that does not have a result is to be rejected.

original: gal te spyi ni don bya ba mi byed kyi 'on kyang gsal ba kho na'i don byed na /
analyzed: gal te spyi ni don bya ba mi byed kyi 'on kyang gsal ba kho na'i don byed na /
translated: If a universal does not perform a function, but rather only an instance does,

original: gsal ba bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir spyi la sbyar ba'i sgras spyi mtshon par byed la /
analyzed: gsal ba bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir spyi la sbyar ba'i sgras spyi mtshon par byed la /
translated: then since an instance cannot be indicated, a word that is applied to a universal indicates a universal.

original: sgras mtshon pa'i spyi des de dang 'brel pa'i phyir gsal ba yang mtshon par byed de /
analyzed: sgras mtshon pa'i spyi des de dang 'brel pa'i phyir gsal ba yang mtshon par byed de /
translated: And since that universal indicated by the word is related to it, the instance is also indicated.

original: de bas na mtshon zin pas mtshon par bya ba'i rigs brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na mtshon zin pas mtshon par bya ba'i rigs brjod do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the type that is to be indicated is mentioned because it is already indicated.

original: 'brel pa yod du zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs te /
analyzed: 'brel pa yod du zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pas lan 'debs te /
translated: The response to that is ‚ÄúEven if there is a relation,‚Äù and so on.

original: rigs dang de dang ldan par 'brel pa yod du zin kyang 'on kyang gsal ba'i khyad par sgras ma brjod pa la ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rigs dang de dang ldan par 'brel pa yod du zin kyang 'on kyang gsal ba'i khyad par sgras ma brjod pa la ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: Even if there is a relation between a universal and that which possesses it, still, since the word does not indicate a particular instance, how could it engage with it?

original: mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba nyid do //
translated: It could not!

original: de nyid bsgrub par 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid bsgrub par 'ga' zhig la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To prove that, he says, ‚ÄúIf someone says,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'khar ba dang 'khar ba thogs pa 'brel pa yod du zin kyang rtog pa sngon du gtong ba 'ga' zhig la 'khar ba chod cig ces smras na 'khar ba thogs pa gcod pa ni med de sgras ma brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'khar ba dang 'khar ba thogs pa 'brel pa yod du zin kyang rtog pa sngon du gtong ba 'ga' zhig la 'khar ba chod cig ces smras na 'khar ba thogs pa gcod pa ni med de sgras ma brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Although there is a connection between a stick and one who holds a stick, if one says to someone who has a stick in front of him, ‚ÄúCut the stick,‚Äù the one who holds the stick does not cut it, because the word does not express it.

original: de bzhin du rigs brjod kyang gsal ba la mi 'jug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩgal te rigs la bzhon pa dang bzho ba la sogs pa mi srid pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bzhin du rigs brjod kyang gsal ba la mi 'jug go zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gal te rigs la bzhon pa dang bzho ba la sogs pa mi srid pa'i phyir /
translated: In the same way, although the class is expressed, it does not apply to the individual. This is the meaning.

original: sgras ma brjod du zin kyang gsal ba la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: sgras ma brjod du zin kyang gsal ba la 'jug par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If one says that the class is not expressed by the word, because riding, carrying, and so on are not possible for the class,üîΩthen the class applies to the individual.

original: mi srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /üîΩsmra ba pos bsgo bar bya ba la don gzhan la yod pa'i @104b 'bras bu mi srid pa'i don la brjod na /
analyzed: mi srid pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te / smra ba pos bsgo bar bya ba la don gzhan la yod pa'i @104b 'bras bu mi srid pa'i don la brjod na /
translated: If one says that it is not possible, and so on,üîΩthen when the speaker orders the object, the result of the meaning that exists in another object is not possible.

original: rnar mi 'ong ba smra bar 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi mi nus pa brjod pa de las gzhan nus pa la 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnar mi 'ong ba smra bar 'gyur ba 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi mi nus pa brjod pa de las gzhan nus pa la 'jug pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The speaker would only speak of what is impossible, but he cannot express what is possible, and it does not apply to anything else.

original: ci dang 'dra zhe na /
analyzed: ci dang 'dra zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: glang 'jo ba brjod pa bzhin te /
analyzed: glang 'jo ba brjod pa bzhin te /
translated: It is like the expression ‚Äúmilking a bull.‚Äù

original: 'ga' zhig gis glang zhos shig ces smras na /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gis glang zhos shig ces smras na /
translated: If someone says ‚Äúmilk the bull,‚Äù

original: de la bzho ba mi srid pa'i phyir nyan pa po glang las gzhan pa nus pa ba 'jo ba la 'jug pa ni med kyi de 'di snyam du 'dis rnar mi 'ong ba zhig smras so snyam du sems pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
analyzed: de la bzho ba mi srid pa'i phyir nyan pa po glang las gzhan pa nus pa ba 'jo ba la 'jug pa ni med kyi de 'di snyam du 'dis rnar mi 'ong ba zhig smras so snyam du sems pa 'ba' zhig tu zad do //
translated: since it is impossible to milk a bull, the listener understands ‚Äúmilk‚Äù to refer to a cow, which is capable of being milked, but not to the bull.

original: gal te glang brjod na 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ba 'jo bar 'jug par mi 'gyur gyi rigs brjod na ni 'brel pa'i phyir gsal ba la 'jug go snyam du sems na ;
analyzed: gal te glang brjod na 'brel pa med pa'i phyir ba 'jo bar 'jug par mi 'gyur gyi rigs brjod na ni 'brel pa'i phyir gsal ba la 'jug go snyam du sems na ;
translated: If you think that if the word ‚Äúbull‚Äù is uttered, since there is no connection, one does not understand ‚Äúmilk,‚Äù but if the word ‚Äúcow‚Äù is uttered, since there is a connection, one understands ‚Äúmilk,‚Äù

original: don gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then the response to that is ‚ÄúIf another object is expressed, etc.‚Äù

original: 'brel pa spyi don gzhan brjod kyang gzhan zhes bya ba gsal ba mtshon pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'brel pa spyi don gzhan brjod kyang gzhan zhes bya ba gsal ba mtshon pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Even if a general connection is expressed, another object is not indicated.

original: 'brel pa yod du zin kyang sgras ma brjod pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pas don 'di bshad zin pa kho na ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: 'brel pa yod du zin kyang sgras ma brjod pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pas don 'di bshad zin pa kho na ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But hasn‚Äôt this point already been explained in the statement ‚ÄúEven if there is a connection, if it is not expressed by a word, etc.‚Äù?

original: bden mod kyi don lhag mar brjod pa'i phyir yang gleng ngo //üîΩde nyid kyi phyogs snga ma dgod pa'i phyir /üîΩgal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bden mod kyi don lhag mar brjod pa'i phyir yang gleng ngo // de nyid kyi phyogs snga ma dgod pa'i phyir / gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: True, but we will discuss it again in order to explain the remainder of the meaning.üîΩIn order to set forth the opponent‚Äôs position, he says,

original: 'khar ba gang la 'brel pa ma nge pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: 'khar ba gang la 'brel pa ma nge pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is said that the word ‚Äòstick‚Äô is applied to a man because of the similarity of the stick that he holds,

original: 'di ltar 'khar ba ni 'khar ba thogs pa med kyang yod do //üîΩde'i ngo bo nyid ni de'i phyir de la zhes bya ba 'khar ba thogs pa la mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'khar ba ni 'khar ba thogs pa med kyang yod do // de'i ngo bo nyid ni de'i phyir de la zhes bya ba 'khar ba thogs pa la mi 'jug ste /
translated: then the word ‚Äòstick‚Äô would not be applied to the stick.‚ÄùüîΩThe word ‚Äústick‚Äù is applied to a man because of the similarity of the stick that he holds, but not because of the nature of the stick itself.

original: 'khar ba brjod na 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'khar ba brjod na 'jug par mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Therefore, the word ‚Äústick‚Äù is not applied to the stick that he holds, because when the stick is mentioned, it is not applied.

original: rigs brjod na ni 'brel pa nges pa can nyid kyi phyir gsal ba la 'jug par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na /üîΩgrub pa'i mthas smra bas de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rigs brjod na ni 'brel pa nges pa can nyid kyi phyir gsal ba la 'jug par 'gyur ro snyam du sems na / grub pa'i mthas smra bas de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you think that when the universal is mentioned, it is applied to the individual because the relation is definite,üîΩthe proponent of tenets says, ‚ÄúThat is not so, because the relation is indefinite.‚Äù

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa ma nges pa can nyid de /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa ma nges pa can nyid de /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the indefiniteness of the relation.

original: rigs la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: rigs la yang mtshungs so //
translated: It is the same for the universal.

original: gal te ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar zhe na /
translated: If you ask, ‚ÄúHow?‚Äù

original: gsal ba rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩgal te ji ltar 'khar ba thogs pa la 'khrul pa de bzhin du 'khar ba thogs pa yang 'khar ba la 'khrul gyi rigs ni gsal ba med par yod du zin kyang gsal ba ni rigs la mi 'khrul te /
analyzed: gsal ba rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // gal te ji ltar 'khar ba thogs pa la 'khrul pa de bzhin du 'khar ba thogs pa yang 'khar ba la 'khrul gyi rigs ni gsal ba med par yod du zin kyang gsal ba ni rigs la mi 'khrul te /
translated: The response to that is: ‚ÄúThe manifestation of the pot, etc.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir gzhan la 'jug go snyam du sems na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan la 'jug go snyam du sems na /
translated: If you think that just as the person who holds the stick is mistaken about the stick, so the stick is mistaken about the stick, but the class is not mistaken about the manifestation, even though it exists without the manifestation, and therefore it engages another,

original: de la yang log pa yin te /
analyzed: de la yang log pa yin te /
translated: then that is also incorrect.

original: gal te gsal ba'i sgo nas rigs mtshon par 'dod pa zhig tu gyur na ni de'i tshe gsal bas rigs mi 'khrul lo zhes bya ba 'di rung ngo //üîΩgal te ji ltar pa la sogs pa 'brel pa can cig shos med du @105a * //
analyzed: gal te gsal ba'i sgo nas rigs mtshon par 'dod pa zhig tu gyur na ni de'i tshe gsal bas rigs mi 'khrul lo zhes bya ba 'di rung ngo // gal te ji ltar pa la sogs pa 'brel pa can cig shos med du @105a * //
translated: If you assert that the class is indicated by the manifestation, then it is correct to say that the manifestation is not mistaken about the class.

original: zin kyang de las gzhan pa spun drung la sogs pa rjod par byed pa'i sgra rnams kyis 'brel pa cig shos 'phen par byed pa ltar phyi yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: zin kyang de las gzhan pa spun drung la sogs pa rjod par byed pa'i sgra rnams kyis 'brel pa cig shos 'phen par byed pa ltar phyi yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: If you think that just as the words ‚Äúbrother‚Äù and so on refer to one who is related, even though the other person is not present, so the words that refer to the manifestation also refer to the class,üîΩthen that is also incorrect.

original: zhe na spun drung zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhe na spun drung zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you say that the words ‚Äúbrother,‚Äù etc.,

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra bsdu ste /
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni bu zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra bsdu ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the words ‚Äúson,‚Äù etc.

original: de dag ni 'brel pa can gyi sgra yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de dag ni 'brel pa can gyi sgra yin pa'i phyir /
translated: They are related terms.

original: 'brel pa can gzhan la ltos pa kho nas rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'brel pa can gzhan la ltos pa kho nas rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Because they are posited only in dependence on another related term.

original: gzhan 'phen par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sbun drung la sogs pa'i zla bo'o //
analyzed: gzhan 'phen par 'gyur zhes bya ba ni sbun drung la sogs pa'i zla bo'o //
translated: ‚Äú Another would be implied‚Äù means the opposite of ‚Äúbrother,‚Äù etc.

original: 'phen pa yang 'brel pa can cig shos kyi rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa skyed pa yin gyi nye bar 'jog pa nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'phen pa yang 'brel pa can cig shos kyi rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa skyed pa yin gyi nye bar 'jog pa nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: An implication is the production of a conception that has the form of the other related term, but it is not a mere placement.

original: 'brel pa can med kyang rnam par rtog pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa can med kyang rnam par rtog pa skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because a conception can be produced even when the related term does not exist.

original: / de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos mi mthun pa bsnyad pa yin no //
analyzed: / de ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni chos mi mthun pa bsnyad pa yin no //
translated: The phrase ‚ÄúIn the same way,‚Äù etc., states an example that is contrary to the conclusion.

original: gal te 'brel pa can rjod par byed pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te 'brel pa can rjod par byed pa yin na /
translated: If a related term is expressed,

original: de'i tshe nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rigs gsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩrigs gang dag la gsal ba dang bral ba yod pa de dag gis kyang de'i sgra dag las rigs rjod par byed pa'i sgra dag las rtag tu 'jug pa'i yul du gyur pa gsal ba rjes su 'gro bar thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ro zhes bya bar rigs gsal ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / rigs gang dag la gsal ba dang bral ba yod pa de dag gis kyang de'i sgra dag las rigs rjod par byed pa'i sgra dag las rtag tu 'jug pa'i yul du gyur pa gsal ba rjes su 'gro bar thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: At that time, this fault would ensue.üîΩThe term ‚Äúmanifest‚Äù refers to the class of things that are manifest. Those who have a manifest class of things would also have a manifest class of things that is permanent, because it would follow that the manifest class of things would be the object of the activity of the words that express the class of things.

original: rigs gsal ba zhig pa can gyis kyang gsal ba don bya ba byed pa 'jog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rigs gsal ba zhig pa can gyis kyang gsal ba don bya ba byed pa 'jog par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that even if the manifest class of things were destroyed, the manifest class of things would still perform its function.üîΩIf one says, ‚ÄúThe manifest class of things is inferred from the words that express the class of things,‚Äù

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu bar byed de /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu bar byed de /
translated: one anticipates an objection with ‚ÄúIf you say . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: dus thams cad du zhes bya ba ni gsal ba yod pa dang med pa'i dus dag tu'o //
analyzed: dus thams cad du zhes bya ba ni gsal ba yod pa dang med pa'i dus dag tu'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAt all times‚Äù refers to the times when the manifest class of things exists and when it does not exist.

original: de dang 'brel par rung ba nyid du shes pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de dang 'brel par rung ba nyid du shes pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is known to be suitable to be related to that.

original: gsal ba dang 'brel par rung ba nyid du shes pa'i phyir gsal ba rjes su dpag par 'dod pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: gsal ba dang 'brel par rung ba nyid du shes pa'i phyir gsal ba rjes su dpag par 'dod pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: Because it is known to be suitable to be related to the manifest class of things, you only infer the manifest class of things.

original: 'di skad du ji ltar sbun drung zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra 'brel par rung ba'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di skad du ji ltar sbun drung zhes bya ba la sogs pa'i sgra 'brel par rung ba'i phyir /
translated: It is said that just as the word ‚Äúhusks‚Äù generates the cognition ‚Äúthere is something that is the husks of that,‚Äù because it is suitable to be related to that,üîΩbut it does not posit a specific instance of a general class that is related to it,

original: sbun drung ni gang gi yin pa 'ga' zhig ni yod do zhes de lta bu'i shes pa skyed par byed kyi 'brel pa can bye brag phye ste 'jog par byed pa ni ma yin pa de bzhin du rigs zhes bya ba'i sgra yang rigs 'di ni gsal baüîΩ'ga' zhig gi rung ba nyid yin no zhes de lar rung ba nyid 'phen par byed do zhes smras pa yin no //
analyzed: sbun drung ni gang gi yin pa 'ga' zhig ni yod do zhes de lta bu'i shes pa skyed par byed kyi 'brel pa can bye brag phye ste 'jog par byed pa ni ma yin pa de bzhin du rigs zhes bya ba'i sgra yang rigs 'di ni gsal ba 'ga' zhig gi rung ba nyid yin no zhes de lar rung ba nyid 'phen par byed do zhes smras pa yin no //
translated: in the same way, the word ‚Äúgenus‚Äù also impels the suitability of that genusüîΩto a specific instance of a general class.

original: 'o na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni la na 'debs te /
analyzed: 'o na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni la na 'debs te /
translated: The response to that begins with ‚ÄúBut if that is so,‚Äù and so on.

original: dus thams cad du zhes bya ba gsal ba yod pa dang med pa'i dus dag tu ba @105b lang zhes bya ba'i sgra las bzhon pa dang bzho bar rung ba gsal ba'i khyad par la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus thams cad du zhes bya ba gsal ba yod pa dang med pa'i dus dag tu ba @105b lang zhes bya ba'i sgra las bzhon pa dang bzho bar rung ba gsal ba'i khyad par la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúox‚Äù would not refer to a specific instance of a general class that is suitable to be a mount or a plow at all times, that is, at times when the specific instance exists and at times when it does not.

original: gal te ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: lhan cig byed pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: lhan cig byed pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúCo-operation‚Äù and so on.

original: rigs kyi gsal ba dang lhan cig pa dang / lhan cig pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs dag tu gsal pa'i khyad par don byed nus pa khyad par du ma 'phangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs kyi gsal ba dang lhan cig pa dang / lhan cig pa ma yin pa'i gnas skabs dag tu gsal pa'i khyad par don byed nus pa khyad par du ma 'phangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the specific capacity to perform a function is not attributed to the specific manifestation of the universal, either in the state of co-operation with it or in the state of non-co-operation with it.

original: 'di skad du ji ltar rigs gsal ba dang bral ba brjod na rung ba nyid tsam 'phen pa ltar rigs gsal ba dang bcas pa brjod na yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: 'di skad du ji ltar rigs gsal ba dang bral ba brjod na rung ba nyid tsam 'phen pa ltar rigs gsal ba dang bcas pa brjod na yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: In other words, just as the mere capacity for expression is attributed when the universal is spoken of as divorced from the manifestation, so also is it when the universal is spoken of as endowed with the manifestation.

original: gnyi gar 'brel par rung ba nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyi gar 'brel par rung ba nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Because there is no difference between the two in their capacity for connection.

original: gal re rigs 'ba' zhig brjod pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal re rigs 'ba' zhig brjod pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: ‚ÄúBut,‚Äù it might be argued, ‚Äúit is not the universal alone that is spoken of,

original: 'on kyang gsal ba dang 'brel pa can gyi rigs brjod pa'i phyir gsal ba la 'jug par ma 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nyes pa med do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang gsal ba dang 'brel pa can gyi rigs brjod pa'i phyir gsal ba la 'jug par ma 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i nyes pa med do zhe na /
translated: but rather the universal as related to the manifestation. So there is no fault in the universal being applied to the manifestation.‚Äù

original: de ltar yin la ni rag na 'on kyang gsal ba de yang de'i khyad par nyid du zhes bya ba rigs kyi khyad par nyid du gnas pas rigs brjod pa na 'phangs pa kho na'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar yin la ni rag na 'on kyang gsal ba de yang de'i khyad par nyid du zhes bya ba rigs kyi khyad par nyid du gnas pas rigs brjod pa na 'phangs pa kho na'i phyir /
translated: Although that is so, it is said that the manifestation is a particular of the universal, and since it is a particular of the universal, when the universal is mentioned, the manifestation is implied.

original: rigs 'ba' zhig brjod par byas pa ni ma yin gyi /üîΩ'on kyang de dag ldan pa brjod par bya ba yin no zhes phyogs gzhan yongs su gzung par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rigs 'ba' zhig brjod par byas pa ni ma yin gyi / 'on kyang de dag ldan pa brjod par bya ba yin no zhes phyogs gzhan yongs su gzung par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, the universal alone is not mentioned,üîΩbut rather, the possession of that is mentioned.

original: de la yag 'og nyid nas nye ba bshad par bya'o snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de la yag 'og nyid nas nye ba bshad par bya'o snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: This is the other position that is accepted, and it will be explained below.

original: rigs dang de dang ldan pa dag 'brel pa khas blangs nas de skad du bshad kyi 'brel pa nyid ni med pas rigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rigs dang de dang ldan pa dag 'brel pa khas blangs nas de skad du bshad kyi 'brel pa nyid ni med pas rigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The universal and the possessor of the universal are accepted as related, and that is explained, but they are not related.

original: phan tshun zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'brel pa med pa ston to //
analyzed: phan tshun zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'brel pa med pa ston to //
translated: The mutual non-benefiting of the universal and the manifestation is shown by ‚Äúmutually‚Äù and so on.

original: rigs dang gsal ba phan tshun phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rigs dang gsal ba phan tshun phan 'dogs pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because the universal and the manifestation do not mutually benefit each other.

original: gsal ba la yang rigs kyis byas pa'i phan pa med la /
analyzed: gsal ba la yang rigs kyis byas pa'i phan pa med la /
translated: Nor is there any benefit produced by the manifest for the potential.

original: rigs la yang gsal bas byas pa'i phan pa med do //
analyzed: rigs la yang gsal bas byas pa'i phan pa med do //
translated: Nor is there any benefit produced by the potential for the manifest.

original: phan pa med pa nyid rgyu gang gis she na /
analyzed: phan pa med pa nyid rgyu gang gis she na /
translated: Why is there no benefit?

original: bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa nyid du zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa nyid du zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of the relationship of that which is produced and that which produces.‚Äù

original: mtshan nyid tha dad pa dag ni phan pa med na 'brel pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshan nyid tha dad pa dag ni phan pa med na 'brel pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no relationship between things that are not different in characteristics.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Therefore, because there is no relationship,

original: rigs brjod pas rdzas mtshon par yang rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rigs brjod pas rdzas mtshon par yang rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not logical to indicate a substance by mentioning a potential.

original: de lta bas na zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes bya ba ni mjug sdud pa ste /
translated: Thus, he concludes.

original: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni don byed pa med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: 'bras bu med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni don byed pa med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is without effect means because it is without activity.

original: de lta na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phyogs gzhan smras te /
analyzed: de lta na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni phyogs gzhan smras te /
translated: In the phrase, ‚Äúin that case,‚Äù etc., he presents another position.

original: de ldan zhes bya ba ni rigs dang ldan pa'o //üîΩnus pa zhes @106a * //
analyzed: de ldan zhes bya ba ni rigs dang ldan pa'o // nus pa zhes @106a * //
translated: Endowed with that means endowed with a potential.

original: bya ba ni phod pa'o //
analyzed: bya ba ni phod pa'o //
translated: Capable means able.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni rigs dang ldan pa la ste /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni rigs dang ldan pa la ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the one who possesses the universal.

original: de la sgra sbyor ro zhes smra ba ni rigs kyi sgo nas rdzas la sgra sbyor bar 'dod kyi dngos su ni ma yin pas /
analyzed: de la sgra sbyor ro zhes smra ba ni rigs kyi sgo nas rdzas la sgra sbyor bar 'dod kyi dngos su ni ma yin pas /
translated: The statement ‚ÄúThe word is applied to that‚Äù means that the word is applied to the substance by way of the universal, but not directly.

original: de ltar na mtha' yas pa'i nyes pa yongs su spangs par 'gyur ro zhes so //
analyzed: de ltar na mtha' yas pa'i nyes pa yongs su spangs par 'gyur ro zhes so //
translated: Thus, the infinite faults are completely avoided.

original: de nyid kyi phyir grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de nyid la brgal bar de yang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de nyid la brgal bar de yang ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, the proponent of tenets raises an objection to that very point, saying, ‚ÄúBut that‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di nyid kyi rnam par bshad pa ni sgra de zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi rnam par bshad pa ni sgra de zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The explanation of this is ‚ÄúThat word‚Äù and so on.üîΩWhat need is there for another universal that obstructs it?

original: de la bar du gcod par byed pa gzhan gyis ci zhig bya zhes bya ba ni gsal ba de la bar du gcod par byed pa spyi gzhan brtag pas ci zhig bya zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de la bar du gcod par byed pa gzhan gyis ci zhig bya zhes bya ba ni gsal ba de la bar du gcod par byed pa spyi gzhan brtag pas ci zhig bya zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What need is there for another universal that obstructs that manifestation?

original: gal te mtha' yas phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba'o //
analyzed: gal te mtha' yas phyir zhes bya ba ni gzhan gyi dogs pa bsu ba'o //
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúBecause it is infinite,‚Äù that is the same.

original: 'di mtshungs zhes bya ba ni lan to //
analyzed: 'di mtshungs zhes bya ba ni lan to //
translated: This is the reply.

original: 'di nyid kyi rnam par bshad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi rnam par bshad pa ni gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The explanation of this is ‚ÄúIf, etc.‚Äù

original: de dang ldan pa yang mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni de dang ldan pa'i brjod par bya ba la yang 'dra ba'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa yang mtshungs so zhes bya ba ni de dang ldan pa'i brjod par bya ba la yang 'dra ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe same applies to the possessor of the universal‚Äù means that the same is true of the expression of the possessor of the universal.

original: gal te ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If someone asks, ‚ÄúWhy?‚Äù

original: rigs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rigs kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúBecause of the difference in the universal, etc.‚Äù

original: rigs kyi khyad par du byas pa rnams kyis gsal ba'i ngo bo thun mong ma yin pa nyams pa pa ni med do //
analyzed: rigs kyi khyad par du byas pa rnams kyis gsal ba'i ngo bo thun mong ma yin pa nyams pa pa ni med do //
translated: There is no loss of the uncommon nature of the manifestation that is distinguished by the universal.

original: de lta bas na rigs kyi khyad par du byas pa'i gsal ba dag kyang brjod par bya ba kho na yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar de la zhes bya ba la gsal ba rnams la sgra 'brel pa bye dgos na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na rigs kyi khyad par du byas pa'i gsal ba dag kyang brjod par bya ba kho na yin pa'i phyir gdon mi za bar de la zhes bya ba la gsal ba rnams la sgra 'brel pa bye dgos na zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Therefore, since the manifestations distinguished by the universal are also the object of expression, it is necessary to connect the word ‚Äúit‚Äù to the manifestations, saying, ‚Äúit is necessary to connect the word to the manifestations.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: If someone asks, ‚ÄúWhy?‚Äù

original: 'brel ba ma byas pa can ni brjod du mi rung ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'brel ba ma byas pa can ni brjod du mi rung ba'i phyir te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúBecause that which is not connected is inexpressible.‚Äù

original: sgra gang la 'brel pa ma byas pa yod pa des brjod du mi rung ba'i phyir byed pa po drug pa'am /
analyzed: sgra gang la 'brel pa ma byas pa yod pa des brjod du mi rung ba'i phyir byed pa po drug pa'am /
translated: Because that which is not related to a word is inexpressible, the sixth case is the agent.

original: sgra'i don gang don gang la 'brel pa ma byas pa yod pa de ni brjod du mi rung ba'i phyir las kyis drug pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra'i don gang don gang la 'brel pa ma byas pa yod pa de ni brjod du mi rung ba'i phyir las kyis drug pa yin no //
translated: Or, because that which is not related to the meaning of a word is inexpressible, the sixth case is the object.

original: sgra'i de dang ldan pa dang lhan cig 'brel pa de yang bya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: sgra'i de dang ldan pa dang lhan cig 'brel pa de yang bya bar mi nus te /
translated: Moreover, that relation of the word to that cannot be a function,

original: mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mtha' yas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is infinite.

original: de lta bas na phyogs de yongs su gzung ba ni rigs pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na phyogs de yongs su gzung ba ni rigs pa yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is reasonable to accept that position.

original: gal te de dang 'brel pa can la gsal ba dang 'brel pa can spyi la sgra'i 'brel pa byas pa'i phyir rigs dang 'brel pa can gyi gsal ba de la yang byas pa kho na yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de dang 'brel pa can la gsal ba dang 'brel pa can spyi la sgra'i 'brel pa byas pa'i phyir rigs dang 'brel pa can gyi gsal ba de la yang byas pa kho na yin no zhe na /
translated: If the relation of the word to that is made to the universal that is related to that, then the relation of the word to the individual that is related to the class is also made.

original: 'di la bshad zin te /
analyzed: 'di la bshad zin te /
translated: This has already been explained.

original: spyi gsal ba dang 'brel pa can yod du zin kyang rigs gcig la brdar byas pas gsal ba gzhan la rtog pa ni med de /
analyzed: spyi gsal ba dang 'brel pa can yod du zin kyang rigs gcig la brdar byas pas gsal ba gzhan la rtog pa ni med de /
translated: Even if there were a connection between the universal and the particular, the idea of one particular would not occur in regard to another particular, because of the convention made in regard to one class.

original: dper na 'khar ba la byas pas @106b 'khar ba thogs pa mi rtog pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'khar ba la byas pas @106b 'khar ba thogs pa mi rtog pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, when one makes a convention in regard to a stick, the idea of ‚Äústick-holder‚Äù does not occur.

original: rigs dang de dang ldan pa dag 'brel pa yang med do zhes de skad du yang bshad zin te /
analyzed: rigs dang de dang ldan pa dag 'brel pa yang med do zhes de skad du yang bshad zin te /
translated: And it has already been explained that there is no connection between the universal and that which possesses it.

original: 'brel pa yod du zin kyang 'khar ba zhes bya ba'i sgras 'khar ba thags pa ni med do zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du rigs dang gsal ba dag 'brel pa 'ga' yang med do zhes bshad ma thag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa yod du zin kyang 'khar ba zhes bya ba'i sgras 'khar ba thags pa ni med do zhes bya ba dang / de bzhin du rigs dang gsal ba dag 'brel pa 'ga' yang med do zhes bshad ma thag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if there were a connection, the word ‚Äústick‚Äù does not refer to the stick-holder, and in the same way, it has just been explained that there is no connection whatsoever between the universal and the particular.

original: de byed pa brjod par 'dod pa'i don byed pa rnams de byed pa ma yin pa brjod par 'dod pa'i don bya ba byed pa ma yin pa gang dag yin pa de las log pa gang yin pa des de byad pa thams cad mtshungs so //
analyzed: de byed pa brjod par 'dod pa'i don byed pa rnams de byed pa ma yin pa brjod par 'dod pa'i don bya ba byed pa ma yin pa gang dag yin pa de las log pa gang yin pa des de byad pa thams cad mtshungs so //
translated: All of the activity of that which is intended to be expressed by the word is the activity of that which is not intended to be expressed by the word. That which is the opposite of that is the activity of that which is intended to be expressed by the word.

original: de'i phyir log par mtshungs pa gzhan sel ba'i mtshan nyid de la cis ma byas te ci ste brdar ma byas /
analyzed: de'i phyir log par mtshungs pa gzhan sel ba'i mtshan nyid de la cis ma byas te ci ste brdar ma byas /
translated: Therefore, why not apply the definition of the exclusion of other to that which is similar to a mistake? Why not use it as a convention?

original: de nyid don byed pa gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /üîΩsreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis don byed cing sgrub pa gang gi dbang du byas shing ched du bsams nas mngon par 'dod pa'i don bya ba byed pa'i don rnams la sgra sbyor ba zhes bya ba rab tu sbyor ba'i skyes bu 'di'i
analyzed: de nyid don byed pa gang gi zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te / sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis don byed cing sgrub pa gang gi dbang du byas shing ched du bsams nas mngon par 'dod pa'i don bya ba byed pa'i don rnams la sgra sbyor ba zhes bya ba rab tu sbyor ba'i skyes bu 'di'i
translated: That very thing is shown by ‚Äúthat which performs a function‚Äù and so on.

original: de byed pa'i don mngon par 'dod pa'i don byed pa rnams gzhan dag las zhes bya ba de byed pa ma yin pa dag las tha dad pa'i phyir de dag byed pa thams cad ni rigs mi mthun pa las log par tha mi dad pa yin no //
