analyzed: de byed pa'i don mngon par 'dod pa'i don byed pa rnams gzhan dag las zhes bya ba de byed pa ma yin pa dag las tha dad pa'i phyir de dag byed pa thams cad ni rigs mi mthun pa las log par tha mi dad pa yin no //

original: de bas na 'dri ba'i bsam pa ni don de dag gi tha mi dad pa gzhan las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid de kho na la sgra ci ste mi sbyor /
analyzed: de bas na 'dri ba'i bsam pa ni don de dag gi tha mi dad pa gzhan las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid de kho na la sgra ci ste mi sbyor /
translated: Therefore, the thought of the questioner is that the meaning of the words is not applied to the mere definition of the exclusion of other, which is not different from those meanings.

original: sgra'i don gzhan spyi brtags pas ci zhig bya snyam pa yin no //
analyzed: sgra'i don gzhan spyi brtags pas ci zhig bya snyam pa yin no //
translated: What is the use of positing a separate meaning of words that is a universal?

original: gal te de ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sgra'i don dngos po yin par smra ba rnams kyi ltar na brjod par bya ba'i phyogs ni khyad par dang rigs dang de dang ldan pa dag 'brel pa dang / rigs dang ldan pa zhes bya ba gzhi yin pa de la /
analyzed: gal te de ldan zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni sgra'i don dngos po yin par smra ba rnams kyi ltar na brjod par bya ba'i phyogs ni khyad par dang rigs dang de dang ldan pa dag 'brel pa dang / rigs dang ldan pa zhes bya ba gzhi yin pa de la /
translated: If the meaning of the word is a thing, then according to those who say that the meaning of the word is a thing, the position to be expressed is that the particular, the type, and that which possesses it are related, and the basis is called the type possessor.

original: bzhi pa de dang ldan pa'i phyogs la slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos /
analyzed: bzhi pa de dang ldan pa'i phyogs la slob dpon phyogs kyi glang pos /
translated: With regard to the fourth position, that it possesses that, the master DignƒÅga explained the fault as follows.

original: de ldan rang dbang med pa'i phyir //
analyzed: de ldan rang dbang med pa'i phyir //
translated: Because it is not independent.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes pa bshad pa de dang ldan pa'i nyes pa gang yin pa de dang mtshungs pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas nyes pa bshad pa de dang ldan pa'i nyes pa gang yin pa de dang mtshungs pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because it is similar to the fault that is possessed by that,

original: nyes pa de 'di la yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir gzhan las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tha mi dad pa la sgra mi skyor ro zhe na /
analyzed: nyes pa de 'di la yang 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i phyir gzhan las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi tha mi dad pa la sgra mi skyor ro zhe na /
translated: Because this fault would also arise for you, the word is not applied to that which is not different from the definition.

original: nyes pa 'dir 'gyur kyang bla zhes khas len par byed de /
analyzed: nyes pa 'dir 'gyur kyang bla zhes khas len par byed de /
translated: We accept that this fault arises.

original: ji ltar nyes pa 'di med pa de ltar ni 'og nyid nas 'chad par 'gyur bas khas blangs nas de skad du smras par @107a * //
analyzed: ji ltar nyes pa 'di med pa de ltar ni 'og nyid nas 'chad par 'gyur bas khas blangs nas de skad du smras par @107a * //
translated: But since it will be explained below how this fault does not arise, we accept it and say this.

original: zad do // rigs gzhan mi dgos so zhes bya ba ni rigs gzhan yin par ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: zad do // rigs gzhan mi dgos so zhes bya ba ni rigs gzhan yin par ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúthere is no need for another type‚Äù means that it is not logical for it to be another type.

original: 'di nyid kyi rnam par bshad pa ni /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi rnam par bshad pa ni /
translated: This is explainedüîΩin the passage beginning with ‚ÄúIf you think‚Ä¶‚Äù

original: gal te 'di snyam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te gzhan pa de byed pa ma yin pa las ldog pa'i dngos po sgra'i don yin par khas len pa la yang ngo //
analyzed: gal te 'di snyam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te gzhan pa de byed pa ma yin pa las ldog pa'i dngos po sgra'i don yin par khas len pa la yang ngo //
translated: Even if you accept that the meaning of the word is a thing that is the opposite of that which is not a producer,

original: de dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni ldog pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa zhes bya ba ni ldog pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: ‚Äúendowed with that‚Äù means endowed with the opposite.

original: de'i phyogs las ldog pa'i phyogs 'di khyad par med do //
analyzed: de'i phyogs las ldog pa'i phyogs 'di khyad par med do //
translated: The opposite of that is the other class.

original: khyad par med pa nyid log pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: khyad par med pa nyid log pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: The absence of difference is shown by ‚Äúthe absence of difference is the opposite,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di ltar khyod kyis ldog par zhes smras la gzhan gyis rigs zhes smras pa dang / khyod kyis ldog pa dang ldan pa brjod do zhes smras la /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyod kyis ldog par zhes smras la gzhan gyis rigs zhes smras pa dang / khyod kyis ldog pa dang ldan pa brjod do zhes smras la /
translated: Thus, you say ‚Äúthe opposite,‚Äù and the other says ‚Äúthe similar,‚Äù and you say ‚Äúthe opposite is stated,‚Äù

original: gzhan gyis rigs dang ldan pa zhes smras la /
analyzed: gzhan gyis rigs dang ldan pa zhes smras la /
translated: and the other says ‚Äúthe similar is stated.‚Äù

original: brjod par bya ba'i 'di la khyad par ci zhig yod de sgra tha dad pa la ma gtogs pa khyad par gzhan 'ga' yang med do zhe na /
analyzed: brjod par bya ba'i 'di la khyad par ci zhig yod de sgra tha dad pa la ma gtogs pa khyad par gzhan 'ga' yang med do zhe na /
translated: What is the difference between these two statements? There is no difference except in the different words.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de dang ldan pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The proponent of tenets says, ‚ÄúThe possession of that,‚Äù and so on.

original: rigs gzhan zhes bya ba dngos por gyur pa ste /
analyzed: rigs gzhan zhes bya ba dngos por gyur pa ste /
translated: The other class is a real entity.

original: 'di ni rigs gzhan mi dgos so zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di'i 'grel pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni rigs gzhan mi dgos so zhes bya ba'i mdo 'di'i 'grel pa yin no //
translated: This is the commentary on the s≈´tra that says, ‚ÄúThe other class is not necessary.‚Äù

original: yang nyes pa mtshungs pa las ji ste /
analyzed: yang nyes pa mtshungs pa las ji ste /
translated: Again, if the fault is the same,

original: ldog pa khas len par byed kyi /
analyzed: ldog pa khas len par byed kyi /
translated: why do you accept the opposite?

original: spyi dngos por gyur pa ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: spyi dngos por gyur pa ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: But it is not a universal that is a real entity.

original: rigs khas len pas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩde med na zhes bya ba ni ldog pa med na'o //
analyzed: rigs khas len pas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / de med na zhes bya ba ni ldog pa med na'o //
translated: If you accept the existence of a real entity that is a universal, then you must also accept the existence of a real entity that is a particular.üîΩIf there were no real entity that is a universal, then there would be no real entity that is a particular.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni rigs dngos por gyur pa ste /üîΩrigs ni tha dad pa rnams la shes pa rnam pa tha mi dad pa can gyi rgyu yin par rtogs pas tha dad pa med na /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni rigs dngos por gyur pa ste / rigs ni tha dad pa rnams la shes pa rnam pa tha mi dad pa can gyi rgyu yin par rtogs pas tha dad pa med na /
translated: And if there were no real entity that is a particular, then there would be no real entity that is a universal.üîΩA universal is understood to be the cause of the cognition that is the same in regard to different things.

original: der rtogs pa don med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: der rtogs pa don med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If there were no differences, then the cognition of a universal would be pointless.

original: dngos po rnams kyang phan tshun tha dad pa med na thams cad gcig nyid du gyur pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyang phan tshun tha dad pa med na thams cad gcig nyid du gyur pa'i phyir /
translated: And if there were no differences among real entities, then everything would be one.

original: gang zhig gang dang mtshungs te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang dang mtshungs te /
translated: What is the same as what?

original: de ni don du ma dang ldan pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni don du ma dang ldan pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it would have the nature of being many things.

original: de lta bas na gdon mi za bar tha dad par khas blang dgos so //
analyzed: de lta bas na gdon mi za bar tha dad par khas blang dgos so //
translated: Therefore, you must accept that there are differences.

original: de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa gcig las tha dad pa de las gzhan pa'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa de las gzhan pa de'i 'bras bu can rnams kyis tha mi dad pa de nyid des khyad par du byas pa rnams la rtogs pa'i dmigs pa yinüîΩpa'i phyir rtogs pa zhes bshad kyi /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa gcig las tha dad pa de las gzhan pa'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa de las gzhan pa de'i 'bras bu can rnams kyis tha mi dad pa de nyid des khyad par du byas pa rnams la rtogs pa'i dmigs pa yin pa'i phyir rtogs pa zhes bshad kyi /
translated: That which is not the effect of that is different from that which is the effect of that.

original: de nyid rtogs pa ni ma yin no //üîΩyang na rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra byed par bsgrub pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid rtogs pa ni ma yin no // yang na rtogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra byed par bsgrub pa yin te /
translated: That which is the effect of that is not different from that which is not the effect of that.

original: ldog @107b par byed par gyur pa des dngos po rnams rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ldog @107b par byed par gyur pa des dngos po rnams rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That which is the effect of that is different from that which is not the effect of that.üîΩThat which is the effect of that is different from that which is not the effect of that.üîΩThat which is the effect of that is different from that which is not the effect of that.

original: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba ni gal te brjod par bya ba'i don ldog pas khyad par du byas pa'ang rung /
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du zhes bya ba ni gal te brjod par bya ba'i don ldog pas khyad par du byas pa'ang rung /

original: rigs kyis khyad par du byas pa'ang rung ste /
analyzed: rigs kyis khyad par du byas pa'ang rung ste /
translated: That which is the effect of that is different from

original: de dang ldan pa'i phyogs la mtha' yas pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa bshad pa gang yin pa de yongs su spangs par bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa'i phyogs la mtha' yas pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa bshad pa gang yin pa de yongs su spangs par bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and the faults of infinite regress, etc. that are explained in the case of the possession of that are not able to be completely avoided.

original: gal te cis te nyes pa 'dra na go rims kho na ci'i phyir khas mi blang zhe na /
analyzed: gal te cis te nyes pa 'dra na go rims kho na ci'i phyir khas mi blang zhe na /
translated: If the faults are the same, why not accept just the order?

original: don gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don gzhan zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe other meaning, etc.

original: don gzhan ni rigs dngos por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: don gzhan ni rigs dngos por gyur pa'o //
translated: The other meaning is the real entity of the potential.

original: gal te rigs kyi dngos po ni tha dad pa rnams la tha mi dad pa'i blo bskyed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rigs kyi dngos po ni tha dad pa rnams la tha mi dad pa'i blo bskyed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If the real entity of the potential is the producer of the non-different cognition in the different,

original: don de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúThat meaning, etc.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni rigs kyis bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni rigs kyis bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: That means that which is to be established by the potential.

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyis tha mi dad pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba ni de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa las ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyis tha mi dad pas so //
translated: The other means that which is not characterized by the result of that, because it is not different.

original: khyod ni ldog par brtags pas rigs kyis don grub par byed la /
analyzed: khyod ni ldog par brtags pas rigs kyis don grub par byed la /
translated: You establish the meaning by the potential through the imputation of the difference.

original: kho bo ni rigs su rtogs pas byas pa'i khyad par 'ga' yang med do zhe na /
analyzed: kho bo ni rigs su rtogs pas byas pa'i khyad par 'ga' yang med do zhe na /
translated: If you say that there is no difference at all in the cognition of a universal,

original: de'i phyir de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then the following verse is stated:

original: de khas blang ba zhes bya ba ni ldog pa khas blang pa ste /
analyzed: de khas blang ba zhes bya ba ni ldog pa khas blang pa ste /
translated: The statement ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the acceptance of the exclusion.

original: de khas mi len na rigs su rtogs pa nyid kyang mi rung ngo zhes bshad zin to //
analyzed: de khas mi len na rigs su rtogs pa nyid kyang mi rung ngo zhes bshad zin to //
translated: If one does not accept that, then the cognition of a universal is not possible.

original: de ltar na re zhig gzhan sel ba nges par khas blang ba nyid bsgrub pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig gzhan sel ba nges par khas blang ba nyid bsgrub pa yin no //
translated: Thus, first of all, the establishment of the ascertainment of the exclusion of another is accepted.

original: da ni sgra gdon mi za bar ldog pa brjod par bya ba yin pas de bstan par gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: da ni sgra gdon mi za bar ldog pa brjod par bya ba yin pas de bstan par gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Now, since the exclusion must be stated by the word, in order to demonstrate that, he says, ‚ÄúMoreover,‚Äù and so on.

original: brjod par 'dod pa'i don las gzhan pa ni de las gzhan pa ste /
analyzed: brjod par 'dod pa'i don las gzhan pa ni de las gzhan pa ste /
translated: That which is other than the intended object is ‚Äúother than that.‚Äù

original: de yongs su spangs nas nyan pa po 'jug par 'gyur zhes te ston par byed pas sgra brjod do //
analyzed: de yongs su spangs nas nyan pa po 'jug par 'gyur zhes te ston par byed pas sgra brjod do //
translated: Having completely abandoned that, the listener engages, and thus the word is stated by the teacher.

original: kyang zhes smos pa ni tshig snga ma la ltos nas bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: kyang zhes smos pa ni tshig snga ma la ltos nas bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù refers to the meaning of the previous statement.

original: yang na kho na'i don dang rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba yin pas /
analyzed: yang na kho na'i don dang rim pa gzhan du sbyar ba yin pas /
translated: Or else, it is applied to the meaning of ‚Äúonly‚Äù and to another level.

original: de las gzhan pa yongs su spangs zhes bya ba'i mjug thogs su blta bar byas te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa yongs su spangs zhes bya ba'i mjug thogs su blta bar byas te /
translated: Therefore, after ‚Äúhaving completely abandoned the other,‚Äù one should look at the passage:

original: de las gzhan pa pa yongs su spangs pa kho nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa pa yongs su spangs pa kho nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚Äúhaving completely abandoned the other only,‚Äù is what is meant.

original: de yis zhes bya ba ni sgras so //
analyzed: de yis zhes bya ba ni sgras so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy that‚Äù means by the word.

original: de dag rnams las zhes bya ba ni mngon par mi 'dod pa rnams las so //
analyzed: de dag rnams las zhes bya ba ni mngon par mi 'dod pa rnams las so //
translated: ‚ÄúFrom those‚Äù means from those that are not desired.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i don ni /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i don ni /
translated: The desired meaning is

original: rnam par mi gcod cing rnam par gcod pa brjod par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par mi gcod cing rnam par gcod pa brjod par mi byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: not eliminated, and the elimination is not expressed, is what is meant.

original: sgra de ji ltar te /
analyzed: sgra de ji ltar te /
translated: How is that word?

original: ji ltar sbyar bar 'os pa yin /
analyzed: ji ltar sbyar bar 'os pa yin /
translated: How is it suitable to be applied?

original: @108a * // mi 'os pa nyid de de'i tshe sgra sbyor ba don med pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: @108a * // mi 'os pa nyid de de'i tshe sgra sbyor ba don med pa nyid do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is not suitable, and at that time, the application of the word is meaningless, is what is meant.

original: de nyid 'di don rnams las zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: de nyid 'di don rnams las zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: That itself is shown by ‚Äúfrom those meanings,‚Äù and so on.

original: sbyor bar byed pa pos 'di mngon par 'dod pa'i don bya ba byed pa'i don rnams la sgra sbyor ba na ci nas kyang nyan pa po mi 'dod pa yongs su spangs nas zhes bya ba mi 'dod pa'i don rnam par bcad pas 'jug par 'gyur snyam pa'i
analyzed: sbyor bar byed pa pos 'di mngon par 'dod pa'i don bya ba byed pa'i don rnams la sgra sbyor ba na ci nas kyang nyan pa po mi 'dod pa yongs su spangs nas zhes bya ba mi 'dod pa'i don rnam par bcad pas 'jug par 'gyur snyam pa'i
translated: When the speaker employs the sound in order to perform the action that is the intended purpose, he does so with the thought, ‚ÄúI will engage in the action of the sound in such a way that the listener will completely avoid what is not wanted.‚Äù

original: bsam pa 'dis sbyor ro //
analyzed: bsam pa 'dis sbyor ro //
translated: He employs the sound with this thought.

original: gal te sgras gzhan rnam par bcad pa brjod par mi byed na de'i tshe rtogs par 'dod pa de dang gzhan la yang zhes bya ba mngon par mi 'dod pa la yang 'jug tu snang ba yin no //
analyzed: gal te sgras gzhan rnam par bcad pa brjod par mi byed na de'i tshe rtogs par 'dod pa de dang gzhan la yang zhes bya ba mngon par mi 'dod pa la yang 'jug tu snang ba yin no //
translated: If the sound does not express the exclusion of other, then the speaker would not be understood to engage in the action of the sound with regard to what is not wanted.

original: de lta yin na ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don gyi ming brjod pa gang yin pa de smos pa don med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni mngon par 'dod pa'i don gyi ming brjod pa gang yin pa de smos pa don med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If that were so, then it would follow that the statement of the name of the object that is intended would be meaningless.

original: 'di ltar khyer te shog cig ces smras nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar khyer te shog cig ces smras nas /
translated: For example, when one says, ‚ÄúBring the cow,‚Äù

original: dngos po tsam 'phangs pa yin pas /
analyzed: dngos po tsam 'phangs pa yin pas /
translated: one is referring to the mere thing.

original: de la mngon par mi 'dod pa rnam par bcad pa'i phyir me khyer te shog cig ces me'i sgra sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: de la mngon par mi 'dod pa rnam par bcad pa'i phyir me khyer te shog cig ces me'i sgra sbyor bar byed do //
translated: In order to exclude what is not fire, the word fire is applied.

original: gal te de sbyar kyang me ma yin pa khyer te 'ongs pa rnam par mi gcod na ni de'i tshe me zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod pa cung zad kyang dgos pa med do //
analyzed: gal te de sbyar kyang me ma yin pa khyer te 'ongs pa rnam par mi gcod na ni de'i tshe me zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod pa cung zad kyang dgos pa med do //
translated: If, even though the word fire is applied, it does not exclude what is not fire, then at that time the word fire has no purpose at all.

original: khyer te shog cig ces bya ba 'dis kyang khyer te mi 'ong ba ma spangs pa'i phyir khyer te 'ongs pa dang / khyer te mi 'ong ba gnyi ga snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyer te shog cig ces bya ba 'dis kyang khyer te mi 'ong ba ma spangs pa'i phyir khyer te 'ongs pa dang / khyer te mi 'ong ba gnyi ga snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And because this phrase ‚Äúbring the fire‚Äù does not exclude what is not brought, both what is brought and what is not brought appear.

original: de'i phyir 'jug pa dang ldog pa la yang 'jug tu snang ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'jug pa dang ldog pa la yang 'jug tu snang ste /
translated: Therefore, in regard to engaging and disengaging, engaging appears.

original: de lta yin na ni de'i ming smos pa don med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba kho nar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni de'i ming smos pa don med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba kho nar sbyar ro //
translated: If that were the case, then it follows that mentioning its name would be pointless.

original: de ltar gzhan las ldog pa mi brjod na ni me la sogs pa mngon par 'dod pa gcig dang khyer te shog cig ces bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bsgrub pa /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan las ldog pa mi brjod na ni me la sogs pa mngon par 'dod pa gcig dang khyer te shog cig ces bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi bsgrub pa /
translated: If one does not state the reversal of the other, then the proof that has the characteristic of the statement of one thing, such as ‚ÄúCome here, fire and so on, which is desired,‚Äù

original: gcig brjod pa gang yin pa de la mi gus pa'i phyir sgra brjod par bya ba ma yin pa kho nar te /
analyzed: gcig brjod pa gang yin pa de la mi gus pa'i phyir sgra brjod par bya ba ma yin pa kho nar te /
translated: would not be expressed, because one would not respect the statement of one thing.

original: bsnyad par bya ba ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bsnyad par bya ba ma yin pa kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: It would not be expressed at all.

original: yang na 'jug pa dang ldog pa la yang 'jug tu gnang na ni zhes bya ba 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyor te ;
analyzed: yang na 'jug pa dang ldog pa la yang 'jug tu gnang na ni zhes bya ba 'og nas 'byung ba dang sbyor te ;
translated: Or else, if one allows engagement and reversal, then, as it occurs below,

original: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis 'jug pa dang ldog pa la 'jug tu gnang na ni /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis 'jug pa dang ldog pa la 'jug tu gnang na ni /
translated: if one allows engagement and reversal in the manner explained,

original: gcig brjod pa la mi gus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid dang / ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi byed pa gcig brjod pa la mi gus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig brjod pa la mi gus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba 'jug pa'i mtshan nyid dang / ldog pa'i mtshan nyid kyi byed pa gcig brjod pa la mi gus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one would not respect the statement of one thing, because one would not respect the statement of one thing that has the characteristic of engagement and the characteristic of reversal.

original: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin du rnam par bshad par @108b bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni snga ma bzhin du rnam par bshad par @108b bya'o //
translated: The rest should be explained as before.

original: de lta na ni sgra'i tha snyad chad par 'gyur ba zhig na /
analyzed: de lta na ni sgra'i tha snyad chad par 'gyur ba zhig na /
translated: If that were so, then the conventions of words would be cut off.

original: de lta yang ma yin pas de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de lta yang ma yin pas de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: But that is not so, therefore it is said, ‚Äúthus, etc.‚Äù

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan rnam par bcad pa'o //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni gzhan rnam par bcad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is the exclusion of another.

original: de las gzhan pa dag la zhes bya ba ni de byed pa ma yin pa de las gzhan pa 'bras bu gcig pa can dag la tha mi dad pa yin te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa dag la zhes bya ba ni de byed pa ma yin pa de las gzhan pa 'bras bu gcig pa can dag la tha mi dad pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom that, etc.‚Äù means that from that which is not its producer, from that which is different, it is not different from those which have the same effect,

original: thams cad de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa las log pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thams cad de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa las log pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all are the opposite of not having that as its effect.

original: rnam par bcad pa la rigs kyi chos du ma la 'jug pa nyid kyang yod do //
analyzed: rnam par bcad pa la rigs kyi chos du ma la 'jug pa nyid kyang yod do //
translated: In the exclusion, there is also the engagement in many properties of the class.

original: de zhes bya ba ni rnam par bcad pa'o //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rnam par bcad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is the exclusion.

original: khyad par ji lta bu can zhig ce na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu can zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of distinction?

original: nges par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: nges par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: It is said, ‚Äúdefinite, etc.‚Äù

original: rnam par bcad pa gang la nges par khas blangs pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par bcad pa gang la nges par khas blangs pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: That exclusion in which there is a definite acceptance is called that.

original: de khas mi len na rigs med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de khas mi len na rigs med par thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is not accepted, it follows that there is no class.

original: gang la gdon mi za bar brjod pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: gang la gdon mi za bar brjod pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: That which is invariably expressed is so-called.

original: de ma brjod na sgra sbyor ba 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma brjod na sgra sbyor ba 'bras bu med par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is not expressed, the application of the word would be fruitless.

original: gsal pa rnams la blo dang sgra dag rjes su 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rigs kyi don de rab tu sgrub pa 'di rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal pa rnams la blo dang sgra dag rjes su 'gro ba'i mtshan nyid kyi rigs kyi don de rab tu sgrub pa 'di rab tu bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is established in order to establish the meaning of the universal, which is the characteristic of the concomitance of cognition and word with regard to the manifest.

original: rnam par bcad pa de lta bu de yongs su bor nas spyi don gzhan du rtog pa ni don med pa la gcig po cher 'dzin pa 'ba' zhig tu zad de //
analyzed: rnam par bcad pa de lta bu de yongs su bor nas spyi don gzhan du rtog pa ni don med pa la gcig po cher 'dzin pa 'ba' zhig tu zad de //
translated: Having abandoned such an exclusion, the imagination of a different, universal object is meaningless, being only the apprehension of a great oneness.

original: dngos po med pa la mngon par zhen pa nyid 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi rgyu gzhan ni cung zad med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: dngos po med pa la mngon par zhen pa nyid 'ba' zhig tu zad kyi rgyu gzhan ni cung zad med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: It is only the adherence to non-entity, and there is no other cause at all. This is the meaning.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: rtag pa dang / khyab pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag tu ji ltar brtags pa bzhin du spyi de mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag pa dang / khyab pa la sogs pa'i rnam pa dag tu ji ltar brtags pa bzhin du spyi de mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that universal is not tenable in the aspects imagined, such as permanent, pervasive, and so on.

original: gzhan gyis rnam par gcod par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis rnam par gcod par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIt is not that sound does not eliminate other objects of action, etc.‚Äù

original: sgras rnam par gcod par mi byed pa nyid ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: sgras rnam par gcod par mi byed pa nyid ni ma yin gyi /
translated: It is not that sound does not eliminate other objects of action, etc.

original: 'on kyang byed pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang byed pa kho na'o //
translated: But it does eliminate them.

original: 'o na ji ste /
analyzed: 'o na ji ste /
translated: Well then, what does it do?

original: rigs brjod ce na /üîΩde'i phyir 'jug pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rigs brjod ce na / de'i phyir 'jug pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIt expresses a property possessor.‚Äù

original: don byed pa don du gnyer ba'i 'jug pa gang yin pa de'i yul ni rigs yin pas kho bo de brjod pas rigs smras so zhe na /
analyzed: don byed pa don du gnyer ba'i 'jug pa gang yin pa de'i yul ni rigs yin pas kho bo de brjod pas rigs smras so zhe na /
translated: The object of the action of one who seeks to perform an object is a property possessor. Therefore, by expressing that, I have stated a property possessor.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩgal te sgra 'di la brjod par bya ba rnam par bcad pa yod do zhe'am /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / gal te sgra 'di la brjod par bya ba rnam par bcad pa yod do zhe'am /
translated: The proponent of tenets says, ‚ÄúIf you say, etc.‚ÄùüîΩIf you say that this sound has the elimination of the expressed object,

original: gal te rigs dang ldan pa 'di la sgra'i brjod par bya ba rnam par bcad pa yod do zhe na /üîΩsgra rnams kyi dgos pa ni gzhan rnam par bcad pas 'dod @109a * //
analyzed: gal te rigs dang ldan pa 'di la sgra'i brjod par bya ba rnam par bcad pa yod do zhe na / sgra rnams kyi dgos pa ni gzhan rnam par bcad pas 'dod @109a * //
translated: or if you say that this property possessor has the elimination of the expressed object of sound,

original: pa la 'jug pa de tsam du zad pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: pa la 'jug pa de tsam du zad pa ma yin nam /
translated: isn‚Äôt the purpose of sounds just to engage in what is desired by eliminating others?

original: khyed la der zhes bya ba gzhan rnam par bcad pas 'dod pa la 'jug pa de la spyi gzhan gyis ni ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: khyed la der zhes bya ba gzhan rnam par bcad pas 'dod pa la 'jug pa de la spyi gzhan gyis ni ci zhig bya ste /
translated: What use is there for you of a universal that is the exclusion of another, since you engage in the desired object by means of that?

original: khyod la spyi cung zad kyang mi dgos so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khyod la spyi cung zad kyang mi dgos so zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that you do not need a universal at all.

original: gzhan gyis 'jug pa'i yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa dang / slob dpon gyis da skad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis 'jug pa'i yul zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras pa dang / slob dpon gyis da skad ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: When the opponent says, ‚ÄúThe object of engagement is another,‚Äù the master says, ‚ÄúNow, this . . .‚Äù

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rigs pa ma yin pa nyid ston pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rigs pa ma yin pa nyid ston pa yin te /
translated: ‚ÄúIn this way‚Äù and so on teaches the illogicality of this.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni rigs so //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni rigs so //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the universal.

original: rigs ni don byed par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs ni don byed par nus pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not able to perform a function.

original: 'jug par rung ba nyid ma yin no zhes de skad du rigs don byed rung min zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan zin to //
analyzed: 'jug par rung ba nyid ma yin no zhes de skad du rigs don byed rung min zhes bya ba la sogs pas bstan zin to //
translated: It is not suitable to engage in it. This is stated in the lines ‚ÄúA universal is not suitable to perform a function‚Äù and so on.

original: gal te rigs rung ba ma yin yang /
analyzed: gal te rigs rung ba ma yin yang /
translated: Even if a universal is not suitable,

original: 'on kyang de brjod na shugs kyis rdzas ma brjod pa skyes bu 'jug par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang de brjod na shugs kyis rdzas ma brjod pa skyes bu 'jug par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: if it is expressed, then by implication the substance that is not expressed will be engaged.

original: de'i sgo nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i sgo nas zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The response to that is as follows:

original: rigs kyi sgo nas rdzas ma brjod pa la 'jug pa yang 'brel pa yod du zin kyang sgras ma brjod pa la ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pas stsal zin to //
analyzed: rigs kyi sgo nas rdzas ma brjod pa la 'jug pa yang 'brel pa yod du zin kyang sgras ma brjod pa la ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur te zhes bya ba la sogs pas stsal zin to //
translated: Even though there is a connection to the expression of substance by way of type, how could it engage the unexpressed?

original: gal te rigs kyi sgo nas de dang ldan pa kho nas brjod do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rigs kyi sgo nas de dang ldan pa kho nas brjod do zhe na /
translated: If one says that it is expressed just by way of the type,

original: de dang ldan pa brjod pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa brjod pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the response to that is as follows:

original: de la spyis bar du chod par 'gyur bas na /
analyzed: de la spyis bar du chod par 'gyur bas na /
translated: Since the type would be obstructed,

original: de yang ni ci'i phyir dngos sbyor mi byed ces bya ba dang de la bar du gcod par byed pa gzhan gyis ci zhig bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsal zin te /
analyzed: de yang ni ci'i phyir dngos sbyor mi byed ces bya ba dang de la bar du gcod par byed pa gzhan gyis ci zhig bya zhes bya ba la sogs pas bsal zin te /
translated: why would it not be directly applied? What would be the point of another obstruction?

original: gal te rigs sam gsal ba 'ba' zhig ni sgra'i rten can gyi 'jug pa'i rten ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te rigs sam gsal ba 'ba' zhig ni sgra'i rten can gyi 'jug pa'i rten ma yin te /
translated: If only the type or the manifestation is not the basis of engagement that is the basis of the term,üîΩthen the term would not be applied to the substance.

original: rigs 'ba' zhig gis don byed par mi nus pa'i phyir dang / gsal ba 'ba' zhig kyang brjod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs 'ba' zhig gis don byed par mi nus pa'i phyir dang / gsal ba 'ba' zhig kyang brjod par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the universal alone cannot perform the function, and because the individual alone cannot be expressed.

original: de lta bas na rigs dang de dang ldan pa bsdongs pa dag ni 'jug pa'i rgyu yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na rigs dang de dang ldan pa bsdongs pa dag ni 'jug pa'i rgyu yin te /
translated: Therefore, the universal and that which possesses it, when combined, are the cause of engagement.

original: de dag tshogs pa kho na'i don nyid yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de dag tshogs pa kho na'i don nyid yin no zhe na /
translated: The collection of those alone is the object.

original: de'i phyir rigs dang de dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rigs dang de dang ldan pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚Äúthe universal and that which possesses it,‚Äù and so on.üîΩIf it is the object of engagement,

original: 'jug pa'i yul nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni sgra'i rten can gyis 'jug pa'i yul nyid yin par khas len na /
analyzed: 'jug pa'i yul nyid yin na zhes bya ba ni sgra'i rten can gyis 'jug pa'i yul nyid yin par khas len na /
translated: if it is accepted as the object of engagement of the sound-based,

original: ldog pa dang de dang ldan pa dag yin par ji ste /üîΩmi 'dod 'jug pa'i yul nyid du zhes bya bar khong nas dbyung ngo //
analyzed: ldog pa dang de dang ldan pa dag yin par ji ste / mi 'dod 'jug pa'i yul nyid du zhes bya bar khong nas dbyung ngo //
translated: why is it not accepted as the object of disengagement?üîΩThe object of engagement is to be understood.

original: ldog pa dang ldog pa dang ldan pa dag ni tshad ma grub po snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: ldog pa dang ldog pa dang ldan pa dag ni tshad ma grub po snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: If it is the object of disengagement, it is thought that the valid cognition of disengagement and that which possesses it is established.

original: gal te ldog pa'i sgra'i yul du @109b gyur pa ni /
analyzed: gal te ldog pa'i sgra'i yul du @109b gyur pa ni /
translated: If it becomes the object of the sound of disengagement,

original: blos kun brtags pa'i phyir dngos po med pa nyid yin no //üîΩrgyu des na bzhon pa dang bzho ba la sogs pa'i don bya ba la /
analyzed: blos kun brtags pa'i phyir dngos po med pa nyid yin no // rgyu des na bzhon pa dang bzho ba la sogs pa'i don bya ba la /
translated: Because it is imputed by thought, it is not a real entity.üîΩFor that reason, since it does not accomplish the object of the action, such as riding and carrying,

original: sgrub pa ma yin pa'i phyir ldog pa dang de dang ldan pa dag 'jug pa'i yul nyid du mi 'dod do zhe na /
analyzed: sgrub pa ma yin pa'i phyir ldog pa dang de dang ldan pa dag 'jug pa'i yul nyid du mi 'dod do zhe na /
translated: we do not accept that the possessor and the possession are the objects of engagement.

original: sgrub pa ma yin pa nyid de ni rigs la yang mtshungs te /
analyzed: sgrub pa ma yin pa nyid de ni rigs la yang mtshungs te /
translated: That it does not accomplish is the same for the potential,

original: de yang bzhon pa dang bzho ba la sogs par nus pa ma yin no /üîΩ// / bam po bcu gcig pa /
analyzed: de yang bzhon pa dang bzho ba la sogs par nus pa ma yin no / // / bam po bcu gcig pa /
translated: because it is not able to ride or carry.üîΩIf you say, ‚ÄúThere is no error because the object of the action is accomplished by possessing that,‚Äù

original: gal te de dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni rigs dang ldan pas don bya ba bsgrub pa'i phyir nyes pa med do 'di skad du rigs kyis don bya ba mi byed mod kyi /
analyzed: gal te de dang ldan pas zhes bya ba ni rigs dang ldan pas don bya ba bsgrub pa'i phyir nyes pa med do 'di skad du rigs kyis don bya ba mi byed mod kyi /
translated: it is said, ‚ÄúThe potential does not perform the object of the action,

original: 'on kyang de dang 'brel ba'i rdzas kyis don bya ba byed de /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dang 'brel ba'i rdzas kyis don bya ba byed de /
translated: but a substance that is related to it performs the object of the action.

original: de'i phyir de'i sgo nas rigs dang de dang ldan pa dag 'jug pa'i yul du mi 'dod do zhes smras pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i sgo nas rigs dang de dang ldan pa dag 'jug pa'i yul du mi 'dod do zhes smras pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, from that perspective, we do not accept that the potential and that which possesses it are objects of engagement.‚Äù

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The proponent of tenets says, ‚ÄúThat which is called ‚Äòthe self‚Äô is the appropriator of the five aggregates.‚Äù

original: don byed pa sgrub pa nyid de ni ldog pa dang ldan pa la yang mtshungs so //
analyzed: don byed pa sgrub pa nyid de ni ldog pa dang ldan pa la yang mtshungs so //
translated: The proponent of the philosophical tenet says, ‚ÄúThat which is the establishment of the performance of an action is also the same in the case of the possessor of the negation.‚Äù

original: de bas na de'i sgo nas ldog pa dang ldog pa dang ldan pa dag sgra'i don du ci ste mi 'dod do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de'i sgo nas ldog pa dang ldog pa dang ldan pa dag sgra'i don du ci ste mi 'dod do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, why would one not accept that, through that, the negation and the possessor of the negation are the meaning of the word?

original: de ltar na re zhig mgo mnyam pa'i tshul du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig mgo mnyam pa'i tshul du bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, this is the explanation in the manner of a parallel case.

original: gal te ldog par smra ba yang gzhan gyi ltar sgra'i don dngos po kho na yin par 'dod pa zhig tu gyur na ni ldog pa bsgrub pa ma yin pa'i phyir sgra'i don nyid du rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i klan ka 'dir yang 'gyur baüîΩzhig na / 'on kyang ldog pa smra ba rnams kyi ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te ldog par smra ba yang gzhan gyi ltar sgra'i don dngos po kho na yin par 'dod pa zhig tu gyur na ni ldog pa bsgrub pa ma yin pa'i phyir sgra'i don nyid du rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i klan ka 'dir yang 'gyur ba zhig na / 'on kyang ldog pa smra ba rnams kyi ltar na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If the proponent of the negation also were to assert that the meaning of the word is only an entity, as the opponent does, then this objection would apply: ‚ÄúBecause the negation is not established, it is not reasonable that it is the meaning of the word.‚ÄùüîΩHowever, according to the proponents of the negation, the meaning of the word is the entity that is the basis of the negation.

original: nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni nges par gzung ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù has the meaning of exclusion.

original: gal te dngos po'i yul can ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po'i yul can ma yin na /
translated: If it is not an object of real things,

original: ji ltar don byed pa don du gnyer ba 'jug par byed ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar don byed pa don du gnyer ba 'jug par byed ce na /
translated: how does it engage in the pursuit of the performance of objects?

original: de ni 'khrul pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni 'khrul pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text declares, ‚ÄúIt is due to error . . .‚Äù

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni sgra'i shes pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni sgra'i shes pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú It‚Äù refers to the cognition of sound.

original: rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i don med pa la don du lhag par zhen pa ni 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i don med pa la don du lhag par zhen pa ni 'khrul pa ste /
translated: The nonexistence of an object that appears to conceptual cognition is conceived to be an object.

original: de'i dbang gis mthus rang snang ba byed pa po ma yin pa las yang byed pa por lhag par zhen pas 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: de'i dbang gis mthus rang snang ba byed pa po ma yin pa las yang byed pa por lhag par zhen pas 'jug par byed de /
translated: Due to the power of that error, one engages in the pursuit of the object, conceiving that which is not a creator to be a creator.

original: skyes bu zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung ngo //
analyzed: skyes bu zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung ngo //
translated: The word ‚Äúperson‚Äù is inserted.

original: 'khrul pas 'jug pa la ni rag na /
analyzed: 'khrul pas 'jug pa la ni rag na /
translated: If one engages in the pursuit due to error,

original: 'on kyang gzhan gyi rjes su dpag ba la gang byas pa de ni mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshul gsum pa'i rtags ston par byed pa'i sgra las byung ba rtags dang rtags can gyi shes pa rnams kyis go ji ltar dngos po 'thob ce
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan gyi rjes su dpag ba la gang byas pa de ni mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa tshul gsum pa'i rtags ston par byed pa'i sgra las byung ba rtags dang rtags can gyi shes pa rnams kyis go ji ltar dngos po 'thob ce
translated: then how does one obtain a real thing from the words that indicate the trimodal logical mark, such as ‚ÄúWhatever is produced is impermanent‚Äù?
üîΩüîΩ

original: de'i phyir dngos po 'thob pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po 'thob pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúObtaining an entity, etc.‚Äù

original: brgyud de dngos po las skye ba'i rgyur gyur pas dngos po de dang 'brel te /
analyzed: brgyud de dngos po las skye ba'i rgyur gyur pas dngos po de dang 'brel te /
translated: Since it is the cause of the arising of an entity through a medium, it is related to that entity.

original: de lta yin na dngos po 'thob par 'gyur gyi zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na dngos po 'thob par 'gyur gyi zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: If that is so, it is said, ‚ÄúObtaining an entity, etc.‚Äù

original: 'di skad du gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la rtags dang rtags can gyi shes pa yang brgyud pas dngos po dang 'brel pa'i rtags kyi sgo nas 'ongs pa'i phyir dngos po 'thob par byed pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di skad du gzhan gyi don gyi rjes su dpag pa la rtags dang rtags can gyi shes pa yang brgyud pas dngos po dang 'brel pa'i rtags kyi sgo nas 'ongs pa'i phyir dngos po 'thob par byed pa yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: In other words, in an inference for the sake of another, the awareness of the reason and the awareness of the subject also obtain an entity because they come through a reason that is related to an entity through a medium.

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa med pa na sgra'i shes pas dngos po 'thob par mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni 'brel pa med pa na sgra'i shes pas dngos po 'thob par mi 'gyur ba kho na'o //
translated: Otherwise, if there were no relation, the awareness of the word would not obtain an entity.

original: gal te sgra ni byas pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba'i sgra'i shes pa yang dngos po ji lta ba las skyes pa'i phyir mngon sum bzhin du mi 'khrul par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te sgra ni byas pa'i phyir mi rtag pa'o zhes bya ba'i sgra'i shes pa yang dngos po ji lta ba las skyes pa'i phyir mngon sum bzhin du mi 'khrul par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that because the cognition of sound, ‚ÄúSound is impermanent because it is produced,‚Äù arises from a thing as it is, it is nonerroneous like direct perception,

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig dngos po las skyes pa de ni mi 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig dngos po las skyes pa de ni mi 'khrul pa ste /
translated: then the syllogism is: Whatever arises from a thing is nonerroneous,

original: dper na mngon sum lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na mngon sum lta bu'o //
translated: like direct perception.üîΩThe cognition of sound arises from a thing.

original: sgra'i shes pa dngos po 'thob pa yang dngos po las skye bas zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no snyam du sems te /
analyzed: sgra'i shes pa dngos po 'thob pa yang dngos po las skye bas zhes bya ba ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pa yin no snyam du sems te /
translated: The thought is that this is the observation of a contradictory pervasion.

original: dngos po las mi skye bas 'khrul pa la khyab pa'i phyir dang / dngos po las skye ba yang de dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po las mi skye bas 'khrul pa la khyab pa'i phyir dang / dngos po las skye ba yang de dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because nonarising from a thing pervades being erroneous, and because arising from a thing is contradictory with that.

original: de ni de lta ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin te /
translated: That is not so.

original: dngos po las skye ba yin du zin kyang /
analyzed: dngos po las skye ba yin du zin kyang /
translated: Even if it did arise from a thing,

original: de mi snang bar dngos po'i ngo bo mi snang bar der lhag par zhen pa'i phyir 'khrul pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de mi snang bar dngos po'i ngo bo mi snang bar der lhag par zhen pa'i phyir 'khrul pa nyid yin no //
translated: because it is attached to that as if it were a thing, although it does not appear as a thing, it is erroneous.

original: de lta bas na dngos po las skye ba dang / 'khrul pa dag 'gal ba med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ldog pa la the tshom za ba can nyid yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po las skye ba dang / 'khrul pa dag 'gal ba med pa'i phyir gtan tshigs ldog pa la the tshom za ba can nyid yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since there is no contradiction between arising from a real thing and error, the reason is one that is doubtful regarding the counter-pervasion.

original: yang na ldog pa la the tshom za ba nyid kyis ci zhig bya /
analyzed: yang na ldog pa la the tshom za ba nyid kyis ci zhig bya /
translated: Or else, what is the point of being doubtful regarding the counter-pervasion?

original: gtan tshigs 'di ni thun mong gi ma nges pa can yin par mngon par shes so zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir 'od la nor bur 'khrul pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //üîΩnor bu'i 'od la nor bur 'khrul pa snang bas 'khrul pa'i yang phyir te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs 'di ni thun mong gi ma nges pa can yin par mngon par shes so zhes bya bar bstan pa'i phyir 'od la nor bur 'khrul pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so // nor bu'i 'od la nor bur 'khrul pa snang bas 'khrul pa'i yang phyir te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this reason is clearly one that is inconclusive because of being common to the dissimilar, he says, ‚ÄúThe error of mistaking the light of a gem for a gem,‚Äù and so on.

original: nor bu'i 'od la nor bur 'khrul pa'i nor bu'i dngos po las skyes kyang 'khrul pa snang ngo //
analyzed: nor bu'i 'od la nor bur 'khrul pa'i nor bu'i dngos po las skyes kyang 'khrul pa snang ngo //
translated: Because the error of mistaking the light of a gem for a gem appears, the error arises from the entity of the gem that is mistaken for a gem.

original: gal te 'khrul pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni smig rgyu la chur 'khrul pas dngos po 'thob par mi byed pa ltar rjes su dpag pa'i rtog pas kyang de dang 'dra'o snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te 'khrul pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni smig rgyu la chur 'khrul pas dngos po 'thob par mi byed pa ltar rjes su dpag pa'i rtog pas kyang de dang 'dra'o snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: If you think that because of delusion, etc., just as delusion about a mirage as water does not cause one to obtain a real thing, so too inference as a conception does not,

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs te /
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs te /
translated: we reply: No, because of the nature of delusion, etc.

original: ji skad bshad pa lta bur kho nas zhes bya ba ni nor @110b ba'i 'od la nor bur 'khrul par snang ba lta bu ste /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa lta bur kho nas zhes bya ba ni nor @110b ba'i 'od la nor bur 'khrul par snang ba lta bu ste /
translated: Just as, in the case of the light of a gem, there is the appearance of delusion about a gem,

original: 'di ltar nor bu'i 'od la nor bur 'khrul pa ni nor bu thob par byed pa nyid do //üîΩ'khrul pa nyid gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar nor bu'i 'od la nor bur 'khrul pa ni nor bu thob par byed pa nyid do // 'khrul pa nyid gzhung gzugs pa'i phyir /
translated: so too, in the case of the light of a gem, delusion about a gem does cause one to obtain a gem.üîΩIn order to prove just that nature of delusion, he says,

original: 'khrul pa'i mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i mtshan nyid ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The definition of delusion, etc.

original: 'di skad du gal te 'khrul pa dang thob par byed pa 'gal ba zhig tu gyur na ni de'i tshe 'khrul pa dngos po thob par byed pa ma yin pa bsgrub par bya ba la 'khrul pa med zhig na /
analyzed: 'di skad du gal te 'khrul pa dang thob par byed pa 'gal ba zhig tu gyur na ni de'i tshe 'khrul pa dngos po thob par byed pa ma yin pa bsgrub par bya ba la 'khrul pa med zhig na /
translated: If error and obtaining were mutually exclusive, then error would not be non-obtaining.

original: de ni med de 'di ltar 'khrul pa'i mtshan nyid ni ldog par snang ba yin gyi thob par mi byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni med de 'di ltar 'khrul pa'i mtshan nyid ni ldog par snang ba yin gyi thob par mi byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But that is not so, because the definition of error is the appearance of the opposite, not non-obtaining.

original: de med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni dngos po med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyis de las skye ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni dngos po med na mi 'byung ba nyid kyis de las skye ba'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBecause of the invariable concomitance of that‚Äù means that because it arises from that, it is not non-obtaining.

original: thob par byed pa nyid snang ba la ltos pa ma yin zhing dngos por gtogs pa'i snang ba la ltos pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: thob par byed pa nyid snang ba la ltos pa ma yin zhing dngos por gtogs pa'i snang ba la ltos pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Obtaining does not depend on appearance, nor does it depend on the appearance of an entity,

original: dngos po dang 'brel pa kho nas de mi snang bas kyang 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po dang 'brel pa kho nas de mi snang bas kyang 'thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is obtained even when that does not appear, just by being related to the entity.

original: de lta bas na sgra'i shes pa log par snang yang dngos po dang 'brel pa yod na de thob par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na sgra'i shes pa log par snang yang dngos po dang 'brel pa yod na de thob par byed pa yin no zhes bya ba 'di gnas pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, even though the cognition of the word appears erroneously, if it is related to the thing, it causes the attainment of that thing.

original: 'on te yang sgra'i shes pa dngos po ji lta ba bzhin kho na yin par 'dod na /
analyzed: 'on te yang sgra'i shes pa dngos po ji lta ba bzhin kho na yin par 'dod na /
translated: But if you maintain that the cognition of the word is just as the thing is,

original: de'i tshe phyi rol gyi dngos po la ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin dngos po ji lta ba bzhin sems gtad cing shes pa bskyed pa ste ;
analyzed: de'i tshe phyi rol gyi dngos po la ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin dngos po ji lta ba bzhin sems gtad cing shes pa bskyed pa ste ;
translated: then you must admit that the mind is directed to the external thing just as it is and that cognition arises just as it is.

original: sgra'i stobs kyis dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du shes ba skyes pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sgra'i stobs kyis dngos po ji lta ba bzhin du shes ba skyes pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means that by the power of the word, cognition arises just as the thing is.

original: de ltar 'jug pa khas len na ni sgra'i shes pa de'i gzung bar bya ba spyi yin par 'dod par bya dgos te /
analyzed: de ltar 'jug pa khas len na ni sgra'i shes pa de'i gzung bar bya ba spyi yin par 'dod par bya dgos te /
translated: If you accept such engagement, then you must admit that the universal is the object of the cognition of the word,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni sgras mi brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni sgras mi brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the word does not express the particular.

original: gzung bar bya ba'i spyi de don byed par mi rung ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul gyi spyi de la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzung bar bya ba'i spyi de don byed par mi rung ba'i phyir rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa'i yul gyi spyi de la 'jug par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Because that universal which is the object of apprehension is not suitable to perform a function, it does not engage the universal which is the object of the conceptual consciousness.

original: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba'i ni spyi las gzhan pa sgras ma brjod pa gsal ba la yang 'jug na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan la yang zhes bya ba'i ni spyi las gzhan pa sgras ma brjod pa gsal ba la yang 'jug na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it engages the individual which is not expressed by the word, other than the universal, there is an absurd consequence.

original: ba lang gi sgras rta la yang 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ba lang gi sgras rta la yang 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: The word cow would engage a horse.

original: gal te ba lang nyid kyi spyi dang rta'i gsal bar ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir de ltar mi 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te ba lang nyid kyi spyi dang rta'i gsal bar ni 'brel pa med pa'i phyir de ltar mi 'gyur ro zhe na ma yin te /
translated: If you say that is not so because the universal cowness is not related to the individual horse, that is not so.

original: 'brel pa yod du zin kyang sgras ma brjod pa la 'jug par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'brel pa yod du zin kyang sgras ma brjod pa la 'jug par mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if there were a relation, it is not suitable for it to engage what is not expressed by the word.

original: de lta ma yin na 'khar ba chod cig ces smras na /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na 'khar ba chod cig ces smras na /
translated: If that were not so, when one says bring the stick,

original: 'khar ba thogs pa la yang 'jug par 'gyur ro //üîΩ'khar ba dang 'khar ba thogs @111a * //
analyzed: 'khar ba thogs pa la yang 'jug par 'gyur ro // 'khar ba dang 'khar ba thogs @111a * //
translated: it would engage one who holds a stick.

original: pa dag 'brel pa nges pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: pa dag 'brel pa nges pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that it is not definite that a stick and one who holds a stick are related, that is not so.

original: rigs dang de dang ldan pa dag la yang mtshungs so zhes de ni gong nyid du bshad zin to //
analyzed: rigs dang de dang ldan pa dag la yang mtshungs so zhes de ni gong nyid du bshad zin to //
translated: This has already been explained above.

original: 'on te rigs 'ba' zhig sgras brjod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te rigs 'ba' zhig sgras brjod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not the case that the word expresses only the universal;

original: 'on kyang de dang ldan pa yang yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dang ldan pa yang yin no zhe na /
translated: rather, it also expresses that which possesses it.

original: de'i tshe de dang ldan pa 'dzin par khas len na ni spyi don med pa la sogs par bshad zin te gsal ba rnams kho na la dngos su sgra sbyor 'dod cing /
analyzed: de'i tshe de dang ldan pa 'dzin par khas len na ni spyi don med pa la sogs par bshad zin te gsal ba rnams kho na la dngos su sgra sbyor 'dod cing /
translated: In that case, if you accept that that which possesses it is apprehended, then the pointlessness of the universal and so on has already been explained.

original: spyis ci zhig bya zhes spyi don med par bshad do //
analyzed: spyis ci zhig bya zhes spyi don med par bshad do //
translated: The word directly expresses only the individual, and what is the use of the universal?

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni mtha' yas pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa yongs su bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni mtha' yas pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa yongs su bsdu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúand so on‚Äù includes the faults of being infinite and so on.

original: sgras ni rigs kho na brjod na /
analyzed: sgras ni rigs kho na brjod na /
translated: If the word expresses only the universal,

original: rigs de ni gsal ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs de ni gsal ba dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: then that universal is connected to the individual.

original: yan gar du gzung ba mi nus pas de'i phyir gsal ba'i ngo bo gcig tu gyur pa 'dzin to snyam na /
analyzed: yan gar du gzung ba mi nus pas de'i phyir gsal ba'i ngo bo gcig tu gyur pa 'dzin to snyam na /
translated: Since it cannot be apprehended separately, you may think that it apprehends the single nature of the individual.

original: de kho na'i dogs pa bsu bar gal te rigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de kho na'i dogs pa bsu bar gal te rigs zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To anticipate the objection, he says ‚ÄúIf it is argued that it is a valid cognition, etc.‚Äù

original: 'dres par snang ba zhes bya ba rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag 'dres pa snang ba'i blos don bya ba byed pa gsal ba la 'jug par byed do zhen /
analyzed: 'dres par snang ba zhes bya ba rang dang spyi'i mtshan nyid dag 'dres pa snang ba'i blos don bya ba byed pa gsal ba la 'jug par byed do zhen /
translated: If it is argued that the mind that perceives the appearance of a mixture of universals and particulars engages in the function of an object,

original: de'i tshe rigs kyang ma yin la de dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe rigs kyang ma yin la de dang ldan pa yang ma yin te /
translated: then it is not a valid cognition and it does not possess a valid cognition.

original: rang gi ngo bor gzung ba zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung ngo //üîΩci'i phyir zhe na spyi'am /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bor gzung ba zhes bya ba khong nas dbyung ngo // ci'i phyir zhe na spyi'am /
translated: This is because it is said to apprehend its own nature.

original: de dang ldan pa gcig gi yang rang gi ngo bor gnas pa ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de 'dres par snang ba 'khrul pa'i blos ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang ldan pa gcig gi yang rang gi ngo bor gnas pa ma 'dres pa'i ngo bo gang yin pa de 'dres par snang ba 'khrul pa'i blos ma bzung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is that? Because the nature of a universal or of something that possesses it that exists as its own nature, which is not a mixed nature, is not apprehended by a mistaken mind that perceives a mixture.

original: de bas na 'khrul pa'i blo 'jug par khas blangs pa'i phyir gzhan gyi smra ba kho na la ste /
analyzed: de bas na 'khrul pa'i blo 'jug par khas blangs pa'i phyir gzhan gyi smra ba kho na la ste /
translated: Therefore, because it is accepted that a mistaken mind engages, only the assertions of others,

original: gzhan sel bar smra ba'i lta ba kho na la brten par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan sel bar smra ba'i lta ba kho na la brten par 'gyur ro //
translated: only the view of the proponents of the exclusion of other, will be relied upon.

original: gzhan gyi de lta na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi de lta na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúIn that case, etc.‚Äù

original: rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni gsal ba du ma dang ldan pa'i spyi'o //
analyzed: rjes su 'gro ba zhes bya ba ni gsal ba du ma dang ldan pa'i spyi'o //
translated: ‚ÄúPervasion‚Äù is the generality that is related to many instances.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas nyes pa med de zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas nyes pa med de zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The proponent of the thesis says, ‚ÄúThere is no error, etc.‚Äù

original: tha dad kyang zhes bya ba ni phan tshun log pa nyid yin yang ngo //
analyzed: tha dad kyang zhes bya ba ni phan tshun log pa nyid yin yang ngo //
translated: ‚ÄúAlthough different‚Äù means although mutually contradictory.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni chu bcu ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni chu bcu ba la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the act of pouring water, etc.

original: dngos po'i chos nyid kyis shes pa la sogs pa don bya ba 'dra ba de dang de byed pa ni /
analyzed: dngos po'i chos nyid kyis shes pa la sogs pa don bya ba 'dra ba de dang de byed pa ni /
translated: The performance of that and that action, such as the cognition of objects, etc., is similar by the reality of things.

original: don rnams mthong nas gzhan mthong ba yang ste /
analyzed: don rnams mthong nas gzhan mthong ba yang ste /
translated: ‚ÄúHaving seen objects, etc.‚Äù means that although one sees other objects,

original: sngar mthong ba las gzhan pa mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba mthong yang ngo //
analyzed: sngar mthong ba las gzhan pa mtshan nyid mi 'dra ba mthong yang ngo //
translated: that is, although one sees objects that are different from those previously seen and have different characteristics,

original: sgra gang dag la yul de las gzhan dang zhes bya ba de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dag dang bral zhing rnam par gcod pa yod pa'i @111b sgra nang gi brjod pa'i ngo bo rnams kyis de nyid 'di yin no zhes don rnams lhan cig sbyar te
analyzed: sgra gang dag la yul de las gzhan dang zhes bya ba de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dag dang bral zhing rnam par gcod pa yod pa'i @111b sgra nang gi brjod pa'i ngo bo rnams kyis de nyid 'di yin no zhes don rnams lhan cig sbyar te
translated: The meaning of the summary is as follows: Those sounds that are not the effects of something other than that object, and that are not devoid of the exclusion of that object, the internal sounds that have the nature of expressions, connect those objects together, saying ‚Äúthis is that.‚Äù

original: / skyes bu dan bya ba 'dra bar byed pa nyid kyis bslus pas gcig pa nyid du sgro btags nas ngo shes par byed do zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: / skyes bu dan bya ba 'dra bar byed pa nyid kyis bslus pas gcig pa nyid du sgro btags nas ngo shes par byed do zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: Because they are deceived by the similarity of the activity of the person, they superimpose sameness and make recognition.

original: yang ji ltar tha dad pa rnams don bya ba tha mi dad pa dag byed ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ltar tha dad pa rnams don bya ba tha mi dad pa dag byed ce na /
translated: Again, how do different things perform a different action?

original: de'i phyir 'di ni bshad zin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni bshad zin te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúThis has already been explained,‚Äù and so on.üîΩAbove it was explained with statements such as:

original: gong du / gcig rtogs don shes la sogs pa //
analyzed: gong du / gcig rtogs don shes la sogs pa //
translated: The cognition of one thing, the cognition of an object, and so on,

original: don gcig bsgrub la kha cig ni //
analyzed: don gcig bsgrub la kha cig ni //
translated: Some accomplish a single purpose,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad zin to //
translated: and so on.

original: de dag la zhes bya ba ni don tha dad pa rnams la ste /
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba ni don tha dad pa rnams la ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to different objects.

original: gcig ces bya ba 'dra ba de mthong ba'i skyes bu la gzhan dag las zhes bya ba de byed pa ma yin pa ldog pa'i dngos po rnams kyi chos nyid kho nas dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo kho nas de nyid 'di yin no snyam pa de lta
analyzed: gcig ces bya ba 'dra ba de mthong ba'i skyes bu la gzhan dag las zhes bya ba de byed pa ma yin pa ldog pa'i dngos po rnams kyi chos nyid kho nas dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo kho nas de nyid 'di yin no snyam pa de lta
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù in the verse means that the cognition of the gem is produced by the nature of the thing itself, that is, by the thing itself, which is the opposite of what is not a producer.

original: bu'i rnam pa can nor bu'i shes pa skyed par byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bu'i rnam pa can nor bu'i shes pa skyed par byed do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù is to be supplied in the phrase ‚Äúproduces the cognition of the gem.‚Äù

original: khyad par ji lta bu can zhig ce na /üîΩde las ldog pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩsgra gang la yul don gcig bya ba byed pa'i don rnams de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dag las ldog pa gang yin pa de yod pa'i sgra de dang 'brel cing 'dres pa ste /

translated: What is the nature of the distinction?üîΩThe phrase ‚Äúthe word that has the opposite‚Äù and so on.

original: khyad par bsres pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi snga phyir mthong ba'i gsal ba dag gis khyad par bsres shing gcig tu byas pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: khyad par bsres pa zhes bya ba ni rang gi snga phyir mthong ba'i gsal ba dag gis khyad par bsres shing gcig tu byas pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: In particular, that which is called ‚Äúmixed‚Äù is so called because it is mixed and made one with the earlier and later things that are seen.

original: gal te dngos po'i chos nyid kyis skyed par byed na ji ste rtag tu mi skyed ce na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po'i chos nyid kyis skyed par byed na ji ste rtag tu mi skyed ce na /
translated: If it is the intrinsic reality of things that produces, then why does it not always produce?

original: rang nyams su myong ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rang nyams su myong ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThe prior experience of those things . . . ‚Äù

original: dngos po de dag gi rang nyams su myong ba sngar skyes pa des ngo shes pa skye bar byed pa'i bag chags nus pa'i mtshan nyid gzhag pa gang yin pa de sad pa ni 'bras bu bskyed pa la mngon sum du phyogs pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po de dag gi rang nyams su myong ba sngar skyes pa des ngo shes pa skye bar byed pa'i bag chags nus pa'i mtshan nyid gzhag pa gang yin pa de sad pa ni 'bras bu bskyed pa la mngon sum du phyogs pa ste /
translated: The prior experience of those things deposits the latent potentialities that are the characteristics of the capacity of the arising of recognition. The awakening of those latent potentialities is the direct cause of the production of the effect.

original: de sad pa yang de dang 'dra ba'i dngos po nyams su myong ba las 'gyur la /
analyzed: de sad pa yang de dang 'dra ba'i dngos po nyams su myong ba las 'gyur la /
translated: The awakening of those latent potentialities comes from the experience of things that are similar to those things.

original: de lta bu'i mtshan nyid kyi sad pa yang dus thams cad du ma yin pas de'i phyir rtag tu ngo shes 'byung ba yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu'i mtshan nyid kyi sad pa yang dus thams cad du ma yin pas de'i phyir rtag tu ngo shes 'byung ba yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Since such a memory does not occur at all times, it is not always the case that recognition occurs.

original: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te 'bras bu gcig byed pa nyid du 'dra bas tha dad pa dag la yang gcig pa nyid du sgro btags nas ngo shes pa'i 'khrul par mi 'dod kyi /
analyzed: de lta ma yin na zhes bya ba ni gal te 'bras bu gcig byed pa nyid du 'dra bas tha dad pa dag la yang gcig pa nyid du sgro btags nas ngo shes pa'i 'khrul par mi 'dod kyi /
translated: If that were not so, if you did not assert that the error of recognition occurs through superimposing sameness on different things that are similar in performing a single function,

original: 'on kyang spyi gcig dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhe na /üîΩde'i @112a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang spyi gcig dang ldan pa'i phyir ro zhe na / de'i @112a * //
translated: but rather that it occurs because they possess a single universal,üîΩthen

original: tshe blo khyad par bsre ba can du mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: tshe blo khyad par bsre ba can du mi 'gyur te /
translated: at that time, the mind would not be mixed with distinctions.

original: khyad par rnams bsre ba ni ngo bo gcig tu byed pa'o //
analyzed: khyad par rnams bsre ba ni ngo bo gcig tu byed pa'o //
translated: Mixing distinctions is making them into a single entity.

original: blo de dang ldan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: blo de dang ldan par 'gyur te /
translated: The mind would possess that,

original: mang po dag la ngo bo gcig pa'i blor mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: mang po dag la ngo bo gcig pa'i blor mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: but it would not be the mind that has a single entity with regard to many things.

original: ltung gcig dang ldan pa'i ltung la brgyus pa rnams kyang gcig nyid du 'dzin pa ni med do //
analyzed: ltung gcig dang ldan pa'i ltung la brgyus pa rnams kyang gcig nyid du 'dzin pa ni med do //
translated: Also, those who have one downfall do not apprehend many downfalls as being a single downfall.

original: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir dper na ltung ba la brgyus pa dag lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de nyid bstan pa'i phyir dper na ltung ba la brgyus pa dag lta bu'o zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate just this, he says, for example, like those who are bound by a downfall.

original: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de nyid gsal bar byed de /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni de nyid gsal bar byed de /
translated: In this regard, etc.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni ltung la brgyus pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni ltung la brgyus pa rnams la'o //
translated: In this regard refers to those who are bound by a downfall.

original: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni ltung la brgyus pa gcig las gzhan pa'i ltung la brgyus pa la'o //
analyzed: gzhan la zhes bya ba ni ltung la brgyus pa gcig las gzhan pa'i ltung la brgyus pa la'o //
translated: Another refers to another downfall of those who are bound by a downfall.

original: de 'di la yong do snyam mo zhes bya ba ni ltung la brgyus pa gcig la mthong ba'i ltung gi rdzas gang yin pa de cig shos 'di la yang yod do snyam pa de lta bur sems par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de 'di la yong do snyam mo zhes bya ba ni ltung la brgyus pa gcig la mthong ba'i ltung gi rdzas gang yin pa de cig shos 'di la yang yod do snyam pa de lta bur sems par 'gyur ro //
translated: He thinks that it is like this refers to the fact that he thinks that the substance of the downfall that is seen in one who is bound by a downfall also exists in the other.

original: de bzhin du gsal ba gcig la mthong ba'i spyi gang yin pa de gsal ba gzhan 'di la yang yod do snyam pa de lta bur sems par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de bzhin du gsal ba gcig la mthong ba'i spyi gang yin pa de gsal ba gzhan 'di la yang yod do snyam pa de lta bur sems par 'gyur gyi /
translated: In the same way, he thinks that the universal that is seen in one particular also exists in another particular.

original: gsal ba rnams ngo bo nyid gcig go snyam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba rnams ngo bo nyid gcig go snyam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But he does not think that the particulars are of one nature.

original: gal te de lta yin du zin mod ce na /
analyzed: gal te de lta yin du zin mod ce na /
translated: If this is so, then what?

original: ngo shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: ngo shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The line recognition, etc. is stated.

original: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug sdud de /
analyzed: de bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni mjug sdud de /
translated: The line therefore, etc. is the conclusion.

original: gcig cig zhes bya ba ni spyi'o //üîΩgsal ba du ma la mthong ba skyes bu la yang khyad par bsre ba dang ldan par te /
analyzed: gcig cig zhes bya ba ni spyi'o // gsal ba du ma la mthong ba skyes bu la yang khyad par bsre ba dang ldan par te /
translated: The line one, etc. is the general statement.

original: khyad par rnams bsre ba ni rnam pa gcig pa nyid de /
analyzed: khyad par rnams bsre ba ni rnam pa gcig pa nyid de /
translated: The line many, etc. is the particular statement.

original: shes pa de dang ldan par rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: shes pa de dang ldan par rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: The line the arising of the cognition, etc. is the application of the example to the present case.

original: gzhan sel bar smra ba la ni nyes pa med pas /üîΩ'khrul pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
analyzed: gzhan sel bar smra ba la ni nyes pa med pas / 'khrul pa'i dbang gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te ;
translated: The line the cognition, etc. is the refutation of the opponent's position.üîΩThe line the cognition, etc. is the refutation of the rebuttal.üîΩThe line the cognition, etc. is the refutation of the rejoinder.üîΩThe line the cognition, etc. is the refutation of the counter-rejoinder.üîΩThe line the cognition, etc. is the refutation of the reply.

original: 'khrul pa'i mthus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩde ltar zhes bya ba ni ngo bo gcig pa nyid du'o //
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i mthus zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // de ltar zhes bya ba ni ngo bo gcig pa nyid du'o //
translated: The line the cognition, etc. is the refutation of the counter-reply.üîΩThe line the cognition, etc. is the refutation of the final reply.üîΩThe line the cognition, etc. is the refutation of the final counter-reply.

original: gal te ngo shes pa'i rgyu mtshan ni spyi dngos por gyur pa yin na /üîΩde med pa'i phyir 'khrul par mi rigs so zhe na /
analyzed: gal te ngo shes pa'i rgyu mtshan ni spyi dngos por gyur pa yin na / de med pa'i phyir 'khrul par mi rigs so zhe na /
translated: The line the cognition, etc. is the refutation of the final rejoinder.üîΩThe line the cognition, etc. is the refutation of the final counter-rejoinder.

original: dngos po don med de gcig byed par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: dngos po don med de gcig byed par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The line the cognition, etc. is the refutation of the final reply.üîΩThe line the cognition, etc. is the refutation of the final counter-reply.üîΩThe line the cognition, etc. is the refutation of the final rejoinder.üîΩThe line the cognition, etc. is the refutation of the final counter-rejoinder.

original: shes pa la sogs pa don de gcig byed pa ni byed pa'i ngang tshul can no //
analyzed: shes pa la sogs pa don de gcig byed pa ni byed pa'i ngang tshul can no //
translated: The cognition, etc., that have that one thing as their object are the state of being the cause.

original: de dag nyid ces bya ba ni log pa'i dngos po rnams so //
analyzed: de dag nyid ces bya ba ni log pa'i dngos po rnams so //
translated: Those very things that are the cause of the error are the basis of the error.

original: nyams su myong ba nyid sgo ste rgyu yin no //
analyzed: nyams su myong ba nyid sgo ste rgyu yin no //
translated: The experience itself is the door, the cause.

original: des na rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis 'khrul pa'i 'bras bu can gyis rnam par 'khrul pa'i 'bras bu can gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'khrul @112b pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: des na rang bzhin gyi ngo bo nyid kyis 'khrul pa'i 'bras bu can gyis rnam par 'khrul pa'i 'bras bu can gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir 'khrul @112b pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
