translated: Therefore, the cause of error is the cause of the effect of error, which has the nature of being essentially erroneous.

original: de lta bas na 'dis ni ngo shes par 'khrul pa'i rgyu ni brgyud pa'i sgo nas khyad par de dag kho na yin gyi spyi ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na 'dis ni ngo shes par 'khrul pa'i rgyu ni brgyud pa'i sgo nas khyad par de dag kho na yin gyi spyi ni ma yin no zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, this shows that the cause of the error of recognition is only those specific things, not the universal, indirectly.

original: 'o na ni smig rgyu la sogs pa la chur 'khrul pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'o na ni smig rgyu la sogs pa la chur 'khrul pa 'byung bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: But then the occurrence of the error of water, etc., in relation to a mirage, etc., would not be possible,

original: rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there would be no basis for the error.

original: re zhig chu'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: re zhig chu'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the intrinsic identity of water,

original: de ni med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that does not exist.

original: chu'i ngo bo ma yin pa rlangs pa la sogs pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: chu'i ngo bo ma yin pa rlangs pa la sogs pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not water, nor is it steam, etc.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because that would lead to absurdity.

original: smig rgyu la sogs pa chur 'khrul pa ni mthong ste /üîΩde lta bas na smig rgyu la sogs pa chu'i ngo bo ma yin pa dag las yang gang zhig mthong ba'i sgo nas chur 'khrul par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: smig rgyu la sogs pa chur 'khrul pa ni mthong ste / de lta bas na smig rgyu la sogs pa chu'i ngo bo ma yin pa dag las yang gang zhig mthong ba'i sgo nas chur 'khrul par 'gyur gyi /
translated: But one does see a mirage, etc. as water.üîΩTherefore, from what is not the nature of water, such as a mirage, etc. ,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas ma yin pa /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi sgo nas ma yin pa /
translated: how could there be a delusion of water through seeing, and not through its own nature?

original: chu dang ngo bo mtshungs pa cung zad cig ni yod do zhe na /
analyzed: chu dang ngo bo mtshungs pa cung zad cig ni yod do zhe na /
translated: There is something that is similar to the nature of water.

original: de'i phyir smig rgyu la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir smig rgyu la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, a mirage, etc.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra dang pos ni thag pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgra dang pos ni thag pa la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The first term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes a rope, etc.

original: gnyis pas ni sbrul la sogs par 'khrul pa bsdu ste /
analyzed: gnyis pas ni sbrul la sogs par 'khrul pa bsdu ste /
translated: The second includes the delusion of a snake, etc.

original: 'khrul pa'i rgyu yang tha dad kyang rnam pa tha mi dad par 'di ni chu yin no zhes de ltar bsnyems pa'i shes pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo de dag nyid ces bya ba chu
analyzed: 'khrul pa'i rgyu yang tha dad kyang rnam pa tha mi dad par 'di ni chu yin no zhes de ltar bsnyems pa'i shes pa'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa nyams su myong ba gang yin pa de skyed par byed pa'i ngo bo de dag nyid ces bya ba chu
translated: The cause of delusion is also different, but the aspect is not different. The cause of the consciousness that conceives ‚ÄúThis is water‚Äù is the experience that serves as the reason for that. The nature that produces those, which are called ‚Äúwater,‚ÄùüîΩ

original: dang smig rgyu'i dngos po'i ngo bo dag yin no //
analyzed: dang smig rgyu'i dngos po'i ngo bo dag yin no //
translated: The cause of error is different, but the aspect is not different. The cause of the cognition that conceives of it as water is the experience that generates the nature of those things called ‚Äúwater‚Äù and ‚Äúa mirage.‚Äù

original: 'di skad du bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bshad pa yin te /
translated: The meaning of this is as follows:

original: nyams su myong ba'i shes pas ni re zhig chu'i rnam par bsnyems pa'i bag chags 'jog par byed pa la /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i shes pas ni re zhig chu'i rnam par bsnyems pa'i bag chags 'jog par byed pa la /
translated: The cognition of experience first deposits the latent karmic tendency of the conception of water.

original: bag chags de ni yang chu yi rang gi mtshan nyid ji ltar nyams su myong bas kyang sad par byed la /
analyzed: bag chags de ni yang chu yi rang gi mtshan nyid ji ltar nyams su myong bas kyang sad par byed la /
translated: That latent tendency is activated by the experience of the intrinsic identity of water.

original: de bzhin du smig rgyu zhes bya ba'i dngos po nyams su myong bas kyang sad par byed de /
analyzed: de bzhin du smig rgyu zhes bya ba'i dngos po nyams su myong bas kyang sad par byed de /
translated: In the same way, the experience of the thing called ‚Äúa mirage‚Äù activates it.

original: de ni rang bzhin gyis de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin gyis de lta bu'i ngo bo nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is because its intrinsic identity is like that.

original: de lta bas na ji ltar chu nyams su myong ba las chu'i rnam par bsnyems pa 'byung ba ltar /
analyzed: de lta bas na ji ltar chu nyams su myong ba las chu'i rnam par bsnyems pa 'byung ba ltar /
translated: Therefore, just as the appearance of water arises from the experience of water,

original: smig rgyu zhes bya ba'i dngos po nyams su myong ba las kyang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: smig rgyu zhes bya ba'i dngos po nyams su myong ba las kyang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: in the same way, the appearance of water arises from the experience of a mirage.

original: de'i phyir chu dang smig rgyu zhes bya ba de dag ni dngos po nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas chur 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir chu dang smig rgyu zhes bya ba de dag ni dngos po nyams su myong ba'i sgo nas chur 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan yin no //
translated: Therefore, water and a mirage are the reasons for the error of water through the experience of a thing.

original: ha cang thal bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: ha cang thal bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Nor does the absurd consequence follow that everything is a cause of everything.

original: chu'i ngo bo ma yin par mtshungs pa las dngos po'i mthus smig rgyu dag kho na chur bsnyems pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu'i ngo bo ma yin par mtshungs pa las dngos po'i mthus smig rgyu dag kho na chur bsnyems pa'i rgyur gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, although they are similar in not being the essence of water, by the power of the thing, only mirages become the cause of the appearance of water.

original: de lta bas na thams cad du chu la sogs par bsnyems @113a * //
analyzed: de lta bas na thams cad du chu la sogs par bsnyems @113a * //
translated: Therefore, in every case, the reason for the appearance of water, etc.

original: pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid brgyud pas rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yin gyi spyi dngos por gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: pa'i rgyu mtshan nyid brgyud pas rang gi mtshan nyid kho na yin gyi spyi dngos por gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: is only the intrinsic identity, not a real universal.

original: de nyid de la gang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: de nyid de la gang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: He demonstrates just this in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúThat itself is this‚Äù .

original: de la zhes bya ba ni smig rgyu dag la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni smig rgyu dag la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to mirages.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni chu'i ngo bor ro //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni chu'i ngo bor ro //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that way‚Äù refers to the nature of water.

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni chu dang smig rgyu dag gi mtshungs pa rang gi mtshan nyid las tha dad pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni chu dang smig rgyu dag gi mtshungs pa rang gi mtshan nyid las tha dad pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúOther‚Äù refers to the difference from the individual characteristics of water and mirages.

original: 'on te spyi yod khas len na ni spyi dngos por gyur pa 'dzin pa nyid kyis don yod pa'i 'dzin pa'i blos 'khrul par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te spyi yod khas len na ni spyi dngos por gyur pa 'dzin pa nyid kyis don yod pa'i 'dzin pa'i blos 'khrul par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But if you accept that universals exist, then the mind that apprehends a real object would not be mistaken because it apprehends a real universal.üîΩIf you say that the mind is mistaken because it apprehends a universal that does not exist, then you should not say that the mind is mistaken because it apprehends a universal.

original: gal te yang dag pa ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di skad du smig rgyu dag la spyi 'dzin pa'i phyir blo 'khrul par brjod pa ni ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te yang dag pa ma yin pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni 'di skad du smig rgyu dag la spyi 'dzin pa'i phyir blo 'khrul par brjod pa ni ma yin gyi /
translated: The Proponents of the Doctrines of the Enumerators say, ‚ÄúWe do not say that the mind is mistaken because it apprehends a universal in mirages.

original: 'on kyang chu'i rnam par sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir yin no zhes smras pa yin no //üîΩgrub pa'i mtha' smra bas 'o na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'on kyang chu'i rnam par sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir yin no zhes smras pa yin no // grub pa'i mtha' smra bas 'o na ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: We say that it is mistaken because it superimposes the aspect of water.‚Äù

original: des zhes bya ba ni smig rgyu la chu'i blo byung bas te /
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni smig rgyu la chu'i blo byung bas te /
translated: The Proponents of the Doctrines of the Enumerators say, ‚ÄúWell then, the mind that arises in dependence on a mirage and apprehends water is not mistaken because it does not superimpose the aspect of water.‚ÄùüîΩThe Proponents of the Doctrines of the Enumerators say, ‚ÄúThe mind that arises in dependence on a mirage and apprehends water is not mistaken because it does not superimpose the aspect of water.‚Äù

original: chu dang smig rgyu de dag gi spyi gang yin pa de 'dzin pa ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: chu dang smig rgyu de dag gi spyi gang yin pa de 'dzin pa ma yin zhes bya bar sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The general characteristic of water and a mirage is not apprehended.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: des rnam pa kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: des rnam pa kho na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause of the form alone,‚Äù etc.

original: chu'i rnam pa gang kho na zhes bya bar bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: chu'i rnam pa gang kho na zhes bya bar bsams pa yin no //
translated: The form alone of water is what is meant.

original: blo 'dis yul ni de kho na yin gyi spyi dngos por gyur pa ma yin te /
analyzed: blo 'dis yul ni de kho na yin gyi spyi dngos por gyur pa ma yin te /
translated: This cognition has that alone as its object, not a generally characterized, real entity,

original: sgro gdags par bya ba la ma gtogs pa de mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa dag gcig tu 'dzin pa 'gal ba'i yang spangs phyir ro //
analyzed: sgro gdags par bya ba la ma gtogs pa de mi 'dzin pa'i phyir dang / yang dag pa dang yang dag pa ma yin pa dag gcig tu 'dzin pa 'gal ba'i yang spangs phyir ro //
translated: because it does not apprehend that apart from the object of imputation, and because it is contradictory to apprehend the real and the unreal as one.

original: sgro gdags par bya ba yang ci'i phyir yul nyid yin zhe na /
analyzed: sgro gdags par bya ba yang ci'i phyir yul nyid yin zhe na /
translated: Why is the object of imputation an object?

original: yul nyid du ma byas pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yul nyid du ma byas pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚Äúbecause it is not made into an object,‚Äù etc.

original: rnam pa gzhan bzhin pa ni rnam pa gzhan me la sogs pa ni de la sgro 'dogs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rnam pa gzhan bzhin pa ni rnam pa gzhan me la sogs pa ni de la sgro 'dogs pa ma yin te /
translated: The form of another, such as fire, is not imputed to it,

original: de ni de'i tshe yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni de'i tshe yul ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because at that time it is not the object.

original: de yang zhes bya ba ni chu'i rnam pa sgro gdags par bya ba de yang smig rgyu de la med pas spyi ma yin no //
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba ni chu'i rnam pa sgro gdags par bya ba de yang smig rgyu de la med pas spyi ma yin no //
translated: Moreover, since the aspect of water that is to be superimposed does not exist in a mirage, it is not a universal.

original: gal te ji ltar chu la chu'i ngo bo yod pa de bzhin du smig rgyu dag la yang yong na ni de'i tshe spyi yin par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar chu la chu'i ngo bo yod pa de bzhin du smig rgyu dag la yang yong na ni de'i tshe spyi yin par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If the aspect of water existed in a mirage just as it exists in water, then at that time it would be a universal.

original: rta'i gsal ba dag la med pa'i ba lang nyid ni de dag gi spyi ma yin no //
analyzed: rta'i gsal ba dag la med pa'i ba lang nyid ni de dag gi spyi ma yin no //
translated: But the universal of cow does not exist in the individual horses.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chu dang smig rgyu dag gi spyi ni chu'i rnam pa sgro gdags par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni chu dang smig rgyu dag gi spyi ni chu'i rnam pa sgro gdags par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúif the aspect of water‚Äù and so on indicates that the universal of water and a mirage is not the aspect of water that is to be superimposed.

original: 'on kyang de las gzhan pa chu dang smig rgyu dag gi 'dra ba'i mtshan nyi kho na spyi yin la /
analyzed: 'on kyang de las gzhan pa chu dang smig rgyu dag gi 'dra ba'i mtshan nyi kho na spyi yin la /
translated: However, the mere characteristic of similarity to water and a mirage that is different from them is a universal.

original: spyi de 'dzin pa @113b yod na der zhes bya ba chur sgro 'dogs kyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi de 'dzin pa @113b yod na der zhes bya ba chur sgro 'dogs kyi gzhan du ni ma yin te /
translated: If there is the apprehension of that universal, then the superimposition of water occurs in relation to that, but not in relation to anything else.

original: gal te smig rgyu la chu dang 'dra ba dngos por gyur pa zhig 'dzin par mi 'gyur na /
analyzed: gal te smig rgyu la chu dang 'dra ba dngos por gyur pa zhig 'dzin par mi 'gyur na /
translated: If the aspect of water that is a real entity did not exist in a mirage, then the superimposition of water would not occur in relation to a mirage.

original: de la chur sgro 'dogs pa lta ga la yod /
analyzed: de la chur sgro 'dogs pa lta ga la yod /
translated: How could there be the superimposition of water on that?

original: de 'dzin pa med par chur sgro 'dogs par khas len na ni /
analyzed: de 'dzin pa med par chur sgro 'dogs par khas len na ni /
translated: If you accept that the superimposition of water occurs without apprehending it,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur te me la sogs pa'i ngo bo 'dzin pa la yang chur sgro 'dogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur te me la sogs pa'i ngo bo 'dzin pa la yang chur sgro 'dogs par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: then it follows that there would be the superimposition of water even in the apprehension of the entity of fire and so on.

original: chu dang smig rgyu zhes brjod pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid gang dag la 'bras bu chur bsnyems pa de dag gcig byed pa'i ngang tshul yod pa de dag 'dzin pa yod na ci ste chur sgro gdags par mi 'dod /
analyzed: chu dang smig rgyu zhes brjod pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid gang dag la 'bras bu chur bsnyems pa de dag gcig byed pa'i ngang tshul yod pa de dag 'dzin pa yod na ci ste chur sgro gdags par mi 'dod /
translated: If there is the apprehension of those that have the nature of being the cause of the effect, the superimposition of water, which is expressed as ‚Äúwater‚Äù and ‚Äúa mirage,‚Äù why would you not assert that there is the superimposition of water?

original: ji skad du chu'i spyi dang bral bar 'dra ba las smig rgyu dag kho na la chur sgro 'dogs kyi /
analyzed: ji skad du chu'i spyi dang bral bar 'dra ba las smig rgyu dag kho na la chur sgro 'dogs kyi /
translated: As it was explained, ‚ÄúThe superimposition of water occurs only in relation to mirages, which are similar to water in being devoid of the universal of water.

original: gzhan la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan la ni ma yin te /
translated: It does not occur in relation to anything else.

original: rang bzhin gyis de dag kho na de bskyed pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis de dag kho na de bskyed pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is because those are the nature that generates that by their very nature.‚Äù

original: gal te spyi med na tha dad pa rnams kyi 'bras bu gcig byed pa'i nus pa nyid kyang med do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te spyi med na tha dad pa rnams kyi 'bras bu gcig byed pa'i nus pa nyid kyang med do zhe na /
translated: If universals do not exist, then there would also be no capacity for the performance of a single effect by different things.

original: spyi 'dod pas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩ'di ni ; gcig rtogs don shes la sogs pa //üîΩdon gcig bsgrub la kha cig ni //
analyzed: spyi 'dod pas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / 'di ni ; gcig rtogs don shes la sogs pa // don gcig bsgrub la kha cig ni //
translated: ‚ÄúEven though the universal is accepted by all‚Äù and so on.

original: zhes bya ba'i bar skabs su bstan zin to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i bar skabs su bstan zin to //
translated: This is explained in the passage:üîΩ‚ÄúOne who understands the meaning, etc.,üîΩand some who accomplish the same purpose, etc.‚Äù

original: de'i phyir ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu gcig byed par nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir ni zhes bya ba ni 'bras bu gcig byed par nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTherefore‚Äù means because they are able to produce the same effect.

original: gzhan dag la zhes bya ba de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dag las tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag la zhes bya ba de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dag las tha dad pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúFrom others‚Äù means from those that do not have that effect.

original: de dag kho nas zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i gsal ba dag kho nas yin gyi /
analyzed: de dag kho nas zhes bya ba ni ji skad bshad pa'i nus pa dang ldan pa'i gsal ba dag kho nas yin gyi /
translated: ‚ÄúOnly those‚Äù means only those entities that possess the capacity as it has been explained.

original: spyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spyis ni ma yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the universal‚Äù means not by the universal.

original: de lta bu zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gcig pa can yin no //
analyzed: de lta bu zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gcig pa can yin no //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch‚Äù means having the same aspect.

original: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni dngos po la ma 'das pa ste /
analyzed: dngos po ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni dngos po la ma 'das pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúJust as the entity is‚Äù means not deviating from the entity.

original: rnam par rtog pa can gyi shes pas rang gi mtshan nyid spyi dang bral ba ji ltar gnas pa de las mi 'da' bar ci ste mi rtogs /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa can gyi shes pas rang gi mtshan nyid spyi dang bral ba ji ltar gnas pa de las mi 'da' bar ci ste mi rtogs /
translated: Why does conceptual consciousness not conceive the particular that is free of universals just as it is, without deviating from it?

original: ci'i phyir de las spyi yang dag pa ma yin pa sgro 'dogs par byed dngos po ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyi don ni khyad par ma 'dres pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir de las spyi yang dag pa ma yin pa sgro 'dogs par byed dngos po ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyi don ni khyad par ma 'dres pa can zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: Why does it superimpose a false universal on that? The meaning of ‚Äújust as the thing is‚Äù is ‚Äúhaving a distinct particular nature,‚Äù and so on.

original: dngos po gang la khyad par phan tshun tha dad pa ma 'dres shing ngo bo gcig pa nyid du ma gyur pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: dngos po gang la khyad par phan tshun tha dad pa ma 'dres shing ngo bo gcig pa nyid du ma gyur pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has a distinct particular nature, not mixed with other things, not becoming a single nature, is said to be ‚Äújust as the thing is.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa rnams la mtshan nyid ji ltar gnas pa bzhin 'dzin pa'i nus pa 'di med do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnams la mtshan nyid ji ltar gnas pa bzhin 'dzin pa'i nus pa 'di med do //
translated: Imaginations do not have the power to apprehend characteristics just as they are.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na ma rig pa'i mthus te yang dag pa'i don 'dzin pa ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na ma rig pa'i mthus te yang dag pa'i don 'dzin pa ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: Why is that? Because of the power of ignorance. The apprehension of the real object is ignorance.

original: @114a * // rnam par rtog pa ni de dang 'gal ba'i phyir ma rig pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: @114a * // rnam par rtog pa ni de dang 'gal ba'i phyir ma rig pa kho na yin no //
translated: Imagination is just ignorance because it is contrary to that.

original: mthu zhes bya ba'i sgras ni mthu stobs kho na brjod do //
analyzed: mthu zhes bya ba'i sgras ni mthu stobs kho na brjod do //
translated: The word ‚Äúpower‚Äù just expresses power.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i mthus zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i mthus zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is ‚Äúby the power of imagination.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni dngos po ji lta ba bzhin mi 'dzin pa yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rang gi ngo bo ni dngos po ji lta ba bzhin mi 'dzin pa yin te /
translated: The nature of conceptualization is not the apprehension of things as they are,

original: de ni rang bzhin gyis 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni rang bzhin gyis 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is by nature deluded.

original: gal te phyi dngos por gyur pa med na /
analyzed: gal te phyi dngos por gyur pa med na /
translated: If external things do not exist,

original: rnam par rtog pa'i 'khrul pa de nyid rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i 'khrul pa de nyid rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: then the delusion of conceptualization is not tenable.

original: phyi rol gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúExternal things are not the cause of the delusion of conceptualization.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rang gi ngo bo kho na 'dir nang gi bslad pa yin par bshad de /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rang gi ngo bo kho na 'dir nang gi bslad pa yin par bshad de /
translated: The nature of conceptualization itself is explained here as the internal cause of delusion.

original: rnam par rtog pa kho na'i rang gi ngo bo ni gang gis na 'di phyi rol gyi chos 'dra ba la mi ltos par 'khrul par gyur pa de yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa kho na'i rang gi ngo bo ni gang gis na 'di phyi rol gyi chos 'dra ba la mi ltos par 'khrul par gyur pa de yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The nature of conceptualization itself is such that it is deluded without depending on external things that resemble it.

original: skra la sogs par 'khrul pa ni skra la sogs pa'i rnam par 'khrul pa ste /
analyzed: skra la sogs par 'khrul pa ni skra la sogs pa'i rnam par 'khrul pa ste /
translated: The delusion of hair, etc., is the delusion in the form of hair, etc.

original: don ni 'dir ji ltar de phyi rol gyi don la mi ltos par yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam pas nye bar zin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi nang gi bslad pa la brten nas 'khrul par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
analyzed: don ni 'dir ji ltar de phyi rol gyi don la mi ltos par yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam pas nye bar zin pa'i mtshan nyid kyi nang gi bslad pa la brten nas 'khrul par 'gyur ba de bzhin du /
translated: The meaning here is this: Just as error occurs in dependence on internal error, which has the characteristic of being grasped by unreal images without depending on external objects,

original: rnam par rtog pa yang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i spyi'i rnam par 'dzin pa'i phyir 'khrul par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di yin par bsams pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa yang yang dag pa ma yin pa'i spyi'i rnam par 'dzin pa'i phyir 'khrul par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di yin par bsams pa'o //
translated: so too, conceptualization is error because it apprehends the unreal in general.

original: re zhig 'dir nang gi bslad pa ni 'khrul pa'i sa bon yin la /
analyzed: re zhig 'dir nang gi bslad pa ni 'khrul pa'i sa bon yin la /
translated: Here, internal error is the seed of error.

original: de las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de lta bu'i don du bsam pa ni ma yin te 'di ni 'og nas gsal bar byed do //
analyzed: de las byung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba de lta bu'i don du bsam pa ni ma yin te 'di ni 'og nas gsal bar byed do //
translated: It is not intended that the meaning is that error arises from that, because this will be clarified later.

original: klan ka bas ni ma rig pa'i mthus zhes bya ba 'dir ma rig pa zhes bya ba'i sgras sgrib pa ma spangs pa'i rgyud la gnyis su snang ba'i sa bon yod pa kho na yin par bshad la /
analyzed: klan ka bas ni ma rig pa'i mthus zhes bya ba 'dir ma rig pa zhes bya ba'i sgras sgrib pa ma spangs pa'i rgyud la gnyis su snang ba'i sa bon yod pa kho na yin par bshad la /
translated: The opponent says, ‚ÄúThrough the power of ignorance,‚Äù and here the word ignorance explains that the seed of dualistic appearance exists only in the continuum of one who has not abandoned obscuration.

original: de'i mthus zhes bya ba ni de las skye ba'o //
analyzed: de'i mthus zhes bya ba ni de las skye ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúBy the power of that‚Äù means ‚Äúarisen from that.‚Äù

original: de bzhin du nang gi bslad pa zhes bya ba yang sa bon de kho na yin pas /üîΩma rig pa las byung ba de lta bu ni rnam par shes pa thams cad la yod do snyam du bsams nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du nang gi bslad pa zhes bya ba yang sa bon de kho na yin pas / ma rig pa las byung ba de lta bu ni rnam par shes pa thams cad la yod do snyam du bsams nas /
translated: Similarly, ‚Äúinternal corruption‚Äù also refers to just that seed.

original: mig la sogs pa la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa la yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Thinking that such a state exists for all consciousnesses, he says, ‚ÄúIn the same way, the eye consciousness, etc.‚Äù

original: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rang gi bsam pa ston te /
analyzed: ma yin te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rang gi bsam pa ston te /
translated: ‚ÄúNo, because . . .‚Äù and so forth presents his own view.

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid ni spyi'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'i mtshan nyid ni spyi'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa'i rnam par rtog pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to ignorance, because the characteristic of ignorance is the conception of a universal.

original: de nyid rnam par rtog pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: de nyid rnam par rtog pa nyid ces bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: He demonstrates this with ‚ÄúThat is itself conceptualization . . .‚Äù and so forth.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to ignorance.

original: ngo bo nyid kho nas zhes bya ba @114b ni rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kho nas zhes bya ba @114b ni rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy its very nature‚Äù means ‚Äúnaturally.‚Äù

original: dbang po'i shes pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ha cang thal ba spong bar byed de /
analyzed: dbang po'i shes pas zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni ha cang thal ba spong bar byed de /
translated: ‚ÄúThe sense consciousnesses . . .‚Äù and so forth reject the absurd implication of that.

original: de dag ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa can nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa can nyid kyis rnam par rtog pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are not conceptual, since they have the aspect of their own characteristics.

original: de lta bas na de dag ni rnam par rtog pa bzhin du ngo bo nyid kyis 'khrul ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na de dag ni rnam par rtog pa bzhin du ngo bo nyid kyis 'khrul ba ma yin gyi /
translated: Therefore, they are not essentially erroneous, like conceptualization.

original: dbang po la sogs pa gyur pas ni kha cig 'khrul pa nyid du yang gyur to //
analyzed: dbang po la sogs pa gyur pas ni kha cig 'khrul pa nyid du yang gyur to //
translated: However, some are erroneous due to the transformation of the sense faculties, etc.

original: phyi rol gyi don gyis tshul du bshad nas /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don gyis tshul du bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the mode of external objects,

original: da ni shes bya yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: da ni shes bya yang na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: now he says, ‚ÄúOr, the object of knowledge,‚Äù etc.

original: 'di skad du bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is the explanation:

original: klan ka tshol bas ma rig pa'i sgra'i don ji lta bu btags pa ltar yin du chug na yang /
analyzed: klan ka tshol bas ma rig pa'i sgra'i don ji lta bu btags pa ltar yin du chug na yang /
translated: Even if one grants that the meaning of the term ‚Äúignorance‚Äù is as you have imputed it,

original: 'on kyang 'dod pa'i phyir ha cang thal ba'i nyes pa med pas mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa de dag la yang 'khrul pa nyid 'di nyes pa med de de dag kyang bslad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dod pa'i phyir ha cang thal ba'i nyes pa med pas mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa de dag la yang 'khrul pa nyid 'di nyes pa med de de dag kyang bslad pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: still, because we accept it, there is no fault of overextension. Therefore, even those consciousnesses such as visual consciousness are erroneous, because they are also adulterated.

original: de nyid gnyis med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: de nyid gnyis med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: The nonduality of that is taught by the phrase ‚Äúnondual‚Äù and so on.

original: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rang rig pa nyid gnyis med pa yin te /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa rnams kyi rang rig pa nyid gnyis med pa yin te /
translated: The reflexive awareness of the eye consciousness and so on is nondual.

original: 'di la gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di la gnyis med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no duality in this.

original: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa dang dus snyam du rnam par chad par snang ba gzung ba nyid du 'dod pa sngon po la sogs pa ni gcig dang du mar dpyad ni mi bzod pa nyid kyis don dam par med la /
analyzed: 'di ltar rnam par shes pa dang dus snyam du rnam par chad par snang ba gzung ba nyid du 'dod pa sngon po la sogs pa ni gcig dang du mar dpyad ni mi bzod pa nyid kyis don dam par med la /
translated: Thus, since what is asserted to be the object of apprehension, such as blue, does not withstand analysis as being either one or many, it does not exist ultimately.

original: de la ltos nas rnam par shes pa 'dzin pa nyid du byed pa po'i ngo bo gang yin pa de yang med kyi /
analyzed: de la ltos nas rnam par shes pa 'dzin pa nyid du byed pa po'i ngo bo gang yin pa de yang med kyi /
translated: In dependence on that, the consciousness that is the agent of apprehending does not exist either.

original: rang rig pa nyid ni med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang rig pa nyid ni med pa ma yin te /
translated: But reflexive awareness itself does not not exist.

original: de ni mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni mngon sum yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is direct perception.

original: ji ste gal te rang rig pa nyid gnyis med pa yin na /
analyzed: ji ste gal te rang rig pa nyid gnyis med pa yin na /
translated: If you say, ‚ÄúIf reflexive awareness is nondual,

original: rang rig pa de ni mngon sum yin pas thams cad de kho na nyid mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rang rig pa de ni mngon sum yin pas thams cad de kho na nyid mthong bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: since reflexive awareness is direct perception, everyone would see reality.‚Äù

original: ma yin te mngon sum pa nyid yin yang 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan srid pas mi nges pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te mngon sum pa nyid yin yang 'khrul pa'i rgyu mtshan srid pas mi nges pa'i phyir ro //
translated: No, because even though they are direct perception, they are not ascertained because the reason for error is possible.

original: de bas na de ltar ji ltar bshad pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis dang bral ba'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni gnyis med pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de ltar ji ltar bshad pa'i gzung ba dang 'dzin pa gnyis dang bral ba'i phyir mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ni gnyis med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, in this way, because of being free from the duality of the apprehended and apprehender as explained, the eye consciousness and so on are nondual.

original: gnyis med pa de dag gnyis su snang ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnyis med pa de dag gnyis su snang ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because those nondual consciousnesses appear as dual,

original: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bor snang ba'i phyir de dag kyang 'khrul pa yin no zhes le'u gsum pa las bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i ngo bor snang ba'i phyir de dag kyang 'khrul pa yin no zhes le'u gsum pa las bshad par bya'o //
translated: because they appear in the aspect of the apprehended and apprehender, they are also erroneous. This will be explained in the third chapter.

original: gal te tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa ji ltar rnam par dbye zhe na /
analyzed: gal te tshad ma dang tshad ma ma yin pa ji ltar rnam par dbye zhe na /
translated: If one asks, how are valid cognition and invalid cognition distinguished?

original: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: thams cad ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúAll‚Äù and so on.

original: bslad pa ni 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: bslad pa ni 'khrul pa'o //
translated: Corrupted is erroneous.

original: der snang ba ni tshad ma ltar snang ba'o //
analyzed: der snang ba ni tshad ma ltar snang ba'o //
translated: Appearing as that is appearing as a valid cognition.

original: tshad ma @115a * //
analyzed: tshad ma @115a * //
translated: Valid cognition

original: dang der snang ba de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam par dbye ba'o //
analyzed: dang der snang ba de dag gi rnam par gzhag pa ni rnam par dbye ba'o //
translated: and that appearance are their classification.

original: gnas pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i 'khrul pa'i sa bon can no //
analyzed: gnas pa ni kun gzhi rnam par shes pa'i 'khrul pa'i sa bon can no //
translated: The basis is the seed of error of the store consciousness.

original: gnas gyur pa ni sgrib pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: gnas gyur pa ni sgrib pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The transformation is the freedom from obscuration.

original: bar du zhes bya ba ni mtshams te gnas gyur pa'i sngon rol du rtag tu don byed par rung ba dang / 'dod pa thob par byed pa'i phyir tshad ma rnam par gzhag go zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: bar du zhes bya ba ni mtshams te gnas gyur pa'i sngon rol du rtag tu don byed par rung ba dang / 'dod pa thob par byed pa'i phyir tshad ma rnam par gzhag go zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The middle is the interval. The means of valid knowledge is established as always being suitable for the performance of action and for the attainment of the desired goal prior to the transformation.üîΩThe performance of action is the characteristic of the representation that appears as the burning, cooking, etc.

original: don byed pa ni sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: don byed pa ni sreg pa dang 'tshed pa la sogs par snang ba'i rnam par rig pa'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: of the means of valid knowledge.

original: der rung ba dang der 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: der rung ba dang der 'dod pa ste /
translated: The suitability for that and the desire for that are the desire of the person.

original: skyes bu'i 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skyes bu'i 'dod pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the desire of the person, the means of valid knowledge is established as always being suitable for the performance of action and for the attainment of the desired goal prior to the transformation.üîΩThe attainment of that is the attainment of the desired goal.üîΩThe means of valid knowledge is established as always being suitable for the performance of action and for the attainment of the desired goal prior to the transformation.

original: de thob par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te /üîΩ'dod pa kho na thob par byed pa'i phyir zhe nges par gzung gi thob par byed pa kho na'i phyir zhe bya bar ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de thob par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar te /üîΩ'dod pa kho na thob par byed pa'i phyir zhe nges par gzung gi thob par byed pa kho na'i phyir zhe bya bar ni ma yin te /
translated: The attainment of that is the attainment of the desired goal.üîΩThe means of valid knowledge is established as always being suitable for the performance of action and for the attainment of the desired goal prior to the transformation.

original: tshad ma las kyang res 'ga' rkyen ma tshang bas thob par byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshad ma las kyang res 'ga' rkyen ma tshang bas thob par byed pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: and also from the PramƒÅ·πáavƒÅrttika, because sometimes it is impossible to obtain the object due to the incompleteness of conditions.

original: don byed par rung ba dang 'dod pa thob par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
analyzed: don byed par rung ba dang 'dod pa thob par byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni nye bar mtshon pa ste /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause it obtains the object that is fit for and desired to be cognized‚Äù is an example.

original: de bzhin du 'dod pa'i don thob par mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar yang blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'dod pa'i don thob par mi byed pa'i phyir ro zhes bya bar yang blta bar bya'o //
translated: Similarly, the phrase ‚Äúbecause it does not obtain the desired object‚Äù should be understood.

original: de ltar na tshad mar snang bar gzhag pa'i rgyu bshad par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: de ltar na tshad mar snang bar gzhag pa'i rgyu bshad par 'gyur gyi /
translated: Thus the cause for positing valid knowledge as an appearance is explained.

original: de lta ma yin na tshad ma dang der snang bar rnam par ga zhag pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir gcig bstan pa rigs pa ma yin pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na tshad ma dang der snang bar rnam par ga zhag pa'i skabs yin pa'i phyir gcig bstan pa rigs pa ma yin pa'i ngo bor 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would be illogical to teach one because this is a section that distinguishes valid knowledge and its appearance.

original: rnam par shes pa tsam du zad pa'i lta ba la phyi rol gyi med pa'i phyir ji ltar don byed par rung ba dang 'dod pa thob par byed pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa tsam du zad pa'i lta ba la phyi rol gyi med pa'i phyir ji ltar don byed par rung ba dang 'dod pa thob par byed pa yin zhe na /
translated: If the view is merely consciousness, how does it obtain the object that is fit for and desired to be cognized because external objects do not exist?

original: de ni nyes pa med de /
analyzed: de ni nyes pa med de /
translated: There is no fault.

original: me dang chu la sogs par snang ba sreg pa dang / 'tshod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bskyed par nus pa nyid rung ba'i sgrar brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: me dang chu la sogs par snang ba sreg pa dang / 'tshod pa la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa bskyed par nus pa nyid rung ba'i sgrar brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is possible for the appearance of fire, water, etc. to generate consciousnesses that have the aspect of burning, boiling, etc.

original: de ltar na re zhig mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / du ba la sogs pa'i rtags las skyes pa me la sogs par snang ba tshad mar rnam par gzhag pa bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa dang / du ba la sogs pa'i rtags las skyes pa me la sogs par snang ba tshad mar rnam par gzhag pa bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it has been explained that the consciousnesses of fire, etc. that arise from the evidence of smoke, etc. are posited as valid cognitions in regard to the appearance of fire, etc.

original: byas pa la sogs pa'i rtags las skyes pa bdag med ba la sogs pa'i shes pa tshad mar rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir /
analyzed: byas pa la sogs pa'i rtags las skyes pa bdag med ba la sogs pa'i shes pa tshad mar rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to posit the consciousness of selflessness, etc. that arises from the evidence of being produced, etc. as valid cognitions,

original: log pa nyid yin yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: log pa nyid yin yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚ÄúEven though it is erroneous, etc.

original: bdag med pa la sogs pa'i shes pa ni spyi'i rnam par zhugs pa'i phyir nor pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: bdag med pa la sogs pa'i shes pa ni spyi'i rnam par zhugs pa'i phyir nor pa yin mod kyi /
translated: The consciousness of selflessness, etc. is indeed erroneous because it engages its object in a general way.

original: 'on kyang rab tu zhi ba dang mthun pa'i phyir tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang rab tu zhi ba dang mthun pa'i phyir tshad ma yin no //
translated: Nevertheless, it is a valid cognition because it is conducive to peace.

original: rab tu zhi @115b ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa spangs pa ste /
analyzed: rab tu zhi @115b ba ni 'dod chags la sogs pa spangs pa ste /
translated: Peace is the abandonment of attachment, etc.

original: dngos po bdag med pa la sogs pa spyi'i rnam par gzung nas sgom par byed pa'i sgom pa grub na /
analyzed: dngos po bdag med pa la sogs pa spyi'i rnam par gzung nas sgom par byed pa'i sgom pa grub na /
translated: If one cultivates meditation by apprehending the general aspects of things, selflessness, etc.,

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid mngon sum du mi byed pas 'dod chags la sogs pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid mngon sum du mi byed pas 'dod chags la sogs pa spong ba'i phyir ro //
translated: then one does not directly experience the specific characteristics of desire, etc., and thus one does not abandon desire, etc.

original: yang gang zhig nor pa nyid yin yang rab tu zhi ba dang / mthun par mthong zhe na /
analyzed: yang gang zhig nor pa nyid yin yang rab tu zhi ba dang / mthun par mthong zhe na /
translated: Moreover, if one sees that even error is conducive to tranquility,

original: de'i phyir ma la sogs pa 'du shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ma la sogs pa 'du shes zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then the verse states, ‚ÄúThe perception of mother, etc.,‚Äù

original: ma ma yin pa las mar 'du shes pa nor ba yin yang /
analyzed: ma ma yin pa las mar 'du shes pa nor ba yin yang /
translated: The perception of an unreal mother is an error,

original: 'dod chags mi skye ba'i rgyu yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags mi skye ba'i rgyu yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: but it is a cause for the non-arising of desire.

original: chos mthun pa 'di tsam gyis 'di dper bstan gyi ;
analyzed: chos mthun pa 'di tsam gyis 'di dper bstan gyi ;
translated: This mere similarity is the example,

original: ma la sogs par 'du shes pa tshad ma ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ma la sogs par 'du shes pa tshad ma ni ma yin no //
translated: but the perception of mother, etc., is not a valid cognition.

original: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sring mo la sogs par 'du shes pa yongs su bsdu'o //
analyzed: sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni sring mo la sogs par 'du shes pa yongs su bsdu'o //
translated: The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the perception of sister, etc.

original: phyi rol gyi don du lta ba la yang spyi dngos por gyur pa med pa'i phyir gal te rnam par rtog pa thams cad 'khrul pa yin na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi don du lta ba la yang spyi dngos por gyur pa med pa'i phyir gal te rnam par rtog pa thams cad 'khrul pa yin na /
translated: Also, in the view of external objects, a universal that is a real entity does not exist.

original: de la ji ltar smig rgyu la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid chu'i spyi dang bral ba las chu'i rnam par rtog pa skyes pa 'khrul pa yin pa ltar /
analyzed: de la ji ltar smig rgyu la sogs pa'i rang gi mtshan nyid chu'i spyi dang bral ba las chu'i rnam par rtog pa skyes pa 'khrul pa yin pa ltar /
translated: If all conceptual thoughts are mistaken, then just as a conceptual thought of water arises from a mirage, etc., which is devoid of the universal of water, and is mistaken,

original: chu yang dag pa chu nyid kyis stong pa las chu'i rnam par rtog pa skyes pa yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: chu yang dag pa chu nyid kyis stong pa las chu'i rnam par rtog pa skyes pa yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: in the same way, a conceptual thought of water arises from water that is empty of real water.

original: de yang de med pa la der 'dzin par zhugs pa'i phyir 'khrul pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de yang de med pa la der 'dzin par zhugs pa'i phyir 'khrul pa nyid yin no //
translated: Moreover, that is mistaken because it engages in apprehending that which does not exist as existing.

original: de lta bas na gcig ni don thob par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de lta bas na gcig ni don thob par byed pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, one is that which causes the attainment of an object,üîΩand the other is not.

original: cig shos ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las shes na /
analyzed: cig shos ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di ga las shes na /
translated: How is this known?

original: smig rgyu la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: smig rgyu la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúA mirage, etc.,‚Äù

original: gzhan zhes bya ba ni chu yang dag pa la chur shes pa ste /
analyzed: gzhan zhes bya ba ni chu yang dag pa la chur shes pa ste /
translated: and ‚Äúanother‚Äù is the cognition of real water as water,

original: chu nyid kyi spyi med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu nyid kyi spyi med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is devoid of the universal of water.

original: smig rgyu dag dang chu ni dngos po tha dad pa'o ;
analyzed: smig rgyu dag dang chu ni dngos po tha dad pa'o ;
translated: The mirage and water are different things.

original: / de las skye ba ste /
analyzed: / de las skye ba ste /
translated: From that, there is arising.

original: der khyad par med par zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: der khyad par med par zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúwithout distinction‚Äù should be supplied.

original: 'khrul par khyad par med kyang zhes bya ba ni ji ltar smig rgyu chu nyid dang bral ba la chu'i spyir sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir chur rnam par rtog pa 'khrul pa ltar /
analyzed: 'khrul par khyad par med kyang zhes bya ba ni ji ltar smig rgyu chu nyid dang bral ba la chu'i spyir sgro 'dogs pa'i phyir chur rnam par rtog pa 'khrul pa ltar /
translated: Although there is no distinction in error, just as the error of the conceptual thought of water in regard to a mirage is the superimposition of the universal of water upon that which is devoid of water,

original: chu yang dag pa la yang de dang 'dra ste /
analyzed: chu yang dag pa la yang de dang 'dra ste /
translated: so too is the error of water in regard to real water.

original: de med pa la der 'dzin pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de med pa la der 'dzin pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Because it is the apprehension of that which does not exist as existing.

original: mngon par 'dod pa'i don bya ba ni ltung ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa'i don bya ba ni ltung ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The object of the desire is the falling of water, etc.

original: der rung ba ni chu'i rang gi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: der rung ba ni chu'i rang gi mtshan nyid do //
translated: The suitable is the intrinsic identity of water.

original: mi rung ba ni smig rgyu dag ste /üîΩde las skye ba'i phyir chu yang dag pa dang smig rgyu dag la chu rnam par rtog pa ni go rims bzhin du thob par byed pa dang cig @116a * //
analyzed: mi rung ba ni smig rgyu dag ste / de las skye ba'i phyir chu yang dag pa dang smig rgyu dag la chu rnam par rtog pa ni go rims bzhin du thob par byed pa dang cig @116a * //
translated: The unsuitable is the mirage.

original: shos dag yin te /
analyzed: shos dag yin te /
translated: Because of arising from that, the conceptual thought of water in regard to real water and the mirage is, respectively, the cause of obtaining and the cause of not obtaining.

original: cig shos zhes bya ba ni thob par mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: cig shos zhes bya ba ni thob par mi byed pa'o //
translated: The other is that which does not produce attainment.

original: mi rung ba'i smig rgyu'i rang gi mtshan nyid las te /
analyzed: mi rung ba'i smig rgyu'i rang gi mtshan nyid las te /
translated: From the unreal mirage-nature.

original: chu'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa ni chu'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: chu'i ngo bo nyid ma yin pa ni chu'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa skyed par byed pa ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The non-water nature does not produce a consciousness having the aspect of water.

original: rnam par rtog pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs te /
translated: The reply to that is stated beginning with ‚ÄúThe conceptualizations, etc.‚Äù

original: don dang 'brel pa ni don gyi rnam pa'i rjes su byed par skye ba'o //
analyzed: don dang 'brel pa ni don gyi rnam pa'i rjes su byed par skye ba'o //
translated: The connection with the object is the arising in conformity with the aspect of the object.

original: de nyid rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston te /
analyzed: de nyid rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston te /
translated: That itself is taught beginning with ‚Äúconceptualization, etc.‚Äù

original: don ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dngos po las mi 'da' bar ro //
analyzed: don ji lta ba bzhin du zhes bya ba ni dngos po las mi 'da' bar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúJust as the object‚Äù means without exceeding the entity.

original: gal te 'o na ji ltar smig rgyu'i shes pa dngos po tha dad pa las skye bar bshad ce na /
analyzed: gal te 'o na ji ltar smig rgyu'i shes pa dngos po tha dad pa las skye bar bshad ce na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúWell then, how is the mirage-consciousness explained as arising from a different entity?‚Äù

original: smig rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: smig rgyu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The reply is ‚ÄúThe mirage, etc.‚Äù

original: dang por smig rgyu dag la mig gi rnam par shes pa ma 'khrul pa skye ba'o //
analyzed: dang por smig rgyu dag la mig gi rnam par shes pa ma 'khrul pa skye ba'o //
translated: First, the non-mistaken eye consciousness arises in regard to the mirage.

original: de yong na chur 'khrul pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par sgro 'dogs par 'gyur bas brgyud pas de las skye ba ste /
analyzed: de yong na chur 'khrul pa yang dag pa ma yin pa'i rnam par sgro 'dogs par 'gyur bas brgyud pas de las skye ba ste /
translated: Therefore, it is said that it arises from that indirectly.

original: smig rgyu las skye ba zhes bya ba'o ;
analyzed: smig rgyu las skye ba zhes bya ba'o ;
translated: It is said that it arises from a mirage.

original: / bum pa la sogs pa chur 'khrul pa skyed mi nus pa la ni chu ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: / bum pa la sogs pa chur 'khrul pa skyed mi nus pa la ni chu ma yin pa zhes bya ba'o //
translated: A pot, etc. that is unable to generate the error of water is said to be not water.

original: de dang bral ba la ni chur 'khrul pa skyed nus pa'i don ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dang bral ba la ni chur 'khrul pa skyed nus pa'i don ces bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of that which is free from that is said to be that which is able to generate the error of water.

original: rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i ngo bo las mi 'da' ba ste /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba ni dngos po'i ngo bo las mi 'da' ba ste /
translated: Just as it is in reality means that it does not transcend the entityness of a thing.

original: smig rgyu zhes bya ba'i don de lta bus rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin bskyed pa'i phyir de las skye pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: smig rgyu zhes bya ba'i don de lta bus rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin bskyed pa'i phyir de las skye pa zhes bya ba ni ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Because it generates just that entityness of a mirage, it is said that it arises from that.

original: rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyi don ni rang gi ngo bo'i rjes su byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo ji lta ba bzhin zhes bya ba 'di nyid kyi don ni rang gi ngo bo'i rjes su byed pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin no //
translated: The meaning of just as it is in reality is that it conforms with its entityness.

original: rang gi ngo bo'i rjes su byed pas na /üîΩrang gi ngo bo'i rjes su byed pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo'i rjes su byed pas na / rang gi ngo bo'i rjes su byed pa ste /
translated: because it conforms to its own nature.üîΩIt conforms to its own nature.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid dang mthun pa'i gzugs brnyan no //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid dang mthun pa'i gzugs brnyan no //
translated: It is a reflection that conforms to its own characteristic.

original: de shes pa la 'jog cing gtod pas bskyed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de shes pa la 'jog cing gtod pas bskyed pa'i phyir ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not generated by the placement and fixing of consciousness in it.

original: yang de dngos su gang gis skyed ce na /
analyzed: yang de dngos su gang gis skyed ce na /
translated: By what is it directly generated?

original: de'i phyir de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚ÄúThat is generated by the ripening of its own habitual tendency. ‚Äù

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni 'khrul pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the error.

original: chu dang smig rgyu'i khyad par gang yin pa de mtshon cing bye brag tu nges par gzung ba de la mi gsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chu dang smig rgyu'i khyad par gang yin pa de mtshon cing bye brag tu nges par gzung ba de la mi gsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is not clear in the distinction and determination of the difference between water and a mirage.

original: rang gi bag chags ni chur 'khrul pa'i sa bon no //
analyzed: rang gi bag chags ni chur 'khrul pa'i sa bon no //
translated: Its own habitual tendency is the seed of the error of water.

original: de sad pa ni skyed pa dang mthun pa des skyed do //
analyzed: de sad pa ni skyed pa dang mthun pa des skyed do //
translated: The awakening of that is the generation of that which is compatible with it.

original: khyad par ji lta bu can zhig gis she na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu can zhig gis she na /
translated: By what kind of distinction is it generated?

original: rkyen la ltos pas te rkyen ni smig rgyu mthong ba dang / chu dang chos mthun pa dran pa la @116b sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rkyen la ltos pas te rkyen ni smig rgyu mthong ba dang / chu dang chos mthun pa dran pa la @116b sogs pa'o //
translated: It is generated by the dependence on conditions, where the conditions are the seeing of the mirage and the recollection of the similarity of the mirage to water and so on.

original: de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa mjug sdud pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bas na zhes bya ba la sogs pa mjug sdud pa ste /
translated: Thus, etc. is the conclusion.

original: 'khrul pa nyid rnam par rtog pa yin te zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'khrul pa nyid rnam par rtog pa yin te zhes bya bar tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: Error itself is imagination.

original: spyi med pa'i phyir dngos po tha dad cing rang gi mtshan nyid tsam du zad de /
analyzed: spyi med pa'i phyir dngos po tha dad cing rang gi mtshan nyid tsam du zad de /
translated: Because there is no universal, things are different and exhausted as mere individual characteristics.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i 'khrul pa'i gang la de las skye ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i 'khrul pa'i gang la de las skye ba yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which arises from that is called that.

original: spyi tha dad pa mthong ba la ni ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi tha dad pa mthong ba la ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not from seeing a different universal.

original: de ni gsal ba las ma gtogs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni gsal ba las ma gtogs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir ro snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The idea is that it is not perceived apart from the manifestation.

original: spyi tha mi dad pa mthong ba las kyang ngo shes pas ma yin zhes bya bar rnal ma dang sbyar te /
analyzed: spyi tha mi dad pa mthong ba las kyang ngo shes pas ma yin zhes bya bar rnal ma dang sbyar te /
translated: From seeing a non-different universal, it is not recognition.üîΩThe natural state is connected.

original: gsal ba bzhin rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i bdag nyid yin na /
analyzed: gsal ba bzhin rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni gsal ba'i bdag nyid yin na /
translated: Because there is no subsequent pervasion like the manifestation. If it has the nature of the manifestation,

original: de dang 'dra ba kho nar de la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir spyi'i ngo bo nyid med pa yin no //
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba kho nar de la rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir spyi'i ngo bo nyid med pa yin no //
translated: Because it is not invariably concomitant with that, it does not have a universal nature.

original: gzhan gyi ltar na'ang zhes bya ba ni spyi'i ngo bor lta ba'i ltar na'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi ltar na'ang zhes bya ba ni spyi'i ngo bor lta ba'i ltar na'o //
translated: Even according to the other, i.e., according to the view that it is a universal,

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni spyi'i rnam pa can no //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni spyi'i rnam pa can no //
translated: that, i.e., the universal,

original: 'ba' zhig nyid las zhes bya ba ni gsal ba la mi ltos pa las so //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig nyid las zhes bya ba ni gsal ba la mi ltos pa las so //
translated: from mere itself, i.e., without depending on the particulars,

original: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par 'grel pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni rnam par 'grel pa yin no //
translated: is not perceived by the other, i.e., by the cognition of the universal.

original: ci'i phyir rigs pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir rigs pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it not reasonable?

original: rtag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rtag tu zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIt would always be perceived,‚Äù etc.

original: de tsam rnam par shes nas zhes bya ba ni spyi tsam 'dzin na'o //
analyzed: de tsam rnam par shes nas zhes bya ba ni spyi tsam 'dzin na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúHaving cognized that much‚Äù means having apprehended the mere universal.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam par 'chad par byed do /üîΩ'dis zhes bya ba ni spyi'i rnam pa can gyis so //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam par 'chad par byed do / 'dis zhes bya ba ni spyi'i rnam pa can gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúIf,‚Äù etc., explains this.üîΩ‚ÄúBy this‚Äù means by the cognition of the universal.

original: shes pa 'dis zhes bya ba ni spyi la 'chel pas so //
analyzed: shes pa 'dis zhes bya ba ni spyi la 'chel pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúBy this cognition‚Äù means by the cognition of the universal.

original: de'i tshe na zhes bya ba ni spyi 'dzin na'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe na zhes bya ba ni spyi 'dzin na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúAt that time‚Äù means when apprehending the universal.

original: de ldan zhes bya ba ni spyi'i rten to //
analyzed: de ldan zhes bya ba ni spyi'i rten to //
translated: ‚ÄúEndowed with that‚Äù is the universal‚Äôs substratum.

original: 'brel pa ni spyi dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: 'brel pa ni spyi dang ldan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúRelation‚Äù is the universal‚Äôs possession.

original: de dang ldan pa ni spyi dang ldan pa ste /
analyzed: de dang ldan pa ni spyi dang ldan pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúEndowed with that‚Äù is the universal‚Äôs possession.

original: gal te shes pa des spyi dang de'i rten 'dzin na ni de'i tshe de gnyi ga 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba'i de dang ldan pa nges par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te shes pa des spyi dang de'i rten 'dzin na ni de'i tshe de gnyi ga 'dzin pa sngon du 'gro ba'i de dang ldan pa nges par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that cognition apprehends the universal and its substratum, then at that time, the ascertainment of the possession of both of them would precede.

original: spyi 'dzin pa de las ji ltar gsal ba la tha snyad 'dogs pa 'jug ste mi 'jug pa nyid do //
analyzed: spyi 'dzin pa de las ji ltar gsal ba la tha snyad 'dogs pa 'jug ste mi 'jug pa nyid do //
translated: How could the application of the convention to the particular, from the apprehension of the universal, not be applied?

original: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: gang gi tshe zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed de /
translated: When, etc. explains.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni spyi dang de dang ldan pa dag ste /
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni spyi dang de dang ldan pa dag ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù are the universal and its possession.

original: 'di ni khyad par 'di'i spyi'o zhes bya bar ro //
analyzed: 'di ni khyad par 'di'i spyi'o zhes bya bar ro //
translated: ‚ÄúThis is the universal of this particular.‚Äù

original: de lta na ni zhes bya ba ni spyi de dang ldan pa dag 'brel par ma rtogs na ste /üîΩde rtogs pas de spyi rtogs pas de dang ldan pa la ste /
analyzed: de lta na ni zhes bya ba ni spyi de dang ldan pa dag 'brel par ma rtogs na ste / de rtogs pas de spyi rtogs pas de dang ldan pa la ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn that case,‚Äù etc. means: if the relation of the universal and its possession is not understood,

original: spyi dang ldan pa la'o //
analyzed: spyi dang ldan pa la'o //
translated: then, by understanding that, the universal is understood, and the possession of that, i.e., the universal‚Äôs possession.

original: don gzhan bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rta rtogs pa'i dus na de'i ngo bor ma @117a * //
analyzed: don gzhan bzhin no zhes bya ba ni rta rtogs pa'i dus na de'i ngo bor ma @117a * //
translated: ‚ÄúLike another object‚Äù means that at the time of the realization of the horse, the nature of the rope is not realized.

original: bzung ba ba lang gi rdzas la rta rtogs pas ni 'jug pa ni med do //
analyzed: bzung ba ba lang gi rdzas la rta rtogs pas ni 'jug pa ni med do //
translated: ‚ÄúLike another object‚Äù means that when a horse is perceived, the substance of a cow is not apprehended, and therefore the perception of a horse does not engage the substance of a cow.

original: gal te dngos gcig grogs byed pa'i //
analyzed: gal te dngos gcig grogs byed pa'i //
translated: If you think that a single entity is a cooperative condition,

original: zhes bya ba'i ni spyi grogs byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i ni spyi grogs byed pa'o //
translated: the ‚Äúsingle entity‚Äù is the universal, and the ‚Äúcooperative condition‚Äù is the universal.

original: 'di nyid kyi rnam par bshad pa ni gal te 'di snyam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi rnam par bshad pa ni gal te 'di snyam du zhes bya ba la sogs pa yin te /
translated: The explanation of this is as follows: If you think that a single entity is a cooperative condition,

original: de'i zhes bya ba ni shes pa'o ;
analyzed: de'i zhes bya ba ni shes pa'o ;
translated: ‚Äúthat‚Äù refers to the cognition.

original: / gcig lhan cig byed pa yod pa zhes bya ba ni spyi lhan cig byed pa yod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: / gcig lhan cig byed pa yod pa zhes bya ba ni spyi lhan cig byed pa yod pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúA single entity that is a cooperative condition‚Äù means a universal that is a cooperative condition.

original: de dang lhan cig tu zhes bya ba ni spyi dang lhan cig tu ste /
analyzed: de dang lhan cig tu zhes bya ba ni spyi dang lhan cig tu ste /
translated: ‚ÄúTogether with that‚Äù means together with the universal.

original: de ltar na spyi dang ldan pa gnyi ga gzung ba'i phyir mi rtogs pas spyi dang ldan pa rtogs par grub po snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na spyi dang ldan pa gnyi ga gzung ba'i phyir mi rtogs pas spyi dang ldan pa rtogs par grub po snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Thus, because both the universal and the possessor of the universal are apprehended, you think that the possessor of the universal is perceived, but the universal is not perceived.

original: slob dpon gyis dngos po gcig des zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis dngos po gcig des zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The master says, ‚ÄúOne thing, etc.‚Äù

original: dngos po gcig ni spyi'o //üîΩgsal ba de rnams kyi tha dad pa nyid sel cing 'dor ram ci /
analyzed: dngos po gcig ni spyi'o // gsal ba de rnams kyi tha dad pa nyid sel cing 'dor ram ci /
translated: One thing is the universal.üîΩDo you reject or eliminate the difference among those particulars?

original: yang ji ste de rnams kyi tha dad pa nyid sel bar 'dod ce na /
analyzed: yang ji ste de rnams kyi tha dad pa nyid sel bar 'dod ce na /
translated: But if you do assert the elimination of their difference,

original: de'i phyir tha dad phyir ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha dad phyir ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then why is it that the master says, ‚ÄúBecause they are different, etc.‚Äù?

original: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba'i sgra ni gang gi phyir zhes bya ba'i don yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúbecause‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúsince.‚Äù

original: de dag la zhes bya ba ni gsal ba dag la'o //
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba ni gsal ba dag la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn them‚Äù refers to the particulars.

original: gcig pu des zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: gcig pu des zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed de /
translated: He explains with ‚ÄúOne thing, etc.‚Äù

original: gcig pu des zhes bya ba ni spyis so //
analyzed: gcig pu des zhes bya ba ni spyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúOne thing‚Äù refers to the universal.

original: khyad par rnams kyis tha dad pa nyid gang yin pa de ni khyad par de dag la gcig gis rnam par shes pa mi skyed pa nyid kyi rgyu yin par brjod do //
analyzed: khyad par rnams kyis tha dad pa nyid gang yin pa de ni khyad par de dag la gcig gis rnam par shes pa mi skyed pa nyid kyi rgyu yin par brjod do //
translated: The difference among them is the cause of the non-production of a cognition of those differences in one thing.

original: de bas na tha dad pa'i phyir gsal ba rnams kyis gcig gi rnam par shes pa mi 'dzin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na tha dad pa'i phyir gsal ba rnams kyis gcig gi rnam par shes pa mi 'dzin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, because they are different, the cognitions of one thing are not grasped by the manifest things.

original: spyi gcig dang 'brel du zin kyang gal te khyad par rnams tha dad pa nyid la mnyam na /
analyzed: spyi gcig dang 'brel du zin kyang gal te khyad par rnams tha dad pa nyid la mnyam na /
translated: Even if a single universal were related to them, if the particulars were different,

original: de dag la rnam par shes pa rnam pa gcig pa can mi skye bas snga ma bzhin du gsal ba rnams mi 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag la rnam par shes pa rnam pa gcig pa can mi skye bas snga ma bzhin du gsal ba rnams mi 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: then the cognition would not have a single aspect, and the manifest things would not be grasped, just as before.

original: gal te gsal ba'i ngo bo du ma'ang gcig ces bya ba la spyi la'o //
analyzed: gal te gsal ba'i ngo bo du ma'ang gcig ces bya ba la spyi la'o //
translated: If the many natures of the manifest things are called ‚Äúone,‚Äù then the universal is the same as the particulars.

original: tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: tha dad pa'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed de /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúbecause they are different‚Äù and so on explains this.

original: gal te khyad par gyis skyes par 'gal ba zhig tu gyur na ni /
analyzed: gal te khyad par gyis skyes par 'gal ba zhig tu gyur na ni /
translated: If it were contradictory for something to arise from a particular,

original: de'i tshe spyi yod du zin kyang khyad par rnams kyis gcig gi rnam par skyed par mi byed do //
analyzed: de'i tshe spyi yod du zin kyang khyad par rnams kyis gcig gi rnam par skyed par mi byed do //
translated: then even if the universal exists, the particulars would not generate the cognition of one thing.

original: de dag ces bya ba ni gsal ba dag go //
analyzed: de dag ces bya ba ni gsal ba dag go //
translated: ‚Äú Those‚Äù refers to the manifest things.

original: ci ril gyis med par ram zhe na /
analyzed: ci ril gyis med par ram zhe na /
translated: Are they all nonexistent?

original: ma yin te re re med par yang zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: ma yin te re re med par yang zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: No, he says, ‚Äúeven if each is not nonexistent.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar khra bo med kyang khu yul ba lang gi blo 'byung la /
analyzed: 'di ltar khra bo med kyang khu yul ba lang gi blo 'byung la /
translated: Thus, even though there is no variegated color, the cognition of a cow occurs.

original: @117b de med na gzhan la yang 'byung ngo //
analyzed: @117b de med na gzhan la yang 'byung ngo //
translated: If that does not exist, it occurs in relation to others as well.

original: de ltar na gsal ba thams cad re re zhing med kyang spyi /
analyzed: de ltar na gsal ba thams cad re re zhing med kyang spyi /
translated: Thus, even though each individual thing does not exist,

original: de gcig gis kyang bskyed par bya'i /
analyzed: de gcig gis kyang bskyed par bya'i /
translated: the cognition of a universal is produced by a universal.

original: blo mngon par shes pa'i bdag nyid la gsal ba de rnams nus pa med do //
analyzed: blo mngon par shes pa'i bdag nyid la gsal ba de rnams nus pa med do //
translated: But in the cognition of a person with clairvoyance, those individual things do not have the capacity to produce the cognition of a universal.

original: rgyu de'i phyir /
analyzed: rgyu de'i phyir /
translated: For that reason,

original: blos spyi'i blo gsal ba de rnams 'dzin pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: blos spyi'i blo gsal ba de rnams 'dzin pa med pa yin no //
translated: the cognition of a universal does not apprehend those individual things.

original: de nyid de ni ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: de nyid de ni ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: He demonstrates just that with ‚ÄúHow could that . . . ‚Äù and so on.

original: shes pa de la zhes bya ba ni spyi'i rnam pa can la'o //
analyzed: shes pa de la zhes bya ba ni spyi'i rnam pa can la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn that cognition‚Äù refers to the cognition that has the aspect of a universal.

original: de yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni spyi'i shes pa yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de yod pa'i phyir zhes bya ba ni spyi'i shes pa yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúBecause that exists‚Äù means because the cognition of a universal exists.

original: 'dis ni ldog pa med par bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni ldog pa med par bshad do //
translated: This explains that there is no counterexample.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang med kyang yod pa de ni de'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang med kyang yod pa de ni de'i rgyu mtshan can ma yin te /
translated: The syllogism is: Whatever exists even though something else does not exist is not a reason for that,

original: dper na s'a lu'i sa bon med kyang nas kyi myu gu yod pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na s'a lu'i sa bon med kyang nas kyi myu gu yod pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, even though there is no barley seed, there is a barley sprout.

original: khra bo med kyang khu yu la ba lang gi blo 'byung bas khyad par byed pa 'gal ba yin te /
analyzed: khra bo med kyang khu yu la ba lang gi blo 'byung bas khyad par byed pa 'gal ba yin te /
translated: And even though there is no variegation, there is the cognition of a cow in a cow. Therefore, the reason is contradictory,

original: de med na med pas de'i rgyu mtshan can la khyab pa'i phyir dang / de med kyang yod pa ni de dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med na med pas de'i rgyu mtshan can la khyab pa'i phyir dang / de med kyang yod pa ni de dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because if that does not exist, it does not exist, and because that which exists even though that does not exist is contradictory to that.

original: de bzhin du gsal ba gzhan la yang phyogs kyi chos spangs nas brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gsal ba gzhan la yang phyogs kyi chos spangs nas brjod par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, in regard to another instance, having abandoned the property of the position, one should state,

original: spyi ni de la nus pa yod pas spyi med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: spyi ni de la nus pa yod pas spyi med na zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúIf there is no universal, there is no cognition of a universal.‚Äù

original: spyi med na spyi'i blo med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: spyi med na spyi'i blo med pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because if there is no universal, there is no cognition of a universal.

original: 'dis ni ldog pa bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni ldog pa bshad do //
translated: This explains the pervasion.

original: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni spyi yod na spyi'i blo yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhan du na zhes bya ba ni spyi yod na spyi'i blo yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúOtherwise,‚Äù means if there is a universal, there is a cognition of a universal.

original: 'dis ni rjes su 'gro ba bshad do//
analyzed: 'dis ni rjes su 'gro ba bshad do//
translated: This explains the positive concomitance.

original: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang med kyang yod na yod la med na med pa de la mi ltos par de tsam gyi byed rgyu can yin te /
analyzed: sbyor ba ni gang zhig gang med kyang yod na yod la med na med pa de la mi ltos par de tsam gyi byed rgyu can yin te /
translated: The syllogism is as follows: Whatever exists when something else exists and does not exist when it does not exist is not dependent on that other thing, but is a cause of that other thing by its mere presence.

original: dper na nas kyi sa bon med kyang s'a lu'i sa bon yod na yod la med na med pas s'a lu'i myu gu lta bu'o //üîΩkhra bo med kyang spyi yod na spyi'i blo yod la /
analyzed: dper na nas kyi sa bon med kyang s'a lu'i sa bon yod na yod la med na med pas s'a lu'i myu gu lta bu'o // khra bo med kyang spyi yod na spyi'i blo yod la /
translated: For example, a rice sprout exists when a rice seed exists and does not exist when it does not exist.üîΩThe universal exists when the particulars exist, and does not exist when they do not exist.

original: med na yang med pas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs su thal bar 'gyur ba yin no //üîΩgal te spyi dang lhan cig pa'i gsal ba rnams kho na'o //
analyzed: med na yang med pas rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs su thal bar 'gyur ba yin no // gal te spyi dang lhan cig pa'i gsal ba rnams kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, it follows, absurdly, that the universal is a natural reason.

original: spyi'i blo la nus par 'dod na /
analyzed: spyi'i blo la nus par 'dod na /
translated: If you accept that the particulars, which exist simultaneously with the universal, are the only things that have the ability to produce the cognition of the universal,

original: de'i tshe ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis spyi kho na la nus pa yod kyi /
analyzed: de'i tshe ji skad bshad pa'i tshul gyis spyi kho na la nus pa yod kyi /
translated: then, as was explained earlier, the universal alone has the ability to produce the cognition of the universal,

original: gsal ba rnams la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba rnams la ni ma yin no //
translated: but the particulars do not.

original: de lta bas na gsal ba rnams kho na tha dad kyang rang bzhin gyis rnam par shes pa gcig tu snyems pa can bskyed do //
analyzed: de lta bas na gsal ba rnams kho na tha dad kyang rang bzhin gyis rnam par shes pa gcig tu snyems pa can bskyed do //
translated: Therefore, even though the particulars are different, they give rise to a single cognition that conceives of them as a single entity.

original: de lta ma yin na spyi med pa'i phyir spyi'i blo de rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ma grub po //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na spyi med pa'i phyir spyi'i blo de rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa ma grub po //
translated: If it were not so, then because there would be no generality, the cognition of generality would not be established as following after and turning away from the particulars.

original: 'di ni nyes pa med de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs te /
analyzed: 'di ni nyes pa med de zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs te /
translated: The response to this is stated in the passage beginning with ‚ÄúThere is no fault here‚Äù and so on.

original: re re bsal kyang @118a * //
analyzed: re re bsal kyang @118a * //
translated: Even when each is removed,

original: zhes bya ba ni re re nas kyang bsal kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
