analyzed: zhes bya ba ni re re nas kyang bsal kyang zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: the meaning of ‚Äúeven when each is removed‚Äù is the meaning of ‚Äúeven when each is removed.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar gang gi tshe mig gi rnam par shes pa sngon po la sogs pa'i tshogs la dmigs pa skye ba na /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang gi tshe mig gi rnam par shes pa sngon po la sogs pa'i tshogs la dmigs pa skye ba na /
translated: Thus, when the eye consciousness that observes a collection of blue and so on arises,

original: de la sngon po la sogs pa re re bsal kyang kha dog gi tshogs lhag ma la mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba kho nar 'gyur la /
analyzed: de la sngon po la sogs pa re re bsal kyang kha dog gi tshogs lhag ma la mig gi rnam par shes pa skye ba kho nar 'gyur la /
translated: even when each of the blue and so on is removed, the eye consciousness arises only with respect to the remaining collection of colors.

original: de tsam gyis sngon po la sogs pa'i tshogs la yang nus pa med pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: de tsam gyis sngon po la sogs pa'i tshogs la yang nus pa med pa ma yin gyi /
translated: That much does not lack the ability to produce the collection of blue and so on.

original: 'on kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i tshogs la so sor nus pa yod pa kho na'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang sngon po la sogs pa'i tshogs la so sor nus pa yod pa kho na'o //
translated: However, the collection of blue and so on definitely has the ability to produce each individual.

original: de bzhin du bsal ba 'di la yang so sor re re bstsal na zhes bya ba bsal ba re re nas bsal na yang spyi'i rnam par shes pa skye ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsal ba 'di la yang so sor re re bstsal na zhes bya ba bsal ba re re nas bsal na yang spyi'i rnam par shes pa skye ste /
translated: So too, in the case of the exclusions, if each exclusion is removed individually, the cognition of the universal arises.

original: 'di tsam gyis ni dus thams cad du bsal ba rnams so sor nus pa med pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis ni dus thams cad du bsal ba rnams so sor nus pa med pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: This much shows that at all times the exclusions are not individually incapable.

original: 'di skad du khra bo med na khu yu lhan cig byed pa'i spyis bskyed par bya ba'i rnam par shes pa la khra bo'i nus pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: 'di skad du khra bo med na khu yu lhan cig byed pa'i spyis bskyed par bya ba'i rnam par shes pa la khra bo'i nus pa med mod kyi /
translated: This is what is being said: If the multicolored is not present, the multicolored is not capable of producing a cognition that is generated by the universal of the cow that is a co-operating cause.

original: 'on kyang rang gi bdag nyid lhan cig byed pas 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba la nus pa yod pa kho na yin la de bzhin du khu yu la sogs pa la yang rang gi rten gyi sgo nas 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa la nusüîΩpa yod do //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi bdag nyid lhan cig byed pas 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa skye ba la nus pa yod pa kho na yin la de bzhin du khu yu la sogs pa la yang rang gi rten gyi sgo nas 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa la nus pa yod do //
translated: However, it is only capable of producing a cognition that arises from its own nature as a co-operating cause, and likewise the cow and so on are capable of producing a cognition that arises from their own basis.

original: de bas na gang zhig gang med na zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba ma nges pa yin no zhes smras pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na gang zhig gang med na zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba ma nges pa yin no zhes smras pa yin no //
translated: Therefore it is said that the application of ‚Äúif this is not present‚Äù is indefinite.

original: slob dpon gyis mi mthun par nye bar bkod pa ste zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis mi mthun par nye bar bkod pa ste zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: The master has stated the counter position.

original: nye bar bkod pa yin pas na /
analyzed: nye bar bkod pa yin pas na /
translated: Since it is stated,üîΩit is a counter position.

original: nye bar bkod pa ni sngon po la sogs pa'i dpe ste /
analyzed: nye bar bkod pa ni sngon po la sogs pa'i dpe ste /
translated: The example of blue and so on is a counter position.

original: de skabs su bab ba dang 'dra ba med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //üîΩgsal ba la ji ltar yang ni de ltar min zhes bya ba ni gsal ba rnams la ni so sor yang nus pa med la /
analyzed: de skabs su bab ba dang 'dra ba med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // gsal ba la ji ltar yang ni de ltar min zhes bya ba ni gsal ba rnams la ni so sor yang nus pa med la /
translated: The meaning is that it is not similar to the present case.

original: tshogs pa las yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tshogs pa las yang med do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of ‚Äúbut the manifestation is not like that‚Äù is that individual manifestations have no power and that a collection also has no power.

original: de nyid sngon po la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston te /
analyzed: de nyid sngon po la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ston te /
translated: He demonstrates just that in ‚ÄúBlue and so on . . .‚Äù

original: so so'i nus pa yang mthong zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa ji ltar rang rang gi ngo bos tha dad pa de bzhin du mig gi rnam par shes pa rnams kyang rnam pa tha dad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: so so'i nus pa yang mthong zhes bya ba ni sngon po la sogs pa ji ltar rang rang gi ngo bos tha dad pa de bzhin du mig gi rnam par shes pa rnams kyang rnam pa tha dad pa'i phyir te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe power of each is also seen‚Äù means that just as blue and so on are different by way of their individual natures, eye consciousnesses are also different in their aspects.

original: de la sngon po dang lhan cig pa'i tshogs kyis bskyed par bya ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni med na med la /
analyzed: de la sngon po dang lhan cig pa'i tshogs kyis bskyed par bya ba'i mig gi rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de ni med na med la /
translated: The eye consciousness that is to be generated by the collection that is simultaneous with blue is one thing,

original: skyed pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan kho na yin no //
analyzed: skyed pa gang yin pa de ni gzhan kho na yin no //
translated: and that which is to be generated by the collection that is simultaneous with yellow is another.

original: de lta bas na tshogs kyi rnam pas nye bar bsgyur ba'i rnam par @118b shes pa sngon po la sogs pa so so'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir de rnams la ni so sor nus pa yod par mngon pas tshogs la yang
analyzed: de lta bas na tshogs kyi rnam pas nye bar bsgyur ba'i rnam par @118b shes pa sngon po la sogs pa so so'i rjes su 'gro ba dang ldog pa'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir de rnams la ni so sor nus pa yod par mngon pas tshogs la yang
translated: Therefore, since consciousness is transformed by the collection in the aspect of blue, etc., it follows the individual and ceases when they cease. Since it is evident that they individually have the ability to generate it,

original: nus pa mi 'gal lo //
analyzed: nus pa mi 'gal lo //
translated: it is not contradictory that the collection has the ability to generate it.

original: nam yang zhes bya bas ni so sos kyang ma yin la tshogs pas kyang ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: nam yang zhes bya bas ni so sos kyang ma yin la tshogs pas kyang ma yin pa'o //
translated: ‚Äú Never‚Äù means that it is not generated by the individual factors, nor by the collection.

original: 'di skad du bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is explained as follows:

original: khra bo dang lhan cig pas bskyed par bya ba'i ba lang gi shes pa yang gzhan khu yu dang lhan cig bskyed par bya ba yang gzhan yin pa zhig tu gyur na ni /
analyzed: khra bo dang lhan cig pas bskyed par bya ba'i ba lang gi shes pa yang gzhan khu yu dang lhan cig bskyed par bya ba yang gzhan yin pa zhig tu gyur na ni /
translated: If the consciousness of a cow that is to be generated by the collection that is simultaneous with a multicolored object is one thing, and that which is to be generated by the collection that is simultaneous with milk is another,üîΩthen the consciousness of a cow would not be generated by the collection that is simultaneous with milk.

original: de'i tshe gsal ba rnams la rang gi rten gyi sgo nas 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa la so sor nus pa yod par shes par 'gyur ba zhig na 'on kyang gsal ba thams cad la mngon par shes pa gcig kho nar zad do //
analyzed: de'i tshe gsal ba rnams la rang gi rten gyi sgo nas 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa la so sor nus pa yod par shes par 'gyur ba zhig na 'on kyang gsal ba thams cad la mngon par shes pa gcig kho nar zad do //
translated: At that time, it would be understood that the consciousness that arises from the individual bases of the manifestations has the ability to distinguish them. However, there is only one superknowledge that manifests in all of them.

original: de ni thams cad la rnam pa gcig pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni thams cad la rnam pa gcig pa can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it has the same form in all of them.

original: de bas na khra bo yod na ba lang gi shes pa skye ba gang yin pa de nyid khra bo med na yang /
analyzed: de bas na khra bo yod na ba lang gi shes pa skye ba gang yin pa de nyid khra bo med na yang /
translated: Therefore, when there is a multicolored object, the consciousness that arises from it is the same as the consciousness that arises from a multicolored object when there is no multicolored object.

original: khu yu lhan cig byed pa'i spyi las skye bas gsal ba rnams la so sor nus pa yod par rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: khu yu lhan cig byed pa'i spyi las skye bas gsal ba rnams la so sor nus pa yod par rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: Because it arises from the universal that is the simultaneous cause of the multicolored object. Therefore, it is not understood that the manifestations have the ability to distinguish them.

original: gal te spyi la mi ltos par rjes su 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed na /
analyzed: gal te spyi la mi ltos par rjes su 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa skyed na /
translated: If the consciousness that arises from the universal were to arise from the universal without depending on the manifestations,

original: de lta na de dag la nus pa yod par 'gyur ba zhig na de yang med de /
analyzed: de lta na de dag la nus pa yod par 'gyur ba zhig na de yang med de /
translated: then the manifestations would have the ability to produce it. But that is not the case.

original: de lta bas na gsal ba rnams kyis spyi'i mtshan nyid shes pa de la mi nus pa'i kho na yin pa'i phyir spyi'i shes pa des de rnam par mi 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta bas na gsal ba rnams kyis spyi'i mtshan nyid shes pa de la mi nus pa'i kho na yin pa'i phyir spyi'i shes pa des de rnam par mi 'dzin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, since the cognition of the universal is not capable of that, the cognition of the universal does not apprehend those particulars.

original: gal te gsal ba de dag gi nang nas 'ga' zhig la ltos nas te /
analyzed: gal te gsal ba de dag gi nang nas 'ga' zhig la ltos nas te /
translated: If it is in dependence on some one of those particulars,

original: gsal ba cung zad gcig la ltos nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gsal ba cung zad gcig la ltos nas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: the meaning is that it is in dependence on some one particular.

original: des zhes bya ba ni spyis so //
analyzed: des zhes bya ba ni spyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the universal.

original: 'ba' zhig min zhes bya ba ni gsal ba la ma ltos pas so //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig min zhes bya ba ni gsal ba la ma ltos pas so //
translated: ‚ÄúNot alone‚Äù means not in dependence on the particular.

original: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: 'on te zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed de /
translated: If it is in dependence on some one of those particulars,

original: tha ga pa ni thags 'thag pa'o //
analyzed: tha ga pa ni thags 'thag pa'o //
translated: the weaver is the one who weaves the cloth.

original: thags zangs mang po zhig gi nang nas thags zangs re re med kyang thags zangs gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig gis ras yug 'thag pas thams cad la 'khrul du zin kyang /
analyzed: thags zangs mang po zhig gi nang nas thags zangs re re med kyang thags zangs gang yang rung ba 'ga' zhig gis ras yug 'thag pas thams cad la 'khrul du zin kyang /
translated: Even though each individual thread is absent in a cloth with many threads, a cloth is woven by some one of the individual threads, and thus all are not mistaken.

original: de kho na la thag pa thags zangs dang bral ba de kho na las ras yug 'byung ba zhes brjod par nus pa ni ma yin te 'di ltar spyil pos ras yug brtag pa mi nus pa'i phyir tha ga pa thags zangs dang ma bral bar ras yug
analyzed: de kho na la thag pa thags zangs dang bral ba de kho na las ras yug 'byung ba zhes brjod par nus pa ni ma yin te 'di ltar spyil pos ras yug brtag pa mi nus pa'i phyir tha ga pa thags zangs dang ma bral bar ras yug
translated: It is not possible to say that the cloth arises from just that, because the cloth cannot be produced from the warp and weft alone.

original: 'thag go // slob dpon gyis de lta yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa @119a * //
analyzed: 'thag go // slob dpon gyis de lta yin na zhes bya ba la sogs pa @119a * //
translated: The master [BhƒÅviveka] says, ‚ÄúIf that is so,‚Äù and so on.

original: smos te / spyi ni de dag gi nang nas gang yang rung ba zhig la ltos nas nus so zhes smras pas spyi gsal bas phan par bya ba yin par 'dod de /
analyzed: smos te / spyi ni de dag gi nang nas gang yang rung ba zhig la ltos nas nus so zhes smras pas spyi gsal bas phan par bya ba yin par 'dod de /
translated: Since you say that the universal is able to rely on any of them, you assert that the universal is something that is helped by the particulars.

original: phan mi 'dogs pa la ltos pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan mi 'dogs pa la ltos pa mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it is not suitable to rely on something that does not help.

original: gal te de lta yin na ni gsal ba de dag gis spyi de gcig la phan 'dogs na go //
analyzed: gal te de lta yin na ni gsal ba de dag gis spyi de gcig la phan 'dogs na go //
translated: If that is so, then if those particulars help that universal,

original: ji ltar blo gcig nyid la min ji ltar mngon par shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi blo gcig kho na la phan 'dogs par mi byed de /
analyzed: ji ltar blo gcig nyid la min ji ltar mngon par shes pa'i bdag nyid kyi blo gcig kho na la phan 'dogs par mi byed de /
translated: how is it that they do not help a single cognition? How is it that they do not help a single cognition that has the nature of a mental direct perceiver?

original: de la yang phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: de la yang phan 'dogs par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It is said that the universal is the object of the conceptual consciousness, and that the particular is the object of the non-conceptual consciousness.

original: nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni kho na zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: nyid ces bya ba'i sgra ni kho na zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The word ‚Äúonly‚Äù means ‚Äújust.‚ÄùüîΩHe explains ‚Äúdifferent objects‚Äù and so on.

original: don tha dad pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed de /üîΩtha dad pa mtshan nyid mi mthun pa rnams don gcig la sbyor ba ste /
analyzed: don tha dad pa rnams zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed de / tha dad pa mtshan nyid mi mthun pa rnams don gcig la sbyor ba ste /
translated: Different means dissimilar.üîΩThey are applied to the same object because they are mutually exclusive, and because they perform the same function, such as recognizing.

original: ngo shes pa la sogs pa'i don gcig byed pa 'gal bas 'di thams cad spyi grub par bya ba'i phyir brtsams pa yin na'o //
analyzed: ngo shes pa la sogs pa'i don gcig byed pa 'gal bas 'di thams cad spyi grub par bya ba'i phyir brtsams pa yin na'o //
translated: All of this is undertaken in order to establish the universal.

original: de rnams la zhes bya ba gsal ba rnams la mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par shes pa gang gis na rnam par shes pa de mi skye ba'i nyes pa ci zhig byas cung zad kyang ma byas te /
analyzed: de rnams la zhes bya ba gsal ba rnams la mngon par shes pa zhes bya ba'i rnam par shes pa gang gis na rnam par shes pa de mi skye ba'i nyes pa ci zhig byas cung zad kyang ma byas te /
translated: ‚ÄúThose‚Äù refers to the particulars. The consciousness that is called ‚Äúperception‚Äù is the consciousness by which the universal is perceived. What fault is there in the non-arising of that consciousness? Nothing at all.

original: da lta bas na de nyid bskyed do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: da lta bas na de nyid bskyed do snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is thought that just that should be produced.

original: de lta yin na de la bar ma do'i lhag mas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: de lta yin na de la bar ma do'i lhag mas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: If that is so, what is the use of the remaining middle term?

original: spyi bo dang yan lag gi bar na sha lhag yod pa ni bar ma do'i lhag pa ste /
analyzed: spyi bo dang yan lag gi bar na sha lhag yod pa ni bar ma do'i lhag pa ste /
translated: The excess flesh between the crown and the limbs is the excess of the intermediate state.

original: de dang 'dra ba la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: de dang 'dra ba la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: That which is similar to that is called that.

original: de lta bu'i don med pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de lta bu'i don med pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: Since it has no such meaning, it is said to be meaningless.

original: gal te tha dad pa rnams la spyi gcig pa la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa yod de de'i phyir de dag spyi kho na la dngos su phan 'dogs kyi rnam par shes pa la ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te tha dad pa rnams la spyi gcig pa la phan 'dogs pa'i nus pa yod de de'i phyir de dag spyi kho na la dngos su phan 'dogs kyi rnam par shes pa la ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: If there is a single universal that benefits different things, then it is said that they are directly benefited by the universal, but not by consciousness.

original: de'i phyir ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said that just as, etc.

original: de gcig kho na zhes bya ba spyis bskyed par bya ba'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de kho na skyed pa la rag mod spyi la phan 'dogs pa mi dgos pas ci zhig bya /
analyzed: de gcig kho na zhes bya ba spyis bskyed par bya ba'i rnam par shes pa gang yin pa de kho na skyed pa la rag mod spyi la phan 'dogs pa mi dgos pas ci zhig bya /
translated: If that single universal generates a consciousness, it must generate just that consciousness. Since there is no need to benefit the universal, what is the use of it?

original: 'di snyam du rnam par shas pa gsal ba rnams rang gi rnam pa nye bar 'jog pas zho sha 'bul ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di snyam du rnam par shas pa gsal ba rnams rang gi rnam pa nye bar 'jog pas zho sha 'bul ba ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that the clear consciousnesses offer their own aspects to the universal, like a tax on milk products.

original: spyi'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa la rang gi mtshan nyid mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa la rang gi mtshan nyid mi snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the aspect of consciousness does not appear as the particular.

original: 'on kyang bdag po tsam gyis yin na de ni spyi la ji lta bar rnam par shes pa yang de dang 'dra bas mtshungs so snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang bdag po tsam gyis yin na de ni spyi la ji lta bar rnam par shes pa yang de dang 'dra bas mtshungs so snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: But if it is merely the dominant condition, then consciousness is similar to the universal, so it is the same.

original: gzhan yang gal te gsal ba de dag gis @119b spyi la phan 'dogs na de'i tshe spyi'i bdag nyid 'di'i gsal ba de rnams kyi 'bras bur gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te gsal ba de dag gis @119b spyi la phan 'dogs na de'i tshe spyi'i bdag nyid 'di'i gsal ba de rnams kyi 'bras bur gyur te /
translated: Moreover, if those particulars benefit the universal, then those particulars of this universal nature would be the effect.

original: 'di ltar phan 'dogs pa nyid skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar phan 'dogs pa nyid skyes pa yin no //
translated: In this way, the benefit would be produced.

original: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir sngon rol bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid gsal bar bya ba'i phyir sngon rol bzhin du zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to make that very point, he says, ‚Äúlike before,‚Äù and so on.

original: phan 'dogs par byed pa nye ba na yang phan 'dogs par byed pa nye ba'i sngon rol bzhin du'o //
analyzed: phan 'dogs par byed pa nye ba na yang phan 'dogs par byed pa nye ba'i sngon rol bzhin du'o //
translated: Even when the benefit is near, it is like before when the benefit was near.

original: bogs ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: bogs ni khyad par ro //
translated: Enhancement is a distinction.

original: de med pa'i phyir bogs med pa'i bdag nyid rang gi mtshan nyid ngo bo 'dzin pa'i spyi 'di la ni phan pa zhes bya ba 'ga' yang med de zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir bogs med pa'i bdag nyid rang gi mtshan nyid ngo bo 'dzin pa'i spyi 'di la ni phan pa zhes bya ba 'ga' yang med de zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Since that is not so, there is no ‚Äúbenefit‚Äù whatsoever to this universal that is the nature of grasping its own character, which has the nature of not being enhanced.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir te /
translated: Because it would follow that there would be an absurd consequence.

original: de lta na ni thams cad kyang thams cad la phan par byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na ni thams cad kyang thams cad la phan par byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were so, then everything would benefit everything.

original: de lta bas na phan par byed pa pos phan par bya ba'i bogs shig skyed do zhes bya bar khas blangs dgos so //
analyzed: de lta bas na phan par byed pa pos phan par bya ba'i bogs shig skyed do zhes bya bar khas blangs dgos so //
translated: Therefore it must be accepted that the benefit is produced by the benefactor.

original: bogs de yang phan gdags par bya ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin pas phan 'dogs pa nyid la skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: bogs de yang phan gdags par bya ba'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin pas phan 'dogs pa nyid la skyed pa yin no //
translated: And that enhancement is the nature of the object benefited, so it is produced by the benefactor.

original: spyi las don gzhan du gyur pa kho na'i bogs shig gsal bas skyed do zhe na /
analyzed: spyi las don gzhan du gyur pa kho na'i bogs shig gsal bas skyed do zhe na /
translated: If you say that the enhancement is produced by the manifestation of something that is completely different from the universal,

original: de'i phyir don gzhan zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir don gzhan zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then NƒÅgƒÅrjuna‚Äôs Root Verses on the Middle Way says:

original: phan pa don gzhan des phan par bya ba'i spyi de la ci zhig byed /
analyzed: phan pa don gzhan des phan par bya ba'i spyi de la ci zhig byed /
translated: What would that other benefit do for the universal that is benefited?

original: yang na gang gis na spyi des phan pa 'di yin no zhes 'brel par 'gyur ba spyi des phan pa don gzhan de la ci zhig byed spyi dang 'brel pa'i phan pa byed pa'i phyir gsal ba rnams kyang phan par byed pa yin la phan pa'i rten ni
analyzed: yang na gang gis na spyi des phan pa 'di yin no zhes 'brel par 'gyur ba spyi des phan pa don gzhan de la ci zhig byed spyi dang 'brel pa'i phan pa byed pa'i phyir gsal ba rnams kyang phan par byed pa yin la phan pa'i rten ni
translated: Because the purpose of the generality is to benefit, the manifestation is also that which benefits.

original: spyi yin pas de'i phyir de dag rten dang brten pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel to zhe na /
analyzed: spyi yin pas de'i phyir de dag rten dang brten pa'i mtshan nyid kyis 'brel to zhe na /
translated: Since the basis of the benefit is the generality, therefore they are related by the characteristics of the basis and the based.

original: de'i phyir de de'i rten nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de de'i rten nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore it is said, ‚ÄúIf that is its basis,‚Äù and so on.

original: gang la rten spyi de yod pas zhes phan pa de de'i rten can nyid yin du'am /
analyzed: gang la rten spyi de yod pas zhes phan pa de de'i rten can nyid yin du'am /
translated: If the benefit exists in that which is the basis of the generality, then the benefit is based on it.

original: yang na phan pa de'i rten yin pas na spyi de de'i rten nyid yin du'o //
analyzed: yang na phan pa de'i rten yin pas na spyi de de'i rten nyid yin du'o //
translated: Or, if the benefit is the basis of that, then the generality is its basis.

original: phan par byed pas na phan 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: phan par byed pas na phan 'dogs pa'o //
translated: Because it benefits, it is that which benefits.

original: de med pa'i phyir phan 'dogs pa med pa ste spyi'o //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir phan 'dogs pa med pa ste spyi'o //
translated: Because it does not exist, the benefit does not exist.

original: phan pa 'di la spyis byas pa'i phan pa yod pas na phan 'dogs pa'o //
analyzed: phan pa 'di la spyis byas pa'i phan pa yod pas na phan 'dogs pa'o //
translated: Because the benefit exists in this benefit that is created by the generality, it is that which benefits.

original: de bkag pa'i phyir phan 'dogs pa med pa ste /
analyzed: de bkag pa'i phyir phan 'dogs pa med pa ste /
translated: Because it is refuted, there is no benefit.

original: brjod pa gcig gis don gnyis smos pa yin no //
analyzed: brjod pa gcig gis don gnyis smos pa yin no //
translated: One statement has two meanings.

original: des na don ni spyi dang phan pa phan 'dogs pa med pa la /
analyzed: des na don ni spyi dang phan pa phan 'dogs pa med pa la /
translated: Therefore, the meaning is that there is no benefit of a universal and no benefit of benefit,

original: go rims bzhin du rten dang brten pa'i dngos po 'di ci zhig yod ces bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: go rims bzhin du rten dang brten pa'i dngos po 'di ci zhig yod ces bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: and what is the point of this state of the support and the supported?

original: yang na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phan 'dogs pa med pa la @120a * //
analyzed: yang na ni ha cang thal bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni phan 'dogs pa med pa la @120a * //
translated: Or else, there is the consequence of absurdity.

original: rten dang brten pa'i dngos pa yod na ni de thams cad la thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa'i dngos pa yod na ni de thams cad la thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If the state of the support and the supported exists without benefit, then that consequence applies to everything.üîΩEven if there is benefit,

original: phan 'dogs na yang zhes bya ba ni spyis byas pa'i phan pa khas len na spyi de kho na la phan pa de 'brel pas phan pa de byed pa'i phyir spyi de la phan par byed pa gsal ba'i khyad par gzhan ci dgos te mi dgos pa kho
analyzed: phan 'dogs na yang zhes bya ba ni spyis byas pa'i phan pa khas len na spyi de kho na la phan pa de 'brel pas phan pa de byed pa'i phyir spyi de la phan par byed pa gsal ba'i khyad par gzhan ci dgos te mi dgos pa kho
translated: if one accepts that the benefit is produced by the universal, then because that benefit is related to just that universal, it is produced by that benefit. Therefore, what need is there for a particular instance of the universal to benefit it?

original: na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: There is no need,üîΩbecause it is the universal itself that benefits it.

original: de la ltos pa zhes bya ba ni gsal ba la ltos pa'o //
analyzed: de la ltos pa zhes bya ba ni gsal ba la ltos pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn dependence on that‚Äù means in dependence on the manifest.

original: rten gyis zhes bya ba spyis te phan pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro /üîΩ// / bam po bcu gnyis pa /
analyzed: rten gyis zhes bya ba spyis te phan pa'i rten yin pa'i phyir ro / // / bam po bcu gnyis pa /
translated: ‚ÄúBy support‚Äù means by the support of benefit.

original: de la sbyor na ni zhes bya ba ni phan pa de la nye bar sbyor bar rtogs na ni skyi rtag pa'i phyir phan par bya ba ma yin pa nyid la gsal ba la ltos pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yod de med pa kho na'o //
analyzed: de la sbyor na ni zhes bya ba ni phan pa de la nye bar sbyor bar rtogs na ni skyi rtag pa'i phyir phan par bya ba ma yin pa nyid la gsal ba la ltos pa zhes bya ba 'di ci zhig yod de med pa kho na'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIf it is understood that it is applied to that benefit‚Äù means that if it is understood that it is applied to that benefit, then because the permanent is not an object of benefit, what is the point of saying ‚Äúin dependence on the manifest‚Äù? It is pointless.

original: 'o na gang zhig ltos she na /
analyzed: 'o na gang zhig ltos she na /
translated: ‚ÄúWell then, what is it dependent on?‚Äù

original: de las skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de las skye ba zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIt is dependent on that from which it arises.‚Äù

original: ltos par bya ba de las skyes pa ni de las skye ba'o //
analyzed: ltos par bya ba de las skyes pa ni de las skye ba'o //
translated: ‚ÄúArisen from that‚Äù means arisen from that on which it is dependent.

original: gang la chos de'i ngo bo nyid yod pa de ni de las skyes ba'i chos can gyi dngos po'o //
analyzed: gang la chos de'i ngo bo nyid yod pa de ni de las skyes ba'i chos can gyi dngos po'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThe entity that has the nature of that property‚Äù means the entity that has the property of being arisen from that.

original: rang bzhin 'brel cing rag las pa'i phyir phan par byed pa la ltos pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'brel cing rag las pa'i phyir phan par byed pa la ltos pa zhes bya ste /
translated: Because it is related to its essence, it is said to be ‚Äúdependent on the benefactor.‚Äù

original: bya zhes bya ba'i sgras ni grags pa ston par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: bya zhes bya ba'i sgras ni grags pa ston par byed pa yin no //
translated: The term ‚Äúetc.‚Äù indicates that it is well known.

original: gal te spyi mi skye ba'i chos can la yang ltos par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te spyi mi skye ba'i chos can la yang ltos par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that a universal is also dependent on that which is not produced,

original: bogs dbyung du med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bogs dbyung du med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: it is said that ‚Äúit is not possible to improve upon what is unproduced.‚Äù

original: gang la bdag nyid phan par byed pa gzhan dag gis bogs dbyung du yod pa med pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: gang la bdag nyid phan par byed pa gzhan dag gis bogs dbyung du yod pa med pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: That which is unproduced is not something that can be improved upon by others who benefit themselves.

original: gang la de lta bu'i bdag nyid yod pa zhes yang 'bru mang po par bya'o //üîΩspyi dngos po ni de lta bu yang yin la gzhan dag la yang ltos so zhes bya ba 'di ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pas nyams pa yin te /
analyzed: gang la de lta bu'i bdag nyid yod pa zhes yang 'bru mang po par bya'o // spyi dngos po ni de lta bu yang yin la gzhan dag la yang ltos so zhes bya ba 'di ni khyab par byed pa 'gal ba dmigs pas nyams pa yin te /
translated: It is said that ‚Äúit is not possible to improve upon what is unproduced.‚Äù

original: 'di ltar ltos pa ni bogs dbyung du yod pa nyid kyis khyab la bogs dbyung du med pa nyid ni de dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar ltos pa ni bogs dbyung du yod pa nyid kyis khyab la bogs dbyung du med pa nyid ni de dang 'gal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The universal is unproduced and it is dependent on others. This is undermined by the observation of a contradiction in the pervader, because dependence is pervaded by the possibility of improvement and the impossibility of improvement is incompatible with that.

original: gang cung zad dngos po 'ga' zhig rten la lar 'brel pa dngos po las gyur pa de thams cad ni bskyed par bya ba ste /
analyzed: gang cung zad dngos po 'ga' zhig rten la lar 'brel pa dngos po las gyur pa de thams cad ni bskyed par bya ba ste /
translated: Whatever things arise in dependence on some basis are all produced.üîΩ

original: 'bras bu kho na'i khongs su gtogs so //
analyzed: 'bras bu kho na'i khongs su gtogs so //
translated: Whatever is a thing that is related to some other thing, all that is produced, that is, it is included in the category of effect.

original: gal te rten gyis brten pa'i bdag nyid du ma gyur pa kho na'i phan pa zhig byed do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te rten gyis brten pa'i bdag nyid du ma gyur pa kho na'i phan pa zhig byed do zhe na /
translated: If it is argued that it is helpful to the thing that is related to it, even though it is not the nature of the thing that is related to it,

original: gzhan gyi dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: then it is said, ‚ÄúIf it is helpful to something else, etc. ‚Äù

original: de la phan pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba phan gdags par bya ba de la phan pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la phan pa med pa'i phyir zhes bya ba phan gdags par bya ba de la phan pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: There is no help for it, because there is no help for that which is to be helped.

original: gzhan la byas na @120b gzhan la phan gdags par bya ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan la byas na @120b gzhan la phan gdags par bya ba ni ma yin no //
translated: If it is helpful to something else, then it is not helpful to that which is to be helped.üîΩSince there is no help for it, what is the point of this relationship between the thing that is related to it and the thing that is related, which is supposed to be its basis?

original: de de'i rten nyid du phan 'dogs pa med pa la brten pa dang brten pa'i dngos po 'di ci zhig yod ces bya ba thams cad kyang brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de de'i rten nyid du phan 'dogs pa med pa la brten pa dang brten pa'i dngos po 'di ci zhig yod ces bya ba thams cad kyang brjod par bya'o //
translated: This should be said in every case.

original: zlos pa nyid kyis nyes pa yang med do //
analyzed: zlos pa nyid kyis nyes pa yang med do //
translated: There is no fault of repetition.

original: sngar ni spyi dang de dang ldan pa dag la phan par bya ba dang phan par byed pa'i ngo bo'i sgo nas bshad /
analyzed: sngar ni spyi dang de dang ldan pa dag la phan par bya ba dang phan par byed pa'i ngo bo'i sgo nas bshad /
translated: Previously, the general and the possessor of the general were explained in terms of the nature of the object to be benefited and the benefactor.

original: da ni 'brel pa dngos po las gyur pa thams cad kyi yul la brten nas bshad do //
analyzed: da ni 'brel pa dngos po las gyur pa thams cad kyi yul la brten nas bshad do //
translated: Now, the explanation is based on the domain of all relationships that arise from things.

original: de lta bas na don gzhan byed pa'i phyir rten du 'dod pa ni cung zad kyang mi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na don gzhan byed pa'i phyir rten du 'dod pa ni cung zad kyang mi byed pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, since it has a different meaning, the assertion that it is a basis does not do anything at all.

original: gal te de lta bu yang phan par byed pa'i yin par 'dod de zhe na /
analyzed: gal te de lta bu yang phan par byed pa'i yin par 'dod de zhe na /
translated: If it is asserted that it benefits in that way,

original: cung zad kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: cung zad kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: then it is said that it does not do anything at all, etc.

original: de'i phyir zhes bya ba 'jug sdud pa ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes bya ba 'jug sdud pa ste /
translated: Therefore means that it is included in the conclusion.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is so, therefore.

original: rnam par shes pa bskyed na zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa bskyed na ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bskyed na zhes bya ba ni rjes su 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa bskyed na ste /
translated: If consciousness is produced means if subsequent consciousness is produced.

original: spyi 'di 'bras bur 'gyur bar gsal lo //
analyzed: spyi 'di 'bras bur 'gyur bar gsal lo //
translated: It is clear that this generality would be the effect.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i nyes pas 'jigs pas spyi gsal ba la mi ltos pa 'ba' zhig gis spyi'i rnam par shes pa bskyed par nus par khas len na ni gsal ba rnams kyi dus nam yang rjes su 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa gang la yang nus par
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i nyes pas 'jigs pas spyi gsal ba la mi ltos pa 'ba' zhig gis spyi'i rnam par shes pa bskyed par nus par khas len na ni gsal ba rnams kyi dus nam yang rjes su 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa gang la yang nus par
translated: If you accept that a single consciousness that does not depend on a specific instance of a universal can arise from a universal, then at no time would the consciousnesses of the specific instances be able to follow it.üîΩ

original: ma grub pa'i phyir gsal ba rnams gzung bar bya ba nyid ma yin te /
analyzed: ma grub pa'i phyir gsal ba rnams gzung bar bya ba nyid ma yin te /
translated: If you accept that a consciousness of a universal can be produced by a particular that is not related to a universal, then the particulars would never be apprehended, because the consciousness that is concomitant with them would not be established as a potentiality.

original: rgyu ma yin pa la yul nyid mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu ma yin pa la yul nyid mi rung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is not tenable that a noncause is an object.

original: rnam par shes pa la snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nus pa med pa ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ni rjes su 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba med kyi /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la snang ba'i phyir zhes bya ba ni nus pa med pa ri bong gi rva la sogs pa ni rjes su 'gro ba'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba med kyi /
translated: The statement ‚Äúbecause it appears to consciousness‚Äù means that a nonpotential thing, such as the horn of an ass, does not appear to a consciousness that is concomitant with it.

original: gsal ba rnams ni snang ste /
analyzed: gsal ba rnams ni snang ste /
translated: But the particulars do appear.

original: de lta bas na spyi dang 'dra bar de rnams kyis kyang nus so snyam pa'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na spyi dang 'dra bar de rnams kyis kyang nus so snyam pa'o //
translated: Therefore, like universals, they too are potentials.

original: gsal ba gang dag la spyi'i rnam par shes pa la phan 'dogs par ma grub pa yod pa de dag ni phan 'dogs par ma grub pa can rnams te /
analyzed: gsal ba gang dag la spyi'i rnam par shes pa la phan 'dogs par ma grub pa yod pa de dag ni phan 'dogs par ma grub pa can rnams te /
translated: Those that are not established as being helpful to the universal consciousness are those that are not established as being helpful.

original: de rnams ji ltar spyi'i rnam par shes pa la snang ste /
analyzed: de rnams ji ltar spyi'i rnam par shes pa la snang ste /
translated: How can they appear to the universal consciousness?

original: mi snang ba nyid do //
analyzed: mi snang ba nyid do //
translated: They do not appear.

original: gal te phan 'dogs pa nyid ji ltar ma grub ce na /
analyzed: gal te phan 'dogs pa nyid ji ltar ma grub ce na /
translated: If it is asked how it is that they are not established as being helpful,

original: de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the root text states, ‚Äúbecause of that, etc.‚Äù

original: de nyid ces bya ba ni phan pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid ces bya ba ni phan pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù refers to the benefit.

original: spyi khas len na /
analyzed: spyi khas len na /
translated: If the universal is accepted,

original: de nyid kyis de la nus kyi gsal ba rnams kyis ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyis de la nus kyi gsal ba rnams kyis ni ma yin te /
translated: it is that which has the power over it, not the particulars.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it was explained:

original: de dag re re med pa yang //
analyzed: de dag re re med pa yang //
translated: Even if each of them is absent,

original: de gcig gis kyang bskyed bya ba'i //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa lta bu'o //üîΩgsal @121a * //
analyzed: de gcig gis kyang bskyed bya ba'i // zhes bya ba la sogs pa bshad pa lta bu'o // gsal @121a * //
translated: it is generated by just one of them.

original: ba rnams spyi'i rnam par shes pa la mi phan du zad mod /üîΩyul nyid du lta ji ste /
analyzed: ba rnams spyi'i rnam par shes pa la mi phan du zad mod / yul nyid du lta ji ste /
translated: The particulars do not help the universal consciousness.

original: mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: But how can they be the object?

original: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The root text states, ‚Äúbecause of that, etc.‚Äù

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa yul nyid yin na ni /
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro zhes bya ba ni phan 'dogs par byed pa ma yin pa yul nyid yin na ni /
translated: If that which does not assist were an object,

original: thams cad kyang rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi yul du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyang rnam par shes pa thams cad kyi yul du 'gyur ro //
translated: then everything would be the object of every consciousness.

original: gal te yul ma yin du zin kyang snang bar go ji ste mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yul ma yin du zin kyang snang bar go ji ste mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If, although not an object, it were to appear, why would it not be an object?

original: yul ma yin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: yul ma yin pa ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If it is not an object, etc.

original: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gtso bo dang dbang phyug la sogs pa lung ji bzhin du brtags pa rnams bsdu'o //
analyzed: gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni gtso bo dang dbang phyug la sogs pa lung ji bzhin du brtags pa rnams bsdu'o //
translated: If, etc. The word ‚Äúetc.‚Äù includes the principal, ƒ™≈õvara, and so on, just as they are described in the scriptures.

original: med pa rnams zhes bya ba ni nus pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa rnams zhes bya ba ni nus pa'i rgyu med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: They do not exist, because they are not causes that have the capacity.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas grub pa'i grub pa yin par ston te /
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas grub pa'i grub pa yin par ston te /
translated: The proponent of tenets shows that this is established by ‚ÄúTheir consciousnesses, etc.‚Äù

original: de dag gi shes pa rnams zhes bya ba ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: de dag gi shes pa rnams zhes bya ba ni 'das pa la sogs pa'i shes pa rnams so //
translated: ‚ÄúTheir consciousnesses‚Äù refers to consciousnesses of the past, etc.

original: yul med pa nyid yin na ji ltar de dag la byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i don gyi rjes su byed par snang zhe na /
analyzed: yul med pa nyid yin na ji ltar de dag la byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa'i don gyi rjes su byed par snang zhe na /
translated: If the object does not exist, how can they arise from those?üîΩIf the object does not exist, how can they arise from those?

original: don med du zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don med du zin kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The meaning of this and the like is as follows: even though the object does not exist, the consciousness that arises in the aspect of that object is said to be subsequent to the object.

original: de'i rjes su byed pa zhes bya ba ni don gang nyams su myong ba 'das pa de'i rjes su byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su byed pa zhes bya ba ni don gang nyams su myong ba 'das pa de'i rjes su byed pa'o //
translated: Subsequent to that object means subsequent to the object that is experienced in the past.

original: don 'das pa kho na la mi gsal ba'i ngo bo rjes su byed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: don 'das pa kho na la mi gsal ba'i ngo bo rjes su byed pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is subsequent to the past object alone because it has the nature of non-clarity.

original: gang zhig gis rjes su byed par 'gyur ba 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: gang zhig gis rjes su byed par 'gyur ba 'das pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni cung zad kyang med do //
translated: There is nothing at all that is past and so on that it would be subsequent to.

original: snang ba de yang rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: snang ba de yang rnam par shes pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa kho na yin te /
translated: Moreover, that appearance is only of the nature of consciousness,

original: phyi rol gyi la mi gsal ba'i ngo bo med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phyi rol gyi la mi gsal ba'i ngo bo med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the external object does not have the nature of non-clarity.

original: de'i rjes su byed pa nyid kyi rgyur nyams su myong ba lta bus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i rjes su byed pa nyid kyi rgyur nyams su myong ba lta bus zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To explain that it is the cause of being subsequent to that, he says, ‚ÄúIt is like the experience of the object in the past.‚Äù

original: de ltar gyis don nyams su myong ba ji lta bu skyes pa des gzhag pa'i bag chags gang yin pa de las skye ba'i rnam par shes pa ni nyams su myong ba'i don gyi rnam par skye'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar gyis don nyams su myong ba ji lta bu skyes pa des gzhag pa'i bag chags gang yin pa de las skye ba'i rnam par shes pa ni nyams su myong ba'i don gyi rnam par skye'o zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning of that is this: the consciousness that arises from the latent impressions deposited by the experience of an object in that way arises in the aspect of the experienced object.

original: da lta'i gnas skabs na don nyams su myong ba'i phyir 'das pa la ni don nyams su myong ba de lta bu las skye bar rigs grang na /
analyzed: da lta'i gnas skabs na don nyams su myong ba'i phyir 'das pa la ni don nyams su myong ba de lta bu las skye bar rigs grang na /
translated: Since the object is experienced in the present state, it is reasonable that it arises from the experience of the object in the past.

original: ma 'ongs pa la go ji ltar te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa la go ji ltar te /
translated: But how is it in the future?

original: de la don nyams su myong ba ni med do zhe na /
analyzed: de la don nyams su myong ba ni med do zhe na /
translated: Since there is no experience of the object in the future, how is it?

original: de la yang don 'di lta bu zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu'i sgra las brjod pa dang 'dres @121b ba'i rnam par rtog pa skye ba gang yin pa de nyid rang rig pa yin pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba de lta bu yin
analyzed: de la yang don 'di lta bu zhig 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu'i sgra las brjod pa dang 'dres @121b ba'i rnam par rtog pa skye ba gang yin pa de nyid rang rig pa yin pa'i phyir nyams su myong ba de lta bu yin
translated: In that case, the conceptual thought that arises mixed with the expression ‚Äúsuch an object will occur‚Äù is reflexive awareness itself, and thus it is that kind of experience.

original: la des gzhag pa'i bag chags las skye ba'i phyir nyes pa med do //
analyzed: la des gzhag pa'i bag chags las skye ba'i phyir nyes pa med do //
translated: Since it arises from the latent impressions deposited by that, there is no fault.

original: de bzhin du dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa la yang lung ji lta ba bzhin du sgra'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa nyams su myong ba'i bag chags las skye ba rnam par bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dbang phyug la sogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa la yang lung ji lta ba bzhin du sgra'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa nyams su myong ba'i bag chags las skye ba rnam par bshad par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the conceptual thoughts of ƒ™≈õvara, etc., should be explained as arising from the latent impressions of the experience of conceptual thoughts that have the form of words, just as in the scriptures.

original: de ltar na 'das pa la sogs pa yul ma yin pa'i phyir phan par byed ba ma yin pa ni yul ma yin te zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de nges pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na 'das pa la sogs pa yul ma yin pa'i phyir phan par byed ba ma yin pa ni yul ma yin te zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de nges pa nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, it is certain that what was said, ‚Äúbecause the past, etc., are not objects, they are not beneficial,‚Äù is correct.

original: de lta yin na gsal ba phan 'dogs par ma grub pa can rnams yul ma yin pa'i phyir spyi'i shes pa la snang ba med do //
analyzed: de lta yin na gsal ba phan 'dogs par ma grub pa can rnams yul ma yin pa'i phyir spyi'i shes pa la snang ba med do //
translated: If that is so, since the unestablished benefactors are not objects, there is no appearance in the cognition of the universal.

original: de bas na rnam par shes pa la snang ba'i phyir gsal ba'i rnams kyis nus so zhes smras pa gang yin pa de ma nges pa nyid du bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rnam par shes pa la snang ba'i phyir gsal ba'i rnams kyis nus so zhes smras pa gang yin pa de ma nges pa nyid du bshad pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, what was said, ‚Äúbecause of appearing to consciousness, the particulars are capable,‚Äù is explained as uncertain.

original: da ni snang ba khas blangs nas ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir yod pa dang med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: da ni snang ba khas blangs nas ma nges pa nyid du bstan pa'i phyir yod pa dang med pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that, having accepted appearances, they are not ascertained, he says, ‚ÄúIf it exists or does not exist,‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam par shes pa don yod na ni yod la de med na ni med pa ni yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa ste /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa don yod na ni yod la de med na ni med pa ni yod pa dang med pa'i rjes su byed pa ste /
translated: If consciousness exists, it exists; if it does not exist, it does not exist. It follows existence and nonexistence.

original: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa la don gyi nus pa yod par mngon no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rnam par shes pa la don gyi nus pa yod par mngon no //
translated: Therefore, it is evident that consciousness has the power to be an object.

original: snang ba'i phyir ni ma yin te /
analyzed: snang ba'i phyir ni ma yin te /
translated: But it is not because of appearance.

original: 'di ltar dngos po'i tshul gyis ni spyi rnam par rtog pa can gyi rnam par shes pa la mi snang yang nus pa khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar dngos po'i tshul gyis ni spyi rnam par rtog pa can gyi rnam par shes pa la mi snang yang nus pa khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, in terms of the mode of being of things, even though the universal does not appear to conceptual consciousness, its power is accepted.

original: de nyid gsal ba la ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
analyzed: de nyid gsal ba la ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston te /
translated: He teaches just that with ‚ÄúThe appearance of a universal that is not included in the individual . . .‚Äù

original: gsal ba la ma gtogs pa spyi snang ba ni med do //
analyzed: gsal ba la ma gtogs pa spyi snang ba ni med do //
translated: The appearance of a universal that is not included in the individual does not exist.

original: spyi snang ba can rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de yang kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i rnam pa can kho na yin te /
analyzed: spyi snang ba can rnam par rtog pa'i shes pa gang yin pa de yang kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i rnam pa can kho na yin te /
translated: And that conceptual consciousness that has the appearance of a universal also has the aspect of color, shape, and so on.

original: de la ni kha dog la sogs pa'i rnam pa ma gtogs pa spyi'i rnam pa gzhan ni mi snang ngo //
analyzed: de la ni kha dog la sogs pa'i rnam pa ma gtogs pa spyi'i rnam pa gzhan ni mi snang ngo //
translated: In that case, apart from the aspects of color and so on, no other general aspect appears.

original: spyi ni kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: spyi ni kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa'i bdag nyid kyang ma yin te /
translated: And a universal is not the nature of color, shape, and so on.

original: de lta bas na dngos po'i tshul gyis na rnam par shes pa la spyi mi snang ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po'i tshul gyis na rnam par shes pa la spyi mi snang ngo //
translated: Therefore, in terms of the mode of being of things, a universal does not appear to consciousness.

original: 'on kyang khyed kyi gzhung lugs kyis rnam par shes pa la mi snang ba de la byed pa yod cing nus pa yod pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'on kyang khyed kyi gzhung lugs kyis rnam par shes pa la mi snang ba de la byed pa yod cing nus pa yod pa'i phyir te /
translated: However, in your system, that which does not appear to consciousness has activity and has the capacity.

original: 'dis 'bras bu byed cing bskyed pas na byed pa ni nus pa la bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis 'bras bu byed cing bskyed pas na byed pa ni nus pa la bya'o //
translated: Because it produces and generates an effect, activity is said to be the capacity.

original: de ltar na snang ba med du zin kyang nus pa khas blangs par bstan pa yin no //üîΩsnang ba yod du zin kyang nus @122a * //
analyzed: de ltar na snang ba med du zin kyang nus pa khas blangs par bstan pa yin no // snang ba yod du zin kyang nus @122a * //
translated: Thus, even though there is no appearance, the capacity is accepted.

original: pa med par bstan pa'i phyir skra la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: pa med par bstan pa'i phyir skra la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to show that even though there is an appearance, there is no capacity, he says, ‚ÄúEven though there is an appearance of hair and so on,‚Äù and so on.

original: dngos po nyid las nyams shing bral bas na nyams pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po nyid las nyams shing bral bas na nyams pa'o //
translated: It is damaged because it is impaired and deprived of being a thing.

original: sgra la sogs pa nyid nyams pa yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: sgra la sogs pa nyid nyams pa yin pas zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: The words ‚Äúand so on‚Äù are to be supplied after ‚Äúsound,‚Äù etc.

original: de dag ni rab rib can la sogs pa'i shes pa la snang na 'on kyang de rnams la byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag ni rab rib can la sogs pa'i shes pa la snang na 'on kyang de rnams la byed pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even though they appear to the consciousnesses of those with eye disease, etc., they are not productive of those consciousnesses.

original: byed pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni snga ma bzhin du bye brag tu bshad pa'i phyir byed pa med pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni nus pa med pa brjod de /
analyzed: byed pa zhes bya ba'i sgra ni snga ma bzhin du bye brag tu bshad pa'i phyir byed pa med pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni nus pa med pa brjod de /
translated: The word ‚Äúproductive‚Äù is explained as above. The word ‚Äúnonproductive‚Äù indicates that they are not capable of producing consciousnesses.

original: rnam par shes pa skyed par mi nus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa skyed par mi nus pa'i phyir zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are not capable of producing consciousnesses.

original: de ltar na nus pa med kyang snang ba'i phyir ;
analyzed: de ltar na nus pa med kyang snang ba'i phyir ;
translated: Thus, even though they are not capable of producing consciousnesses, they appear.

original: snang ba'i phyir nus pa yod do zhes bya ba ma nges so zhes bshad pa yin no //üîΩde dag de gcig la phan na //
analyzed: snang ba'i phyir nus pa yod do zhes bya ba ma nges so zhes bshad pa yin no // de dag de gcig la phan na //
translated: Therefore, the statement ‚ÄúThey exist because they appear‚Äù is not established.üîΩIf they are not productive of a single consciousness,

original: ji ltar blo gcig nyid la min //
analyzed: ji ltar blo gcig nyid la min //
translated: how could they be productive of a single cognition?

original: zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de la gzhan gyi lan gyi dogs pa bsu bar gal te tha dang min zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de la gzhan gyi lan gyi dogs pa bsu bar gal te tha dang min zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this, the opponent might say, ‚ÄúEven though they are not productive of a single consciousness, they are productive of a single cognition.‚Äù

original: rnam pa gcig pa can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig pa can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: the meaning is: having the same aspect.

original: tha dad rnams la zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid rnams la'o //
analyzed: tha dad rnams la zhes bya ba ni rang gi mtshan nyid rnams la'o //
translated: With regard to different things means with regard to particularities.

original: du ma las zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: du ma las zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed de /
translated: He explains with regard to many, etc.

original: mtshan nyid mi mthun pa de dag gi rnam par ni de dag gi rnam pa'o //
analyzed: mtshan nyid mi mthun pa de dag gi rnam par ni de dag gi rnam pa'o //
translated: The aspect of those is the aspect of those different things.

original: blo gang la de gzhag cing gtad pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: blo gang la de gzhag cing gtad pa yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: That cognition in which that is placed, that is to say, is called that.

original: gal te mtshan nyid mi mthun pa rnams kho na las skye na ni /
analyzed: gal te mtshan nyid mi mthun pa rnams kho na las skye na ni /
translated: If it arises only from different things,

original: de lta bur ni tha mi dad par snang bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na snang ba'ang 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta bur ni tha mi dad par snang bar mi 'gyur ba zhig na snang ba'ang 'gyur te /
translated: it would not appear as undifferentiated, but it does appear.

original: de lta bas na mtshan nyid mi mthun pa rnams kho na las skye ba ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang spyi ni dngos po las skye'o zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bas na mtshan nyid mi mthun pa rnams kho na las skye ba ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang spyi ni dngos po las skye'o zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it does not arise only from different things, but rather the universal arises from a thing.üîΩWith regard to the apprehensions of universals, etc.

original: spyi'i 'dzin pa rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs so //
analyzed: spyi'i 'dzin pa rnams la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni lan 'debs so //
translated: is the reply.

original: 'di skad du bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said.

original: gal te rang gi mtshan nyid rnams rang gi rnam par 'jog pas spyi'i rnam pa can gyi blo rnams skyed par byed pa yin par 'dod na ni de'i tshe ji ltar tha dad pa rnams la tha mi dad pa snang ba zhes bya ba 'di rung bar 'gyur
analyzed: gal te rang gi mtshan nyid rnams rang gi rnam par 'jog pas spyi'i rnam pa can gyi blo rnams skyed par byed pa yin par 'dod na ni de'i tshe ji ltar tha dad pa rnams la tha mi dad pa snang ba zhes bya ba 'di rung bar 'gyur
translated: If you assert that particular instances generate cognitions that possess a universal aspect by way of their own characteristics, then how could it be tenable to say that different things appear as undifferentiated?

original: ba zhig na de ni med de /
analyzed: ba zhig na de ni med de /
translated: It is not tenable.

original: 'di ltar spyi 'dzin pa'i blo rnams la ni rang gi mtshan nyid mi snang ba nyid do //
analyzed: 'di ltar spyi 'dzin pa'i blo rnams la ni rang gi mtshan nyid mi snang ba nyid do //
translated: Because in the case of cognitions apprehending universals, particular instances do not appear.

original: 'di ltar spyi 'dzin pa'i blo rnams la rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba zhig tu khas len na rnam par brtag pa gsum te /üîΩmig la sogs pa'i blo la gsal ba rnams ngo bo gang gis snang ba de @122b nyid spyi'i blo rnams la yang snang ba'am /
analyzed: 'di ltar spyi 'dzin pa'i blo rnams la rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba zhig tu khas len na rnam par brtag pa gsum te / mig la sogs pa'i blo la gsal ba rnams ngo bo gang gis snang ba de @122b nyid spyi'i blo rnams la yang snang ba'am /
translated: If you accept that particular instances appear to cognitions apprehending universals, there are three alternatives.üîΩThe clarity that appears to cognitions such as the eye consciousness is the same that appears to cognitions apprehending universals.

original: spyi'i blo la snang ba'i ngo bo gang yin pa de nyid rang gi mtshan nyid rnams kyi yin pa'am /
analyzed: spyi'i blo la snang ba'i ngo bo gang yin pa de nyid rang gi mtshan nyid rnams kyi yin pa'am /
translated: Or the entity that appears to cognitions apprehending universals is the particular instances.

original: gang gis na ngo bo gcig ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la snang ba cig shos ni rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo la snang bar 'gyur ba khyad par gcig la ngo bo gnyis yod pa yin pa zhig tu khas blang grang /
analyzed: gang gis na ngo bo gcig ni mig gi rnam par shes pa la snang ba cig shos ni rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo la snang bar 'gyur ba khyad par gcig la ngo bo gnyis yod pa yin pa zhig tu khas blang grang /
translated: How could one accept that there are two natures in one thing, one appearing to the eye consciousness and the other appearing to a conceptual consciousness?

original: de la phyogs dang po ltar yin na ni mig la sogs pa'i blo bzhin du rang gi mtshan nyid med na spyi'i blo rnams kyang med par 'gyur ba zhig na de ltar yang ma yin te /
analyzed: de la phyogs dang po ltar yin na ni mig la sogs pa'i blo bzhin du rang gi mtshan nyid med na spyi'i blo rnams kyang med par 'gyur ba zhig na de ltar yang ma yin te /
translated: If it were the first case, then like the consciousnesses of the eye and so on, if there were no specific characteristics, there would be no consciousnesses of universals. But that is not so,

original: de med kyang rang gi mtshan nyid med kyang spyi'i blo de dag yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med kyang rang gi mtshan nyid med kyang spyi'i blo de dag yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because even though they do not exist, those consciousnesses of universals exist even though there are no specific characteristics.

original: phyogs gnyis pa med par bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩrang gi rnam par shes pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: phyogs gnyis pa med par bstan pa'i phyir / rang gi rnam par shes pa la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to teach that the second case does not exist,üîΩhe says, ‚ÄúBecause it is not tenable that a consciousness of a universal is produced from a specific characteristic.‚Äù

original: rang gi rnam par shes pa ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi rnam par shes pa ni mig la sogs pa'i rnam par shes pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIts own consciousness‚Äù is the eye consciousness and so on.

original: de dag ni gsal ba thun mong ma yin pa snang ba can yin pa'i phyir rang gi rnam par shes pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag ni gsal ba thun mong ma yin pa snang ba can yin pa'i phyir rang gi rnam par shes pa yin no //
translated: They are the consciousnesses of those very things, because they are the appearance of the uncommon clarity of those things.

original: spyi'i rnam pa las rnam pa gzhan du thun mong ma yin pa'i rnam par snang ste /
analyzed: spyi'i rnam pa las rnam pa gzhan du thun mong ma yin pa'i rnam par snang ste /
translated: The uncommon appearance of a form, for example, is not the appearance of a sound.

original: gal te spyi'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa la snang ba'i ngo bo kho na gsal ba rnams kyi yin pa zhig tu gyur na /
analyzed: gal te spyi'i rnam pa can gyi shes pa la snang ba'i ngo bo kho na gsal ba rnams kyi yin pa zhig tu gyur na /
translated: If the nature that appears in a consciousness that has a universal as its aspect were the clarity of the things themselves,

original: de'i tshe rang gi rnam par shes pa la rnam pa gzhan du snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe rang gi rnam par shes pa la rnam pa gzhan du snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: then the form would not appear in a different aspect in one‚Äôs consciousness.

original: gal te gsal ba rnams la ngo bo gnyis yod ce na /
analyzed: gal te gsal ba rnams la ngo bo gnyis yod ce na /
translated: If the things themselves have two natures,

original: gcig la rnam pa du ma mi rung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: gcig la rnam pa du ma mi rung ba'i phyir zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: then it is said that ‚Äúit is not possible for a single thing to have many natures.‚Äù

original: gcig dang du ma nyid dag 'gal ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gcig dang du ma nyid dag 'gal ba'i phyir /
translated: Because singularity and plurality are mutually exclusive,

original: gcig la du ma nyid ni rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig la du ma nyid ni rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: it is not logical for a single thing to have many natures.

original: 'dis ni phyogs gsum pa med par bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni phyogs gsum pa med par bshad do //
translated: This explains that there is no third alternative.

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i yang phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ;
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i yang phyir ro zhes bya ba ni ;
translated: And because of the absurd consequence that

original: gcig la du ma nyid du rtog na gang la yang gcig pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gcig la du ma nyid du rtog na gang la yang gcig pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: If one imagines that the many are in one, then nothing would be one.

original: de lta bas na rang gis mtshan nyid kho na khyad par gyi bdag nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de lta bas na rang gis mtshan nyid kho na khyad par gyi bdag nyid yin gyi /
translated: Thus, the specific is the nature of the particular itself.

original: spyi ni khyad par gyi bdag nyid ma yin la /
analyzed: spyi ni khyad par gyi bdag nyid ma yin la /
translated: The universal is not the nature of the specific.

original: khyad par yang spyi'i blo la mi snang ngo //
analyzed: khyad par yang spyi'i blo la mi snang ngo //
translated: And the specific does not appear in the cognition of the universal.

original: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir spyi'i rnam pa can gyi blo 'di ni de las byung zhing /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de lta yin pa de'i phyir spyi'i rnam pa can gyi blo 'di ni de las byung zhing /
translated: Since this is so, this cognition having the aspect of the universal arises from that,

original: don tha dad pa las 'byung zhing don tha dad pa 'dzin pa yin na /
analyzed: don tha dad pa las 'byung zhing don tha dad pa 'dzin pa yin na /
translated: and if it arises from a different object and apprehends a different object,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa can yin na ni tha mi dad cing rnam pa gcig pa can du snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi rnam pa can yin na ni tha mi dad cing rnam pa gcig pa can du snang bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: if it has the aspect of the particular, it would not appear as undifferentiated and having a single aspect.

original: 'on kyang 'di ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pas nyams @123a * //
analyzed: 'on kyang 'di ni rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pas nyams @123a * //
translated: However, it is not impaired by apprehending the particular.

original: su myong bas gzhag pa'i bag chags la brten nas rang bzhin gyis 'khrul pa kho nar skye la brgyud pas ni gsal ba rnams rgyu yin par brjod do //
analyzed: su myong bas gzhag pa'i bag chags la brten nas rang bzhin gyis 'khrul pa kho nar skye la brgyud pas ni gsal ba rnams rgyu yin par brjod do //
translated: and the latent impressions that are deposited by the experience of that, then the error arises naturally, and the manifest is said to be the cause of that.

original: gal te spyi'i blos rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba ma yin na /
analyzed: gal te spyi'i blos rang gi mtshan nyid snang ba ma yin na /
translated: If the universal idea does not appear with the specific characteristic,

original: ji ltar sgra'i shes pa dang / rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa las 'jig rten tha snyad la 'jug ca na /
analyzed: ji ltar sgra'i shes pa dang / rang gi don gyi rjes su dpag pa las 'jig rten tha snyad la 'jug ca na /
translated: how does the world engage in conventional usage through the idea of sound and inference of its object?

original: de'i phyir de mi snang bas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de mi snang bas kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore he says, ‚ÄúEven though it does not appear, etc.‚Äù

original: rang gi mtshan nyid mi snang bas kyang rang la snang ba don med pa la don du lhag par zhen pa'i 'khrul pa'i rgyus 'jig rten tha snyad 'dogs par byed cing 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid mi snang bas kyang rang la snang ba don med pa la don du lhag par zhen pa'i 'khrul pa'i rgyus 'jig rten tha snyad 'dogs par byed cing 'jug par byed de /
translated: Even though the specific characteristic does not appear, the world engages in conventional usage and engages in the designation of the object by the cause of error, which is the adherence to the object as something existent, although it is not.

original: snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don dag gcig tu byas nas 'jug par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba'i don dag gcig tu byas nas 'jug par byed do zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it engages in the object by making the appearance and the object of investigation one.

original: gal te tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo nyid med na tha mi dad pa'i rnam pa can gyi blo mi rung ba yin nam /
analyzed: gal te tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo nyid med na tha mi dad pa'i rnam pa can gyi blo mi rung ba yin nam /
translated: If there is no nature of non-difference, is it not the case that a cognition having the aspect of non-difference is impossible?

original: de lta bas na don rnams tha mi dad pa'i rnam pa yang yod dgos so zhe na /
analyzed: de lta bas na don rnams tha mi dad pa'i rnam pa yang yod dgos so zhe na /
translated: Therefore, it is necessary that objects have an aspect of non-difference.

original: de la snang ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de la snang ba'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response to this, the root text states, ‚ÄúThe universal that appears to . . .‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo de la snang ba'i spyi'i rnam pa de ni don rnams la med de de spyi tha dad pa gsal ba la ma rtogs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang tha mi dad pa ni gsal ba la bzhin du rjes su 'gro baüîΩmed pa'i phyir ro //üîΩtha mi dad pa'i ngo bo nyid med na tha mi dad pa'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa 'brel pa med do zhes smras pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo de la snang ba'i spyi'i rnam pa de ni don rnams la med de de spyi tha dad pa gsal ba la ma rtogs pa mi dmigs pa'i phyir dang tha mi dad pa ni gsal ba la bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir ro // tha mi dad pa'i ngo bo nyid med na tha mi dad pa'i rnam pa can gyi rnam par rtog pa 'brel pa med do zhes smras pa yin zhe na /
translated: The universal that appears to the conceptual cognition does not exist in objects because a universal that is different from the particulars is not perceived, and a universal that is not different from the particulars does not exist in the particulars.üîΩIf there is no nature of non-difference, it is not the case that a conceptual cognition having the aspect of non-difference is impossible.

original: de'i phyir tha dad pa'i tha mi dad pa ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha dad pa'i tha mi dad pa ni ma gtogs so zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: If you say that a conceptual cognition having the aspect of non-difference is impossible if there is no nature of non-difference, then the root text states, ‚ÄúNon-difference is not excluded.‚Äù

original: tha dad pa ni gzhan sel ba'o //
analyzed: tha dad pa ni gzhan sel ba'o //
translated: Difference is the exclusion of other.

original: de nyid tha mi dad pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid tha mi dad pa yin te /
translated: It is not different from that.

original: 'di ltar ji ltar ba lang gi gsal ba gcig la ba lang ma yin pa las ldog pa ltar gzhan yang de dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'di ltar ji ltar ba lang gi gsal ba gcig la ba lang ma yin pa las ldog pa ltar gzhan yang de dang 'dra'o //
translated: Just as one instance of a cow is distinguished from what is not a cow, so are the others.

original: de bas na rnam pa 'dis ni tha dad pa'i tha mi dad pa rang gi mtshan nyid rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa rnams kho na la bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na rnam pa 'dis ni tha dad pa'i tha mi dad pa rang gi mtshan nyid rigs mi mthun pa las ldog pa rnams kho na la bya'o //
translated: Therefore, by this method, difference-that-is-not-different should be understood only in terms of the exclusion of what is of a different type.

original: ma gtogs so zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don ni 'dun pa ma yin pas rnam par dbye ba brgyud do //
analyzed: ma gtogs so zhes bya ba'i sgra'i don ni 'dun pa ma yin pas rnam par dbye ba brgyud do //
translated: The meaning of the term ‚Äúnot excluded‚Äù is not intended, so the analysis is continued.

original: des na tshig gi don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: des na tshig gi don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the meaning of the passage.

original: ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pas na rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid kyi tha dad pa'i tha mi dad pa las gzhan pa snang ba'i rnam pa ni don rnams la med kyi /
analyzed: ji skad bshad pa'i rnam pas na rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid kyi tha dad pa'i tha mi dad pa las gzhan pa snang ba'i rnam pa ni don rnams la med kyi /
translated: The aspect that appears in objects is not different from the nature of the individual intrinsic identity in the way that has been explained, but it is not different from the exclusion of what is of a different type in terms of the nature of the intrinsic identity.

original: 'on kyang mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid kyi tha dad par rigs mi mthun pa las log pas tha mi dad pa kho na thams cad la yod la /
analyzed: 'on kyang mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid kyi tha dad par rigs mi mthun pa las log pas tha mi dad pa kho na thams cad la yod la /
translated: However, all objects have the nature of the exclusion of what is of a different type in terms of the nature of the intrinsic identity.

original: de yang rang bzhin gyis @123b brgyud pas spyi'i rnam pa can gyis mngon par shes pa'i sa bon yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang rang bzhin gyis @123b brgyud pas spyi'i rnam pa can gyis mngon par shes pa'i sa bon yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: The seed of the superknowledges is the universal aspect of the natural lineage.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid kyi gzhan sel ba 'di yang brgyud pas rnam par rtog pa'i bdag po tsam yin gyi snang bas ni ma yin no //üîΩgal te rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i rnam par yang ji ste /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid kyi bdag nyid kyi gzhan sel ba 'di yang brgyud pas rnam par rtog pa'i bdag po tsam yin gyi snang bas ni ma yin no // gal te rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i rnam par yang ji ste /
translated: This exclusion of other, which has the nature of a specific characteristic, is merely the dominant condition for the conceptualization of the natural lineage, but it is not the appearing object.üîΩIf the aspect that appears in conceptualization does not exist,

original: gsal ba rnams la med ce na /
analyzed: gsal ba rnams la med ce na /
translated: why is it that it does not exist for the clear?

original: de ni med pa'i ngo bo yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
analyzed: de ni med pa'i ngo bo yin te zhes bya ba smos so //
translated: The response to that is, ‚ÄúIt is a nonexistent entity.‚Äù

original: ni zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'i don te /
analyzed: ni zhes bya ba ni 'di ltar zhes bya ba'i don te /
translated: The word ‚Äúni‚Äù has the meaning of ‚Äúlike this.‚Äù

original: rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i rnam pa de ni gsal ba rnams la de nyid dang gzhan nyid du de'i rang gi ngo bo rnam par gzhag pa mi nus pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i rnam pa de ni gsal ba rnams la de nyid dang gzhan nyid du de'i rang gi ngo bo rnam par gzhag pa mi nus pa'i phyir ngo bo nyid med pa kho na yin te /
translated: That aspect that appears in conceptualization is just an entity that is nonexistent, because it is not possible to posit its own nature as either the same as or different from the clear.

original: gsal ba las gzhan pa nyid gcig yin na ni /
analyzed: gsal ba las gzhan pa nyid gcig yin na ni /
translated: If it were different from the clear,

original: nyams su myong ba'i blo sna tshogs su snang bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i blo sna tshogs su snang bar 'gyur la /
translated: The various experiences of the mind appear.

original: de nyid yin na ni gsal pa bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir mtshungs pa ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de nyid yin na ni gsal pa bzhin du rjes su 'gro ba med pa'i phyir mtshungs pa ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: If it were that, it would not be similar, because it would not be followed by the clear.

original: gsal ba zhig na yang de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir zhig pas gsal ba zhig pa las spyi'i rnam pa can gyi blong yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsal ba zhig na yang de dang tha mi dad pa'i phyir zhig pas gsal ba zhig pa las spyi'i rnam pa can gyi blong yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And even if it were clear, it would not be clear, because it would not be different from that.

original: de lta bas na rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i rnam pa 'di ni 'khrul pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i rnam pa 'di ni 'khrul pa kho na yin no //
