translated: Therefore, this appearance in the form of an aspect in conceptual cognition is only an error.

original: blo des de kho na 'dzin pa na ste /
analyzed: blo des de kho na 'dzin pa na ste /
translated: When that cognition apprehends reality,

original: de'i rnam par skye ba nyid 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam par skye ba nyid 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: it arises in the form of that, and it is the apprehension of that.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ngo bo med pa'i rnam par 'dzin pa'i phyir bslad cing 'khrul par 'gyur ba'i snga ma rig pa'i mthus rnam par rtog pa rnams la mthu 'di med do zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad zin to //
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ngo bo med pa'i rnam par 'dzin pa'i phyir bslad cing 'khrul par 'gyur ba'i snga ma rig pa'i mthus rnam par rtog pa rnams la mthu 'di med do zhes bya ba la sogs pas bshad zin to //
translated: Thus, because it apprehends the form of essencelessness, it is adulterated and mistaken. This power of conceptual cognition has been explained by the previous reasoning.

original: nyes pa yongs su spangs pa bshad nas /
analyzed: nyes pa yongs su spangs pa bshad nas /
translated: Having explained the complete abandonment of faults,üîΩnow, in order to explain the complete abandonment of the cause of faults, he says:

original: de ni mtshungs pa nyid du bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir /üîΩgzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de ni mtshungs pa nyid du bsgrub pa bstan pa'i phyir / gzhan yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: In order to demonstrate that this is the same,üîΩhe says, ‚ÄúMoreover, etc.‚Äù

original: gzhan gyis mtshungs pa ma yin zhes bya ba smras te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis mtshungs pa ma yin zhes bya ba smras te /
translated: ‚Äú It is not the same as the other‚Äù means that it is not the same as the other, i.e., the particulars.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni gsal ba tha dad pa rnams la yang ngo //
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni gsal ba tha dad pa rnams la yang ngo //
translated: ‚Äú In that‚Äù means in the different particulars.üîΩ‚Äú The cognition is the same in regard to that alone‚Äù means that the cognition is the same in regard to the universal alone.

original: spyi de kho na la blo rnam pa mtshungs pa can du 'gyur bas klan ka mtshungs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: spyi de kho na la blo rnam pa mtshungs pa can du 'gyur bas klan ka mtshungs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: The opponent says that the objection is not the same.

original: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: grub pa'i mtha' smra bas de la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The advocate of tenets says, ‚ÄúIn that, etc.‚Äù

original: gsal ba de la spyi de yod kyang gsal ba rnams nyams su myong ba'i blo dag gis snang ba'i rnam pa mi rtogs te /üîΩmig la sogs pa'i blos gsal ba'i rnam pa dang spyi'i rnam pa gnyi ga rtogs par myong ba ni med pas spyi rtogs pa med pa'i sgo nas kyang ji ltar gsal ba @124a * //
analyzed: gsal ba de la spyi de yod kyang gsal ba rnams nyams su myong ba'i blo dag gis snang ba'i rnam pa mi rtogs te / mig la sogs pa'i blos gsal ba'i rnam pa dang spyi'i rnam pa gnyi ga rtogs par myong ba ni med pas spyi rtogs pa med pa'i sgo nas kyang ji ltar gsal ba @124a * //
translated: Even though the universal exists in that particular, the cognitions that experience the particulars do not understand the aspect of appearance.

original: rnams la rnam pa gcig pa can gyi blor 'gyur /
analyzed: rnams la rnam pa gcig pa can gyi blor 'gyur /
translated: Since there is no experience of the cognition that understands both the aspect of the particular and the aspect of the universal by means of the cognition of the eye, etc., how can the cognition be the same in regard to the particulars, in the sense that it understands the universal?

original: gal te mig la sogs pa blo la spyi'i rnam par rtag pa kho na'o zhe na /
analyzed: gal te mig la sogs pa blo la spyi'i rnam par rtag pa kho na'o zhe na /
translated: If you say that the eye, etc. are always in the form of a universal in the cognition,

original: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then he says, ‚ÄúThat cognition is not experienced as such.‚Äù

original: gsal ba rnams la nyams su myong ba'i blo de ni kha dog dang dbyibs su snang ba dang ldan par yid ches shing nyams su myong ngo //
analyzed: gsal ba rnams la nyams su myong ba'i blo de ni kha dog dang dbyibs su snang ba dang ldan par yid ches shing nyams su myong ngo //
translated: That cognition which experiences the manifest is believed to appear as color and shape.

original: gal te kha dog la sogs pa'i rnam pa kho na spyi yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gal te kha dog la sogs pa'i rnam pa kho na spyi yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the aspect of color, etc. is a universal,

original: spyi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: spyi ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: he says, ‚ÄúA universal is not a different thing.‚Äù

original: de lta bu zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi rnam pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bu zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs kyi rnam pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúSuch‚Äù means the aspect of color and shape.

original: kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa ni yin la spyi ni yon tan tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha dog dang dbyibs la sogs pa ni yin la spyi ni yon tan tha dad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Color and shape, etc. are different things because they are different qualities.

original: de la ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs las ma gtogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la ma gtogs pa zhes bya ba ni kha dog dang dbyibs las ma gtogs pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúNot included in that‚Äù means not included in color and shape.

original: de ltar na re zhig spyi tha dad par smra ba bye brag pa dang rigs pa can la sogs pa la tha mi dad pa'i shes pa mi rung ste /
analyzed: de ltar na re zhig spyi tha dad par smra ba bye brag pa dang rigs pa can la sogs pa la tha mi dad pa'i shes pa mi rung ste /
translated: Thus, first, for the Vai≈õe·π£ika, NaiyƒÅyika, and so on, who assert that universals are different things, a cognition that is not different is not tenable.

original: spyi med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyi med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no universal.

original: spyi tha mi dad par smra ba grangs can la yang rigs pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir rnam pa spyi yin par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa te /
analyzed: spyi tha mi dad par smra ba grangs can la yang rigs pa ma yin par bstan pa'i phyir rnam pa spyi yin par zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that it is also unreasonable for the SƒÅ·πÉkhya, who maintains that the universal is not different, he says, ‚ÄúThe universal is the mere similarity of the particulars,‚Äù and so on.

original: rnam pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid rnams kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa kho na'i 'dra ba yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa ni rang gi mtshan nyid rnams kyi bdag nyid du gyur pa kho na'i 'dra ba yin no //
translated: The particulars are the individual characteristics. The mere similarity of those is the universal.

original: de nyid spyi yin te grangs can gang la der smra ba yod pa'am /
analyzed: de nyid spyi yin te grangs can gang la der smra ba yod pa'am /
translated: That itself is the universal. The SƒÅ·πÉkhya is one who speaks of that.

original: gang la der smra ba'i ngang tshul yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la der smra ba'i ngang tshul yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: Or, one who has the nature of speaking of that is called that.

original: spyi de khyad par bzhin du rang gi mtshan nyid las tha mi dad pa'i rgyus don gzhan gsal ba gnyis pa la sogs pa la mi 'jug ste /
analyzed: spyi de khyad par bzhin du rang gi mtshan nyid las tha mi dad pa'i rgyus don gzhan gsal ba gnyis pa la sogs pa la mi 'jug ste /
translated: That universal, like a particular, does not engage in a second manifest thing that is different from its individual characteristic because of being non-different from it.

original: de'i phyir spyi de yang tha dad cing rang gi mtshan nyid kho nar gyur to //
analyzed: de'i phyir spyi de yang tha dad cing rang gi mtshan nyid kho nar gyur to //
translated: Therefore, that universal also becomes different and individual.

original: tha dad pa de'i phyir 'dra ba de'i sgo nas kyang tha mi dad par snang ba mi rung ste /
analyzed: tha dad pa de'i phyir 'dra ba de'i sgo nas kyang tha mi dad par snang ba mi rung ste /
translated: Because of that difference, it is also unreasonable for it to appear as non-different through that similarity.

original: gsal ba rnams la zhes bya ba khong nas drang ngo //
analyzed: gsal ba rnams la zhes bya ba khong nas drang ngo //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúin the case of the manifest‚Äù is to be supplied.

original: de ltar na spyi tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa mi rung ba'i phyir gsal ba rnams pa gcig tu snang ba 'di ni 'khrul pa kho na'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na spyi tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa mi rung ba'i phyir gsal ba rnams pa gcig tu snang ba 'di ni 'khrul pa kho na'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: Thus, because a universal cannot be either different or non-different from the individual things in a class, the appearance of the individual things as one is a case of error.

original: da ni gsal ba rnams la gcig tu snang ba nyid med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir yang na yin du zad de zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: da ni gsal ba rnams la gcig tu snang ba nyid med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir yang na yin du zad de zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: Now, in order to show that the individual things do not appear as one, he says, ‚ÄúOr, let us assume that they are not perceived as different.

original: tha dad mi snang blo /
analyzed: tha dad mi snang blo /
translated: The cognition that does not perceive a difference

original: tha dad pa rnams la mi 'dod ces smras pa gang yin pa de yin du zad de de na 'dod pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: tha dad pa rnams la mi 'dod ces smras pa gang yin pa de yin du zad de de na 'dod pa kho na'o zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: is just what we assert, that is, it is just what we maintain.

original: 'di ltar gsal ba la dmigs pa'i blo snang ba tha dad de /
analyzed: 'di ltar gsal ba la dmigs pa'i blo snang ba tha dad de /
translated: In this way, the cognition that perceives the individual things has a different appearance.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: gsal ba de dag mtshungs zhes 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba de dag mtshungs zhes 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it apprehends those individual things as the same.

original: de dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed de de dag la @124b zhes bya ba ni gsal ba dag la'o //
analyzed: de dag la zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed de de dag la @124b zhes bya ba ni gsal ba dag la'o //
translated: He explains this in the passage that begins with ‚Äúin the case of those‚Äù and so on. ‚Äú In the case of those‚Äù refers to the individual things.

original: gal te gcig tu snang yang mtshungs pa'o zhes 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te gcig tu snang yang mtshungs pa'o zhes 'dzin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If you think that even though they appear as one, they are apprehended as similar,

original: gcig tu snang ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: gcig tu snang ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: then the root text states, ‚ÄúThe cognition that perceives them as one . . .‚ÄùüîΩWhat is the problem? The problem is that if the cognition perceives them as one, then it cannot perceive them as similar.üîΩIf you think that the cognition perceives them as one, but it perceives them as similar, then the root text states, ‚ÄúThe cognition that perceives them as one . . .‚ÄùüîΩWhat is the problem? The problem is that if the cognition perceives them as one, then it cannot perceive them as similar.

original: 'o na ci zhe na de nyid yin no snyam mo zhes bya ba ni sngon mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid snang ba 'di yin no zhes de snyam du sems par 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: 'o na ci zhe na de nyid yin no snyam mo zhes bya ba ni sngon mthong ba gang yin pa de nyid snang ba 'di yin no zhes de snyam du sems par 'gyur gyi /
translated: If you think that the cognition perceives them as similar, then the root text states, ‚ÄúThe cognition that perceives them as similar . . .‚ÄùüîΩWhat is the problem? The problem is that if the cognition perceives them as similar, then it cannot perceive them as one.üîΩIf you think that the cognition perceives them as one and also perceives them as similar, then the root text states, ‚ÄúThe cognition that perceives them as one and also perceives them as similar . . .‚ÄùüîΩWhat is the problem? The problem is that if the cognition perceives them as one, then it cannot perceive them as similar.üîΩIf you think that the cognition perceives them as similar, then the root text states, ‚ÄúThe cognition that perceives them as similar . . .‚ÄùüîΩWhat is the problem? The problem is that if the cognition perceives them as similar, then it cannot perceive them as one.üîΩIf you think that the cognition perceives them as one and also perceives them as similar, then the root text states, ‚ÄúThe cognition that perceives them as one and also perceives them as similar . . .‚Äù

original: snga ma dang 'di mtshungs so zhes snyam pa ni ma yin te /üîΩspyi'i tha snyad tha dad pa'i rten can ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: snga ma dang 'di mtshungs so zhes snyam pa ni ma yin te / spyi'i tha snyad tha dad pa'i rten can ni rigs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: What is the problem? The problem is that if the cognition perceives them as one, then it cannot perceive them as similar.üîΩIf you think that the cognition perceives them as one and also perceives them as similar, then the root text states, ‚ÄúThe cognition that perceives them as one and also perceives them as similar . . .‚ÄùüîΩWhat is the problem? The problem is that if the cognition perceives them as one, then it cannot perceive them as similar.üîΩIf you think that the cognition perceives them as one and also perceives them as similar, then the root text states, ‚ÄúThe cognition that perceives them as one and also perceives them as similar . . .‚Äù

original: gal te gnyi ga zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te spyi 'ba' zhig kho na de dag gis 'dzin na ni de'i tshe nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te gnyi ga zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni gal te spyi 'ba' zhig kho na de dag gis 'dzin na ni de'i tshe nyes pa 'dir 'gyur ro //
translated: What is the problem? The problem is that if the cognition perceives them as one, then it cannot perceive them as similar.üîΩIf you think that the cognition perceives them as one

original: 'on kyang spyi'i blos spyi dang rang gi mtshan nyid gnyi ga 'dzin pa de'i phyir nyes pa med de 'di ltar spyi de kho na dang ldan pa'i gsal ba rnams la mtshungs so snyam du 'dzin to zhe ne /
analyzed: 'on kyang spyi'i blos spyi dang rang gi mtshan nyid gnyi ga 'dzin pa de'i phyir nyes pa med de 'di ltar spyi de kho na dang ldan pa'i gsal ba rnams la mtshungs so snyam du 'dzin to zhe ne /
translated: But since the general mind apprehends both the universal and its own character, there is no fault. Thus, it is thought that the particulars that possess that universal are similar.

original: slob dpon gyis 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis 'on kyang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The master [ƒÄryadeva] says, ‚ÄúBut . . .‚Äù and so on.

original: gnyi ga 'dzin par brtag pa na yang de 'di la'o snyam par 'gyur zhing sngar gsal ba zhig la mthong ba'i spyi gang yin pa de gsal ba gzhan 'di la snang ngo zhes de snyam du sems par 'gyur gyi mtshungs so snyam pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gnyi ga 'dzin par brtag pa na yang de 'di la'o snyam par 'gyur zhing sngar gsal ba zhig la mthong ba'i spyi gang yin pa de gsal ba gzhan 'di la snang ngo zhes de snyam du sems par 'gyur gyi mtshungs so snyam pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Even when it is imagined that both are apprehended, it would be thought, ‚ÄúThis is in that,‚Äù and it would be thought, ‚ÄúThe universal that was seen in a previous particular appears in this other particular,‚Äù but it would not be thought that they are similar.

original: 'di skad du spyi yang gsal ba dang mtshan nyid shin tu mi 'dra la gsal ba rnams kyang de dang shin tu mi 'dra'o //
analyzed: 'di skad du spyi yang gsal ba dang mtshan nyid shin tu mi 'dra la gsal ba rnams kyang de dang shin tu mi 'dra'o //
translated: This is stated: The universal and the particulars have completely different characters, and the particulars also have completely different characters from that.

original: de bas na de ltar spyi dang de dang ldan pa dag phan tshun mi mthun na spyi 'byung po'i mgul chings bzhin du gsal ba rnams la gnas su zin kyang 'o na ji ltar de rnams la mtshungs so snyam du rtogs par 'gyur /
analyzed: de bas na de ltar spyi dang de dang ldan pa dag phan tshun mi mthun na spyi 'byung po'i mgul chings bzhin du gsal ba rnams la gnas su zin kyang 'o na ji ltar de rnams la mtshungs so snyam du rtogs par 'gyur /
translated: Therefore, if the universal and those possessing the universal are mutually incompatible, then just like the noose of a ghost, even if the universal were to exist in the manifest phenomena, how could it be understood that they are similar?

original: mgul chings gcig dang 'brel ba'i phyir /
analyzed: mgul chings gcig dang 'brel ba'i phyir /
translated: Because it is related to one noose,

original: 'byung po rnams la spyi'i rnam par 'dzin pa ni med do zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'byung po rnams la spyi'i rnam par 'dzin pa ni med do zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: it is explained that the universal is not apprehended in the ghosts.

original: gal te de nyid ces bya ba ni ba lang nyid la sogs pa don gzhan du gyur pa ni gsal ba de dag gi mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te de nyid ces bya ba ni ba lang nyid la sogs pa don gzhan du gyur pa ni gsal ba de dag gi mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: If the so-called universal, such as cowness, is a different object, it is the similarity of those manifest phenomena.

original: des de dag mtshungs so zhe na /
analyzed: des de dag mtshungs so zhe na /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúBy what is it similar?‚ÄùüîΩIn what way is the universal nature similar to the other, and the individual characteristics of those other?

original: ji ltar spyi'i bdag nyid gzhan dang rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan du mtshungs pa yin pa rnam pa gang gis mtshungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar spyi'i bdag nyid gzhan dang rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan du mtshungs pa yin pa rnam pa gang gis mtshungs te /
translated: By what is it similar?

original: gang gis kyang ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis kyang ma yin no snyam du bsams pa yin no //
translated: By nothing at all.

original: 'di ltar gsal ba'i ngo bo'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir spyi gsal ba rnams kyis mtshungs pa yin par brtag grang na de ni med de spyi gsal ba dag dang rang gi mtshan nyid shin tu mi mthun pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgal te gsal @125a * //
analyzed: 'di ltar gsal ba'i ngo bo'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir spyi gsal ba rnams kyis mtshungs pa yin par brtag grang na de ni med de spyi gsal ba dag dang rang gi mtshan nyid shin tu mi mthun pa'i phyir ro // gal te gsal @125a * //
translated: Thus, if the universals are considered to be similar to the manifest particulars because they conform to the manifest nature, that is not so, because the universals are quite dissimilar to the manifest particulars.

original: ba'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir mtshungs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ba'i rjes su byed pa'i phyir mtshungs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: If they are not similar because they do not conform to the manifest,

original: 'on kyang de dag dang 'brel ba'i phyir gsal ba dag dang 'brel pa'i phyir spyi gsal ba rnams kyis mtshungs pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: 'on kyang de dag dang 'brel ba'i phyir gsal ba dag dang 'brel pa'i phyir spyi gsal ba rnams kyis mtshungs pa yin no zhe na /
translated: then they are similar to the manifest particulars because they are related to them.

original: de ni de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: de ni de lta ma yin no //
translated: That is not so.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: rag ma las pa la gsal ba la rag ma las pa la ste /
analyzed: rag ma las pa la gsal ba la rag ma las pa la ste /
translated: Because they are not dependent on the manifest, that is, they are not dependent on the manifest particulars.

original: de dag gis phan ma btags pa la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de dag gis phan ma btags pa la zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that they are not helped by them.

original: spyi don gzhan dang 'brel pa gsal ba rnams kyi mtshungs pa yin na ni de'i tshe /
analyzed: spyi don gzhan dang 'brel pa gsal ba rnams kyi mtshungs pa yin na ni de'i tshe /
translated: If the universals are similar to the manifest particulars because they are related to something else, their object,

original: ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: ha cang thal bar 'gyur te /
translated: then there is an absurd consequence.

original: thams cad kyang thams cad kyi mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thams cad kyang thams cad kyi mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: and all would be the same for all.

original: don rnam pa gcig tu na spyi gsal ba dag dang 'brel du zin kyang 'on kyang ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de tsam gyis gzhan dang gzhan du mtshungs pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: don rnam pa gcig tu na spyi gsal ba dag dang 'brel du zin kyang 'on kyang ha cang thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir de tsam gyis gzhan dang gzhan du mtshungs pa ni ma yin te /
translated: In one sense, even though universals are related to particulars, still, because of the absurdity of the consequence, they are not the same in every respect.

original: 'khar ba yang 'khar ba thogs pa rnams dang 'brel pa'i phyir de rnams kyi mtshungs pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'khar ba yang 'khar ba thogs pa rnams dang 'brel pa'i phyir de rnams kyi mtshungs pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: For, a stick would be the same as those who carry sticks, because it is related to them.

original: gzhan gyis gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Another says: If you think that, etc.

original: mtshungs pa'o snyam du 'dzin pa'i phyir gsal ba rnams la snang ba tha dad par sgrub par ni byed na de yang 'gal te 'di ltar gal te gsal ba de dag mtshungs na ni ji ltar tha dad pa'i blos gzung bar bya ba kho na yin no zhes
analyzed: mtshungs pa'o snyam du 'dzin pa'i phyir gsal ba rnams la snang ba tha dad par sgrub par ni byed na de yang 'gal te 'di ltar gal te gsal ba de dag mtshungs na ni ji ltar tha dad pa'i blos gzung bar bya ba kho na yin no zhes
translated: If you prove that the appearances of particulars are different because you think that they are the same, that is contradictory, because if those particulars are the same, how could they be apprehended by a different cognition?

original: nges par gzung bar bya ba bcas pa yin te tha mi dad pa'i blos gzung bar bya ba ma yin par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i yang tha tshig go //
analyzed: nges par gzung bar bya ba bcas pa yin te tha mi dad pa'i blos gzung bar bya ba ma yin par yang 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'i yang tha tshig go //
translated: and it is to be apprehended as a single thing, and it is not to be apprehended as a different thing.

original: 'di ltar gang la spyi yang cung zad cig yod la khyad par yang cung zad cig yod pa de la mtshungs so snyam du 'dzin gyi /
analyzed: 'di ltar gang la spyi yang cung zad cig yod la khyad par yang cung zad cig yod pa de la mtshungs so snyam du 'dzin gyi /
translated: Thus, when there is a universal and also a particular, one thinks that they are the same.

original: gang la shin tu tha mi dad pa'am tha dad pa yod pa de la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la shin tu tha mi dad pa'am tha dad pa yod pa de la ni ma yin no //
translated: But when there is complete non-difference or complete difference, one does not think that they are the same.

original: de nyid du mtshungs pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
analyzed: de nyid du mtshungs pa'o zhes bya ba la sogs pas ston to //
translated: This is what is shown by the words ‚Äúin that case, they are the same, etc.‚Äù

original: gsal ba 'di dag la ste /
analyzed: gsal ba 'di dag la ste /
translated: ‚ÄúIn these manifestations‚Äù

original: 'dis ni khyad par gyi ngo bo bstan to //
analyzed: 'dis ni khyad par gyi ngo bo bstan to //
translated: This shows the nature of the particular.

original: tha mi dad par snang ba ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni grub ces bya ba'i khong nas dbyung se /
analyzed: tha mi dad par snang ba ma yin nam zhes bya ba ni grub ces bya ba'i khong nas dbyung se /
translated: ‚ÄúAre they not perceived as non-different?‚Äù is supplied from the commentary.

original: 'di ni spyi'i ngo bo bshad do //
analyzed: 'di ni spyi'i ngo bo bshad do //
translated: This explains the nature of the universal.

original: de ltar thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bo gzung ba'i phyir gsal ba rnams la mtshungs so snyam du 'dzin to zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: de ltar thun mong dang thun mong ma yin pa'i ngo bo gzung ba'i phyir gsal ba rnams la mtshungs so snyam du 'dzin to zhes bya ba ni bsdus pa'i don yin no //
translated: Thus, the meaning of the summary is this: ‚ÄúOne thinks that the manifestations are the same because they apprehend the common and uncommon natures.‚Äù

original: slob dpon gyis de mthong ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: slob dpon gyis de mthong ba la zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: The master says, ‚ÄúIn seeing that . . .‚Äù

original: de mthong ba la zhes bya ba ni gsal ba 'dzin pa'i shes pa la'o //
analyzed: de mthong ba la zhes bya ba ni gsal ba 'dzin pa'i shes pa la'o //
translated: ‚ÄúIn seeing that‚Äù means in the cognition that apprehends the manifestations.

original: tha dad pa tha mi dad pa dag ces bya ba ni khyad par dang spyi dag go //
analyzed: tha dad pa tha mi dad pa dag ces bya ba ni khyad par dang spyi dag go //
translated: ‚ÄúThe different and the non-different‚Äù means the particular and the universal.

original: @125b 'bras bu gcig 'dra zhes bya ba la ji ltar gsal ba mtshan nyid mi mthun pa rnams kyis kyang 'bras bu gcig byed pa de ni bstan zin te /
analyzed: @125b 'bras bu gcig 'dra zhes bya ba la ji ltar gsal ba mtshan nyid mi mthun pa rnams kyis kyang 'bras bu gcig byed pa de ni bstan zin te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe same effect‚Äù means that the different manifestations produce the same effect. This has already been explained.

original: 'bras bu gcig pa de nyid de dag gi 'dra ba yin pas 'dra ba de kho nas mtshungs pa dag tu shes kyi tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag 'dzin pa'i phyir ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig pa de nyid de dag gi 'dra ba yin pas 'dra ba de kho nas mtshungs pa dag tu shes kyi tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag 'dzin pa'i phyir ni ma yin no ;
translated: That same effect is their similarity. Therefore, they are known to be the same because of that similarity, not because they apprehend the different and the non-different.

original: / ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: / ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: kho bos ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: kho bos ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúI have already refuted this in detail.‚Äù

original: don gyi shes pa la zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i shes pa la'o //
analyzed: don gyi shes pa la zhes bya ba ni nyams su myong ba'i shes pa la'o //
translated: With regard to the cognition of the object means with regard to the cognition of experience.

original: rnam pa gnyis pa la zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag go //üîΩgnyis rab tu brtags pas zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa dang mi mtshungs pa'i ngo bor rab tu brtag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam pa gnyis pa la zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa dang tha mi dad pa dag go // gnyis rab tu brtags pas zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa dang mi mtshungs pa'i ngo bor rab tu brtag pa'o //
translated: The two alternatives means the alternatives of difference and nondifference.üîΩThrough the thorough investigation of the two means through the thorough investigation of the two in terms of sameness and difference.

original: rtogs pa'i yul nyid du zhes bya ba ni gcig pa nyid du sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid du'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i yul nyid du zhes bya ba ni gcig pa nyid du sgro 'dogs par byed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i yul nyid du'o //
translated: The object of the conceptual thought means the object of the conceptual thought that superimposes identity.

original: 'dis zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i blos so //
analyzed: 'dis zhes bya ba ni rnam par rtog pa'i blos so //
translated: By this means by the conceptual mind.

original: de ltar zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa'i ngo bo nyid du'o //üîΩgzhan gyis de dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes bya ba ni mtshungs pa'i ngo bo nyid du'o // gzhan gyis de dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smras te /
translated: Thus means in terms of sameness.üîΩAnother says, ‚ÄúThose cognitions are the effect of those manifestations, and they are different.‚Äù

original: gsal ba de dag gi 'bras bu ni blo yin na de yang tha dad do zhes bya ba 'di tsam ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i cha yin no //
analyzed: gsal ba de dag gi 'bras bu ni blo yin na de yang tha dad do zhes bya ba 'di tsam ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i cha yin no //
translated: This much is the portion of the verse.

original: dngos po re re zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam par 'grel te /
analyzed: dngos po re re zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni rnam par 'grel te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúeach thing‚Äù and so on is an explanation.

original: dngos po dang dngos po la de snang ba'i rnam par shes pa yang /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po la de snang ba'i rnam par shes pa yang /
translated: Things and the consciousness that appears as those things

original: gsal ba snang ba'i rnam par shes pa yang de dang 'dra bar gsal ba dang 'dra bar tha da dpa'i phyir /
analyzed: gsal ba snang ba'i rnam par shes pa yang de dang 'dra bar gsal ba dang 'dra bar tha da dpa'i phyir /
translated: are like the appearance of clarity. The consciousness that appears as clarity is also like that, because it is similar to clarity.

original: ji ltar rang gi mtshan nyid thams tha dad pa ltar de dag nyams su myong ba'i shes pa de dag kyang de dang 'dra ba yin na ji ltar gsal ba rnams 'bras bu gcig pa nyid yin te ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: ji ltar rang gi mtshan nyid thams tha dad pa ltar de dag nyams su myong ba'i shes pa de dag kyang de dang 'dra ba yin na ji ltar gsal ba rnams 'bras bu gcig pa nyid yin te ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: If it is like that, then just as all of their intrinsic natures are different, the consciousnesses that experience them are also like that. How could they be the same effect? They could not be!

original: gal te nyams su myong ba'i rnam par shes pas gsal ba rnams 'bras bu gcig pa can ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang rnam par rtog pa can gang zhig gi ngo bor sgro 'dogs par 'jug pa de la ltos nas yin no ze na /
analyzed: gal te nyams su myong ba'i rnam par shes pas gsal ba rnams 'bras bu gcig pa can ni ma yin gyi 'on kyang rnam par rtog pa can gang zhig gi ngo bor sgro 'dogs par 'jug pa de la ltos nas yin no ze na /
translated: If you say that the consciousness that experiences them does not have clarity as its same effect, but rather that it is the conceptual consciousness that superimposes the nature of those things that has the same effect,

original: de'i phyir de dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: then the root text states, ‚ÄúTherefore, the consciousnesses that experience them,‚Äù and so on.

original: gsal ba de dag gi 'bras bu ni nyams su myong ba'i shes pa de yin gyi rnam par rtog pa can gyi shes pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba de dag gi 'bras bu ni nyams su myong ba'i shes pa de yin gyi rnam par rtog pa can gyi shes pa ni ma yin te /
translated: The result of those cognitions is the experience, not the conceptual cognition,

original: de ni gsal ba med kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni gsal ba med kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that exists even when there is no experience.

original: mtshungs so snyam du de ltar rnam par rtog pa skye ba de nyid kyang gsal ba rnams la ci zhig mtshungs na /
analyzed: mtshungs so snyam du de ltar rnam par rtog pa skye ba de nyid kyang gsal ba rnams la ci zhig mtshungs na /
translated: The idea that they are similar arises from the conceptual cognition, but what is similar among the cognitions?

original: gang gis na gsal ba kha cig la mtshungs pa'o snyam du 'dzin gyi thams cad @126a * //üîΩla ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la 'bras bu gcig pa nyid kyi 'dra ba nges par byed pa yin par brjod de /
analyzed: gang gis na gsal ba kha cig la mtshungs pa'o snyam du 'dzin gyi thams cad @126a * // la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba 'di la 'bras bu gcig pa nyid kyi 'dra ba nges par byed pa yin par brjod de /
translated: One thinks that some cognitions are similar, but not all.üîΩThe cause of the idea that they are similar is the single result, which is the experience.

original: de la rnam par rtog pa can gyi shes pa de kho na la ltos nas 'bras bu gcig pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa rigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la rnam par rtog pa can gyi shes pa de kho na la ltos nas 'bras bu gcig pa nyid du rnam par gzhag pa rigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable to posit a single result in relation to conceptual cognition alone.

original: de lta bas na nyams su myong ba'i shes pa kho na dngos su gsal ba rnams kyi 'dra ba yin na de yang tha dad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na nyams su myong ba'i shes pa kho na dngos su gsal ba rnams kyi 'dra ba yin na de yang tha dad do //
translated: Thus, the experience is the actual similarity of the cognitions, but it is different from them.

original: gal te 'o na chu chu ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gcig pa yin no zhe na /üîΩbu ma pa la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gal te 'o na chu chu ba la sogs pa'i 'bras bu gcig pa yin no zhe na / bu ma pa la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: If you say that the effect is the same, such as water for water,üîΩthen the response is, ‚ÄúThe effect of a pot, etc., is not the same as the effect of a cloth, etc.‚Äù

original: bum pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu chu chu ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ras yug rnams kyis grang ba sel ba zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa bsdu'o //
analyzed: bum pa la sogs pa'i 'bras bu chu chu ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa zhes bya ba'i sgras ni ras yug rnams kyis grang ba sel ba zhes bya ba de lta bu la sogs pa bsdu'o //
translated: The phrase ‚Äúsuch as water for water‚Äù means that the effect of a pot, etc., is not the same as the effect of a cloth, etc. The phrase ‚Äúsuch as‚Äù includes the removal of cold by blankets, etc.

original: rdzas re re'i zhes bya ba ni rdzas dang rdzas kyi khyad par de'i sgo nas tha dad pa yin pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rdzas re re'i zhes bya ba ni rdzas dang rdzas kyi khyad par de'i sgo nas tha dad pa yin pas zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: ‚ÄúFor each substance‚Äù means that the difference is in terms of the particular substance.

original: slob dpon gyis de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: slob dpon gyis de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: The Master responds, ‚ÄúThat is not so.‚Äù

original: 'di skad du bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is the explanation.

original: gsal ba rnams ni nyams su myong ba'i shes pa la ltos pa kho nas 'bras bu gcig pa nyid yin la rang gi mtshan nyid shes pa de dag ni 'bras bu gcig pa nyid kyi 'dra bas gcig ces bya ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid tha mi dad pasüîΩni ma yin te /
analyzed: gsal ba rnams ni nyams su myong ba'i shes pa la ltos pa kho nas 'bras bu gcig pa nyid yin la rang gi mtshan nyid shes pa de dag ni 'bras bu gcig pa nyid kyi 'dra bas gcig ces bya ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid tha mi dad pas ni ma yin te /
translated: The clarity of those consciousnesses is the same result, because it depends on the consciousness that experiences them. The consciousnesses that are the intrinsic identity of those is not the same result, because it is not different in terms of the intrinsic identity of being the same result.üîΩAlthough the consciousnesses that apprehend intrinsic identity are different, they are not different in terms of the result, because they are the same result.

original: ji ltar gsal ba rnams kyis dngos su rnam pa gcig tu rtogs pa'i shes pa mi skyed mod kyi de dag la dmigs pa rang gi mtshan nyid shes pa rnams ni gcig tu rtogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar gsal ba rnams kyis dngos su rnam pa gcig tu rtogs pa'i shes pa mi skyed mod kyi de dag la dmigs pa rang gi mtshan nyid shes pa rnams ni gcig tu rtogs pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Although the clarity of those consciousnesses does not directly generate a consciousness that realizes them as one, the consciousnesses that are the intrinsic identity of those that observe them are the cause of realizing them as one.

original: de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i blo ni tha dad kyang 'bras bu gcig pa nyid kyis tha dad pa med pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i blo ni tha dad kyang 'bras bu gcig pa nyid kyis tha dad pa med pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, although the consciousnesses that apprehend intrinsic identity are different, they are not different in terms of the result, because they are the same result.

original: de ltar nye bar btags pa'i gcig pa nyid kyis gcig pa nyams su myong ba'i blo gcig pu gang yin pa blo gcig pu de'i rgyu'i dngos pos gsal ba rnams kyang tha mi dad /
analyzed: de ltar nye bar btags pa'i gcig pa nyid kyis gcig pa nyams su myong ba'i blo gcig pu gang yin pa blo gcig pu de'i rgyu'i dngos pos gsal ba rnams kyang tha mi dad /
translated: The consciousness that experiences the single object is a single consciousness because of the single object that is imputed. The clarity of those consciousnesses is not different in terms of the entity of the cause of that single consciousness.

original: ci'i phyir nye bar btags pa'i gcig pa nyid khas len gyi dngos po ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir nye bar btags pa'i gcig pa nyid khas len gyi dngos po ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why do we accept a mere nominal identity and not an actual one?

original: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ji ltar zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúHow can there be a single cognition, etc. ?‚Äù

original: gang phyir dngos kun rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: gang phyir dngos kun rang bzhin gyis //
translated: Because all things by nature

original: rang rang ngo bo la gnas phyir //
analyzed: rang rang ngo bo la gnas phyir //
translated: Abide in their own forms.

original: zhes bya bar der bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes bya bar der bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is explained in the above verse.

original: de la zhes bya ba ni khyad par ma 'dres pa rnams te /
analyzed: de la zhes bya ba ni khyad par ma 'dres pa rnams te /
translated: ‚Äú There‚Äù refers to the unmixed specific characteristics.

original: rnam pa gcig pa can gyi blo ni de ma yin pa las de 'dzin pa'i phyir 'khrul pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa gcig pa can gyi blo ni de ma yin pa las de 'dzin pa'i phyir 'khrul pa kho na yin no //
translated: A cognition that has a single aspect is mistaken, because it apprehends as one what is not one.

original: gal te 'khrul pa de gang @126b dag gis skyed par byed /
analyzed: gal te 'khrul pa de gang @126b dag gis skyed par byed /
translated: If it is asked, ‚ÄúBy what is this mistake produced?‚Äù

original: de rgyu med ba can du ni rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de rgyu med ba can du ni rigs pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is not reasonable that it be causeless.

original: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa te /
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos pa te /
translated: He says, ‚ÄúThat mistake, etc. ‚Äù

original: 'khrul pa de ni dngos po tha dad pa rang gi mtshan nyid log pa rnams kyi rim gyis bskyed kyi dngos su ni de ma yin no //
analyzed: 'khrul pa de ni dngos po tha dad pa rang gi mtshan nyid log pa rnams kyi rim gyis bskyed kyi dngos su ni de ma yin no //
translated: That mistake is produced gradually by the reversal of the specific characteristics of different things, but not directly.

original: rim gyis zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de'i rnam par bshad pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i rgyur gyur pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rim gyis zhes bshad pa gang yin pa de'i rnam par bshad pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i rgyur gyur pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba yin te /
translated: The explanation of what was said about ‚Äúin sequence‚Äù is ‚Äúby those that are causes of conceptualization.‚Äù

original: nyams su myong ba'i shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: nyams su myong ba'i shes pa ni rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rnam par rtog pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The consciousness that experiences is called ‚Äúconceptualization‚Äù because it is the cause of conceptualization.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rgyus nyams su myong ba'i shes pa'i rgyu rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rgyus nyams su myong ba'i shes pa'i rgyu rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning is that it is by those that are causes of the consciousness that experiences, which is the cause of conceptualization.

original: 'dir rim pa'i don ni gsal ba rnams kyis ni nyams su myong ba'i shes pa bskyad la des ni rnam pa gcig par 'khrul pa bskyed do zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
analyzed: 'dir rim pa'i don ni gsal ba rnams kyis ni nyams su myong ba'i shes pa bskyad la des ni rnam pa gcig par 'khrul pa bskyed do zhes bya ba 'di yin no //
translated: Here, the meaning of ‚Äúin sequence‚Äù is that the manifest elements give rise to the consciousness that experiences, and that gives rise to the error of a single aspect.

original: ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid kyis zhes bya ba ni rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúNaturally‚Äù means ‚Äúby nature.‚Äù

original: kyang zhes bya ba 'di yang bshad zin zhes bya ba'i rjes snyeg phyir te 'di yang skabs de nyid du bshad zin to //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba 'di yang bshad zin zhes bya ba'i rjes snyeg phyir te 'di yang skabs de nyid du bshad zin to //
translated: ‚ÄúAlso‚Äù is connected to ‚Äúexplained‚Äù and that is also explained in that context.

original: 'di dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i don te /
analyzed: 'di dag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i don te /
translated: The words ‚Äúby these‚Äù and so on refer to the meaning of the verse.

original: de ni zhes bya ba ni dngos po 'di dag gi tha dad pa ste gzhan sel ba'o //
analyzed: de ni zhes bya ba ni dngos po 'di dag gi tha dad pa ste gzhan sel ba'o //
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the difference among these things, that is, the exclusion of other.

original: ngo bo nyid ji lta bu zhig ce na /
analyzed: ngo bo nyid ji lta bu zhig ce na /
translated: What is their nature?

original: de byed pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid las tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: de byed pa ma yin pa'i ngo bo nyid las tha dad pa ste /
translated: It is the difference from the nature of that which does not produce them.

original: de ni 'di dag gi tha mi dad pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ni 'di dag gi tha mi dad pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That is called their ‚Äúnondifference.‚Äù

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: shes pa la sogs pa'i don dbang po'i shes pa dang / chu chu ba la sogs pa gcig byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes pa la sogs pa'i don dbang po'i shes pa dang / chu chu ba la sogs pa gcig byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the single effect of the cognition, etc., of the object, such as the sense consciousness of water, and the cognition, etc., of the water-bearer.

original: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo dang 'tshams pa ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig ces bya ba ni rang gi ngo bo dang 'tshams pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú Some‚Äù means that which is suitable as its own nature.

original: de ni phyed 'og ma'i rnam par bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni phyed 'og ma'i rnam par bshad pa yin no //
translated: This is the explanation of the second half of the verse.

original: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyed gong ma'i rnam par bshad pa ste /
analyzed: de yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa ni phyed gong ma'i rnam par bshad pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù and so on explain the first half of the verse.

original: shes pa la sogs pa 'bras bu de yang tha mi dad par snang ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: shes pa la sogs pa 'bras bu de yang tha mi dad par snang ngo zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The effect of cognition, etc., is also seen as nondifferent.

original: rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis zhes bya ba ni ngo bo nyid kyis so //
translated: ‚ÄúNaturally‚Äù means by its very nature.

original: tha mi dad par snyems pa'i zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad par lhag par zhen pa'i'o //
analyzed: tha mi dad par snyems pa'i zhes bya ba ni tha mi dad par lhag par zhen pa'i'o //
translated: ‚ÄúConceit of non-difference‚Äù means the adherence to non-difference.

original: rtogs pa de lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsal ba rnams kyang brgyud pas rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: rtogs pa de lta bu'i zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni gsal ba rnams kyang brgyud pas rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: ‚ÄúSuch a conceptualization‚Äù and so on shows that the manifest elements are indirectly the cause of conceptualization.

original: shes pa la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba nyams su myong ba'i shes pa dang / chu chu ba la sogs pa'i don gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir gsal ba rnams kyis kyang rim gyis gcig gi shes pa bskyed do zhes bya bar @127a * //
analyzed: shes pa la sogs pa'i zhes bya ba nyams su myong ba'i shes pa dang / chu chu ba la sogs pa'i don gyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir gsal ba rnams kyis kyang rim gyis gcig gi shes pa bskyed do zhes bya bar @127a * //
translated: ‚ÄúThe cause of the cognition of water, etc.‚Äù means that the manifest elements are the cause of the cognition of water, etc., and the experience of cognition. Therefore, the manifest elements gradually produce the cognition of one thing, as it were.

original: sbyar ro // khyad par ji lta bu can zhig ce na /
analyzed: sbyar ro // khyad par ji lta bu can zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of distinction?

original: rnam pa bsres pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: rnam pa bsres pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: ‚ÄúThe mixing of the aspects‚Äù and so on.

original: gang gis gsal ba rnams la rnam pa gcig bsres shing sgro btags pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis gsal ba rnams la rnam pa gcig bsres shing sgro btags pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which mixes and superimposes one aspect on the manifest elements is so called.

original: gang la rten rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par gzhan las log pa'i bo de nyid don dam pa yin gyi nye bar btags pa'i ma yin pa yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
analyzed: gang la rten rang gi ngo bo'i khyad par gzhan las log pa'i bo de nyid don dam pa yin gyi nye bar btags pa'i ma yin pa yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar te /
translated: That which is the basis, the entity itself, which is distinguished from others, is the ultimate, not the nominal.

original: rnam par rtog pa ni brgyud pas rang gi mtshan nyid log pa'i sgo nas 'ongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa ni brgyud pas rang gi mtshan nyid log pa'i sgo nas 'ongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Conceptual thought is indirect, because it comes about by way of the negation of the intrinsic identity.

original: de ni dngos po tha dad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas don 'di bshad ma thag pa kho na ma yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: de ni dngos po tha dad pa zhes bya ba la sogs pas don 'di bshad ma thag pa kho na ma yin nam zhe na /
translated: But wasn‚Äôt this very point just explained in the passage beginning ‚ÄúThe difference among things is not real‚Äù?

original: bden na 'on kyang 'dis ni rim gyis rnam par rtog pa'i rgyur gyur pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i don 'di kho na gsal bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: bden na 'on kyang 'dis ni rim gyis rnam par rtog pa'i rgyur gyur pa rnams kyis zhes bya ba'i don 'di kho na gsal bar byas pa yin no //
translated: It is true, but this passage makes clear the meaning of the phrase ‚Äúby those which are the causes of conceptual thought in succession.‚Äù

original: 'bras bu gcig pa nyid spyi dngos por gyur pa yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'bras bu gcig pa nyid spyi dngos por gyur pa yin par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: The universal, which is the single effect, would be a real entity.

original: de de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de de'i phyir zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: To respond:

original: de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dang bral zhing ldog pa de kho na 'bras bu gcig pa can nyid yin gyi /
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dang bral zhing ldog pa de kho na 'bras bu gcig pa can nyid yin gyi /
translated: That which is not its effect is excluded and eliminated. That alone is the single effect.

original: spyi dngos por gyur pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: spyi dngos por gyur pa ni ma yin no //
translated: But it is not a universal that is a real entity.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gsal ba la ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa rang gi mtshan nyid las gzhan pa rjes su 'gro ba'i dngos po ma mthong ba'i phyir dang bkag pa sngar bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsal ba la ma gtogs pa de las gzhan pa rang gi mtshan nyid las gzhan pa rjes su 'gro ba'i dngos po ma mthong ba'i phyir dang bkag pa sngar bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because, apart from the individual things, we do not see any other universal that is different from the individual things, and because the refutation has been explained above.

original: ltar rung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed de /
analyzed: ltar rung ba zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni 'chad par byed de /
translated: He explains the term ‚Äúsuitable to appear‚Äù and so on.

original: ltar rung ba ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ltar rung ba ni dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid kyir gyur pa'o //
translated: ‚ÄúSuitable to appear‚Äù means having the characteristic of being perceived.

original: rnam par dbye bar zhes bya ba ni gsal ba dag las tha dad par ro //
analyzed: rnam par dbye bar zhes bya ba ni gsal ba dag las tha dad par ro //
translated: ‚ÄúTo be distinguished‚Äù means to be different from the individual things.

original: spyi yod na yang brtags pa'i phyir sogs dbyung du med pa nyid kyis gsal ba'i khyad par gang la yang mi rten na ji ltar shes pa'i rgyu yin /
analyzed: spyi yod na yang brtags pa'i phyir sogs dbyung du med pa nyid kyis gsal ba'i khyad par gang la yang mi rten na ji ltar shes pa'i rgyu yin /
translated: Even if the universal exists, because it cannot be inferred since it is not perceived, and because it does not rely on any particular individual thing since it does not rely on anything, how can it be the cause of cognition?

original: ma yin pa nyid des rten gyis gsal bar bya ba de ni shes pa'i rgyu nyid du 'dod do //
analyzed: ma yin pa nyid des rten gyis gsal bar bya ba de ni shes pa'i rgyu nyid du 'dod do //
translated: It is not. Therefore, the universal is asserted to be the cause of cognition.

original: de yang bshad zin to zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar te /
analyzed: de yang bshad zin to zhes bya ba 'di dang sbyar te /
translated: And that has already been explained.

original: 'di yang sngar bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di yang sngar bshad zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This also has been explained previously.üîΩSince a universal does not exist as a real entity,

original: gang gi phyir de ltar spyi dngos por gyur pa med pa de'i phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar spyi dngos por gyur pa med pa de'i phyir /
translated: therefore,

original: brda ni yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: brda ni yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: the expression ‚Äúthat‚Äù and so on.

original: de zhes bya ba ni gzhan sel ba yin par sbyar ro //
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni gzhan sel ba yin par sbyar ro //
translated: The expression ‚Äúthat‚Äù is connected with the exclusion of other.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te gzhan las log pa rang gi mtshan nyid dang / de mthong ba'i sgo nas 'ongs par rtogs pa la snang ba'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te gzhan las log pa rang gi mtshan nyid dang / de mthong ba'i sgo nas 'ongs par rtogs pa la snang ba'i rnam pa ste /
translated: Moreover, it is twofold: the specific property of an entity that is the opposite of other and the aspect that appears to the cognition that is understood through the perception of that.

original: de ni sngar rnam par bkrol zin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ni sngar rnam par bkrol zin pa nyid do //
translated: That has already been explained in detail.

original: de la sgra'i don ni rnam @127b par rtog pa la snang ba'i rnam pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhan sel ba yin te /
analyzed: de la sgra'i don ni rnam @127b par rtog pa la snang ba'i rnam pa'i mtshan nyid kyi gzhan sel ba yin te /
translated: The meaning of the word is the exclusion of other that has the characteristic of an aspect that appears to thought,

original: sgra'i shes pa la snang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra'i shes pa la snang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it appears to the cognition of the word.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin te /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the specific property of an entity,

original: de ni sgra'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i skyes bu'i yul yin te /
analyzed: de ni sgra'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i skyes bu'i yul yin te /
translated: because it is the object of a person who engages through the medium of the word,

original: rang gi mtshan nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the engagement of the specific property of an entity.

original: de la gang gi tshe rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i rnam pa gzhan sel ba yin pa de'i tshe ni rig pa shes pa'i don yin te /
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i rnam pa gzhan sel ba yin pa de'i tshe ni rig pa shes pa'i don yin te /
translated: When the exclusion of other is the aspect that appears to thought, then the meaning of awareness is the object of knowledge.

original: rnam par rtog pa la snang ba de rig pa ni de rig pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la snang ba de rig pa ni de rig pa'o //
translated: That awareness of the appearance to thought is the awareness of that.

original: de nyid don te 'bras bu yin par shes khyad par gyi tshig bsdu'o //
analyzed: de nyid don te 'bras bu yin par shes khyad par gyi tshig bsdu'o //
translated: That itself is the object, the result.

original: brda gang la de yod pa zhes ldan pa'i drug par byas te bsdus pa'i don ni rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i rnam par shes par bya ba'i don can yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: brda gang la de yod pa zhes ldan pa'i drug par byas te bsdus pa'i don ni rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i rnam par shes par bya ba'i don can yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the compound is that it has the meaning of the object of knowledge that is the appearance to thought.

original: gang gi tshe rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan las log pa kho na gzhan sel ba yin pa de'i tshe ni rig pa thob pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan las log pa kho na gzhan sel ba yin pa de'i tshe ni rig pa thob pa'i don yin no //
translated: When the exclusion of other is the own characteristic that is the opposite of other, then the meaning of awareness is the attainment of that.

original: rang gi mtshan nyid log pa de rig pa ni de rig pa ste /
analyzed: rang gi mtshan nyid log pa de rig pa ni de rig pa ste /
translated: The awareness of that own characteristic that is the opposite of other is the awareness of that.

original: de 'thob pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: de 'thob pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: That is the attainment of that.

original: / de nyid don yin pas shes las 'dzin pa dang / ldan pa'i drug par yang byas te /
analyzed: / de nyid don yin pas shes las 'dzin pa dang / ldan pa'i drug par yang byas te /
translated: and the sixth case is used to indicate the meaning of that which is to be attained.

original: bsdus pa'i don ni de 'thob pa'i don can yin no zhes bya ba yin no //üîΩdon 'di gnyis ni tshig le'ur byas pa las tshig zur gnyis su smos pa'am /
analyzed: bsdus pa'i don ni de 'thob pa'i don can yin no zhes bya ba yin no // don 'di gnyis ni tshig le'ur byas pa las tshig zur gnyis su smos pa'am /
translated: The summarized meaning is that which has the meaning of attaining that.üîΩThese two meanings are to be understood as being indicated by the two words in the verse,

original: bzlas pa smos pas bstan par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: bzlas pa smos pas bstan par blta bar bya'o //
translated: or by the repetition of the words in the verse.

original: de la rigs pa shes pa'i don yin par bzung nas /
analyzed: de la rigs pa shes pa'i don yin par bzung nas /
translated: There, having taken the meaning of knowledge of reasoning,

original: brda zhing tu byas na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: brda zhing tu byas na yang zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: he says, ‚Äúif one makes a convention,‚Äù etc.

original: dngos po rnams kyi phan tshun tha dad pa ni gzhan sel ba ste /
analyzed: dngos po rnams kyi phan tshun tha dad pa ni gzhan sel ba ste /
translated: The mutual difference of things is the exclusion of other.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba zhes bya bar bsams pa yin no//
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rnam par shes pa la snang ba zhes bya bar bsams pa yin no//
translated: It is thought that it appears to the conceptual consciousness.

original: de kho na shes par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: de kho na shes par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is for the sake of knowing thatness,

original: de kho na nges par bya ba'i phyir byed na mdzes te rigs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de kho na nges par bya ba'i phyir byed na mdzes te rigs pa dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: for the sake of ascertaining thatness. If one makes a convention, it is beautiful, because it is reasonable.

original: rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i ngo bo ni dngos po med pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i ngo bo ni dngos po med pa ma yin nam /
translated: Is the nature of what appears in conceptual cognition not unreal?

original: de ji ltar dngos po rnams kyis zhes bya ba la /
analyzed: de ji ltar dngos po rnams kyis zhes bya ba la /
translated: How can it be said that ‚Äúit is like things‚Äù?

original: don bya ba mi byed pa rtogs pa de yang cir dgos na /
analyzed: don bya ba mi byed pa rtogs pa de yang cir dgos na /
translated: What is the purpose of understanding that it does not perform a function?

original: gang gi phyir de kho na shes par bya ba'i phyir zhes brjod na /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de kho na shes par bya ba'i phyir zhes brjod na /
translated: If it is said that it is for the sake of knowing reality,

original: de ni nyes pa med de phan tshun tha dad pa'i dngos po mthong ba'i sgo nas 'ongs pa'i phyir dang / skyes bu'i lhag par zhen pa'i dbang gis de rnams kyi zhes brjod do //üîΩ'di ltar tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa ni rnam par rtog pa la snang @128a * //
analyzed: de ni nyes pa med de phan tshun tha dad pa'i dngos po mthong ba'i sgo nas 'ongs pa'i phyir dang / skyes bu'i lhag par zhen pa'i dbang gis de rnams kyi zhes brjod do // 'di ltar tha snyad 'dogs par byed pa ni rnam par rtog pa la snang @128a * //
translated: there is no fault, because it is said that ‚Äúthose‚Äù are different from each other from the perspective of seeing different things, and because it is said that ‚Äúthose‚Äù are due to the power of a person‚Äôs conception.

original: ba dang / phyi rol gyi ngo bo gcig tu byas nas tha snyad 'dogs par byed pas de bas na skyes bu'i lhag par zhen pa'i dbang gis dngos po de rnams kyi phan tshun tha dad pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: ba dang / phyi rol gyi ngo bo gcig tu byas nas tha snyad 'dogs par byed pas de bas na skyes bu'i lhag par zhen pa'i dbang gis dngos po de rnams kyi phan tshun tha dad pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Thus, when a convention is designated, it is designated by making what appears in conceptual cognition and the external nature one. Therefore, due to the power of a person‚Äôs conception, those things are said to be different from each other.

original: rigs pa'i sgo nas sgra'i brjod par bya ba rnam par 'jog par byed pa rnams ni rnam par rtag pa la snang ba'i rnam par 'jog par byed do //
analyzed: rigs pa'i sgo nas sgra'i brjod par bya ba rnam par 'jog par byed pa rnams ni rnam par rtag pa la snang ba'i rnam par 'jog par byed do //
translated: Those who posit the content of speech by means of reasoning posit it as appearing to conceptual cognition.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pa snang ba'i rnam pa ni don bya ba mi byed pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pa snang ba'i rnam pa ni don bya ba mi byed pa yin na /
translated: If the form that appears to conceptual cognition does not perform the function of the object,

original: don bya ba byed pa don du gnyer ba rnams kyis ci'i phyir de shes par bya ba'i phyir brdar byed ce na /
analyzed: don bya ba byed pa don du gnyer ba rnams kyis ci'i phyir de shes par bya ba'i phyir brdar byed ce na /
translated: why do those who seek to perform a function understand it in order to make a convention?

original: de'i phyir de mi byed pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de mi byed pa las zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos so //
translated: Therefore, he says, ‚Äúbecause it does not perform that function,‚Äù and so on.

original: 'di skad du bshad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di skad du bshad pa yin te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i rnam pa dang / phyi rol gyis gcig nyid du lhag par zhen pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa la snang ba'i rnam pa dang / phyi rol gyis gcig nyid du lhag par zhen pa'i phyir te /
translated: Because of the superimposition of identity between the form that appears to conceptual cognition and the external object,

original: 'di ltar brdar 'dogs par byed pa yang phyi rol gyi kho na la bya'o snyam du sems la /
analyzed: 'di ltar brdar 'dogs par byed pa yang phyi rol gyi kho na la bya'o snyam du sems la /
translated: it is thought that the convention is made only in regard to the external object.

original: rtogs par byed pa pos kyang de kho na bzhin du shes so //
analyzed: rtogs par byed pa pos kyang de kho na bzhin du shes so //
translated: And the one who understands it also understands it in just that way.

original: de'i phyir tha snyad 'dogs pa'i dus na yang sgra'i sgo nas de mi byed pa las tha dad pa gcig pa nyid du lhag par zhen pa de kho nas rang gi mtshan nyid la 'jug par grub te /
analyzed: de'i phyir tha snyad 'dogs pa'i dus na yang sgra'i sgo nas de mi byed pa las tha dad pa gcig pa nyid du lhag par zhen pa de kho nas rang gi mtshan nyid la 'jug par grub te /
translated: Therefore, even at the time of designation, it is established that one engages in intrinsic identity by that very adherence to identity through the medium of sound, which is different from non-performance.

original: 'dis ni rigs pa'i don 'thob pa'i don yin par bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni rigs pa'i don 'thob pa'i don yin par bshad do //
translated: This explains that the meaning of reasoning is the meaning of attainment.

original: don 'di nyid log pa'i sgo nas brtan por byas pa'i phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: don 'di nyid log pa'i sgo nas brtan por byas pa'i phyir gal te zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to firmly establish this very meaning, he says, ‚ÄúIf, etc.‚Äù

original: de shes par bya ba'i don du zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod du rung ba'i phyir rol gyi dang lhan cig gcig pa nyid du lhag par zhen pa'i rgyu ji skad bshad pa'i rnam par gcod pa de shes par bya ba'i don du brdar 'dogs pa ma yin na
analyzed: de shes par bya ba'i don du zhes bya ba'i sgras brjod du rung ba'i phyir rol gyi dang lhan cig gcig pa nyid du lhag par zhen pa'i rgyu ji skad bshad pa'i rnam par gcod pa de shes par bya ba'i don du brdar 'dogs pa ma yin na
translated: Because the word ‚Äúfor‚Äù expresses the purpose of knowing that, the reason for the adherence to identity through the medium of sound is not the designation of a convention for the purpose of knowing that exclusion as explained.

original: / de'i tshe rnam par gcod pa de tha snyad kyi dus su yang mi reg pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / de'i tshe rnam par gcod pa de tha snyad kyi dus su yang mi reg pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, because that exclusion is not contacted even at the time of designation.

original: reg pa ni sgra'i stobs kyis de'i rnam par rtog pa skye ba ste /
analyzed: reg pa ni sgra'i stobs kyis de'i rnam par rtog pa skye ba ste /
translated: Contact is the arising of its conception by the power of sound.

original: de la brdar ma btags pa'i sgra'i sgo nas tha snyad kyi dus su de'i rnam par rtog par rigs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de la brdar ma btags pa'i sgra'i sgo nas tha snyad kyi dus su de'i rnam par rtog par rigs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not reasonable that at the time of convention, the conceptualization of that [exclusion] occurs through a word that has not been associated with it.

original: de bas na skyes bu gzhan spangs nas rigs mi mthun pa rnam par bcad nas /
analyzed: de bas na skyes bu gzhan spangs nas rigs mi mthun pa rnam par bcad nas /
translated: Therefore, having excluded other persons, having excluded what is not of the same type,

original: de dang rigs mthun pa'i dngos po la snang ba dang rnam par btags par bya ba dag gcig tu byas nas 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dang rigs mthun pa'i dngos po la snang ba dang rnam par btags par bya ba dag gcig tu byas nas 'jug par mi 'gyur te /
translated: one does not engage in superimposing the appearance and the conceptualized object onto a thing that is of the same type, treating them as one.

original: sgra las byung ba'i don rtogs pas gcig pa nyid du lhag par zhen pa'i rgyus sgra brjod par bya ba gzhan sel ba la ma reg pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra las byung ba'i don rtogs pas gcig pa nyid du lhag par zhen pa'i rgyus sgra brjod par bya ba gzhan sel ba la ma reg pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because, having understood the meaning that arises from the word, one does not touch the exclusion of other expressible things due to the cause of excessive attachment to identity.

original: ma reg pa nyid bsgrub @128b pa'i phyir de rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: ma reg pa nyid bsgrub @128b pa'i phyir de rnams kyis zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In order to establish that [exclusion] is not touched, they say those and so on.

original: de 'bras bu can de rnams kyi dag las zhes bya ba de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dag las tha dad pa rnam par gcod pa de tha snyad kyi dus su smra ba pos sgras brjod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
analyzed: de 'bras bu can de rnams kyi dag las zhes bya ba de'i 'bras bu can ma yin pa dag las tha dad pa rnam par gcod pa de tha snyad kyi dus su smra ba pos sgras brjod pa ma yin no zhes bya bar sbyar te /
translated: The phrase ‚Äúfrom those that have that as their effect‚Äù means that the exclusion of those that do not have that as their effect is not expressed by the word at the time of conventional usage.

original: de zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa ste /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni tha dad pa ste /
translated: ‚Äú That‚Äù refers to the exclusion.

original: gal te de shes par bya ba'i phyir brdar byas pa zhig tu gyur na de lta tha snyad kyi tshe yang sgras brjod par 'gyur la brjod pa'i sgo nas kyang rtogs pa bos sgra la byung ba'i blos de las reg par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te de shes par bya ba'i phyir brdar byas pa zhig tu gyur na de lta tha snyad kyi tshe yang sgras brjod par 'gyur la brjod pa'i sgo nas kyang rtogs pa bos sgra la byung ba'i blos de las reg par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were a convention created in order to make that known, then it would be expressed by the word at the time of conventional usage, and it would be cognized by the mind that arises from the word.

original: de ltar yin na gzhan spangs nas 'jug par 'gyur bas thams cad la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar yin na gzhan spangs nas 'jug par 'gyur bas thams cad la 'jug par 'gyur ro //
translated: If that were the case, it would engage all objects, since it would engage all objects after excluding others.

original: gal te sgras rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo kho na bskyed pas de la snang ba'i rnam pa kho nas sgra'i yul yin na /
analyzed: gal te sgras rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo kho na bskyed pas de la snang ba'i rnam pa kho nas sgra'i yul yin na /
translated: If the object of the word is the aspect that appears to the conceptual consciousness that is produced by the word alone,

original: blo de yang don med pa kho na yin pas /
analyzed: blo de yang don med pa kho na yin pas /
translated: then that consciousness would be meaningless.

original: ji ltar blo de lta bu skyed par byed pa'i mnyan pa rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan las log pa la mi slu ba yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar blo de lta bu skyed par byed pa'i mnyan pa rang gi mtshan nyid gzhan las log pa la mi slu ba yin te /
translated: The listener who generates such a mind is nondeceptive with regard to the other that is, with regard to the intrinsic identity of the other.

original: gang gis na de mi byed pa las tha dad pas 'jug pa nyid du zhes brjod /
analyzed: gang gis na de mi byed pa las tha dad pas 'jug pa nyid du zhes brjod /
translated: How could it be that he does not perform that action and yet is said to engage in it?

original: yang na ji ltar dngos po rnams gzhan sel ba'i yul nyid yin te /
analyzed: yang na ji ltar dngos po rnams gzhan sel ba'i yul nyid yin te /
translated: Or else, how could things be the object of exclusion of other?

original: rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo la gnas pa'i rnam pa ni phyir rol gyi rnams la med do zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa can gyi blo la gnas pa'i rnam pa ni phyir rol gyi rnams la med do zhe na /
translated: The aspect that is present in the conceptual mind does not exist externally.

original: de'i phyir mnyan pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mnyan pa de ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Therefore, it is said, ‚ÄúThat listener, etc.‚Äù

original: gzhan sel ba rtogs par bya ba'i phyir brdar gdags pa'i mnyan pa gang yin pa de ni blo skyed par byed pa yang mi slu ba yin par 'dod do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan sel ba rtogs par bya ba'i phyir brdar gdags pa'i mnyan pa gang yin pa de ni blo skyed par byed pa yang mi slu ba yin par 'dod do zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: The listener who is designated as a convention in order to understand the exclusion of other is asserted to be nondeceptive with regard to the generation of the mind.

original: khyad par ji lta bu can zhig ce na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu can zhig ce na /
translated: What kind of distinction does it have?

original: de byed min la zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: de byed min la zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: It is said, ‚ÄúIt is not that which performs that action.‚Äù

original: rang la snang ba la ba bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: rang la snang ba la ba bskyed pa'o //
translated: It generates the appearance of itself.

original: de byed pa dang 'dra ba'i ngo bor don bya ba byed pa dang 'dra ba'i ngo por snang zhing lhag par zhen pa zhes de lta bur gyur pa'i gsum par tshig bsdus nas phyis de gang la yod pa zhes ldan pa'i don du byas te /
analyzed: de byed pa dang 'dra ba'i ngo bor don bya ba byed pa dang 'dra ba'i ngo por snang zhing lhag par zhen pa zhes de lta bur gyur pa'i gsum par tshig bsdus nas phyis de gang la yod pa zhes ldan pa'i don du byas te /
translated: The meaning of the compound is: ‚Äúthat which appears as if it performs a function, and is conceived as if it performs a function.‚Äù

original: rang la snang ba don bya ba mi byed pa la yang don bya ba byed pa lta bur lhag par zhen pa can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: rang la snang ba don bya ba mi byed pa la yang don bya ba byed pa lta bur lhag par zhen pa can zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: The meaning of the compound is: ‚Äúthat which appears to oneself as if it performs a function, although it does not perform a function.‚Äù

original: 'dis ni sgra snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba dag gcig pa nyid du lhag par zhen pa bskyed pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i yan lag nyid du bshad do //
analyzed: 'dis ni sgra snang ba dang rnam par brtag par bya ba dag gcig pa nyid du lhag par zhen pa bskyed pa'i phyir 'jug pa'i yan lag nyid du bshad do //
translated: This is explained as the limb of engagement because it generates the conception that the appearance of the word and the object of investigation are the same.

original: gal te spyi dngos por 'gyur pa'i med na de las skye re skan zhen /
analyzed: gal te spyi dngos por 'gyur pa'i med na de las skye re skan zhen /
translated: If the universal were not a real entity, then how could it generate its effect?

original: dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te /üîΩdngos po rnams kyi tha dad pa'i dngos po ni phan tshun tha dad @129a * //
analyzed: dngos po zhes bya ba la sogs pa smos te / dngos po rnams kyi tha dad pa'i dngos po ni phan tshun tha dad @129a * //
translated: He says, ‚ÄúIf the universal is not a real entity,‚Äù and so on.

original: pa'i ngo bo'o //
analyzed: pa'i ngo bo'o //
translated: The real entities of the different things are their different natures.

original: gang la brgyud pas sa bon byed rgyu de tsam yod kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo bo ni ma yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: gang la brgyud pas sa bon byed rgyu de tsam yod kyi rjes su 'gro ba'i ngo bo ni ma yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has only the causal capacity to serve as the seed of a subsequent cognition is said to be the ultimate object of a conceptual cognition.

original: rang la snang ba ni dngos po la med pa'i phyir don dam pa ste blo de skyed par byed pa'i sgra'i don la mi slu ba yin no //üîΩci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: rang la snang ba ni dngos po la med pa'i phyir don dam pa ste blo de skyed par byed pa'i sgra'i don la mi slu ba yin no // ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: The ultimate object is that which appears to a conceptual cognition, because it is not a real entity. The word of the statement ‚Äúthe word that produces that cognition is nondeceptive‚Äù refers to the word that produces the conceptual cognition.üîΩWhy is that?

original: de mi byed ;
analyzed: de mi byed ;
translated: Because it does not produce that.

original: yongs spong yan lag ngo bo'i phyir //
analyzed: yongs spong yan lag ngo bo'i phyir //
translated: Because it is the cause of the exclusion of the other.

original: rigs mi mthun pa rnam par gcod pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rigs mi mthun pa rnam par gcod pa'i rgyu'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word is the cause of the exclusion of the other, because it is the cause of the conceptual cognition that apprehends the entity that is the negation of the other.

original: 'di ltar gzhan las log pa'i dngos po dang / sgro btags pa'i gcig pa nyid du byed pa'i blo skyed par byed pa'i mnyan pas gzhan las log pa rang gi mtshan nyid kho na la 'jug par byed kyi thams cad la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar gzhan las log pa'i dngos po dang / sgro btags pa'i gcig pa nyid du byed pa'i blo skyed par byed pa'i mnyan pas gzhan las log pa rang gi mtshan nyid kho na la 'jug par byed kyi thams cad la ni ma yin no //
translated: The word that produces the conceptual cognition that apprehends the entity that is the negation of the other causes one to engage only in the particular that is the negation of the other, not in everything.

original: mnyan pa de ni dngos po tha dad pa'i rten can yang yin te /
analyzed: mnyan pa de ni dngos po tha dad pa'i rten can yang yin te /
translated: That word also has a basis that is a different entity.

original: 'di ltar brda'i dus na mnyan pa'i rten phan tshun tha dad pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar brda'i dus na mnyan pa'i rten phan tshun tha dad pa kho na yin te /
translated: Thus, at the time of the sign, the bases of the hearer and speaker are only different from each other,

original: de la nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la nye bar sbyor ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are applied to that.

original: de ltar na brgyud pas /
analyzed: de ltar na brgyud pas /
translated: Thus, indirectly,

original: dngos po tha dang rten can phyir //
analyzed: dngos po tha dang rten can phyir //
translated: because it has a basis in different things,

original: don la mi slu yin par 'dod //
analyzed: don la mi slu yin par 'dod //
translated: it is held to be nondeceptive with regard to its object.

original: tha snyad kyi dus na yang gzhan las log pa'i dngos po kho na thog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tha snyad kyi dus na yang gzhan las log pa'i dngos po kho na thog par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even at the time of the convention, it is only a different thing that is made known.

original: gang gi phyir sgra de mi byed pa yongs su spong ba'i yan lag gi ngo bo yin pa dang / dngos po tha dad pa'i rten yin pa rgyu /
analyzed: gang gi phyir sgra de mi byed pa yongs su spong ba'i yan lag gi ngo bo yin pa dang / dngos po tha dad pa'i rten yin pa rgyu /
translated: Because that sound is the nature of the limb that excludes the nonproducer and is the basis of different things,

original: de'i phyir gzhan sel yul can te //
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan sel yul can te //
translated: therefore, it is the domain of the exclusion of other.

original: gnyis po de nyid bstan pa'i phyir //üîΩde byed rten pa'i ngo bo'i phyir //
analyzed: gnyis po de nyid bstan pa'i phyir // de byed rten pa'i ngo bo'i phyir //
translated: In order to demonstrate just those two,

original: zhes bya ba smos te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba smos te /
translated: he says,üîΩbecause it is the nature of the basis of that.

original: gzhan sel ba de la byed pa po'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dang / rten pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan sel ba de la byed pa po'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir dang / rten pa'i ngo bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that exclusion of other is the nature of the agent and the nature of the basis.

original: 'di ltar sgra ni tha snyad kyi dus na gzhan sel bar byed pa'i phyir de mi byed pa yongs su spong ba'i yan lag gi ngo bo'i sgo nas gzhan sel ba de la byed pa po'i ngo bo yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar sgra ni tha snyad kyi dus na gzhan sel bar byed pa'i phyir de mi byed pa yongs su spong ba'i yan lag gi ngo bo'i sgo nas gzhan sel ba de la byed pa po'i ngo bo yin la /
translated: Thus, since sound excludes other at the time of convention, it is the agent in regard to that exclusion of other by way of the nature of the limb that excludes what does not perform that.

original: brda'i dus na dngos po tha dad pa la brten pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i phyir gzhan sel ba de la brten pa'i ngo bo yin no //
analyzed: brda'i dus na dngos po tha dad pa la brten pa'i sgo nas 'jug pa'i phyir gzhan sel ba de la brten pa'i ngo bo yin no //
translated: And at the time of the sign, since it operates by way of depending on different things, it is the nature that depends on that exclusion of other.

original: ngo bo nyid gcig dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ston to //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid gcig dang zhes bya ba la sogs pas ni tshig le'ur byas pa'i don ston to //
translated: The meaning of the verse is shown by ‚Äúone nature, etc.‚Äù

original: de zhes bya ba ni rang la snang ba rnam pa gcig pa ste /
analyzed: de zhes bya ba ni rang la snang ba rnam pa gcig pa ste /
translated: ‚ÄúThat‚Äù is the single aspect that appears to itself.

original: don rnams la sgro btags shing gang nas skye ba'i blor rang la snang ba de yang phyin ci log tu snang ba'i phyir bya ba byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don rnams la sgro btags shing gang nas skye ba'i blor rang la snang ba de yang phyin ci log tu snang ba'i phyir bya ba byed pa ma yin no //
translated: Since that which appears to itself, the mind that is born from superimposition on objects, also appears erroneously, it does not perform a function.

original: de lta bu la yang bya ba byed pa lta bur lhag par zhen pa ste /
analyzed: de lta bu la yang bya ba byed pa lta bur lhag par zhen pa ste /
translated: It is also conceived as if it performs a function.

original: 'dis ni ; de byed @129b min la de byed dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par bshad de /üîΩblo gang la sa bon dngos po tha dad pa'i ngo bo tsam /
analyzed: 'dis ni ; de byed @129b min la de byed dang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa rnam par bshad de / blo gang la sa bon dngos po tha dad pa'i ngo bo tsam /
translated: It does not create that which is created.üîΩThe meaning of the above is as follows: The mind that has the mere nature of a seed that is a different entity

original: gzhan rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo tsam yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
analyzed: gzhan rnam par gcod pa'i ngo bo tsam yod pa zhes tshig rnam par sbyar ro //
translated: from the sprout is the mere nature that excludes other things.
